description:
Alright, I'm calling it: as of now, this is my favorite ice cream shop in SF. 

First off, you go inside and the place is super cute. Pretty standard for an ice cream shop. But then you realize that they have 30 gazillion flavors, and that their unusual flavors are flavors that they could've only made up. 

We had the Four Cs (cherry, champagne, chocolate, and coffee) and a banana split with weird flavors: Star Wars, peanut butter Oreo, and jasmine (I'm so bad at matching ice cream because I just want to try everything). The Four Cs was probably our favorite because it had real cherry pieces and you could taste all 4 flavors separately and at different times. It was not only unique but it was done so well! The jasmine was soooo flavorful that I felt like I was eating a flower. It was wonderful! The Star Wars and peanut butter Oreo were tasty too. 

Some other noteworthy things:
         -the employees are very friendly!
         -they give you huge scoops
         -the yelp check in offer is great!!
         -they play cool music 

I have nothing bad to say about Polly Ann. It was an amazing experience and I left in a better mood than when I came in. Can't wait to come back to get my ice cream fix!
author: Claire C.

description:
I've been a local San Franciscan for all my life. I went to middle school across the block at AP Giannini Middle School so I've been coming here for many years. This is the first time I've been treated SO BADLY!
Me and a group of friends came here on a Wednesday night, there was barely anyone here. We proceeded to ask for, at most, two samples each. At my second sample request, an older Asian lady employee or maybe owner, tells me to hurry up and order because we've asked for too many samples. I was so taken back, that I couldn't say anything. Me and my friends had even shared samples earlier to be considerate. 
There was no sample limit on display, nor did anyone tell us there was any sample limit. We decided to avoid any problem and continued to order our flavors. However, as we walked out, my friend bit into a piece of large plastic! So not only did the lady rant about us as we were walking out, she never apologized for the piece of health hazard that my friend almost ate! 

I will never be coming back. Save yourself the stress and take your business elsewhere.
author: Sihui Y.

description:
I came here with my friends who've been coming here for over 10 years so I had high expectations. We each tried two samples, sharing some of them because we didn't want to waste any ice cream. While I was deciding whether or not I wanted a cone, one of the employees yelled at our group for asking for too many samples and told us to hurry up and order something instead. I was a bit taken aback since the store was kind of empty and it was a weekday night. 

Her aggression made me really nervous so I didn't end up getting anything, but my friend found a huge piece of plastic in their ice cream. When we went back to tell them about it, the employee was loudly ranting about us and just said 'okay' in the most disgruntled way. I'm all for supporting small local businesses...so go to Marco Polo. They're much nicer.
author: Connie H.

description:
I heard about all the flavors Polly Ann serves so I had to check it out while visiting SF! 

I sampled the Jasmine Tea and Black Sesame. The Jasmine Tea had a light floral note but it was a little too sweet in my opinion.

Black Sesame 
* Super nutty flavor 
* Hint of bitterness 

Overall, the Black Sesame was good but it was so strong I couldn't finish the scoop. I wish I got another flavor to balance out the strong sesame taste - I would recommend something fruity. 

There were a few people in front of me who ordered the durian flavored ice cream and soon after, the durian smell filled the shop. Their doors were open so I was fine. If you love durian, you should definitely give this place a try since it's such a unique flavor.
author: Courtney H.

description: The ice cream is perfect! Lots of flavors for you to choose from, one of my favorite places to visit when I'm back in sf. Very affordable and conveniently located close to where I live. Though on hot days, I do say that there is a bit of a wait in line for it, truly the experience
author: Shaeli Z.

description:
This place has a lot of unique and interesting flavors. I was particularly fond of the jasmine tea. 

My only complaint is that the ice cream was kind of dripping out of the bottom of the waffle cone at the end. I don't like feeling pressure to finish!

Don't forget to check-in for your free cookie or waffle cone!
author: Julia C.

description:
Perfect stop after a warm day at the beach! 

My kids and I have been so excited to try Polly Ann's for their wide array of flavors (48 to be exact). We had a tough time deciding what to get, but we narrowed our choices down to these three: black sesame, rainbow, and mintie oreo cookie. But if you're realllly having a tough time, they have a wheel you can spin with the numbers correlating to each flavor!

The flavors are all VERY potent and spot on. Pretty sweet, but just enough to not overwhelm.

Only issue here was that we sensed as if the staff felt inconvenienced by us sampling. We were a group of four and only asked for 3 samples. There was no one waiting behind us and with flavors with names not signifying the actual taste, like Star Wars or ET, how would you know if you'd like it? Also, the tables were dirty. Had to wipe off the smeared ice cream and crumbs ourselves.
author: Mary R.

description:
Ice Cream...Ice Cream.. I love you but you're not good for my diet and negate my daily workouts. 

Hopped into this place after a nice jog and was greeted warmly but an employee by the name of Kristy or (Christy?)  She was very helpful and after trying a couple flavor's I settled on
#13 Taro: Absolutely delicious and my favorite
#22 - Sunset Sundae- vanilla fudge, almonds & oreo- Super good as well

I like how they have a ton of flavors and the wheel itself it a cool concept as well. 

Wheel = Like the wheel of fortune set-up they have at many Vegas casinos.  It lists all their flavors in case you're being indecisive and even has a "free" scoop option.
 
This place has a lot going for it and I would definitely return if I was in the area. 

So many good ice cream spots in the city. Here is my ranking but they are all pretty darn good.

Who doesn't love Chocolate and Ice Cream? (If you're raising your hand you can stop here ) 

I like making lists what can I say. I have lists for Ramen, Steakhouse/Brazilian , Milk Tea, Egg Tarts, Chicken & Waffles (super random list right). Give my profile a follow if you like them. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. Check out my latest reviews for my latest up to date Rankings. 

Rod's San Francisco Chocolate and Ice Cream shop Rankings: 
1 Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous
2 Marco Polo Gelato
3 Dandelion Chocolate
4 Polly Ann Ice Cream
5 salt and straw
6 Chocolate Covered
7 Smitten Ice Cream
8 Teuscher Chocolate 
9 Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream
10 Over the Moon
11 The Ice Cream Bar
12 Coletta Gelato
13 Cako Creamery
14 Bi-Rite Creamery
15 San Francisco's Hometown Creamery 
16 Miyako Old Fashioned Ice Cream
17 Mitchells Ice cream
18 St. Francis Fountain
19 Z Cioccolato
20 Joe's Ice Cream
21 Christopher Elbow Artisanal Chocolate
22 The Baked Bear- Custom Ice Cream Sandwiches
23 Recchiuti Confections 
24 Poco Dolce Chocolates
author: Rod M.

description:
Best ice cream in the Sunset.

Small ice cream shop, with lots of candy.

Ice Cream is on point, service is on point. 

Downside is that its always packed especially on hot days.

Coconut and strawberry for the win, or take a risk and spin the wheel.
author: Yuriy T.

description:
ice cream and toppings  mediocre.  The menu states  for Sundae that you "mix and match ice cream,  whipped cream, and 4 toppings". So I asked for chopped peanuts,  Oreo crumbles,  hot fudge and butterscotch as toppings. When they did not give me whipped cream,  I politely asked for it and they refused saying it should have been requested as one of the 4 toppings. Whipped  cream is not listed under the "toppings" section in the menu.  Review the photos and you be the judge. 

I did not finish because it was all pretty mediocre anyway.

Edit: Eric from the shop reached out to me directly and apologized and let me know I should have gotten whipped cream and that he'd be working with the staff.  Well that's good customer service that makes me feel valued. Though I didn't really care for the ice cream, I acknowledge my experience may have been sullied by my treatment.... and also a sundae without whipped cream is a bummer.  I'll give this place another shot in the future.
author: Alex C.

description: Love this place- remember the old location down the corner as well. Great Ice cream- great service-cash a Sunset district institution
author: Matthew S.

description: nice, friendly ice cream store with 40 different flavors. All the usual flavors, as well as a good selection of Asian flavors. Store is super clean and nice to have in the neighborhood.
author: Peter F.

description:
What you need to know: 
- A Sunset ice cream institution, who has been around for many decades 
- They excel in their Asian flavors! 
- If you are ever feeling indecisive, you can spin the wheel, but you will have to take the flavor
- Cash only 
- Has a few tables and a bathroom 
- Has pre-packed select flavors for $7.95 
- The prices for the scoops are:  junior $3.25, single $3.75, double $5.25 and monster $6.50

What I ordered:
- Single scoop of Jasmine tea price $3.75 - This ice cream flavor packs a lot of tea flavor in it! It is quite excellent! The ice cream is not icy and has a dense taste to it. 
- Other recommendations include lychee (I always get the half gallon of this!)and green tea (also lots of tea flavor)
author: Karen L.

description: Great place to grab some late night ice cream! Would definitely come back. Plus the price is decent and plenty of street parking in the area.
author: Andrei L.

description: No question about it - the quality of the ice cream here is excellent.  The problem I have is the oddball selection of flavors.  I just wanted rocky road and they supposedly normally have their own version with a different name but were out of it.  I ended up with some forgettable  banana oreo flavor.  Its expensive too...
author: G. R.

description:
Small shop. Huge amount of flavors. 

You usually wait on line since it's so popular. The friendly counter person powers through the line while displaying a great amount of patience when you try multiple flavors. So hard to decide!

Suggestion: go for the unusual flavors since you could find the basic ones anywhere else. However, they're all good! I love jasmine tea and black sesame.

They also make ice cream cakes. It's definitely worth taking a trip to the Outer Sunset to visit Polly Ann!
author: Carol W.

description:
It was sat around noon and walked by this little gem!

The ice cream was bomb! The flavor names were pretty hilarious! "Star Wars". I'm On my way! a for vanilla tho. 

The server was super nice and explained the flavors and super fast service.

There was a wall or awesome candy that was a blast from the past to see. "Pop rocks" what?!

Will be back here again on another weekend!
author: Robert R.

description: Great and patient staff. I got to spin the wheel and ended up getting red bean ice cream, which was delicious. They offer a ton of flavors, so the wheel helped me narrow down the selection, haha. I'd go back again and try something different each time.
author: LM D.

description: So many awesome ice cream flavors. Loved the Star Wars, blue mint ice cream with marshmallows. Wish they had better descriptions of the flavors online but otherwise really yummy ice cream.
author: David S.

description:
Had this place bookmarked for a realllly long time & finally got the chance to try it out!

They have a ton of different flavors and even unique ones like Star Wars(mint&marshmallow) & CCC (chocolate,cherry,champagne). It can get overwhelming b/c there are many so flavors, but the people are very patient. 

I ended up getting the double ($5) w/ 3 flavors: Black Sesame, Taro, & Coffee&Oreo Bits. I know it's a mix of flavors, but I didn't mind. Very generous portion & all were super delicious!

Overall, really cool neighborhood ice cream shop! Wouldn't go out of my way to come here since it's deep in the Outter Sunset, but when i'm around in that area, I would definitely come back here again!
author: Trina N.

description:
I've literally been coming to Polly Ann's forever now and it's still yet to disappoint me. I love their many offerings of flavors - roughly 45 flavors at any given time. You can also spin the wheel and try your luck (they let you pick the flavors between the number it lands on and 1 to the right and left, respectively). 

My absolute favorites at this point are jasmine tea, macupono, and taro. Many flavors also contain real pieces of the food, fruit, or nut of your chosen flavor (notable examples: taro, macupono, walnut/hazulnut).

Staff at Polly Ann's is also always friendly and patient. They are even willing to accommodate requests. Case in point, they recently removed single split scoops in a cone from their menu. They don't advertise it, but if you are willing to get your single scoop in a cup, you can still get 2 flavors. They will also top it with a basic cone (sugar or wafer) for free if you ask. Best of both worlds! Definitely the route to go if you're like me: indecisive and who would love to, but can't consume that much ice cream at once.

Portion sizes for the price (which yes, has increased over the years) is still very fair in my opinion.
author: Elaine Y.

description: It's been quite a while since we visited this fun lil parlor. Hubby spun the wheel and got a free cone lol. There's a flavor for everyone. Rocky Road with strawberries YUM! Check out this sundae
author: C U.

description:
This spot has been on my list for awhile and I was finally in the Outer Sunset area to check it out; except I still ended up walking a good 2 miles to get there. Nonetheless, I have to say that it was worth it. The shop was nice and chilled, which was great on a rare and hot day in SF. First of all, they have almost 50 flavors to choose from, which is so difficult for indecisive people like me. On the other hand, they have a wheel of ice cream where they can spin and pick a flavor for you according to the number it lands on and the numbers next to it (or if you're lucky enough, you'll get a free ice cream!).

After sampling a couple flavors, I decided on the Jasmine Tea and Green Tea double scoop ($5), but I split them to get one in a waffle cone and one in a cup. There's an offer for a free cookie or waffle cone with a Yelp check-in, except there's also a $5 minimum purchase to receive it thus me getting a double scoop instead of single. I'm not complaining though since both flavors were absolutely amazing. I loved how fragrant they infused the flavors with the florals in the Jasmine and the true bitterness of matcha in the green tea. When you can taste the bitterness of the matcha, you know you have legit green tea --yum!

There's plenty of candies and drinks to also purchase here. They also have a couple popular flavors in a pint boxed to take home if you wish. Great ice cream spot whenever you're in the area!
author: Cindy Z.

description: I only have three words to say: DURIAN ICE CREAM!!!!!!!!!! I guess that was more than three words. Been here twice and first time got only 1 scoop of durian (and one lychee). Came back again and got 2 scoops of durian (and one jasmine tea). All 3 flavors were good honestly. But DURIANNNNNNNN *heart eyes*
author: Trang T.

description:
Talk about a hot day in February and coming all the way out to this part of San Francisco. Polly Ann Ice Cream is definitely one of those nice corner places that has an old time-y feel to it that is different than those bougie parlors you find elsewhere in the SF. 

ICE CREAM: Mint Chocolate Chip. I will say that I may should have opted for another flavor. I think it was a standard mint chocolate chip, but nothing too overwhelming or exciting. 

SERVICE: OK

Maybe this is how I came to the A-OK rating. If I am around the neighborhood on a bright sunny San Francisco day, I'll come back. Definitely use the check-in offer here!
author: Albert H.

description:
Good alternative to Marco Polo.
We've been going to Marco Polo Gelato every time we come thru SF.  We love their specialty Asian flavors.  I came across Polly Ann and decided to give it a try.  Polly Ann did not disappoint!!  I do miss a few very specific flavors but Polly Ann has a very large selection w quite a few special Asian flavors and the price seemed more reasonable.  We like the lychee sherbet pineapple sherbet, ginger, black sesame.  

They have a large selection of flavors.  Some with weird/funny names.  The up side of that is it's funny and adventurous, but the downside is you have no idea what it is...  Star War?  Bumpy Freeway?  E. T.?  Gold Rush?

All in all, thumbs up!  We will be back to try some other flavors!!
author: Kathy H.

description: My brother came home with a tub of green tea ice cream, I opened it and it was brown, like chocolate brown.... I decided to take a risk and try it out and it tastes the same... just brown. So I called them asking if this was on purpose? They said yes, they changed their recipe... interesting.......
author: Carrie L.

description:
Hmmm... I think Polly Ann failed math class. I bought a box of Thai Tea bars and they either made a mistake or they're purposely misleading consumers with their nutrition label. 

Hello... 7g of saturated fat is NOT 6% DV, it's 35% of your daily value based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Look, I know ice cream has fat. Just be honest.

I would have contacted the "corporate office" directly but there was no website or phone number or customer service email address printed on the box :(

P.S. I do like Polly Ann ice cream, especially their green tea flavor. The bars aren't too special though. Not worth the calories.
author: Meows M.

description: We came to this place because they carry durian flavor ice cream! We ended up getting durian, green tea & taro. The durian flavor was very pronounced but not at all overwhelming. The taro was rich & creamy. The green tea was my least favorite as it was extremely bitter. I would totally come back the next time I'm in town to try their other flavors.
author: Cat T.

description: Polly Ann's is a neighborhood favorite, especially with the people that went to the nearby schools in the area. Since I grew up in Daly City, I didn't frequent this place much as a kid, but so many people I know talk about it fondly. Regulars will call in their orders and get a tub set aside for them for pick-up later. There are a ton of flavor options, including Asian flavors that now seem to be staples in every SF ice cream show, but I was partial to the Jamoca Almond Fudge. They also have snacks and candy, and I would look forward to the sour power options they had in stock that I couldn't find anywhere else. It's a close and reliable dessert option after a dinner of Korean BBQ and soju at Toyose (just a couple blocks down).
author: Ghia G.

description:
This place is seriously hyped up. The ice cream is just alright, nothing special. The flavors aren't that strong, the ice cream itself is isn't as creamy as ice cream is supposed to be. The employees are very patient and understanding when you are overwhelmed by the amount of flavors. They will help you sample your choice of ice cream flavors. Line will start to back up because some people take a very long time to try multiple flavors and there were only two employees when I was there.

I tried a few of the flavors and was greatly disappointed. Taro tasted off. Guava made my face scrunch, the texture was sorbet-like and it was dripping in a fake syrup flavor. I was recommended to come here for the durian flavor. Even that was not up to expectation. The durian flavor was too light, the texture of the ice cream was neither thick nor creamy. I can find better durian ice cream at the grocery mart. Lychee was actually pretty good, though.

Pretty cool place to stop by if you're interested in trying a huge variety of ice cream flavors. I wouldn't personally recommend anyone to try this place, though.
author: Jasmine P.

description:
Solid ice cream shop, but I need to admit that I was expecting more with a 1000+ reviews and 4 stars. The ice cream tasted frozen burnt (there was visual freeze on the scoops) and the flavors weren't so pronounced. I did enjoy that you could get 2 flavors in the single scoop for $3.75, but for that price and portion size, nothing crazy. I can't even remember the flavors I ordered - and that says a lot, since I ate it less than 24 hours ago.

I do admit that they have a prime location with a beautiful view of the pacific, and would have loved to sit outside on a bench in front to enjoy those views. Alas, only inside seating. 

Solid neighborhood spot, but def don't go out of your way for it.

Free waffle cone with Yelp check-in saves ya $.75
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
Have been coming to Polly Ann for years and I always have an enjoyable experience. They have a lot of yummy flavors that I enjoy - green tea, lychee, mango. Ice cream is always very creamy and yummy - this includes their boxed ice cream (and frozen pops are yummy) you can purchase in stores. I don't typically stray too far away from my Asian flavors because that I'd exactly what sets them apart from any other ice cream shop. They do these flavors and they do it well. I'm sure their typical flavors are good though.

This last visit, there were two groups ahead of us but it took awhile for us to get our order taken and fulfilled. I really think that they could benefit from having more than one person at the counter - maybe it was just a weird time to be busy? I also think that they can benefit with a little revamping of their space.... the feel is a bit early 2000s. Just a suggestion ;)
author: Jennifer W.

description: Can't help giving a low review because of how good it used to be. They had the BEST green tea ice cream  EVER about 2 years ago. Now they changed the recipe and it tastes too bitter :/ so yea....pretty disappointed in that but mostly everything else is good
author: Stancy L.

description:
I SCREAM. YOU SCREAM. WE ALL SCREAM FOR ICE CREAM.

Ugh. There's nothing more that I love than ice cream. It's my number one guilty pleasure and all time favorite dessert. My goal is to try every ice cream place I can.

This was my first time at Polly Anne's.
It is located in the corner so it's easy to find.

I love that there are so many flavors here.

The staff here is extremely helpful and nice. You can try samples and also if you're indecisive like I am, they have a wheel you can spin to help you choose a flavor.

I opted for a scoop of pistachio in a cup. The boo opted for a strawberry banana Oreo milkshake. Both were bomb diggity.

This place is super cute. I love that hey have Asian candy and snacks. They also have Asian or other exotic flavors too. I actually prefer this place over the hipster places in SF like bi-rite. Idk. If still go to either one lol I love ice cream so much. 

Thanks Polly Anne!
author: Jasmine N.

description: This place is a bay area gem. It has been here for a while. They are more known for their tubs of icecream sold in Asian super markets. They have alot of flavors , durian, hazelnut , banana Oreo, lychee, redbean , macupono, etc. Decent ice cream for a high price.
author: Brian C.

description:
Yummyy! Based on Yelp reviews Polly Ann's seemed pretty popular so I had to check it out when I was in the area. The flavors offered aren't super duper unique like the artisan ice cream shops in SF (ie Bi-Rite, Humphrey Slocombe, etc) but the quality and flavors are on point. 

When I visited I ordered a scoop of Macapuno (baby coconut) and Taro! Both were very tasty! I was happy to see those on the menu since I don't typically get Cookies n' Cream or Chocolate or Strawberry.  

There's free parking on the street in front of the ice cream shop!
author: Jessica N.

description:
This place made me feel more indecisive than when the optometrist asks me "1 or 2? 2 or 3?" Seriously, how do you even come up with 40 flavors?!

After deliberating for a good while, I finally settled on a scoop or taro and a scoop or mint chocolate chip. The mint chocolate chip is your pretty standard stuff except that the chips are extra large. The taro wasn't very strong tasting but had nice chunks of taro in it to make up for that. The ice cream isn't nearly as rich as somewhere like Bi-Rite which is kind of nice because it doesn't feel as heavy or dense.

The girls working the counter were great and politely told us that a particular flavor we asked about (Jasmine) wasn't available that day. Basically what I learned is that I need to come back in order to try them all. 

All in all, a really cute old-time shop with tons of flavors. It might not have been the best ice cream I've ever had but it was good enough and there are enough choices that I would still love to come back!
author: Jason W.

description: I really like how unique the flavor of the ice cream is. I ordered taro/green tea and jasmine/black sesame. All of the flavors were true to their natural taste. They didn't taste artificial or filled with sweet flavoring. The jasmine especially tasted like jasmine tea also with the green tea having a biter taste to it like actual green tea. Overall this place I would say is a must go for any ice cream lover that wants to try ice cream that doesn't taste like over sugared artificial flavoring. The line wasnt too bad and they also have a cool wheel you can spin to win things! They do have a minimum of 5 dollar charge on the card. And they also do single scoop splits which I liked! Will definitely come here again to try all their other flavors!
author: Leslie F.

description: Cute little ice cream shop in the sunset with lots of flavors. They have a lot of interesting and delicious flavors on hand, if youre not sure what to get be sure to ask for a sample. I really liked the turkish coffee and the pineapple. Pretty straight forward place service wise, staff were friendly. The prices here are a little more reasonable then other ice cream pleases in the city while giving you plenty of options. What I like about it is it felt more like a simple neighborhood ice cream shop unlike other fancy/hipster joints with their fancy flavored ice creams elsewhere in the city. Cute little ice cream shop with good ice cream, I wouldn't go out of my way to come all the way here from where I live but if I was in the neighborhood it would certainly be a place to stop by.
author: Peter P.

description: I've been eating Polly Ann Ice Cream ever since I can remember, before they even moved to this location. I even did a fundraiser with them when I was class treasurer in high school and I really appreciated the support! I do have to say their flavors used to be a lot better, notably the green tea and the durian, which just aren't the same as they used to be. However, they still make the best lychee ice cream I've ever had, and their sesame is great too. The red bean ice bars are delicious and chock full of real red beans. On Tuesdays, they have discounted pre-packed ice cream ($6.95 instead of the usual $7.95) and popsicle boxes ($2.00 instead of $2.50), so this is when my family goes to pick up some treats. The young guy at the counter was very nice both on the phone when I called to confirm discount Tuesdays, and later in person when we were purchasing the ice cream (2/6/18 evening). Remember to check-in on Yelp for a free waffle cone (cookie not available when I went)!
author: Nicole M.

description: The best ice cream place there is. They have AMAZING green tea ice cream that's incredibly satisfying and delicious. I cannot stop buying their tea flavored ice cream. There's so many other options to choose from too. I just wish they had one closer to me, because I'd be going there all the time.
author: Alina R.

description:
i LOVE ice cream! everyone that knows me, knows how much i love ice cream. if you see my yelp ice cream list... you'll know how much i love ice cream. 

i'm sorry but polly ann... i totally was not impressed by you. i really really wanted to be. 

i ordered durian without trying it. i have always been a durian fan. so i figured why get something i can typically order at any other ice cream establishment when i can get something a bit more unique. boy, was it hard to even eat. for the first time ever, i couldn't even eat more than 3 spoonful. so what did i do? i ordered another flavor which was coconut because my friends said that one is pretty good. end result- was pretty disappointed again. i really wished i can say i really enjoyed at least the coconut but i sadly cannot. 

my friend who ordered the guava didn't like his either. i tried it and felt like i just put a floral bar soap in my mouth! can i just ask if you tried these flavors before you decided to make a huge batch and put it out for the public to buy? when you have a ton of flavors and i cannot decide what to get, obviously i can't stand there and try all of your flavors but i would at least expect/hope that most of your flavors are decent to pretty darn good. 

they do get packed even on a cold night. staff didn't provide service with a smile. i personally wouldn't recommend polly ann nor would i come back. thanks for the terrible ice cream experience polly ann. 

tips:
*cash and credit card accepted
*indoor seating only
*free samples
*has a yelp offer.
*they recycle.
*no wifi
*no high chair
*street parking
author: Lisa D.

description: This is a cute little ice cream shop! The service here is really good, they're super friendly. I spun the wheel & ended up getting the Strawberry Rocky Road while my friend got Star Wars & both were delicious! If you spin the wheel, you can either get the number that it lands on or the 2 next to it. Keep in mind that if you use credit card, there is a minimum that you have to spend!
author: Stacie I.

description:
One of my favorite ice cream since middle school. I was truly lucky to be a block a way from my middle school to get ice cream almost every day after school. I don't know why I never left a review but this is one my favorite neighborhood ice cream shops in SF. They have tons of different flavors to try and if it's your birthday I think they usually let you spin the wheel or I think if you can't decide on a flavor you can also spin the wheel too. I'm usually boring and I go for green tea since that's always my go-to for ice cream flavors or black sesame flavor. Overall, the price here is pretty cheap for a scoop of ice cream. You can also CHECK IN to yelp and get a free sugar cone! :) Oh, just FYI, if you're going to be using credit card, there's a minimum that you have to spend. 

Mhmm....I'm craving for some ice cream now as I typed this.
author: Monica W.

description:
You know you're old if you remember coming here as a kid with the extra allowance you got to treat yourself to some salty fries or sweet ice cream. I'm old but I remember those days like it was yesterday. I remember my friends and I were upset when it closed for renovation but we were happy to see it get bigger and prettier once it reopened.

During my visits home, I made sure to grab an ice cream cone for old time's sake. Our family almost always has a pint of Polly Ann ice cream on hand, especially chocolate, mango or strawberry. Whenever our cousins come by for a visit, it's become almost a tradition spot for ice cream and laughs. We've dared each other to spin the wheel and eat the flavors at their own risk. Taro flavor? Really? Yuck!

My brother recently forced my sister to try the horrid durian flavor. The young lady at the counter that night was so sweet to offer my sister water and another flavor to sample just to get that nasty taste out of her mouth. We laughed so hard though, we still talk about it months later.

Service is amazing, especially considering how they've got to deal with so many loud children barging in, yelling out their orders and getting on a sugar high just from being there. Extreme amount of flavors to choose from and if you can't make your mind, spin that wheel, I dare you.

More neighborhoods need such mom and pop spots for good times and great memories. Love that my humble neighborhood is one of them.
author: Hala A.

description: Strawberry rocky road. Hell yes! Just like your typical rocky road except with strawberry not chocolate. i had some of my sisters hazelnut ice cream. Yum! This place has some different ice cream choices.
author: Estrella S.

description: Lychee is delicious.  Moved to corner store with more space and some tables.  Root beer was good but made me want to add the real root beer to make a float.
author: Janet J.

description: This is definitely a fun place with a great view! There are SO MANY flavors that it's honestly pretty overwhelming. I'll be honest--the flavor I got, Coffee Fluff, wasn't great. But my partner got the Four Cs and it was divine! I heard many people buzzing about the Asian flavors. I'd love to go back and try more!
author: Sara W.

description: Fun and tasty ice cream experience! They've got a spinning wheel for a chance at a free scoop! I went with a single scoop of Jamoca fudge almond and it was delish ($3.25) ! W/ check in i got a free waffle cone. A few tables and chairs to sit on. Fun spot!
author: Thomas L.

description:
Great ice cream shop with a very large variety of selections - both the mundane and the unusual. Every time I come here, I'm always tempted to spin the wheel for potentially a free ice cream without any successes so far! However, it always makes picking a flavor easy when you're limited to 3 flavors to pick from. You'll always get something youll be satisfied with! 

Additionally, the Polly anns brand popsicles are super cheap and very tasty. Each box comes with four which is perfect for sharing and costs very little. 

The only drawback to this place is sometimes it can get really dirty and messy, especially after all the AP kids get out of school. The lines are also ridiculously long to get to after school too so avoid those hours.
author: Edmund L.

description:
Been coming here for years...ever since they were still a tiny wooden paneled shop (a few stores down) that Anthony Bourdain visited (15yrs ago?). When Polly Ann's upgraded, it lost a little bit of its nostalgia and neighborhood appeal. BUT I will say, they never lost their taste (ice cream flavor taste that is). 

I must say, the Green Tea and Jasmine Tea flavors have always been my jam here. Toasted Almond sometimes gets thrown into the mix (but Swenson's is better for that flavor...). They don't dye their Jasmine Tea ice cream flavor here to purple, as I've seen in many other ice cream shops...which is MUCH appreciated. 

My only qualm about Polly Ann's is that they rarely have the Jasmine Tea pre-made in the buy and takeout fridges. Whyyyy. One time, I called in every other week (for almost two months to check). It was very annoying. AND today when I went in to get my Jasmine Tea, they didn't have any available at all!! Whyyyy are you always out? Is the flavor not popular enough or too popular?? I just want to better understand bc this is your best flavor IMO. 

Anyways, rant over. Come for some awesome and unique SF flavors. 4 stars for the best Jasmine Tea ice cream flavor in town...when it's in stock!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
SF institution thats been around for a long long time. Did a great job on the ice cream cake i ordered. Great quality and nice unique asian flavors

I actually go to marco polo a lot more since i live closer to there.. but great spot for those in the outer sunset
author: Mason L.

description: They stop serving at 9:55 pm!! Don't bother coming if you're coming at this time go to birite or smitten instead!!
author: Julie C.

description: Craving ice cream one night and was staying at an Airbnb near by.. found this place. It's a pretty cool ice cream spot, they have some crazy ice cream flavors. I couldn't decide what to eat so I let the employee pick for me ! They have an icecream called StarWars, give it a try :)
author: Cynthia L.

description:
I've had Polly Ann on my radar for a while, but I don't go to this area often, hence why it's been bookmarked since forever.

Well, enough is enough, I thought to myself. Nothing will get in the way of me and my ice cream, so I hopped in an Uber and went straight to Polly Ann! (Then I Uber'd straight back afterwards, no shame in my ice cream game.)

Free waffle cone with check-in, so two scoops came out to $5. I love the Asian-inspired flavors here, taro and jasmine ftw! Sad they didn't have Thai tea or black sesame when I visited, but I'll be back. IMO, you can't really compare Polly Ann to other places such as Bi-Rite or Humphry's. The flavors here are so unique that there's really no other place in the city that can compare (at least that I know of).
author: Laverne N.

description:
I have heard Polly Ann's is one of THE places to get ice cream so I was glad when I finally got to come here courtesy of the bf. There are so many unique flavors on the menu and I have to say, when you try a flavor, it tastes just like it's supposed to! Honeydew is honeydew. Red Bean is soooo red beany. It's crazy. I got the caramel salt lick and it had such an interesting texture. It's like a soft serve!
Unfortunately, the wheel was broken (by my friend, I later found out), so I was stuck with the difficult decision of picking a flavor. But, I have no problem with that. Polly Ann's is a great place with great staff. And it's so clean!
author: Jenn T.

description:
#88/2016

I haven't given many 5-star reviews lately but Polly Ann Ice Cream is surely deserving.

Friendly, polite service, a dizzying array of ice cream flavors, cleanliness plus a fun game of spinning the roulette wheel -should you choose to play- that either lands on an ice cream flavor you'll be committed to or a "free" space so you get a complimentary cone. 

(Now, if your ice cream's free you'll tip extra generously, right?)

Nearby West Sunset playground, AP Giannini middle school and SI high school, Polly Ann Ice Cream's  location in this family-friendly neighborhood of Outer Sunset can't be beat.

Check in on Yelp and get a free upgrade to a waffle cone.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
I always find myself coming here whenever I'm craving ice cream even if it's out of the way for me. Their ice cream isn't something to die for but it's the neighborhood spot to go to for sure. I love the wide selection of flavors they have to offer. My usual go to is the mint oreo cookie, honeydew, lychee, or the taro. Love how fruity the ice cream favors are especially with the chunks of actual fruit bits in them. You can also buy certain flavors in big tubs to go ! 

Only downside is that I wished their frosty machine had more than just the vanilla flavor.. I definitely miss the old days when they had the swirl !
author: Cindy Jane Y.

description: Growing up in the sunset, I frequented this place quite often. I make the flavor choice easy by just spinning the wheel. Its always clean and the staff are friendly. Everytime I come back to SF I always pay this place a visit
author: Sean S.

description:
we went 30 minutes before closing.  staff was still friendly even though it looked like they were cleaning up for the night.  you know how that goes - customers walk in after you cleaned up, then a  group of 5 decided they wanted ice cream last minute LoL

anywho, lots of flavors to choose from ... fancy names which made me stand there longer than i needed to just to read what each flavor was ... bumpy freeway = rocky road.

i tried a few .... black sesame, pistachio, toasted almond ... pistachio flavor happens to be my favorite flavor at any ice cream place i go to, but here, it didn't taste like pistachio, so i just stuck with the basic rocky road (fancy name Bumpy Freeway) and toasted almond.

the place didn't wow me, but would still recommend.  cute and friendly place if you're in the area =)
author: Ederlyn L.

description: My last trip to SF, I decided to try a new place or two, based on (who else), Anthony Bourdain's recommendations. Polly Ann Ice Cream did not disappoint, after a nice long bus ride across the city (what can I say, I live adventurously). No durian ice cream, however, so I settled for lychee instead. The area was quite lovely, too!
author: Karen O.

description:
Love love love their ice cream! On my last visit I had the black sesame and mangosteen. Both were freaking delicious and I regret not buying pints to take home ): they had so many types that it took me a while to decide on flavors. I also tried a bit of my bf's scoop of lychee which was also delicious, creamy, and refreshing. 

Update: came back again and this time I tried their American Beauty (limited edition rose flavor) and their jasmine tea flavor. So so freaking delicious. The American beauty had the perfect amount of sweetness and the floral wasn't too overpowering either. The jasmine tea flavor had the right balance of creamy and sweet with the subtle jasmine flavor. I did detect the tiniest hint of bitterness with the jasmine flavor, but I think I'm just being picky haha. Polly Ann's doesn't disappoint! If you're on the fence about this place, just come here. You won't regret it
author: Sandy K.

description:
Great and Friendly service!! Even though the line went out the door, we didn't have to wait too long to get our ice cream. Plus, they put out fresh samples of ice cream for those waiting in line!

If it's your first check in here, you can upgrade to a free waffle cone for your ice cream or get a free cookie! 

The ice cream is ! It's really rich and decadent! I got a double scoop of the Mint Chocolate Chip and Coffee & Oreo Bits in a waffle cone. There's hella flavors to choose from, but if you can't decide, you can spin the wheel and let it choose for you! 

You can also order milkshakes or buy pints of ice cream to take home! 

If you're feeling for something sweet, you should definitely come here! You can enjoy your ice cream in the shop (if there are seats available) or you can go to the beach (only a few blocks away!).
author: June F.

description:
After having a late brunch at Outerlands, we wanted ice cream cause that's what you want after a huge brunch and rainy weather!

We thought about going to Mitchell's but it was a bit out of the way, so we decided on finding another ice cream spot more en route to home. Polly Ann was the choice.

It's located off of Noriega and 39th. There's parking in front, but seems to be hit or miss as there's an Eggettes right next door. We were able to easily get street parking a block away.

It's a fairly small spot with 4 tables. They have a ton of flavors and we were lucky to be able to taste a good subset of them. The guy at the counter was quite patient as we hemmed and hawed at which one scoop to get. We ended up getting the Goji Ginger. The ice cream was fairly smooth, but reminded me more of ice cream I make from my ice cream maker. I did like the strong spicy ginger taste. The other flavors we tried felt a little fake in terms of flavor meaning a bit chemically. It also wasn't too far from the pints you get from 99 Ranch which is where I've had them before.

With the Yelp Check-in you can get a free waffle cone. We opted for a bowl since it's easier to eat in the car. Pricing is a bit expected for "special" ice cream though feel like you get less than what you'd get at Coldstone. But what's better than Coldstone is their service. Lots of smiles and lots of enthusiasm.

Try them once. Maybe you'll like it.
author: Carolen M.

description:
I had $20 to my name and only 5 bucks in my pocket so I figured why not ice cream? My cheap cravings led to this nice little ice cream parlor Poly Ann in the Outer Sunset.

Polly Ann is a small shop, thats actually kind of hard to notice when driving by on Noriega but on the inside it has a nice family friendly feel. The menu is displayed in decorative fashion with a wheel of fortune in the middle. I was really looking forward to spinning the wheel to test my luck on a free ice cream, but unfortunately it wasn't working. Instead I had to settle for a mystery bucket where I drew popsicle sticks, and it was still just as fun. I think a big positive to take away from Polly Ann is their wide variety of flavors, ranging from Ginger to "Bumpy Freeway". And the random drawing was also a whole lot of fun, great concept!

Now with the luck of the draw, I wasn't able to get a free scoop, but I did get a scoop of banana oreo ice cream. Although it was not the flavor I was expecting, the ice cream was freakin good. Nice creamy, thick consistency your looking for in quality ice cream. However there was a very strong peanut butter taste, but don't get me wrong it made it a whole lot better.

Hey if your in the neighborhood, and looking for a quick stop to get some quality ice cream, why not test your luck of the draw at Polly Ann's ?!?!
author: Adrian E.

description:
A great place to get ice cream. Pretty reasonably priced for the city. Left in a nice neighborhood and makes sense why it has been open for so long. 

Walking in you are greeted with three options. A basket of numbers where you can pick three flavors and decide where from there. The second option is spinning the wheel, and you get what flavor you get. Third option just the simply old-fashioned way where you pick your flavors.

With the selection, you can go as simple as cookies and cream ice cream to the end of the spectrum with gas leak Durian fruit.

-Atmosphere 5/5 - Great place in the neighborhood that it is in
-Service 5/5 - Staff is friendly 
-Quality 5/5 - Great tasting ice cream made in house 
-Price 4/5 - $3 for one scoop, $5 for two scoops

I would give this place a whopping score of 5/5.

Tip: Can get to sample the flavors before getting them.
author: Frank O.

description:
Polly Ann is on-par with Bi-Rite for me, except for Asian flavored ice cream! They have a large wheel you can spin if you can't decide or are feeling adventurous! However, you do have to get the one it lands on if you choose to spin!

I recommend the Thai Tea and Jasmine Tea. Yes, I'm sure those flavors have something to do with my boba addiction. :p Both flavors are not too sweet and are deliciously creamy. Also, Polly Ann is cheaper than many creameries in the city! 

I've had great luck with parking thus far, though I've always visited during non-peak hours. If the weather permits, grab your delicious ice cream to-go and enjoy it down at Ocean Beach!
author: Kristi T.

description:
My goto spot after going to Land's End for hike, which happened twice in less than 4 weeks (first just to hike; second time to catch Fleet Week, although we didnt' hike far enough--but that's a different story). They have amazing flavors, esp. the black sesame. Parking though stinks (some business parking but there's a popular HK-egg cake/boba right next door (I go there too), you are left with neighborhood parking.

Good crew, great ice cream. Can't complain when we scream for it!
author: Sonny W.

description:
VERY YUMMY!!! The quality of their ice cream is so delicious!! If you happen to not know what flavor you want, you can spin the wheel to choose a flavor!!! How cool?! I am a bit thrown off with their prices but you get your money's worth which is what matters. They even have a snack station, very very cheap man. 
Polly Ann's also sells their own tub of ice cream to buy and bring home. 
Parking is decent, mostly residential based parking.
author: Stacey M.

description:
I feel like this is the most underrated ice cream place in the Bay Area and part of that reason is probably due to location. 

The location is of Outer Sunset and there's really not as much commotion there except for the Beach and Golden Gate Park. Personally, I LOVE that it's located here and I never have a parking problem. 

Polly Ann has been around forever so you know they're good. I grew up with Polly Ann and I was always a fan of their wheel of fortune. Spin and watch your luck. It's a creative idea and also a fun game to play among friends, too! I haven't counted how many slots there are, but you may land on the lucky FREE one. 

I'll have to admit that I take Polly Ann for granted over other hipster and trendy ice cream shops. With all the social media and hype, we often forget that the good stuff is right near us. 

After so many x years, I ordered a Banana Oreo on a cone, and it solidified my reason for loving ice cream. Polly Ann brings back your childhood memories and lingers until the next day to make you come back for more. Through the years, I've seen the place start out as an ugly duckling and now into a beautiful swan. 

Forget the hyped up places all over SF and come here instead. No long lines and the authenticity you look for :)
author: Fiona L.

description:
NEVER been a fan of JB but even freakin Bieber knew how to say "Sorry". I never understood how some people can do such horrible things and make excuses/lies to cover up instead of just saying sorry. Have some dignity! 

Like... Polly Ann, girl, is it too late to say sorry? Yeah I know that I let you down. HOW COULD I NOT WRITE A REVIEW AFTER GOING TO YOU FOR A WHOLE YEAR 10+ TIMES? 

Mystical unique variety of ice cream flavors you will not find anywhere else. Amazingly friendly staff, always clean, good prices with generous portions? What's there to complain about?

Flavors alternate each month I believe. 

Top Favs atm:
-lychee 
-jasmine tea 
-raspberry sherbet 
-praline & cream
-mango and strawberry swirl 
-Thai tea 

2.95 for a junior (1 flavor)
3.50 for a single (1-2 flavor)
5.00 for a double (2-3 flavors) 
6.25 for monster (3-4 flavors) 

Also they sell certain ice cream in pints so you can bring home and enjoy while watching Titanic bawling with a box of tissues .... NOT THAT I DO IT......*shifty eyes* don't judge!  

They have smoothies, sundaes, soft serve, cup of noodles, snacks and candies as well to satisfy. 

If you're indecisive and you cool with any flavors, they also have a wheel they spin. The three closest numbers you can choose from. If you lucky, you can land on FREE and get any for freeeeee. :)
author: Chena N.

description: Great little place. We got the junior size of the coconut and pineapple. Perfect portion. Really yummy, with nice pieces of coconut in there. They had lots of other cool flavors that we'll have to try the next time we're nearby.
author: June W.

description: Okay ice cream. Might be repeatable at some point but not 1st or 2nd choice. Definitely not worth a wait. I think most of the line / wait was due to poor service. Ordered a banana split and they forgot banana until we mentioned it. Odd they use calculator for final total.
author: Luke S.

description:
Honestly, the ice cream here was fantastic. I'm no ice cream snob, but I'm the kind of gal who's made it a mission to try the best ice cream in all the cities and countries I can (14 countries so far)! I've got some standards.

A friend and I stumbled on Polly Ann upon passing by Devil Teeth's line and opting for something that would satisfy our sweet tooth cravings in a flash. There were over 40 options for ice cream, and judging from the steady but short line, everyone came to get their fix in the rare, overly sunny February heat. She got two scoops of green tea in a waffle bowl, while I got a scoop of blueberry cheesecake and another of hazelnut Oreo.

Both flavors packed a major punch, along with some much needed texture. They were at that perfect halfway point between too soft and way frozen; perfect to lick and just cold enough to keep from pooling in a drippy mess at the bottom of my cone. She wasn't as happy with her green tea as I was with my flavors, but I'll be more than happy to revisit for a $5 double scoop of two random flavors!

Check in for the free waffle cone! You won't regret it.
author: Gwen W.

description: Spin the wheel!! Millions of flavors and never go wrong with mango. Star Wars waffle cones and everything in between.
author: Gabe C.

description: This could have been a 4 or 5, but the Waffle Cone was a huge disappointment. The ice cream Selection is Huge 48-flavors - truly something for everyone. We had mint chocolate chip and toasted almond. The flavoring for both was excellent but the texture was slightly below the mark for premium ice cream.  Then came the biggest disappointment of all. In a specialty ice cream shop, I've come to expect a freshly made high quality waffle cone.  Not here. I got an out-of-the-box mass produced buy-at-any-supermarket cone.  Come on Polly Ann - get this part right.
author: Ray D.

description:
This is one of the coolest ice cream places I've been to in SF. They have about 40 flavors so you'll definitely be able to find something you like. If you're feeling lucky, they have this really cute wheel game. There are four squares that say "FREE" on them -- if you land here you get a free single scoop. The catch is that if you don't land on "FREE" you have to pick the flavor that you land on (or the one to the left or right of the square you land on). Maybe this sounds a little scary but luckily all the flavors sound good. :) 

Two of us split a single scoop of toasted almond (after losing the spin game lol) and it was plenty enough and plenty yummy. $3.50 for a single scoop & cash only for orders under $5. I really recommend giving this place a try especially if you've already ventured out to the more touristy Bi-Rite, etc.
author: Selena S.

description: A family friendly place with, "Spin the Wheel" and a variety of unique flavors. A neighborhood favorite for locals and tourists alike.
author: K M.

description: Fun and good ice cream! Give the wheel a spin for a choice of ONLY 3 ice cream flavors. It's a fun way to try something new! Recently discovered a new flavor that I like. I will be back to spin again!
author: Nino S.

description: This place has lots of interesting flavors. I'd tasted 3 and asked the squat woman behind the counter to taste a 4th (there were 5 that interested me) and she refused rudely, saying there was a 3-taste limit. We left even though we'd planned to buy a bunch of pints (about $70 worth of ice cream) for a party we're having this evening. Terrible customer service.
author: Philo L.

description: I loved my ice cream from here - super tasty for sure, but because the wait was about 20 minutes, it did make the ice cream outing a tad less enjoyable. Otherwise, if you find a less busy time to come or don't mind waiting in a long line for your ice cream, this is a good place to try!
author: Anne G.

description:
I tell myself I need to finish off my SF reviews, but I finish my SD/Las Vegas ones... and they happen AFTER my SF trip lol.


Polly Ann Ice Cream is amazing! Why do people not know about this place? Because it's on the West Side of SF in Sunset, not in Downtown or the Mission District. Polly Ann has many many flavors you can choose from

Taro- Subtle. Definitely subtle. Not overly sweet. I wasn't too much of a fan of this one compared to the other ones, but this was still pretty good. Which shows how much better the others one were.

Mintie Oreo Cookie- The mint was gooddddd. And if you love Oreo Cookie, you most definitely must get this! The oreo cookie is infused in the mint and the mint makes you wake up and loveeeeee the flavor.

CCC- I had chocolate. I only remember chocolate. I remember there being chunks but I forget what exactly what was in it. Don't be me. Don't inhale it. This was by far the best of the three :) Would recommend!

They also give doggie cones (I remember seeing that in 2008 or 2009). 

If you are indecisive, there is a wheel. Spin it. Whatever you land on, that's your flavor. You can't change your mind!

With a Yelp check in, you get a free upgrade to a cone :) or a free cookie. Your choice.

It's hidden so on Noriega, make sure you watch for it! :D
author: Raymond L.

description: This just isn't my fave ice cream in SF.  I haven't tried them all, but I've been going to Mitchell's for awhile, which i love, and this doesn't hold a candle.  I used to get Polly Ann's lychee prepacked, which they sell at Walgreens on John Daly in Daly City, and it was awesome (not sure if they still sell it or not, it's been awhile).  But in-store -- this is my 2nd time here and it just.doesn't cut it.  Last time I had your basic chocolate chip and it was just "ok.".  This time I had a scoop of lychee, which tasted like it was from the bottom of the container, not fresh, not creamy, and nothing like the prepacked tubs I've gotten.  I also had Thai Tea which was not at all sweet and even was a bit bitter.  If Walgreens has the lychee, I'll still get it -- and is why I'm giving 3 stars, in addition to the very nice young lady who helped me -- but it is unlikely I'll be back to the shop.
author: Merrick W.

description: Very good quality- loads of crazy flavors, including durian, lychee, and jasmine tea. The owner is very friendly and was happy to let us sample.
author: K C.

description: A classic ice cream spot. Really good ice cream. It's always quick and easy even when they are busy.
author: John Louie B.

description: Awesome so many choices and all delicious I'll def be back.  Anyone whose a rocky road fan will love this place they have 'bumpy road' in multiple flavors all the goodies in chocolate banana it strawberry flavored ice creams
author: JD E.

description: Really unimpressive quality of ice cream. Very mushy/runny and not cold enough. This is happens when you try to have a million different flavors - you sacrifice focusing on the actual textures and basic flavors of each ice cream. Would not recommend at all.
author: Dawnkee K.

description: They stop serving at 9:55, possibly sooner who knows...need to update the closing time!
author: Huan P.

description:
First time trying it. Had the sesame and red bean flavors. Both were good, creamy and strong flavor. 

The part where they give you a free cone when you check in on Yelp is nice. Even with the sign in its $5 for two scoops. 

The flavors on the wall changes constantly. I saw a flavor on Yelp that I wanted to but it wasn't there today when I arrived. 

There are about 5 more flavors I really wanted to try still. 


The cons: there was only one worker and I had to wait 10 mins because the guy in front of me bought two cartons and it had to be scooped out by hand one scoop at a time. 

The guy handling my cone and ice cream did not wear gloves. He also handled money. 

They let people cut in line even when you been waiting for awhile. 

When you say thanks to the worker they ignore you and don't say anything back. 

This place is nice for the neighborhood but the price is going up.
author: U L.

description: I used to come here when I was a kid.  My brother recalls the Star Wars flavor.  I loved that they kept the spinning wheel idea.  Newbies & oldies will enjoy the old & new flavors.  Special thanks to the girls working the counter.  Their smiles & customer service will keep customers coming back for a long while.
author: Lisa F.

description: We found out that there is a Sdead cow named Polly and then they had a poop named Ann then there was ice named cream
author: More A.

description:
My girlfriend and I love the bubble gum flavor here. This is a must-visit place in the city of sf. The staff is very patient and always glad to provide samples as many as you like. 

Other good flavors include Star Wars and black berry.
author: Tom Y.

description: Always a good place to stop by whether it is sunny out, or cloudy with a breeze. Great ice cream with many flavors to choose from. 48 flavors on the board or take a chance and spin tube wheel to possibly get free ice cream! Also, you can get a free waffle cone/cup when you check in! Paid $5 for 2 scoops. A little pricy but it is worth it!
author: Bryce B.

description:
After a long walk at Land's End or Crissy Field, coming down to the peninsula is a blast when taking an ice cream stop at the corner of 38th and Noriega. The best aspect of this place is that if you are indecisive of what delicious flavor you want, you have the option to spin the wheel.
You get to choose one of three flavors. The down side is that there are so many creative and yummy flavors. They are about 40 flavors to choose from. You can get a scoop of plain vanilla or Star Wars flavor (mint ice cream with colored marshmallows.) I recommend this place for people who want to try something different and get out of their comfort zone. Food- 5/5 Service- 5/5 Venue- 5/5 Overall-5/5
author: Max E.

description:
Cute little neighborhood ice cream shop, around since 1955 (I think I got that right...). They have a huge assortment of flavors, ranging from the typical to slightly more exotic (I guess that depends on your background, but whatever).

Be sure to spin the wheel for a chance at a free scoop - we won half-off a scoop after a weird spin. Check it out!
author: Claire S.

description:
Spin the giant wheel for a chance to win free ice cream. You don't actually physically spin it since it is behind the counter but they will spin it for you. I was one away from the freebie so big sigh for the missed chance. You get to pick from either the choice you land on or the numbers next to your number. Spinning is a risk chance since you are committed to paying for whatever you land on although at least you get three or four choices rather than just one.  

They have a variety of flavors and their oreo versions seem to be the most popular. My friend had the Nutella Oreo which was really good. I ended up with Coconut Pineapple which I didn't like that much since the pineapple had a strange artificial taste. A lot of their ice cream have invented names so you should ask them what they are. You can also ask for samples to taste test. Polly Ann has a lot more Asian flavored ice creams such as Durian, Taro, Black Sesame, Red Bean and they are quite generous with their portions. If you check in on Yelp, you can get a free cookie or waffle cone. 

The cashier was super nice and friendly and I give a big thumbs up to her for her amazing service.
author: Diana C.

description: I've been going here since I was a little kid!! This place is amazing. quality ice cream -- and now they have monster milkshakes!! I've yet to try them but their fun menu keeps me coming back
author: Noreen C.

description:
Durian? Black Sesame?  LYCHEE?!??  

Out of all the ice cream joints I could've gone to, Polly Ann's was 1st on my list.  With all these asian flavors, I HAD TO!

It was a cold day but I don't care..I didn't travel 600 mi for nothing.

I first had samples of the following: GT, Jasmine, lychee... then I started feeling bad I was taking too many samples, so I did one more: Durian.  The girl helping me started turning around and went to the back of the store.  She came back about 15 seconds later and handed me my durian sample.  Yum!!  Strong, pungent flavor... not exactly there but good enough.  I showed her my check-in and got 2 scoops: 1 durian and 1 Gt on a waffle cone; durian on top please.

This was obvious but I asked her if the durian ice cream was separated from the rest of the group.  DUH.  My ice cream was creamy, it had strong good flavors of both GT and durian.  The amazing part was I've never had GT ice cream with that particular flavor.  It was so distinct and tasted completely from the other realms of GT ice cream.   It was so good, I bought a quart of GT.  

The next day I had GT for breakfast and GT for Brunch.  Delish.  I wish there was a Polly Ann's here or even the ice cream distributed to S. Cali.  *sigh, wishful thinking.

Muy Bueno!!
author: Katrina N.

description:
Man, my friends and I came at a perfect time! A line was forming out the door after us. I'm usually very overwhelmed with ice cream spots because there are always so many flavors to choose from. However, I saw HONEYDEW! It was the very first flavor I sampled and I loved it! 

The honeydew flavored ice cream reminded me of those Melona bars sold in the Asian supermarkets! Mmmmmm! The ice cream was very refreshing. My friends ordered Thai tea, Starwars and Jasmine tea. All flavors were delicious, but the Jasmine was very strong! The consistency of the Jasmine tea was also pretty sticky. The Star Wars flavor was out of this world! Just kidding, I just really wanted to say that. It was a mint flavored ice cream with marshmallow bits. 

The service is super friendly!
author: Kathleen L.

description: Love Polly Ann's. Stop by if you're in the city. Worth the trek out to the avenues. Must try: sesame, lychee, mocha almond fudge. Lots a new flavors, and the servers are very nice and patient while I try almost every flavor. Remember to tip them!
author: Barnaby W.

description:
BF and I came to Polly Ann Ice Cream after a venture in nearby Golden Gate Park. The line was out the door and we thought man this must be good.  With a lot of flavors on the board and no repeats, we were overwhelmed with what kind of flavor we should get.  We ordered a double scoop in a waffle cone compliments of a yelp check in and chose three flavors--almond fudge, rum raisin and pistachio almond. 

The portions were huge and for the price we felt like the quantity was there.  Service was nice but slow. We must have waited approximately 30 minutes in line and I imagine it is because there's two people scooping ice cream and many guests probably ask to try a ton of flavors.  One thing I did not like is how the people serving ice cream both touch money and go back to serving.  

There's a few tables for inside seating but they were all full when we were there.  We opted to eat our ice cream in the car as eating on the sidewalk just didn't sound like fun to us.

Now onto the ice cream flavors. 

The strongest flavor was the rum raisin. The least flavorful was probably the pistachio almond.  The consistency of the ice cream was creamy but tasted "icy" and like it was stored in the freezer for awhile. 

Parking can be disastrous in this area, but if you're willing to walk a few blocks here you can park in the neighborhoods.  Given the location, taste of ice cream and slow service, I don't think we'd come back to Polly Ann's again.
author: Stephanie G.

description:
This place is very nice and clean with spacious as well. This shop, located in the sunset district of San Francisco has flavors that I never even heard of before. A friend took me to visit and it did not disappoint. 

The employees that was working that day (he may have been the boss) was very polite. He allowed us to try a couple of different flavors. I was told beforehand about the Wheel of Ice cream. My friend got me hyped about stories of possibly free ice cream but the wheel is nice for those who cannot pick a flavor. THEY HAVE A LOT OF ICE CREAM FLAVORS. 

So after looking at the menu I asked about a couple of different flavors and tried the bubble gum. Then I decided to spin the wheel to see what I would get as a choice. Since I could not choose just one flavor I got a waffle cone with Star Wars and Bubble gum. They both have the same color but of course taste different. 

It was a nice combination and I definitely would go back to this place when I get the chance.
author: Gregory C.

description:
Lots of options, but ice cream is never creamy, its always icey. The customer service is decent but for the tiny scoop you get, I think its over priced and not tasty enough. 
Also the frosty machine is always broken!!!!!!!!!

Cheap sodas though!! haha
author: Emma G.

description: I've been coming to Polly Ann's since I was a kid - it has consistently stayed delicious. Authentic ice cream, with a unique selection of flavors. I will continue to remain loyal to Polly Ann's.
author: Adriana G.

description:
Polly Ann's! Always good. About $3.50 for a bountiful scoop and they always have interesting rotating flavors (I saw Goji Ginger this time around). 

Less rich and not very heavy - more airy in texture. I've tried black sesame, pistachio almond, and some other ones and they've always been good! Service-wise, Polly Ann's is always inviting and friendly and the shop is always clean.

Good ratings all around =)
author: Emily C.

description:
Mmmm mmm 

I love that Polly Ann's have unique flavors! I love to get the durian flavor because it's so hard to come by in ice cream stores. I love the fact that it's a quaint shop, rich with history. It kind of captures the feeling of San Francisco to me. I do and will continue to come often (as my waistline allows) because of the yummy flavors, cheap prices, and convenient parking. 

One star taken off for the slow service :/ Maybe it's the flavors I choose, but the staff always has to go to the back to scoop my ice cream. I'm not sure if they have the top access freezers behind the counter, but I hope they'll keep my flavors there next time so I'm not waiting for them to run to the back, scoop the ice cream, and then come back to the counter.
author: Tina Y.

description: They have the absolute best Black Sesame ice cream.  I'd go out of my way any day to buy a 1.5 Quart tub for $7.50.   Mmmmmmm so good.
author: Christina L.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE. I've been coming here since I was a kid till now. It's really just a great place to come to for ice cream. The assortment of different flavors is amazing. My favorite flavor there is the lychee, I love how it doesn't taste like artificial syrup flavoring and it has actually lychee bits. I always love bringing friends here to show them this neat little place.

Oh yeah there's not much seating here btw, so if it's a nice sunny day in San Francisco you're most likely not going to get a seat and the line might go out the door.
author: Deanna C.

description:
My ice cream craving was not met here.

It is a nice location. It is on a corner. The color of the building is definitely eye catching, cone sign above entrance. There are a few chairs to sit down. Everything is white on the inside. The flavors are on the wall. Milkshakes range from $7.99 to $9.99 which I think is crazy. A double scoop is $5.00 bucks. The pricing seems a bit lopsided in comparison to what you get. I got a single scoop and it was a puny scoop. The taste was great but the size of the scoop was pathetic. In looking at the prices you would think that you would be getting LARGE scoops, you're not!!!!

Just a let down. They get the 3 stars for location, speed of service, and their moderate selection of flavors.

HUGE DISCREPANCY between pricing and sizing of scoops. As soon as that is fixed this score will change. Highly disappointed. On to the next ice cream shop! 

Maybe I will just keep an eye out for an ice cream truck. They have never let me down like this place did today!! Looking for another single scoop to satisfy my ice cream craving!!!
author: Robert F.

description:
Best ice cream in the city!  Asian favors and great service!   

Love the spinning wheel selection. Family friendly.
author: TC C.

description: There is a lot of icecream flavors to choose from! Be aware that lines might take long because there was only one ice cream server at the time I went. From the line being so long, the icecream server rushed me and my bf to pick a flavor. I guess we didn't mind bc we knew our flavors from standing in line. I want to try more samples D: anyways, this gets a low rating because as soon as I got my icecream,my icecream cone drops!! I asked for the cone on top bc I forgot to say it so I didn't trip to have a cup and cone on top to lessen his troubles. But the icecream server saw it drop and didn't do anything about it then went on to the next person. My bf and I expected to be offered another cone but nope. Atleast my boyfriend liked his Thai tea icecream..
author: Alex S.

description:
The thing about Polly Ann is that their flavors are hit or miss. One flavor could be bomb diggity and one may not. I do appreciate that they have lots of flavors to choose from but sometimes that can be a curse because you have such a hard time deciding on what you want. If you can't decide you can always spin the wheel and go with the flavor it lands on. I've never actually spun the wheel myself but it's fun watching other people do it. 

My all time favorite is the green tea. I thought the durian was good but after trying Marco Polo's durian gelato, Polly Ann's doesn't even come close. 

Aside from ice cream, they also have a bunch of candy and snacks for sale.
author: Kelly L.

description:
This is definitely the best ice-cream place in the Sunset District. I've been coming to this spot for over a year now and have yet to have a bad experience of any kind. I'm hesitant to offer a 5 star based on the fact that prices keep going up and are now at about 10 dollars for 2 people, but it still remains a regular spot for me because it's consistently yummy, has great service and many, many flavors- no joke like 100. 

Pro Tip: If you can't decide what you want, try spinning their "ice-cream" wheel. You may win some free ice-cream, and if you don't, you'll still be getting a tasty flavor.
author: Alex B.

description: 3 stars for decent coffee, banana, and sesame flavors. The rest are total junk and taste like jolly rancher versions of fruit. While I enjoy jolly ranchers, I expect watermelon sherbet to taste like...wait for it, actual watermelon. The pineapple was a disaster, just sugar and frozen cream. So gross.
author: Alana V.

description: Love that this ice cream place is located in the sunset! Been coming here since childhood and they've remodeled once in all those years. They did keep the wheel though! The wheel is something unique to this ice cream shop where you spin it if you can't make up your mind on which flavor you want. If you do choose to spin the wheel, you have to must either choose the flavor that the needle lands on or the one to the left or right of that (even if you land on a free one). They have Asian flavors such as mango, green tea, lychee, black sesame, and durian! And some other interesting ones such as cotton candy, bubblegum, and rum raisin! Service is always great and the tables and floors are always clean. Prices are also decent and portions are generous.
author: Cynthia T.

description: Was aight. Nothing special. Service was slow. Lady was working hard tho just not working efficiently lol. Nothing bad, just didn't wow me. But it's cute that they give out free dog cones
author: Michelle M.

description:
Polly Ann's.
The sweet tooth of my youth.
Place value on the tooth so I swear I spit the truth.

I'm 25 not yet sitting 25 mil.
Only got 25 memories of those Double Scoop chills.
Only had 25 years to choose the flavor I feel
That's 25 reasons for me to spin the Wheel

Heavy spin to the left.
Counterclockwise
twirling against the hands of time 
going backwards on my path.
To the bowl shaped hair kid who was scared of math
calculated that a Banana Split was worth more than cash
and I showed my work using simple fractions
half Mango, half Star-Wars, half Banana - that last one a distraction
From the adventures of new flavors Thai Tea and Taro
acquired taste, Rum Raisin acquired tomorrow
Durian is evil and Vanilla good
things were simple 
things were understood.

Wheel stops.
Back to the present to the standard of what is pleasant
for an ice cream needs be organic and free of GMO
and bacon bits scattered over Cookie Dough
40 tea flavors that i can't pronounce
twelve dollar pints and four dollar ounce
lines around the block where the cool kids flock
not there for ice cream but for the selfie shot
Wheel stops.
I look up at Polly Ann and the simple times,
It's the flavor of Nostalgia.
Red Bean Ice.

foodkid fAAtcity
author: Ringo M.

description: the ice cream is definitely delicious and the parking really isn't bad in this area. not a ton of indoor seating, but on a warm(ish) saturday afternoon there was one table open at any given time. i got the banana chip and my friend got the mocha almond fudge. i loved mine and so did he! $9.00 for two single scoops in a waffle cone.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Got the Thai tea & black sesame seed ice cream & my boyfriend got the jasmine tea & green tea ice cream. We asked for one scoop of each & their scoops were very generous!!! I used the Yelp check-in reward which is a free cookie or waffle. I got a free waffle bowl.

All four ice cream flavors were delicious. The Thai tea is my favorite as it tastes exactly like drinking the actual drink. Definitely recommend!
author: Trisha G.

description:
I really thought that this place would be better. It looks cute and has a cute design, but I've had way better ice cream. I think the reason it gets good business is because there's no ice cream places near it. They also don't give enough ice cream for the price paid. 

Wish I liked it more since it's so close.
author: Hayley D.

description:
i tried the hazelnut oreo and was disappointed that it tasted more like coffee than hazelnut, so that wasn't my final pick. 

i got red bean, which was kind of bland and didn't have enough red bean in it. my friend's strawberry rocky road was fine, but not memorable.

tl;dr, stick to the jasmine and black sesame.
author: Heather F.

description:
If you want a trip to childhood nostalgia this is the place!

There are so many cool and different ice cream flavors! I want to come back and try so many more! The service was great, and they even let us take to go cups with lids to take home.

There is so much crazy candy I remember having in the 90s in there! It was such an awesome throwback. The whole atmosphere is a fun and friendly one!
author: Larissa S.

description:
Apparently Polly Ann Ice Cream has been around for quite some time.. and I've never been in all my trips to SF?? It finally took until today for a SF local to take me here.... and I LOVED it. 

When I first arrived, I have to admit I was pretty overwhelmed by the huge number of choices here. There is a flavor for everyone for sure! I had heard some great things about the black sesame, so I knew I was going to get that. And since I am a huge fan of mint ice cream, the girl behind the counter recommended angel mint pie. I tried about 5 samples, and the girl was very patient with me.. so thank you! 

ANGEL MINT PIE... freaking delicious. As a mint ice cream lover, I definitely approve! There are little pieces of chocolate cake and the mint is not too overpowering. BLACK SESAME... REALLY REALLY GOOD! The taste of the black sesame is really strong, and it just tastes fresh and authentic. I would definitely get both of these flavors again. But with so many flavors, I would definitely come back to try those too! Oh yeah, they have a really interesting one called STAR WARS... and its basically mint ice cream with marshmallows lol.

THAI TEA & JASMINE TEA flavors are delicious as well! OH, and check in and show them on yelp for a free waffle cone or cookie! Can't wait to come back!!
author: Sandy Y.

description: We went here for the first time last night.  I got the banana chocolate.  It was not creamy at all. It was almost like a finely chopped sno-cone - like it had thawed and was refrozen.
