I then tasted my husbands and it was nice and creamy.  I told the gentleman helping us that I was unhappy with my ice cream - it was not creamy and had the texture of ice.  I then ordered their version of rocky road.  Totally different texture (creamy). When he handed me the new cone, I tried to give him the reject.  He told me I could keep it since he was charging me for both!  I was shocked!  He said since I had tasted it before ordering, I would have to pay for it.  I told him I had not tasted the ice cream before ordering it and he said I would still have to pay for it.  Such poor customer service!!  We won't back and won't recommend to our friends.  Besides, way better ice cream options in SF.
author: M W.

description: Ice cream like no other. Unique flavors made out of real cream. Dog friendly as well.
author: Tim R.

description: I had seen this Ice cream shop for some time, but never had time to go in. Finally, I decided to treat all of my kids to ice cream.  It was worth the stop. The ice cream is rich and flavorful.  Worth a visit.
author: Elizabeth M.

description: Tried the Lemon Chippie (lemon ice cream with chocolate chunks in it) and it was amazing. Check in for a free waffle cone!
author: Holly G.

description: Polly Ann changed their prices. It's more expensive for a 2 scoop serving. POOOOO!
author: Denise C.

description:
Is it extreme to say that this is the best ice cream shop in San Francisco? I know a lot of people are going to disagree and throw out Humphrey and Birite but Polly Ann is where it's at! 

When I'm craving ice cream after a meal and pay for a cup, I want to be able to finish my ice cream scoop. I'm sure you've encountered the times when your order was so sweet it starts hurting your throat (unless you have the biggest sweet tooth). At Polly Ann's you don't have to worry about that. There's also a hugeeeee selection of ice cream flavors. The names are mysterious and fun. You're not going to be able to tell what the flavor is for some of them...unless you ask them. 

I love.. their toasted almond and matcha! They also have a jasmine tea flavor which is more floral. For durian lovers, they also have durian ;)
author: Ingrid C.

description:
Spin the wheel if you dare!  Just hope it doesn't land on durian, lol.  

They make all the ice cream & have creative names for the flavors.  Old fashioned style ice cream.  I think they supply many of the quality Asian restaurants with green tea, red bean, lychee & black sesame ice cream.  They can also be found in some small corner stores.

I find a new favorite with each visit - depends on my mood.  I do like the fruit flavors like mango & lychee.

I love that they provide little cones for your doggy.
author: Kim S.

description: My favourite ice cream place with 40+ choices for most of the time. Love their jasmine and Dutch chocolate.
author: Jane L.

description: This place has over 40 flavors of ice cream and if you want you can try them all. The flavors are creative, interesting and delicious. I tried the taro, Dubliner (guinness), Turkish coffee, watermelon sherbet, kooky dough boy, hazelnut, and star wars. All were delicious but I decided to get the watermelon sherbet since it was a rare warm day in the city and I wanted something refreshing. I cant wait to go back and try the other flavors! The price and sizes are reasonable and if you get a double scoop they can give u a half scoop of a flavor so you can get three flavors. Give it a try!
author: Nia R.

description: Amazing icecream!!! I had the blueberry and Oreo cookie! My husband had mango, blueberry, and coconut! We both loved the flavor!! Simple and delicious!!!
author: Miri S.

description: My nieces were looking for an ice cream place close to where we were and found the closest one was this store ... The flavors are quite unique and tempted to try some flavors but tried just one since there was a long line... Their guava sorbet and watermelon sorbet is so refreshing ... I am not into sorbet but this the two flavors are worth getting for non sorbet lovers you will definitely Love It!
author: Maripaz L.

description: Great service! Wonderful selection of flavors. I got the double scoop waffle cone of Jasmine Tea and Thai tea which were packed with flavor. Totally would come here again. Line can get kind of long but they go away fast.
author: Michele G.

description:
All I have to say is... Ice cream is bomb.

I live an hour away from here and I kid you not, I drove here because I was craving their ice cream. There are literately so many different kinds of flavors that it gets difficult. If you're torn in between 3-4 flavors, no worries, price for 3-4 flavors is well worth it. Workers here are so patient and super friendly!
author: Rachel A.

description:
I visited this charming little ice-cream shop in the outer sunset this past weekend. The locals love swinging by this place for their interesting selection of flavors. There are lots of asian inspired flavors like black sesame, lychee, durian, and red bean. They also have your classics like pistachio, mint chocolate chip, and vanilla. And then you have some interesting ones that I was not brave enough to try - star wars, rum raisin, and goji ginger. I ended up going with chocolate and oreo bits which was perfectly fine with me! 

Polly Ann's is cool because they have a giant spinning wheel behind their counter where you can request a spin for the chance to win free ice-cream! Otherwise you can choose among the 3 numbers; where the needle lands and the two flavors besides it to the left and right. 

Lastly, they apparently have doggy ice-cream cone treats that you can get with ice-cream. So if you have a furry friend, you can bring them in for a sweet treat! My friend brought her dog and she loved it!

TIPS
-Check in to Yelp to redeem a free brownie or waffle cone offer!
-SPIN the wheel for the chance to win free ice-cream
author: Grace J.

description: My neighborhood ice cream store. Delicous ice cream with some unusal flavors like red bean. Try the Turkish Coffee if you love coffee ice cream.  Can't decide, then spin the wheel, you might win a free ice cream cone. If you don't win you get the flavor it landed on or the ones on the adjacent sides.
author: Michael N.

description:
Came to Polly's after being buzzed from drinking. I was seriously so miserable here from my headache, but the ice cream made life a little bit better for me. 

My boyfriend recalled coming here when he was a widdle boy, so it brought a lot of memories for him. We ordered the Star Wars, which was out of this world. The pieces of marshmallows were a nice surprise. I love mint ice cream, and this flavor has this minty freshness that I was familiar with. We also ordered the Jasmine Tea flavor. Man it was hella strong. If you like that strong tea taste, go for it. It was overpowering the Star Wars, which I was sad about. 

Polly Ann's is the picture perfect ice cream parlor with the perkiest workers I've ever met. Great service, good ice cream, happy me.
author: Veda T.

description:
The standout decor would have to be their huge wheel on the wall behind the counter. They have SO many flavors to choose from that they have a wheel to help you pick your flavor. I didn't request to use it because I'm a wimp like that but if you're adventurous, it's a fun way to discover new flavors!

I settled for my favorites: taro and cookies n cream. The flavors are seriously on point and that's pretty much all I need for ice cream. Oh, and the staff looks pretty tired of their work. Don't expect any smiles. But who cares. Tasty ice cream near my home. I can't complain!
author: Lani C.

description: Polly Ann offers a large variety of selection- which includes the traditional flavor and Asian flavor. I particularly like their jasmine tea ice cream and taro ice cream! Also Eric, the owner is super helpful and nice, he waited for us even the shop is closed. This is definitely one of my favorite ice cream shop in the Bay Area.
author: Chel T.

description:
Urghh..it taste like fake ice-cream. So much artificial flavor added. 
I sampled alot of them but i just couldnt settle to one flavor! 
in the end i got the red bean flavor a try and i just couldnt finish it. 
Will never come back here for their ice cream.
author: Michelle T.

description:
Hm. Is it just me 'cause I thought Polly Ann was only OK. We ordered durian and taro on waffle bowl. The flavors were present but not rich enough. The consistency was good but not exactly creamy. In addition, the waffle bowl was stale. To simply put it, it was average and no different from Polly Ann ice cream you can buy at the grocery store. 

Also, for the quality, the price is a bit steep (close to ~$6). I wouldn't recommend coming here.
author: Vivian L.

description:
I grew up on Polly Ann's back when it was a few doors down and merely a hole in the wall. After it was moved and remodeled it's nice to see it still has some of the touches of the original location e.g. the menu, (so retro looking) and some of the signs/quotes.

On my recent visit I was telling my girlfriend about the Starwars flavor they had when I was younger. I didn't know what was in it and surprisingly it was still there! After trying a sample I knew I wanted more. It's minty with a touch of marshmallows, but there could be other things subtle mysterious ingredients in it. I also got the jasmine tea, which was the strongest jasmine tea flavored ice cream I've ever had. It was like I was eating a tea bag. It had a weird texture that was not reminiscent of ice cream, but more so a blob of fluffy and cold cream.

I thought it would cost more, but the double was $5 and you can get 2-3 flavors. The servers here are very friendly and patient. They don't mind giving out samples (but being a dick equates to smaller portions, according to sign, lol). The lady who served my group smiled the entire time and continued to do so with the long line behind us.

This is definitely one of the better, or quite possibly the best, place to get ice cream in the Sunset District.
author: Micki H.

description: Probably Da Best Ice Cream from a Locally Owned Family Business Since ' Buds ' , an Old San Francisco Favorite. Many Traditional Favorites and Some Many Asian Flavors , Which are Not My Thing , With the Exception of of Taro.  Beware Though  - - On a Hot Afternoon School Day , The Line is Out the Door .
author: Gerry L.

description: Not too impressed. The vanilla wasn't great, and the other flavors I tried weren't that great either. I guess most businesses stay afloat by using cheaper ingredients these days. The place looks fairly clean, though I noticed that the counter person had to remove a few cones that were stale in order to get one in the middle that was still good, so I am not sure.
author: Sam T.

description:
I'm changing my one star review to three stars for owner/manager Eric's response and nice gesture. Unfortunately, I can't set foot there again even with his free offer. (The cashier said impatiently last night they didn't make any prepackaged durian ice-cream anymore when I asked about it.) I still have his words playing in my head--he said loudly to me about 5 times that they had no green tea ice-cream in front of a bunch of other customers making me look like an idiot. I'll enjoy my ice-cream elsewhere.


My original review earlier today:

I had a very unpleasant experience here with their grumpy male cashier last night. 

I wanted to get prepackaged durian ice-cream but couldn't see any in their self-serve freezer with a clear glass door. The cashier told me they had none, so I pointed to the freezer and said I'd get the green tea flavor instead. He then said they didn't have any green tea ice-cream. I was totally puzzled and pointed to him a bunch of them (20+ green-color "green tea" labeled quart size boxes) in the freezer. He then repeated in a very annoyed and impatient tone that there's no green tea ice-cream. 

I couldn't believe my ears and went to the freezer, picked up one of the many green boxes to put on the counter and pointed to the "green tea" label on the preprinted box to show him. He then said loudly and rudely, "I work here today and I know" without ever any explanation. It was only then that I saw the top face of the box, which was covered with a "mango" labeled lid. 

Even if the store decided to confuse customers with mango ice-cream packed in green tea labeled boxes, why can't the cashier explain it to a customer? And the rudeness was inexcusable. I will not be back anymore.
author: Linda A.

description: Something is wrong with you if you don't like Polly Ann ice cream. It's delicious ice cream served by lovely people. What else do you want.
author: Montgomery R.

description:
This place has a variety of flavors! Best thing.. you can sample until you find the one you love! If you can't decide what flavor you want, they will spin the wheel for you! I want to try all of their flavors... I've been here a couple of times. This time, I got green tea and strawberry/mango swirl ice cream. I also have tried jasmine tea, thai tea, sesame, and durian. Durian is okay for me. I am not too big of a fan of durian in general, but I wanted to sample it just to see how it would taste. My favorites are jasmine tea and green tea so far! I enjoy the creamy texture. 

SIGH. I want more jasmine and green tea :(

Better yet... Eggettes is right next door. So of course, before I came here, I had to get egg puffs first. I brought the warm, hot, crispy egg puffs to Polly Ann and carefully filled each egg puff with the right amount of ice cream. It was the perfect combination. Heaven.

I'll be back soon!
author: Kimberly H.

description:
The quality of this place is acceptable.  It's location is convenient for parents (it's right next to a school) and I've eaten there a few times since I'm close by but there's no reason I'd ever go to it again if I had to exert an effort.

If you're nearby and want ice cream?  Sure, go for it.
author: Sarah S.

description:
SO GOOD. 

Ice cream scoops here are massive. One scoop is enough to share with another person. My girlfriend and I enjoyed the black sesame and thai tea. 

Check-in on Yelp to get a free waffle cone.
author: Marco C.

description: Pretty good ice cream.  There's almost too many weird flavors to choose from that it can get a bit overwhelming.  In saying that, the customer service here is great!  There are always teens working and they are always super friendly and accommodating.
author: Sierra W.

description:
Ice cream has to be delicious! There is no exception.
This place has a lot different also funny names flavours. There is a Starwars one haha. I got the Dutch chocolate. I expected it to be thicker and heavier than it was. 
Ok for a sunny day, hot day and to get a nice moment with friends.
Today there were so many people, that I couldn't ask calm and try so many flavors. 
Recommended for families.
The place and neighborhood is easy going and relaxed.
author: Vicky D.

description:
Really good ice cream and exotic flavors!
I had Lychee and Honeydew ice cream they were both really good. All of their tea flavors are really good as well.
author: David K.

description:
Ordered through Postmates and got the Kooky dough. Basically payed $9 for a pint of vanilla ice cream. Almost no cookie dough in the entire pint.

Boo
author: Cindi G.

description: Polly Anns doesn't disappoint especially when it's not busy! Came here in the middle of the day on the weekday and nobody was in line. I ordered a double scoop with lychee and jasmine tea (I think...lol). The scoops were super dense and full and worth the price because they were so huge! My ice cream cone needed up being really top heavy and falling off the cone.... And onto my lap in the car! Haha. But if you're around and want ice cream I would definitely give this place a try!
author: Briana L.

description:
Growing up, my family always bought a tub of Polly Ann's ice cream during our weekly trip to the supermarket. When my friends and I walked by Polly Ann Ice Cream on the way to Eggettes, I decided I had to get ice cream instead! The shop is nicely lit and super clean with the bathroom on the far right side. (They have to buzz you in.)

They have a really wide selection of ice cream flavors. If you're feeling adventurous, they have a wheel that you can spin, but you have to get the flavor that it lands on. Wanting to stay on the safe side, I ordered a scoop of taro ice cream.. yummy! A scoop is $2.50, but if you check in on Yelp, you get a free scoop. Score! I'd definitely come back to satisfy my sweet tooth, especially when I'm craving some Asian flavored ice cream.
author: Christine S.

description:
I stumbled upon this place on Yelp and I love ice cream so I had to try it!  I got the caramel pudding and the peanut butter oreo.  Delish!  Even though I got a small size the portion was generous.  Employees were super friendly and patient in answering questions, offering samples and making suggestions.

My husband tried the red bean and green tea and while he liked them as samples, was not as enthused about them as his choice.  We got to try the black sesame which was tasty.

I will definitely come back here when I am in town!

It is small inside and we were there during the day and when it was hot, so we took ours to go (walked and ate) so be prepared for limited or no seating options.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
The first thing I do is to run up to the counter and exclaim, "Can I try the durian!?"

Because how many places will sell durian ice cream?? To my knowledge, only Polly Ann.

A run-in with our friends a few days prior had left me craving green tea ice cream (which the next door Safeway does not stock, fyi) after dinner. The guy and I simultaneously thought of visiting Polly Ann--great minds think alike.

The staff here are fantastic and very willing to let you sample as many flavors as you want. I tried the durian (true to flavor but not as sweet as ripe durian in Taiwan, despite it being in ice cream form), black sesame (so good. deep sesame flavor), and taro (sweet sweet sweet).

The smart cookie he is, my boyfriend convinced me to spin the wheel to simplify the selection process since they have an overwhelming 48 flavors to choose from. Spinning the wheel of fortune (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/polly-ann-ice-cream-san-francisco?select=f_mladLCz_9PW-vNwZWcGA#f_mladLCz_9PW-vNwZWcGA) contractually binds you to choosing among three flavors: the one the arrow is pointing to, the one to the left of the arrow, or the one to the right of the arrow. And, if the arrow lands directly on the free tile, you got yo'self a free scoop!

My boyfriend's spin got him a scoop of MARBLEOUS MINT, #32, which is a rich, creamy combination of mint, chocolate, and other amazing schtuff. Fortuitously, my spin landed me a scoop of GREEN TEA, #28, which I had completely forgotten was the reason why we came here (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/polly-ann-ice-cream-san-francisco?select=f_mladLCz_9PW-vNwZWcGA#GE5UiolesDyOiT0eSUgBog). The green tea was subtly wondrously sweet with its permeating matcha flavor.

$2.95 for a single scoop in a cup, and you get 1 free scoop if you check-in on Yelp yeeee.

Spin the wheel, try the green tea, and definitely try the durian! It'll be the nastiest burps you've ever had bahaha.
author: Adele F.

description:
When I was a teenager looking for a summer job, I actually auditioned to be a performer at the Great America amusement park down in Santa Clara. Yes, I know it's hard to believe but true. Now the only song I knew the lyrics to at the time was Blood, Sweat & Tears' "Spinning Wheel"... "What goes up must come down / Spinning wheel gotta go 'round..." I barely got to the chorus when they stopped me and told me to apply to the food services area. That was the end of my Grammy-winning aspirations, but I managed a sense of déjà vu when I saw the spinning wheel behind the counter at Polly Ann (photo: http://bit.ly/12Z0E4n). "Talking about your troubles it's a crying sin / Ride a painted pony, let the spinning wheel spin..."

Jamie W. and I came here after an all-day road trip we took up to Sebastopol. I recalled Polly Ann from a list of ice cream must-try spots I wrote about as the SF Travel Examiner a few years back. It was the one spot I never tried before, so it was about time we got here. In business since 1955 under various mom-and-pop owners, the spinning wheel is a leftover gimmick that allows indecisive customers to use a carnival-type wheel to determine what flavor they're going to have. I didn't see a single customer willing to go for broke since they now offer 500 flavors, and surely they can't all be winners. I know because I came up bust on at least one flavor.

I decided to go for three flavors with a $4 Double serving in a cup. The Bumpy Freeway was their term for rocky road and just what I wanted with the marshmallows and nuts in milk chocolate ice cream. The Pistachio Almond was also fine, but the Four C's was a train wreck of a flavor. the combination of chocolate, coffee, champagne and cherry brought out a medicinal flavor I couldn't shake for quite some time (photo: http://bit.ly/10MqCb8). Jamie was wiser and stuck with a $2.95 Single in a cup combining Rum Raisin and Cookie Doughboy (photo: http://bit.ly/19jtArl). That was a more satisfying mix than the random, ADD hodgepodge I had them pull together for me. "Ride a painted pony, let the spinning wheel fly!"

ICE CREAM - 3 stars...perhaps the luck of the wheel could help you maneuver the 500 flavors they offer, maybe not
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...old-fashioned spot with few tables (photo: http://bit.ly/1a6pQJd), expect to take it with you
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...cheery enough...though given the excessive number of choices, they should act more like sommeliers and discourage us from making bad combo choices
TOTAL - 3 stars...I think I'll stick with the basics the next time I come here
author: Ed U.

description:
Love, love this place! Has ALL kinds of flavors, from the Asian to the American. It's hard to make up your mind so they have this big spin that makes it more fun and easier or harder to choose! You can spin the wheel for a chance of a free scoop but whatever flavors the arrow lands on, you have to pick between that one flavor and the two flavors flanking right next to it 

Favorite flavors that taste authentic, legit, and delicious!!! 
-Taro (absolute favs)
-Black Sesame (actually really tastes like it and super good!!)
-Thai Tea (like Milk's ice cream macaroons in LA) 
-Green Tea (tastes like more authentic green tea and less sweet; more bitter) 

If you really love a flavor and want more, you can purchase a pint size carton of ice cream :) 

Super friendly customer service and free samples!
author: Cuc N.

description: Awesome flavors and really nice servers! I asked to try about 4 different flavors and the girl serving me was really nice about it and told is what her favorite flavors were, etc. It's pretty easy to get overwhelmed here though (they have about 50 or so flavors to choose from). The fun part was that they have a big wheel on the wall and it looked like you could spin to to get a random flavor, or even a chance to win free scoops! It's a little far out in the Sunset, but I would definitely love to come out here again.
author: Grace C.

description: We just happened by Polly Ann Ice Cream while exploring the neighborhood. We saw the line out the door and knew we had to stop! Street parking wasn't too hard to come by so before long we were in the line contemplating what flavor to get. They have a TON of flavors including all the classics and a bunch of really unique flavors I've never seen anywhere else. I was disappointed that they were out of the Peanut Butter Oreo (they were running out of flavors like crazy) the guy who helped us was apologetic they hadn't had a chance to mark that one as sold out. He was very patient and offered us suggestions and samples to help us make our decision. I ended up with the chocolate oreo which was quite good! My husband got the coconut which he really enjoyed. The servings were generous and the prices were fair. I'll be back next time I'm in town!
author: Michele B.

description:
I'm still too chicken to spin the Wheel of Ice Cream Fortune at Polly Ann's.  I like to know exactly what I'm getting. Stopped by with the bf on a busy Saturday evening around 9:30pm. There were a bunch of families with kids there among the line out the door. Service was speedy and efficient. I like that they added some tables and chairs inside. 

I opted for the black sesame jr. scoop on a cone. Great sesame flavor...yum yum yum! Bf went with strawberry cheesecake single scoop in a cup. He usually gets the same few flavors from Polly Ann.  Me, at least I try something different each visit.  Maybe next time I will finally be spontaneous and take the spin!
author: Liv A.

description:
Polly Ann takes me back to my childhood! My pediatrician works on Noriega St. too so when I leave their office crying, my mom would take me to Polly Ann to settle down, lol. It worked every time. 

I haven't been here in months so I finally got my butt down here and they definitely had some work done. The inside of this place is a pretty decent size and there's really only 4 tables to sit at in here. There's also a restroom, but it's one at a time so just be aware of that. 

The workers themselves are pretty nice. I saw a worker today talk to a little kid who was to shy to order and the worker just said, "Don't worry, I'm a nice guy!" There was a line behind the little kid, but the worker didn't seem to rush him or anything so that was really nice to see. :) 

Parking is all on the streets. There's spots around the shop and then there are residential zones where you can try to find parking, too. 

I got a scoop of their mint chip and green tea and man that takes me back to my childhood. I really should get a tub of that next time I'm in the area. Check in on Yelp to get a free scoop with the purchase of a single or double scoop! 

Overall, love this place. You can never go wrong with ice cream!
author: Venus L.

description: Came here with friends last year on a San Francisco trip and this was the first ice cream place we tried (and we managed to go to an ice cream shop nearly every day while on this trip!) I can't remember which flavors I tried, but I ended up getting the Jasmine tea flavor, which was delicious and certainly tea-y :) Loved it and I think my friends were satisfied with their flavors too.  I will definitely come back when/if I'm ever back in the area!
author: Jenny Q.

description:
Ice cream here isn't just another sweet treat. Polly Ann's has unique flavors with deliciousness and depth!

Taro is a flavor that often tastes overly sweet and artificial, whether in milk teas or ice cream, but Polly Ann's truly does it justice. Their taro has a prominent and authentic taste to it that's delicious without being too sweet.

Most ice cream shops have some form of green tea ice cream, but none can compare to Polly Ann's jasmine green tea flavor. You'll taste jasmine blossoms as well as green tea in every lightly sweetened spoonful.

If you've had red bean, you'll love Polly Ann's red bean flavor. If you haven't had red bean, you'll still love it, too! The red bean is prominent without tasting sugary or artificial.

My favorite flavor by far is the black sesame ice cream I've only ever seen at Polly Ann's. This is a unique and distinct Asian flavor that I'd definitely recommend trying!

I'd eat Polly Ann's even on cold days. This is by far my favorite ice cream shop ever!
author: Tanya A.

description:
My local neighborhood ice cream joint.  It's so close to where I live that I should come here more often, except I don't.  When the weather is nice, there's always such a long line.  

I rarely use the wheel they have (I'm just not that adventurous), instead I'm always getting my go-to flavor of mint chocolate instead.  It's tasty, never fails me.  More often than not, my family usually opt for their 1.5 qt tubs to bring home.  However, I feel the ice cream isn't as good as the ones they immediately serve, the texture is a bit soft.

A good alternative to Marco Polo if you're around the area, as they have similar Asian flavors.
author: Karen L.

description:
Fast, reasonably priced ice cream. Good flavor options. When I went there it seemed like a high school hang out spot, but I guess that's why prices are more reasonable. 
I ordered Jamaca almond which was good, but had a little too many almonds. The Thai tea was good :) I would go here again
author: Melissa N.

description:
Definitely up there with Bi-Rite, maybe even higher. 

Ice cream is thick, creamy, and packed with flavor-flave!

A myriad of flavor offerings and plenty of unique ones - lychee, honey dew, durian (beware of gasoline burps, as other yelpers mentioned!), black sesame, jasmine tea, red bean. 

I'm having Polly Ann withdrawals as we speak! Just go!
author: Camille E.

description: The ice cream flavors here are unique but they also have the basic flavors. There's a wheel for you to spin if you choose to that would help you choose flavors and you have a chance to win free ice cream! I shared a pint of honeydew ice cream with 3 others for less than $10. It was a great size to share and the flavor was super good, it was the perfect amount of sweetness. It's a unique flavor, and the color is super pretty for a nice photo. I recommend it!! When I was a kid, the honeydew flavor, mango, and green tea were my go to flavors at Polly Anns so definitely try them! I've also tried the Thai tea flavor in the past. It's good at first, but it's very very sweet so unless you like super sweet ice cream I wouldn't get it.
author: Lauren L.

description: I had never heard this place mentioned in the conversation of the best ice cream in the city, but it deserves to be in that conversation. They have a huge variety of flavors and a lot of unique ones I had never seen before. I had the honeydew (amazing) and the strawberry brownie (didn't taste anything like brownie, but still pretty good). I also scored a free waffle bowl for checking in on Yelp. The workers are really friendly and helpful with suggestions. The place is spacious and clean and has some nice spots to sit and enjoy your dessert.
author: Cameron S.

description:
My GO TO spot for ice cream! It's close to my house and there are a large variety of flavors! If you can't decide, you can spin the wheel! When spinning the wheel, you have 3 options. You can choose the one that was picked, but if you don't like the flavor, you can choose the two that is next to your winning number. OR you can ask for samples! They let you try whatever you want! 

I LOVE the black sesame! It's my all time favorite!!! YUM!!!!
author: Darlene M.

description:
This is a horrible place for the indecisive.. aka me. They have ~50 flavors, all unique (durian, taro, black sesame, green tea) and drool-worthy. They also customize some of the names, like "rocky road" is known as "Bumpy Freeway", hahah. 

I finally settled with the Rum Raisin. It's a bit pricey at $2.50 for a single scoop, but it was deeeeelicious! Chunks of raisin in very, very subtle rum-infused vanilla. 

Will definitely be back to try more flavors.. and maybe even spin the wheel of ice cream fate :D
author: Samantha C.

description: Been a while since we've had Polly Ann.  We used to live in the avenues and would frequent this place before they remodeled.  Kinda glad they kept their spin the wheel thing lol for those undecided.  Fun flavors, nothing super fancy, but definitely a neighborhood gem.  Soft serve until 9pm for you or your canine.  Friendly staff.  Clean.
author: Margaret W.

description:
SF institution.
Unique flavors that will excite the taste buds.
Affordable and excellent service. Staff is patient to let you sample away.
If you have a sweet craving, come to Polly Ann.
author: David H.

description:
I always fond of the prepackaged Green Tea ice cream from Polly Ann so I suggested my group to come here after biking in the nearby area.  There are about 40 something flavors to choose from but my mind is set after having a tasting of Coconut.  
  
GREEN TEA - I don't always order green tea/matcha ice cream when I go to Asian ice cream parlors, but I just love the one from Polly Ann.  It has a stronger tea flavoring and doesn't taste too sweet.
COCONUT - the coconut flavor just not rich enough to my liking.  I think there are better coconut ice cream from a Filipino brand

I also got to taste what my friends ordered :p

TURKISH COFFEE - OMG, if coffee doesn't make stay awake at night, I would totally get myself another order.  The coffee flavor has just the right intensity. 
BLACK SESAME - very toasty
COCONUT & TARO - Noticeable taste of both taro and coconut

They also offer doggie cone which is the cutest treat ever!
author: Sharon C.

description:
Good, consistent ice cream with a bunch of unique and regular flavors to choose from. Childhood nostalgia always has been getting the bubblegum ice cream, even though I don't eat the pieces of bubblegum (though the most recent time I had it, there were no gumballs). Other than that, my go-to is the green tea. You really can't beat Polly Ann's green tea ice cream. 

I haven't tried too many flavors, but you can always ask to sample and they're happy to give it to you. 

One thing that annoyed me was they had a Yelp promotion going on that if you checked in and bought a single scoop, you get a scoop for free. I showed the older lady working there and she turns to ask who I assume is her daughter, and obviously the younger girl is upset and they talk about it in Chinese (which I speak and understand--it was very rude). If you're not going to honor a deal you put up, please don't put it up and get mad when a customer comes in to use it. 

Other than that, Polly Ann's never disappoints.
author: Doris K.

description: I'm in love with all their tea flavored ice creams (Earl gray, Thai tea, Jasmine tea), not to mention the black sesame!! The scoops are always a generous size and the servers are always friendly. I've been here three times already and will definitely keep coming back!
author: Melanie T.

description:
How many ice cream shops can you name that has a spinning wheel of flavors? I can't think of any place other than at Polly Ann's. They have a giant wheel with all their flavors listed! And there's a "free scoop" on the wheel too.

I got the Jasmine Tea flavor and omggggg, seriously the best thing ever. I looveeeee it here. My friend got the normal green tea flavor and it's absolutely not the same whatsoever. You can tell the difference! It's so good, we got a pint for home and finished it within two weeks haha

I'll be back for the Jasmine tea! But, I will definitely try the other flavors too. There's an abundance of 'em!
author: Sandy T.

description:
Mmmm, yum! I'm going to enjoy writing this review!

This place leans more on the unique side of the ice cream spectrum. Sometimes, I decide to be a little adventurous and trying their durian flavor or bubble gum flavored. If you're unsure of what you want, you can always spin the gigantic wheel on the wall and see what you land on! Me, in fear of getting something I'll hate, rather sample everything and make an ultimate decision. This place also has unique names for their flavors. More often than not, I find myself asking them what flavor is the "Old San Francisco" or "Star Wars" or "Bumpy Road" (which is Rocky Road, I remember because I found that hilarious). I personally love Asian-style flavors, so my recommendations would be
- Jasmine Tea
- Sesame
- Taro
It's uncommon to find a sesame flavored ice cream in an ice cream parlor, so if you hit this place, definitely try it!

TIP #1: Check in to Yelp to redeem a free brownie or waffle cone!

Tip #2: If you are picky with flavors, DO NOT spin the wheel! There's a bigger chance of you getting something you don't want, and you can't change after the wheel has spoken.
author: Jenny C.

description:
I can't believe it took me so long to try this place. I had it bookmarked for probably years and years.

I didn't really know this place was an Asian ice cream place, only that it had a crazy spin wheel so you can take your chances if you are really crazy about just ice cream and didn't care much about the flavor then this is perfect for you.

I really did like the black sesame and the Green Tea Matcha flavors, but then again ... I'm really Asian when it comes to ice cream. The more bland and less sweet the better (haha! - I am like a grandma) 

Friendly staff, easy parking.
author: Lorrie M.

description: My first try flavors were Thai Tea and Durian. Thai tea was absolutely flavorful, I love it. However, durian is bot that great imo, the texture of durian is not rich and bold taste. I wanted to come back and get a pint of Thai tea, but they are not offering that flavor now. I'll have to wait then.
author: Maggie N.

description:
Lots of unique flavors of ice cream! There's something for everyone (or if you're like me and any kind of ice cream is delicious... even better!) Feel free to ask for samples and try new flavors. The spin-the-wheel concept is fun and quite helpful for those who, after trying ten flavors, still can't settle on which one to get.

Prices are reasonable (make sure to check in on Yelp to get a free scoop of ice cream!) and staff is friendly. Overall, a good place to get some creamy, yummy ice cream!
author: Ivonnie S.

description: My sister was visiting from out of town and doesn't have a palate for "fancy" ice cream. (Example of what she consider "fancy": Three Twins.) I was on the lookout for something that was a bit more homegrown, but still had a slew of flavors and was highly rated. Polly Ann did not disappoint. Space is clean, bright, and airy, and just the colorful flavor cards tempted the taste buds. Great range of flavors including harder-to-find ones like Asian fruits. Splurge on the 3-scooper so you can try multiple flavors, it's the better deal anyway! Spoke to friends from SF and apparently this joint has been around for years and years. I can see why it's a classic.
author: Jen E.

description: A few times a year, we make the drive from the east bay out to Polly Ann out in the sunset. Worth the drive each time. We got Taro, Hazelnut Oreo, Mocha Almond Fudge and the Caramel Sea Salt flavors last time. Each one was great in its own right. The lines can be a little long during nice days but this ice cream spot feels like it's a small little family place even though it's part of the greater Polly Ann ice cream company that you see in the local Asian super markets. I think if you love distinct Asian ice cream flavors like taro and red bean and durian, PA is a must stop.
author: James N.

description:
I had no idea that this place existed. I've always eaten the Red Bean Popsicles that are sold at asian grocery stores since I was a kid and I was pleased to find out they had an ice cream shop! There's so many flavors here - I tried Black Sesame and was very satisfied with it. I have no doubt that the other flavors are just as good - some other interesting ones that I'd want to try are all the other Tea flavors. 

If I lived closer to here I'd pick up a pint or some popsicles probably every week...
author: Daniel C.

description: Awesome selection of flavors and great service. Check in on Yelp app to receive a nice treat.
author: Roger E.

description:
Love this place! Thai Tea is my ultimate fav although sometimes it's so good, they run out! The crew members are awesome and patient.

This place is usually packed with families and kids on warm sunny days in the sunset, so hang tight! It's worth the wait
author: Rochelle A.

description: This really is your standard one star crappy restaurant on yelp. I have no clue where all these five star reviews come from. Fake? I've been twice, the customer service is terrible. I ordered the butterscotch once and it tasted mildewed and soured. I asked them if there was something wrong with it and they said " I don't know." I asked them if this was a milk-based ice cream or some other base and they said "I don't know." You work in an ice cream store, how do you not know about the ice cream that is there. They need to either get some new employees or get a whole new business practice. Again, I have no idea where these five stars come from
author: Doris P.

description:
First review of the year!!!! And YES, it's for an ice cream shop =X

Ok, now, do NOT judge me, but I am not always a big fan of ice cream. I don't know why, but when I find a flavor or shop I like, I can't stop thinking about it. and.. yes. I like to eat ice cream when it's cold =X It just doesn't melt as fast. lol. 

Anyways, moving on... Polly Ann is an awesome shop!! So many different flavors! Affordable prices! Free Waffle cone when you check in on Yelp! And service with a smile!! EEEEEEP

I came here a couple of weeks ago, during the coldest nights, and got myself a single scope (2 flavors of choice though!). I got the Peanut Butter Chocolate Fudge and the Black Sesame. Both were very very good. I still think the black sesame gelato from Sophie's crepe is better, but this one is close enough. Very flavorful and strong sesame taste. The peanut butter chocolate fudge (that is a mouthful) is bomb too!

BF really enjoyed the jasmine tea and taro. He said the Taro was super super good!

For our 2 cones, the total came to 6 bucks. say WHAT. that is CHEAP. I was happily skipping around Sunset Blvd with my cone. ok JK. i didn't do that, since it was like 8PM and freezing cold. 

I highly recommend Polly Ann, and will definitely be back. Maybe i should get an eggette from next door and throw some of the black sesame ice cream on. 

=]
author: Judy W.

description:
Delicious ice cream. I've been here three times so far, and they flavors have been different (more or less so) each time! I always get the double scoop (which you can split into three flavors) for $5 in a bowl. One time I had the black sesame, star wars (mint marshmallow!), and thai tea. SO GOOD. Best combo and best color palette ever. I've also tried the blueberry, and hazelnut marble or something.. but nothing compares to my first combo here. Unfortunately, on my last visit they didn't have thai tea or star wars anymore : ( but it's fun to try new flavors, and they have a huge selection!

There's always parking along the street too, so it's super easy to get to.
author: Ravo Y.

description:
Luckily i  came in right on time before a brunch of kids after me and a line after or else i would had to wait. First time coming here but This place has been in my list of bookmarks for quite some time. And finally got to try it since sf had been having nice weather and i was at the beach. And this place was close enough from the beach. 

Like many yelpers had mention, they have many unique flavors/combo and so many choices to choose from that you don't know what to get. But of course theres the spin on the wall that they spin for in case you know which flavor to pick.

Decided to strawberry brownie in a waffle cone (which cost about $3.15or more) since its the first thing that caught my eyes. Strawberry is usually my favorite flavor and never had it with brownie inside the ice cream before. The flavor was not bad. Definitely the next time i come back, i will pick a different that i dont normally get since they have such unique that you don't normally see at other ice cream place. 

Even though is at the corner, you can totally miss if you dont pay attention since their sign isnt noticeable. And i dont think they even have a sign cause i didnt see one when i first visit this place.

Decent amount of parking area

Friendly staff

Decent price ice cream
author: Julie N.

description:
This place has ROSE ice cream in the month of February that tastes like delicious roses. It's bliss. It's called American Beauty and it's *perfectly paired* with the JASMINE TEA ice cream which is the best jasmine tea ice cream you can imagine...

Runner up: Red Bean and Green Tea Matcha. It's all made fresh and if you get the above flavors, or any Asian flavor (Black Sesame, etc.) they do them exceptionally well. 

This place is right down the street from me... yay! Why only 4 stars? Because as an Asian lactose lover/hater, I'd love if they did at least one sorbet! :*
author: Maria A.

description:
This afternoon I ate No. 25 (Cappuccino  favor?) by choice on the spin and auntie order green tea favor both in cup.That was nice and lovely, like the idea of spinning. 
The green tea favor wasn't bad, but the cappuccino was fantastic and There are so many number on the broad. Next time I will try No.31 for fun:)
author: Jacob S.

description: Used to frequent this place back when I was attending Holy Name. I'd walk from 39th Avenue and Lawton Street down to Noriega and buy an ice cream; usually Oreo Cookie. Nowadays, I'm amazed at the display wall. This store has been around since the 1950s! WOW!
author: Julio B.

description:
How does one even pick a flavor of ice cream when they're here?! It's literally torture trying to decide what flavor to get. Being the ice cream enthusiasts I am, I always need two different scoops of ice cream whenever I am here. My favorites are  Green Tea and Mango. 

Keep in mind that if you're indecisive about what flavor to get, there is a wheel that you can spin in hopes of getting a free ice cream. If it doesn't land on the free ice cream slot, you have to get whatever flavor it lands on. That sounds like a pretty good deal especially if you're flustered about what flavor to pick. 

Don't just stop at getting an ice cream cone. Get the sundaes and/or milkshakes too! 

It's a really cute spot to go to if you're ever in the outer sunset. Make sure you don't go around 3:00PM since kids get out of school at that time and the store will be packed! 

Enjoy!
author: Lisa H.

description: Watermelon sherbet cone was great. However, they only had 2 flavors of sherbet to select from.
author: Les O.

description:
Definitely a must try ! My favorite is the gummi bear ice cream. There are a lot of flavors to choose from and the workers are patient for you to try as many as you would like :) if you have no idea what to try there's a wheel that they can spin to help narrow down your options ! On a nice day I would go early since later at night the line is super long or they run out of some flavors :( 
You can also bring the ice cream home : ask for a pint of the flavor or they have some already in the freezer on the left side of the store !
author: Vanessa L.

description: Unique assortment of flavors but they're ok. Nothing special or maybe I ordered the wrong thing. Had a pint of green tea and coconut. Kinda sweet, silky. A bit pricy.
author: Julie L.

description:
Great ice cream! But the service can be poor. Not very friendly kids who work the counter. They are quite rude to both kids and adults. After I asked for napkins the young girl working there just threw them on the counter with a smirk on her face.

The owners need to train their staff on the basics- kindness and politeness.
author: Stormtrooper N.

description: Went for a second visit and bought the dog.  He liked it too - see video.  Yes, they do doggie cones!  Learned that one needs to time the visit here though.  Around 3:00, schools must open up and the lines get long!  Had the pistachio this time and it was good.  Looking forward to try new flavors in our next visit.
author: Ronny T.

description: We got the quart with 3 flavors for I think 17 bucks? The ice cream is very creamy and perfect amount of sweet. Mint chocolate chip, taro and hazelnut are all delicious flavors. My favorite would have to be the taro. There are so many choices available, will definitely go back for more! Friendly service. They also let us try some of the flavors although we ordered first.
author: Yoomi C.

description: Nice place. Nothing unusual good or bad. Right up the middle. Lots of the standard flavors with an Asian twist on a few.
author: Steve F.

description: This place was SOOOO good! So many interesting flavors and none of them fall short! The attendant let me try a bunch and did not seem annoyed once ( i wouldve been! ) lol Great ice cream, great customer service! Just a few that I tried were Star Wars, Toasted Almond, Pistachio Almond, Mocha Almond Fudge, and I cant remember all the others ( We tried a lot! ) All so good! Can't wait to stop in again for an ice cream fix!
author: Polly P.

description:
Before BiRite, Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous and Smitten. And before the whole gourmet/artisanal ice cream trend in the Bay Area, there was Polly Ann. 

Polly Ann is true SF original and a local staple that has been forgotten. Unlike the more trendy ice cream stores, which only offer a few flavors each day based on the seasonal availability of ingredients, Polly Ann sells ice cream in the traditional way, offering more flavors than you can possibly imagine.

What should you get when you're there? Hands down, Polly Ann's most popular flavor is lychee. If I'm not mistaken, they're the first to make ice cream with this fruit. While most fruit-flavored ice cream tastes a little artificial, Polly Ann's lychee ice cream taste like fresh lychee. 

Another one of their distinctive flavors is jasmine. Many ice cream stores now offer jasmine on their menu; Polly Ann has offered this flavor for over 20 years. Their jasmine ice cream is so fragrant, it hits your nose as you draw the scoop to your mouth. 

And lastly, their pumpkin ice cream is the best and is a must try.

If you can't decide on which flavor to choose, spin the wheel and let Lady Luck make the decision for you.

As the Upper Sunset become more trendy as the hipsters begin to move in and more higher end stores open up, I hope residents here will begin to recognize how great Polly Ann's ice cream is and help them revive their former glory as one of the best ice cream stores in the Bay.  But, hopefully, this will not affect their prices.  They offer one of the best values.  Reasonably priced, huge scoops!
author: Albert L.

description: So many different flavors. The staff are great allowed us to try many different flavors. There are 48 flavors, you're bound to find something you'll fall in love with. If you can't decide, try to spin the wheel. Maybe you'll get a free scoop!
author: Duke H.

description:
Came in around 830pm, not that many customers inside, and there were two employees working. Right when we walked in, the girl standing behind the counter didnt look too happy.. Straight faced, looked like she hated her job.. Not surprised that we didnt get a greeting.. Its been a long time since the last time Ive been here so I wanted to sample a couple flavors. So I ask her if I can sample some and she lets out a sigh.. This was also my friends first time here so of course she wanted to sample a couple also..  Basically this girl was super rude and NOT FRIENDLY AT ALL.

We asked her for suggestions on which flavors are good.. And she responds saying " I dont know, everyone has different taste" like wtf? 

Wasnt too happy with my choice.. It was mint and brownie and the mint overpowered everything.. Bleh.. Better luck next time.
author: Alyssa C.

description:
I chatted with some friends over pho and somebody mentioned wanting ice cream. They kept suggesting places that were really far from us so I suggested Polly Ann's which was down the street. Nobody at the table has ever heard of Polly Ann's...which appalled me. From then on, I made it a priority for us to go get Polly Ann's.

When we got there, I made a decision right away to spin the wheel. Everyone else stood and stared at the menu because they were at a loss for what to order. It's a pretty big menu.

Anyway, I spun the wheel. The way it works, the number that it hits and the two that surround it are the three flavors that the wheel chooses for you. You can always choose other flavors aside from it though, it's not like it's a binding decision. 

I spun the wheel and got: oreo, sweet yam, and sesame. I've never had sweet yam so I asked to try it first. It was pretty good...so I got two scoops for $4.95. One sweet yam and one sesame. It sounded like a good combo! And it was. Sesame was the creamiest and the sesame taste was comforting. The sweet yam one was comforting too. It's not too savory, it's lightly sweet with a few sweet yam pieces.

Everyone else made their order and we were all satisfied. 

Would recommend.
author: Sofia R.

description:
Am I to have the honor of being the 1000th reviewer?! 

I love this place -- so much that I've integrated "jasmine tea flavored ice cream lover" to my short bios on Instagram and Twitter. #RealTalk @a12iel on Twitter :)
author: A W.

description: been here twice in the last year and was just back yesterday, I definitely missed it. My favorite flavor was the Green Tea ice cream. I give this place a five because I love their product, though I'm not a fan of how the flavors are such a mystery that there's no list of ingredients, I love how creative their flavors are, free samples, good price ($5 for 2-3 scoops-get 3 scoops, makes more sense) and there's a neighbor-y feel to it. I'm not sure when I'll be back since I don't drive but probably soon. Hopefully! (:
author: Nico F.

description: This is my childhood ice-cream shop and remains to be my ultimate favorite! They have a huge variety of ice cream flavors you can't usually find at other places. My two favorites are Red Bean and Black Sesame. Both flavors are distinct, creamy, and not super sweet. They also give you the option of spinning the ice-cream wheel, which you could possibly get a free scoop of ice cream! This place is a must for your next visit to SF.
author: Vivian W.

description: Best green tea ice cream ever! We came here to try the Jasmine flavor but got both the green tea and jasmine and ended up liking the green tea a lot more. The green tea flavoring was very strong and the coloring is not really green like other green tea ice creams I've tried. Will definitely come back to try the other flavors. Check in gets you a free cookie or waffle cone.
author: Tammy P.

description: Lots of flavors. Spin the wheel for mystery flavors (no durian!) or 4 in 40 (give or take) chance of a free item! Strawberry cheesecake was pretty good. Can't wait to try the red bean.
author: Sherry L.

description:
First time I came here, I was a little overwhelmed by the number of flavors they had. I had such a hard time decide what i wanted to get. Luckily the workers are really nice and very patient with me. She let me sample at least 5 different flavors (cookie points bc some places only limits you to 2 flavors). 
I ended up getting Star Wars. It's like a creamy mint flavor with marshmallows. Sounds a little weird, but trust me it's good. 
Parking isn't too bad. Street parking, but this side of Noriega St. doesn't get too busy. 
Being able to try all their flavors will definitely be in my bucket list!
author: Krystelle D.

description:
I thought the flavors were just ok.

The texture is good but the flavors that I had weren't great.
The jasmine tea wasn't really strong enough. It also had a strange aftertaste.
I did like the green tea. It doesn't taste like matcha but more like hojicha.  
The coconut was ok. I didn't really like the aftertaste. (slightly fruity).

Free scoop with yelp check-in. So I got three flavors for just under $3.
I would come back to try more flavors  just because there's so many.
author: Heejin L.

description: The waffle cone was tasty, the service was great, but the ice cream itself was okay. I wish it was a bit more flavorful and minty.
author: Aimee I.

description:
it was routine to come here after taking my 2 children to the playground at ap giannini. per the request of the kids, we always order a banana split. it works out lovely as they never finish it and mommy and daddy get to eat the rest.... good times.

today however, the goofy looking lanky gentleman who wears glasses behind counter managed to forget the bananas. i mean its called a banana split... cant be too hard. then when we asked for 2 extra spoons, he said he'd have to charge us!!! this is the first ive been told there was a charge for plastic spoons!!!!!!! at that point i was too afraid to ask for extra napkins looool.

smdh, get rid of this kid lol... you guys dont charge for spoons! come on.
author: Jimmy L.

description: I LOVE THEIR THAI TEA ICE CREAM!! It's so rich and has a bold thai tea flavor that Im drooling just thinking about. This little corner spot is my favorite part about living in the outer sunset and I like that this place is less than a 5 min drive from my house and the beach. They have a large selection of flavors to sample and choose from, and all the employees that I've encountered there are always sweet and don't mind me trying to sample flavor after flavor. Your ice cream cravings will most definitely be satisfied here.
author: Cindy F.

description:
Dropped by this place with some buddies after playing ball around the neighborhood. I was skeptical about getting anything here because there were barely any customers, and no one wanted ice cream except for me. 

There's a huge wheel on the wall behind the counter that patrons could spin. If you spin the wheel, you have to get the flavor it lands on, or a flavor adjacent to the one needle landed on. Since I didn't want fate to decide which ice cream I would have to be stuck with, I decided to handle my own flavor destiny. There were so many choices, but I decided to get Honeydew and Guava...IT WAS DELICIOUS! I will be coming back here to try their other flavors. 

Tip: Check in on Yelp to get a free scoop w/ a single or double scoop!
author: Aaron S.

description: YUM I love that this place has "durian" as a flavor. Yes, I know it smells bad, but its delicious once you've learn to appreciate its flavor. There's a huge variety of flavors here, and some catering to more Asian tastes: black sesame, thai tea, red bean, green tea, etc..Its a cute little local ice cream shop that has been around for quite some time. I finally got to try it after hearing about it for 15+ years. Service here is friendly too, and they let you sample til your heart's content.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
Finally got to try Polly Ann! I got the Jasmine Tea and it was yum. We were greeted upon entering the store. Not much to say, but good ice cream! I do have one complaint though...

They might have had a sign before that says there's a minimum on how much you have to spend before you can use card. However, when I went, I didn't see one. I didn't even know there was a minimum. 

I was just going to pay for my ice cream and my friend pays for hers. But! When I gave the girl my card, she charged all 3 ice creams on my card. She didn't even tell me ahead of time that there was a limit.. she just swiped my card. 

The cashier is off to the side, in the back, so if they had a sign there, then no way would customers see that. They need to have a sign in the front that tells customers that there's a limit.
author: Cathy T.

description:
Took my brother here for a root beer float after he left the hospital because he was craving one and he said it was the best cream in the SF area. Located in what looks like a semi-quiet neighborhood on the corner of Noriega and 39th Avenue, it was fairly busy at 3pm on a Saturday afternoon as the line crept out the front door a bit, but the staff was friendly.

We didn't spin the wheel, but next time I am going to dare my brother to do it.
author: Denise H.

description: The staff were very patient and polite while giving us samples and taking our orders! They have a big wheel you can spin if you can't decide which of their many flavors to get! I had the lycee flavor which was delicious!
author: Sandy N.

description: Such a cute corner ice cream shop! Street parking is plentiful, and if you really wanted, you could just take your ice cream and stroll right down to the beach! Unfortunately when we went, the weather was a bit gloomy, so no beach for us.. but it's okay because the ice cream made up for it! With other 40 flavors to choose from, you might be standing there staring at the board for a while, but the guy working there was very helpful and offered some recommendations/samples for us to try out. I ended up getting butterscotch and turkish coffee which had just enough sweetness and the kick from the coffee to keep me awake for the rest of the day. Green tea is also a great choice!
author: Kim D.

description:
Yesss! I looove their Jasmine milk tea ice cream!! Their milkshakes are also very good. They have a great variety of flavors and some are really odd. 

I wouldn't recommend getting a jasmine milk tea shake cause it tasted too milky for me. 

Overall, sorta pricey but it's worth it! I'll be coming back real soon!
author: Jennifer N.

description:
I've been coming here ever since I was a kid when Polly Ann's was still a hole in the wall up the street and was known for their $1 soft serve ice cream cones. Now that I'm older and have tried the likes of Bi-Rite and Ici, Polly Anns doesn't really impress me anymore. Polly Anns isn't really gourmet though, so it's probably unfair to compare them to a creamery like Bi-rite, but even against Fenton's and Mitchell's, the ice cream is just average. 

With that being said, average doesn't mean their ice cream isn't tasty and their prices are lower than other places, which makes them great for families. Tons of different flavors, many of which are named in such a way that I have no idea what's in them, and if you're incredibly indecisive and adventurous, spin the wheel for your chance at free ice cream, a mystery flavor, or total regret! 

I get overwhelmed with all the choices here so I take the boring road and usually end up with scoops of strawberry, mango, or green tea. They have pre-packed quarts and lots of old-school candy too. If I'm in the neighborhood, I might stop by, but it's not a destination spot.

TIP: Check-in on Yelp and get a scoop for free!
author: Deanna Y.

description:
Move over Baskin-Robbins, your puny 31 flavors mean nothing to me.  Polly Ann's 40+, yes, 40+ are the new "it' for me.  I'm sure regulars there don't have a difficult time deciphering the flavors, but it took me a few questions to the staff before I finally made a decision.  If you have a difficult time making a choice, there is always the FLAVOR roulette wheel that can choose for you.  This totally reminds me of "Wheel of Fortune".

In the end, I decided on one scoop of the Angel Mint Pie (white mint ice cream with chocolate chip and BROWNIE pieces) in a sugar cone.

DELISH!

BIG PLUS - great place to go on a sunny day after hanging at GG Park or at the BEACH.  (also, close to the ZOO.)
author: Hiromi N.

description: So many crazy and creative flavors. I tried the pudding caramel, coconut, toasted almond, pistachio almond, Thai tea and Macapuno (young coconut).They were all amazing! And the guy serving ice cream was really nice and accommodating. 10/10 would recommend
author: Brooke T.

description: Every time I go to SF I have to get Polly Ann's. The black sesame and jasmine green tea flavors are my absolute favorite. Texture is always smooth and creamy and the flavors are present but not aggressive.
author: Swan L.

description: I grew up in the sunset district of SF but no longer live there but I have to say that this place is a MUST every time I go back and visit home!! What I love about them is that they just capture the simplicity of icecream but pack in lots of flavor with that creamy smooth texture! And the best part is that they carry all those yummy asian flavors that I grew up with! My favorite is getting a half and half of Lychee icecream with honeydew! I can kill a whole pint of that! I love that they take credit cards and the servers are all very friendly and always have  a smile on their face! But the fun part is spinning the wheel! They do allow some leeway where u can choose among two flavors near your chosen flavor so thats cool! And I must say location is awesome! Getting to Noriega is way easier than having to travel streets of Irving or Taravel which have crowds and traffic! And bonus is that its right next to Eggettes so when I am visiting home you can bet I am hitting up both of these two gems!
author: G B.

description:
Did a yelp check in and got a free waffle cone with our ice cream today.  Service and the ice cream was really good today.


Lycee -good
mango -ok but not exceptional.  skipping this next time
black sesame -excellent
taro - really good
Thai ice tea - too sweet.  skipping this next time
green tea - used to be my favorite, but it's just good now.
author: L C.

description:
Still one of the best ice cream places in the city.  Has "asian" flavors like lychee, jasmine tea, durian, taro, rose, etc.  My favorite flavors by far is Jasmine Tea or coffee.

Polly Ann's has a little more air whipped into the ice cream unlike Bi-Rite that has a very heavy dense cream.  The pricing is amazingly cheap!  We got a half gallon of pre-packed, two single scoops, a 4 pack of lychee popsicles, and a 2-pack of chocolate dipped frozen bananas for $13!
author: Alice L.

description:
childhood favorite Popsicles like red bean and taro. they sell them here also. but I came for the ice cream. too much flavors to choose from. you would have to go multiple times to even get close to trying them all. You can try the flavors before picking. 

I got the Thai tea and jasmine tea sorbet. I was a little disappointed that the jasmine tea was in a sorbet form. but I love anything tea so I got it. the jasmine tea tasted very flowery and little tea taste. a little on the sweet side. So if you have a sweet tooth then this one is for you. the Thai tea ice cream taste just like a Thai tea. loved this! I would get this again. 

check in for a free waffle cone. all this was $3.50 for pretty good size scoops. I tipped them a dollar since I got free waffle cone. their waffle cone is on the thinner side. but does its job. 

happy this is around my neighborhood! will be back for more!
author: Jules L.

description:
I remember coming here after school in middle school. It has since moved to the corner of the block. The place is much bigger now, but the ice cream is still delicious. I recommend the lychee, green tea, and honey dew. If you can't decide, you can always spin the wheel, which narrows it down to 3 flavors for you -- the one it lands on and the ones on either side.

Tl;dr - Spin the wheel if you're indecisive. Many unique flavors. Worth to try again and again.
author: Emily W.

description:
There are lots of good ice cream places scattered across the city. This is the go-to one for Outer Sunset.

This place offers many Asian-style flavors, such as green tea, red bean, and taro, that you don't really find at other ice cream places. They also have all the typical/common flavors if that's what you prefer. They don't really have any wacky creations like you can find at some other places, but I generally prefer simpler flavors anyway so I don't really mind.

SF doesn't get a lot of days suitable for ice cream, especially not the Sunset, but this place is worth visiting in any weather.
author: Allen C.

description: I really like this ice cream store, it had an abundance amount of flavors to try. The worker was very patient with me as I sampled flavors. It seemed pretty busy, but it was a great spot to hang out with your friends while enjoying some delicious ice cream!
author: Linh B.

description: The ice cream here is so delicious. I'm especially impressed with the customer service. The girl that what helping me... I believe her name was Vivi and she was extremely patient and sweet with me. I was very indecisive and she gave me samples I wanted to try without any hesitation. I ended up getting the taro and mint oreo! They go really well together. I'll definitely come back again.
author: Christina T.

description:
Remember coming here when I was little
Prices may be more but the quality and quantity is still the same.
Absolutely outstanding
author: Chris H.

description: They deserve EVERY star! Came to the city for my birthday, and decided to come here after searching through tons of ice cream parlors in San Francisco. What really got my attention were the unique flavours. What I didn't know was that they take cash only. Since I didn't have cash, I told the employees that I would be back once I found an ATM. After leaving, I gave up on the idea and decided to get a bite to eat elsewhere. After dinner, I realized the place was still open and I could make it there before they closed. It had been at least an hour since I left, but when I came back they told me they saved the cups of ice cream they had prepared for me when I was there (any other place would have tossed that in the trash). I would most definitely recommend this place, and will be coming back.
author: Brittany S.

description:
There are simply too many flavors to choose from so I love their "Hurry Up and We'll pick a flavor for you" wheel. Definitely be sure to check in and earn a free bonus scoop! 
If you really want to enhance your experience, grab a fresh waffle from next door and spoon your ice cream into each little puff. Thank me later. =)
author: Phillip G.

description:
Polly Ann's has many flavors to choose from and from spinning the wheel each time, I haven't encountered a flavored I have disliked yet! It's really fun to ask them to spin the wheel if you're not craving anything in particular~ 

Although they don't have their durian flavor as a spin the wheel option... I don think I'll like that one very much.
author: Lilia T.

description:
A non Asian customer walked in after we did, and proceeded to inquire about the Durian flavor since she had no idea what it was, to which the Polly Ann employee replied "it smells like gasoline".

Not sure I agree with that description, but to me the smell of stinky tofu is more fragrant in comparison.

But some Malaysians see durian as an aphrodisiac....there's some saying about "when the durians fall down from the trees, the sarongs go up". 

The black sesame ice cream here is fan-tucking-fastic. Maybe next time I'll make a milkshake out of it.

The caramel ice cream wasn't bad either, but it seems that the Asian slanted flavors might just be better, just like at Marco Polo gelato on Taraval.

If only they could partner with Tak Kee Lee up the street to make a Hong Kong milk tea and a Hong Kong lemon tea ice cream...
author: Ken K.

description: Best ice cream! I love it here! There are so many flavors and they rotate them out so that there's always something new to try! Free doggie cones and the soft serve is the best soft serve in the entire world! Absolutely amazing!
author: Nia B.

description:
Great old fashion ice cream.  There are a few places with overly sweet ice cream -- cough, cough, Bi Rite.  I do like Bi Rite but I prefer old school places like Polly Ann's better than artisan hipster creameries which mixes up shit that doesn't belong with ice cream like balsamic and lavender.   Instead of calling chocolate chips chocolate chips, it's marketed as cacao nibs.  What's wrong with calling them chocolate chips?  Does it cheapen the description of what you're serving?  Bleh. 

I dig the spin the wheel concept.  Spin it and you get a choice of flavors to pick from and that's it.  It definitely helps those are rather indecisive and from holding up the line.

I had the coconut taro and it's was great.  Subtle yet sweet but not overpowering.   I can't wait until my next visit!
author: Anita C.

description:
I've been going to Polly Ann's since it was literally a Hole in the Wall. Back in my middle school days, when the final bell rang ending school at AP, kids would sprint to Polly Ann's to beat the mad rush! 

I don't think I can pick a favorite flavor because this place just has so many unique and tasty ones! No wonder they give you a chance to spin the wheel if you can't decide. 

Recommendations: Banana Oreo, Oreo Cookie, Green Tea, Star Wars
author: Elaine N.

description:
not only does this place have really good ice cream, it's like a munchies paradise. 

they have all kinds of candy and chips and popcorn and they'll microwave you some instant ramen too. 

dope addition to the community.
author: Caleb M.

description:
The red bean ice cream is to die for. 
I was inspired to write this review,
1. Because I have just moved back to the Sunset neighborhood from LA and did not have better ice cream while living there.
2. I just had ice cream at Fenton's in Oakland and in all honesty, I don't even know why that place is that hyped.

This ice cream is extra creamy + soft and has so many flavors to choose from. Being that I am turned onto trying "different" and new things, I tried red bean about 5 years ago and fell I love with it. It reminds me of a butter-popcorn Jelly Belly. So good. 

I'm not a huge ice cream fan because it tends to taste and feel heavy but this is a well deserved treat from time time. So glad I'm back in the neighborhood

Xo-S
author: Sierra L.

description:
My favorite ice cream house in San Francisco.  The tourists go to Swensons.  The locals go here.  As long as it stays that way, this'll always be my favorite place to grab an ice cream.

The flavors are also very unique and the cool part is the "spin the wheel" if you're not sure what to get.  If it lands on "free" you get a free ice cream of your choice.

I think that's neat.
author: Tony U.

description:
Great ice cream spot in the Sunset! Been here a few times more and it's been great each time. One of the workers here always has a smile on her face and seems always happy. 

They have so many flavors here that it might be hard to decide. They have a wheel in front that you can spin and it'll have a number that correlates to a flavor. Haven't tried it yet but maybe next time. 

They are nice and let you try out many flavors. Star Wars was tasty and had marshmallows in it. The mango is always good. I tried the durian but I didn't like it too much. Too strong of a flavor. 

Overall, great tasting ice-cream shop at a decent price in the Sunset.

Pros:
-Star Wars and Mango are good!
-Awesome workers
-Large variety

Cons:
-Maybe a little too much variety, I CAN'T DECIDE
author: Paul U.

description:
SUCH good ice cream. We live next door, and the stuff here is so good that we fudge our diets and come here at least twice a week. Like, seriously, it's some of my favorite ice cream. They have fifty unique, home-made flavors (e.g. Peanut Butter Oreo, Chocolate Cherry Champagne & Coffee, Cookie Doughboy, Lychee, Durian, and oh so many more). I haven't had a bad flavor yet -- my favorites are the Peanut Butter Oreo and White Mint Medley. The service is friendly and quick. They offer a free waffle cone or cookie if you check in on Yelp (great deal). The prices aren't bad for SF, and it's just a short walk to the beach for a relaxed or romantic evening.

But the best part is (get this) they have a huge wheel with every flavor that you can spin, and whatever it lands on, you have to get (or the ones next to it) -- and, to make it fun, there are FREE spaces all over that entitle you to a free scoop.

We love it and will come as often as possible.
author: Luke K.

description:
My go-to ice cream spot!

They have a large selection of flavors, so if you don't know what to get you can spin the wheel..... or go on yelp! I personally would not spin the wheel. Just ask for samples since they have pretty specific descriptions on the flavor. 

I got the green tea and sunset sundae, both were delish! I'm a green tea lover, and you can really taste the tea flavor in this. 

HIGHLY RECOMMEND the Sunset Sundae!!!
author: Jamila W.

description:
Here are my picks:

1. Jasmine tea ice cream
2. Black sesame ice cream
3. Lychee ice cream
4. Green tea ice cream

Not quite in any particular order except for the Jasmine tea one lol.  Loooooove the selections this place has.  I have yet to try more.  I'm so glad ice cream places like this exist.  I mean.....who ever thought of making Jasmine Tea into an ice cream flavor? 

The actually sell Polly Ann Ice Cream at Asian stores, so be on the look out for them if you are craving more than just a scoop. It probably won't be as fresh as they make it as when you come here but it's pretty darn close!  Can't wait to try more flavors from this place
author: Mary-Anne C.

description:
They have Asian flavored ice scream selections!  Jasmine, taro, red bean, sesame, lychee and even durian flavored ice cream!

They also offer other ice cream flavors as well, but what makes them stand out are their Asian flavored ice cream variety!

If you can't seem to make a decision, spin the wheel and let fate decide on your ice cream scoop for the day!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Pretty decent ice-cream place in the sunset district. I like their fruity flavors, especially the lychee and coconut. I tried the green tea, hoping it would be sweet like the ones you get the mochi's that you buy from the store. This green tea was really bitter but good thing I had the fruity flavors to erase all the bitterness from my palette. All in all, I recommend going there, buy their gallon ice cream if you plan to share with a group of friends.
author: Curt C.

description:
A TON of fun flavors and super respectable people.

Taro is amazing, haven't tried that flavor in a long time and was not disappointed. Will continue to bring business here. Enjoy!
author: Tyler G.

description:
The last time I was here, I had an allergic reaction to none other than their napkins, which gave me a swollen lip.

On Sunday, after running the half marathon, I went to Pollyann's (begrudgingly) because my friends wanted ice cream. It's been a few years since my last visit, so I thought why not.

The two young men behind the counter were friendly and the prices were definitely cheaper than Bi Rite. I chose two flavors: durian and jasmine tea.

Both were on point. The durian tasted natural but gave me stinky burps. The jasmine was light, subtle, and fragrant. I also tried my friend's green tea, which also tasted authentic, unlike what you'd get at western stores.

If you like Asian flavors, I wouldn't hesitate to grab some pollyann's.
author: Audrey T.

description:
So many flavors! It was delicious!

First off..remember to check in to get your free ice cream!

I went for the turkish coffee..it was great because it wasn't too sweet..the mango and strawberry swirl wasn't bad, it had a strong creamy taste to it..

durian was really strong, java almond fudge was too sweet, Star Wars was marshmellow-ish..The taro coconut had more taro than coconut..

overall, the flavors are great for ice cream. though i prefer gelato..still a gem in sunset area..
author: Minerva L.

description: Love going with my kids, I got mango and banana ice cream together, OMG, forget about diets. A local place makes you feel really welcome.
author: Walkiria C.

description:
One of the best Rocky Roads, Bumpy Freeway here, I've had. This place gets busy so time your visit. 48 flavors.

Check in on Yelp to get free sugar or waffle cone!
author: John M.

description: This has always been one of my favorite ice cream places growing up.  I remember coming here as a child and spinning the wheel; basically you spin the wheel for a chance at free ice cream, but if you land on a flavor instead, then you have to choose that or a neighboring flavor.
