It's nice to see not much has changed, and that the store is in good condition and doing well.  They do have a great selection of unimaginable favorites, as well as the classic ones.  My go-to flavors are usually the: green tea or lychee.  I like their rainbow sherbet and Thai tea flavor, too.  For those who love sweets, they also have a good candy selection, with fair prices.  Also a plus that they take card.
author: Eric L.

description: OMG! Polly Anne! I'm so into this place. Of course, there's the gimmick of the wheel - you spin and get to choose the one you land on, or the one to the right/left of it. It's a fun thing to do if you can't decide what to get. I really love the jasmine tea flavor and the black sesame. I've tried quite a few others, but these 2 stand out the most.
author: Ryan Y.

description: Polly Ann, you are quite delicious, and you're cheap to boot. Huge portions for sample sizes, $3.50 for a single size (1-2 scoops), and free cookie/waffle cone for checking in on Yelp. Does it get much better? Well, their flavors could do with a little more cream, but other than that, you can't go wrong with Polly Ann. It's not Smitten, but it's pretty damn good, cheap ice cream from a local creamery. The red bean and taro are excellent. Lychee and mango taste super fresh, and their chocolate rocks. Obviously, it's not going to match Mitchell's, but their chocolate is still excellent. Lines never really back up, but their scoops could do with larger sizes. Other than that, I'm a fan.
author: Danny C.

description:
Green Tea ice cream please. 

I have been going to this place ever since I was 3. I know it sounds like I am exaggerating but I swear I am not. Now I am 21 and I still love their green tea ice cream. I still have yet to try a green tea ice cream that beats theirs. Still the longest relationship that I have had with a food yet. I say try any and all of their asian flavored ice cream selections and you just might find your favorite ice cream too. Do yourself a favor though and stay away from the Durian because man oh man it definitely tastes and smells like gasoline. I took off one star because they never come out with new flavors and when they do I probably don't notice it because they never seem good enough to catch my eye.
author: Jacqueline C.

description: Based on reviews I decided to check it out.  The girls working there are not very friendly, no greeting, no smile.  I tasted a few flavors, nothing really stood out but I decided on lychee.  It was delicious!!!  I definitely will go back for more lychee!  Based on previous yelp reviews I asked for a puppy cone.  My dog loved it!
author: Kelly B.

description:
Much love to a local landmark. 

I just found Polly Ann popsicles for silly-cheap at 99 Ranch in El Cerrito/Richmond. http://www.yelp.com/biz/99-ranch-market-richmond-2 

I'd never heard of them, but when I saw that they were made in SF, I indulged and took home coconut, mango, and lychee. They also had red bean, green tea, blueberry, and Taro!

1 star off because the popsicles are un-peu-trop sugary sweet side for my taste.
author: Aaron M.

description:
Growing up in the Sunset, Polly Ann's has seriously always been a part of my life. I remember my family and I visiting their old location so often. Such a great neighborhood ice cream place, and a favorite of my parents who have been in SF for many years. This place (and Joe's Ice Cream in Inner Richmond) holds great memories for me and my family.

Unique ice cream flavors, with great taste, at a low price. And the wheel! An exciting experience for sure.

Highly recommend Polly Ann's and it's charming atmosphere.
author: Greg J.

description: The ice cream is delicious and the guys scooping were extra generous with the number of tastes my friends and I wanted before making a decision. It's a sweet local ice cream shop with tons of choices and seating. The only thing is that it was not cozy and a bit cold (but that's the sunset life). Overall a good experience and I'll bring my friends back!
author: Sarah B.

description:
DID YOU KNOW... that the QUART is $6 but the PINT is $8. I'll let you sit there and process that for a moment because when I asked the worker about it I just couldn't believe it. It doesn't make any sense from a business standpoint but whatever. 

Small business Saturday, my bf and I were all over that. We bought TWO quarts of ice cream for $12 and then was rebated $10 by AMEX. so $2 for two quarts of my favorite ice cream place. YAY.
author: Elaine L.

description:
Late night ice cream run with the roommates. 
So many flavors to choose from. Quantity overall was just okay. 
Make sure you pay in cash
author: Elena R.

description: Literally had instant diarrhea from this place. That was not a fun drive home lol. Black walnut ice cream tasted fake and syrupy. I think it's safe to say I will not be going back here. Save your money and go somewhere better like Mitchell's
author: Melissa W.

description:
Good Ice cream, BAD SERVCE. 

2 stars for good quality of ice cream. We got mango, Thai tea and taro ice cream  and all of em were good. However, thai tea was a little bit bitter than I expected.
 
Extra 1 star for the fact that this is the only ice cream place that I've been to which offers Thai tea flavor. I've been wanting to try that flavor and I'm glad that I finally did.

Minus 1 star for rude service. Since it was my first time, I can't help but ask questions regarding the flavors and how the scooping works. The OLD ASIAN LADY who served me is a fucking bitch. Giving me attitude as she unclearly explain how everything works. I mean, why work as a server if you can't even explain for shit? And how would you expect me to understand you when you can't even speak English clearly ? Like damn. I'm trying my best to understand you.

Another minus 1 star for over reacting. As I was about to exit, the old server yelled "CAN I GET MY PEN BACK!" Making all the other customers look as if I'm stealing the pen. Uhh bitch it's just a pen. I could buy you a whole pack if you want. & how about look at the counter so you'll see that the fucking pen is there as well as the receipt that I signed?  Oh and lemme just end it by saying that she didn't even apologize. 

FUCK YOU OLD ASIAN LADY. Acting all bitchy when you can't even speak English.

Although the ice cream is good, I'm most likely not coming back due to terrible service. I would rather be in Mitchell's, more bomb ass ice creams.
author: Mary U.

description:
We just can't stay away from this ice cream place. Our favorite flavor is a simple chocolate chip, we've been trying to get a quart of it, but its always sold out so we get the hand packed pints. 

We also like their taro, it has a nice creamy and root taste to it like real taro should taste like. If you're in the area definitely give them a try. I know San Francisco has so many ice cream shops to choose from, but you won't know what you like until you've sampled a few.
author: Michael S.

description: This was my first time at this ice cream shop and was impressed with the amounted of flavors they had posted on the wall. I ordered the two milkshakes which was the starwars and the durian. Both milkshakes tasked really good. The durian flavor actually tasted like the actual fruit. I will definitely come back and try the different flavors they offer.
author: J T.

description:
Polly Ann, did you know I love your green tea ice cream tubs?

Polly Ann's is a great place to sit down with friends and have a cone or cup of ice cream. Plus you can get soft serve for $1.25! Yum.. soft serve...
author: Mabel Y.

description: We don't go here because you can't SEE the icecream.  What flavor do I want?  I don't know.  They have names but what is it?  A big part of the icecream experience is visual, and not being able to see the flavors to decide what we want is a huge negative.  We go elsewhere.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: Really liked the idea of winning free ice cream from the wheel. Ice cream was solid and there were a lot of unique flavors!
author: Austin C.

description: Love the selection of exotic and tropical flavors. Taro, Lychee, Red Bean, etc. Their prices are very reasonable and you get huge scoops. They are also very helpful in letting you sample as many flavors as you want before you pick. Best ice cream spot in San Francisco!
author: Christian E.

description:
And of course, gotta wrap up the High School Nostalgia Series with nothing other than thoughts of dessert! Fond memories of those rare fall days when it was HOT in San Francisco. We walked over to Polly Ann's in a sweat, relieved to arrive and excited to dig in to some ice cream. And let me tell you, this ice cream is CREAMY and smooth. They have all the typical flavors and many unique ones. I was thrilled to discover red bean, lychee, and green tea flavors for ice cream, milkshakes, and even popsicles! 

For the indecisive, there is a wheel that you can spin to determine your ice cream flavor. But the catch is that you have to buy whichever flavor the ticker lands on. Good thing durian is not on the wheel! For those who aren't familiar with the durian fruit, it is super stinky but also delicious. No one seems to understand how this is possible.

TIP: Polly Ann's ice cream can also be purchased in stores by the gallon. I highly recommend the mango ice cream -- chunks of mango melded with smooth cream. I've always had trouble sticking to just one serving!
author: Denise L.

description:
Can I live in SF so I can come here all the time?
Really good prices.

I tried the Mango, Honeydew, & Durian. The mango was realllly good and so was the honeydew. But something about the Durian, it tasted a little bitter and not sweet enough.. I had durian burps the whole day ):

I tried some of my bf's Thai Tea & that was sooo good.
I want to go back already and try every flavor!
author: Elsa W.

description: Love the ice cream here! The guy who served us was super patient with me and my boyfriend. We were practically trying every flavor (that we liked). Unfortunately my boyfriend didn't let me get durian, but if I could, I definitely would've. The ice cream here are super flavorful and creamy. We ended up getting lychee and jasmine!
author: Eva K.

description: I grew up coming to this place ever since I can remember! My grandpa loves the pistachio and mango flavor. He has a big sweet tooth, but I love that about him. This place also has doggie cones! My bf took my little spoiled one to get a doggie ice cream and cone! It's perfectly safe for dogs. Just don't ask to put chocolate ice cream on the doggie cone.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
OK so the main reason I'm giving this place 5-stars is because of the customer service. My friend dropped a scoop of her ice cream and the guy working there, Kevin, was super nice about  giving her a new scoop!! 

The ice cream flavors are awesome too! The location is nice, you can walk to the beach :)
author: Anthea W.

description:
I've only been here a few times (in fact, my first time was january of last year!) and I always leave happy.  I forgot what I ordered the first time I came here, it may have been lavender? or IDK. something purple...ish.  The last few times I've been here, I came with my college roommate.  We had the Thai Tea flavor and it was yummy.  I'm not sure if I haven't noticed this about thai tea or maybe it was just the ice cream flavor but it had some metal-y taste in it.... I mean, it was just an aftertaste.  It may have been because I was driving but I still recall liking the flavor.  lolol 

Anyways, after a day/night trip out of town, my roommate was seriously in love with this place and asked me to take her back the following day.  The same guy was working sooooo it was kind of awkward ._. but whatevs, he probably doesn't remember.  Anyways, back to the story.  My roommate got sesame which was kind of powdery to me and I tried the taro with coconut bits -- OMNOMNOM.  okay now some of you may thing taro was what I had before but let me tell you now... I didn't like the taste taro beginning of 2012 so I know that's not what I ordered! But I grew fond of it over the year and omg, with the coconut bits was amazing to me. Definitely try it!

I think one day... I'll spin the wheel JUST to see what I'd get but I'm so scared I'll get a flavor I don't like.  Oh, and one of the guys working there told durian is not a flavor on the wheel SOOO if there's a chance you want to land on it, you might as well just get it :P 

I seem to ALWAYS find parking on the streets close by so that's not an issue at all.
author: Lisa L.

description:
Fun place to take kids for ice cream. Tons of flavors (free samples) and a good value (especially with yelp or other coupons).

My favorite flavor is jasmine tea, which has a bold jasmine aroma. Havent had anything like it anywhere else

Of course the ice cream isnt as fancy and super gourmet like bi-rite but its pretty good.
author: Philip L.

description:
I stumbled upon this place today and decided to check it out, and I was glad I did! The building is spacious and clean with lots of available seating, the staff is friendly, and the ice cream is creamy and delicious! Lots of natural light comes in from the many windows, which sets a really nice vibe for the place. They offer a huge selection of flavors, most of which are somewhat unique, making this place a must-stop when in outer sunset. 

I got a scoop of the jasmine tea and it was phenomenal. I also tried a few others as well and all tasted great!
author: Marilyn M.

description:
When it comes to beating the heat, any local ice cream parlor works for me. Poly Ann Ice Cream has been a Sunset District favorite since 1955 located on Noriega St. It has a wide variety of ice cream, about 48 but sometimes favorites run out.
They also make sundaes, banana splits, shakes and serve up frozen yogurt,
In my opinion it's not as good as Mitchells or St. Francis but comes in handy in the hot days of summer.
author: jack d.

description: Girlfriend and I decided to give their Black Sesame Ice Cream a try, we wanted to try something different and something that's been getting a bit known lately, the taste of their ice cream is Amazing and so was the texture. I would recommend checking this place out and trying all their flavors. I also noticed the random swing on the ice cream which interested me quite a bit! Good job ! Can't wait to try more flavors!
author: Joseph B.

description: Ordered a cake for my son's birthday there. It was SO good! I tried other iceream cakes before, but this one was the best. The only suggestion that I would make is to offer larger sizes. they only had an 8in, which worked for us, but if we had more people, it'd be too small. they have 48 flavors and the ones I tried were great!
author: Igor O.

description: Love the concept of the wheel. Really sets this spot aside from the rest. Good quality ice cream and fast, helpful service!
author: Lauryn S.

description: I love their ice cream and frozen yogurt.  Spin the wheel if you're not sure what to get.  They have lots of choices.
author: Ilan E.

description: Stopped here after a hike at Lands End.  Great service to go along with the delicious ice cream.  We tried black sesame, Kahlua, mango, pineapple, pineapple and strawberry.  Yum!  Parking on street was fine.  Small seating area inside with about 6 tables.
author: Linda L.

description: Not much to really say. They've been around for so long because they make great flavors and with a reasonable price to have a treat without making you need to go to the ATM afterwards. Usually a long wait on the rare warm days in The Sunset. If you've never been here and live in The City, you've never really lived in The City.
author: Bor C.

description: We came in looking for one of the tubs of ice cream (they have a freezer on the side for prepackaged ice creams). We were looking for black sesame and we saw many packages. However, the black sesame containers all had mismatched and different lids, including mango, strawberry, and coconut lids. Then on top of that, all of them had a small sticker label with another flavor. We were confused so we inspected one. It was a black sesame container with a mango lid with a chocolate label. It turns out that the ice cream was chocolate. We were very disturbed by this as It seemed unsanitary and unprofessional. All the tubs looked reused and slightly open. We didn't even know what flavors were in each tub. It is beyond shocking that a store would use different containers with lids and label the ice cream with an additional label. Not ever coming back.
author: Christian A.

description:
There are almost 50 flavors at any given time and they have over 400 different flavors rotating every day.

Even with all the gourmet ice cream shops opening up all over the bay area, this is still a classic. Sample all you like and choose from traditional flavors like strawberry cheesecake, mocha almond fudge, or vanilla to something off the wall like durian, Mexican hot chocolate, or Thai ice tea.

It's ridiculously cheap for a scoop ($2.75) and parking should be easy unless it's one of the five days of the year that it's actually hot outside.
author: Lloyd B.

description:
Lovely Asian lady helped us out with out orders. She was very patient with us and having every flavor explained. Maybe I am just biased because she reminds me of my grandmother. I love my grandmother.

Free cookie with the check in. Not the best cookie of my life; it was either that or the waffle cone. Should've gone with the waffle cone! (Note the cookie did not in any way affect my rating of this place. As they sell ice cream, not cookies, for profit.)

No line. Interesting flavors. Wonderful service. I officially dub thee my favorite ice cream spot in SF.
author: Kaithlyn R.

description:
Growing up, we would stop by Polly Ann after school for a ice cream cone. I loved the variety of flavors that they have here and have fond memories of coming here.

Although it's been awhile since I come into this store location, I like to treat myself sometimes. I often buy the ice cream popscicles from the Manila Oriental Market. 

My favorite flavors are the honeydew, mango, green tea, coconut and thai iced tea. It makes a great summer day dessert and only 120 calories.
author: Rebekah T.

description: Consistently great ice cream
author: Steven B.

description: they have awesome selections! I got jasmine tea, Turkish coffee, and their signature flavor. I was expecting a small portion, but they gave me more then $5 worth of ice cream.
author: S L.

description:
This place has been around since 1955 and is still going strong. My dad has been taking me here since I was a kid. I now live a few blocks away and can indulge is my love of ice cream more often than is probably good for me. 

Their flavors change all the time depending on the time of year and what kinds of ingredients they want to use to make fun ice cream flavors.

If you can't decide on a flavor, you can spin the wheel. The wheel has all the flavors on it but the catch is that if you spin you have to get the flavor it lands on or the one immediately to the left or immediately to the right.

I never spin the wheel because I almost always get Taro Coconut which is my favorite flavor that they have. However, I do taste one or two flavors every time I go in because I want to make sure I am not missing out.
author: Thea M.

description: Really good ice cream. Especially for the sunset district. This is a great mom-and-pop shop that I used to go to as a kid. They always have helpful servers and really interesting flavors. Go and try it out and spin their wheel mayhem.
author: Theo L.

description: You want good ice cream?, got it...you want new flavors?, got it...you want the best milkshake you ever had?...got it here. Trust me and just go here, you won't regret it!
author: Adrian J.

description:
Went back on Saturday... with a cooler.  No Thai Tea popsicle/bar... oh well, but got to try out Star Wars and Bumpy Freeway, which were actually a good pairing.  Wendy was very nice and patient to explain all the flavors to us 'out of towners'.

Up from 4 to 5 stars and will be back for more. :)
author: Al S.

description:
Great ice cream but horrible service. 

I came here last Wednesday night with my girlfriend.  Two girls were working the counter.  The taller  fobby girl with far set eyes helped us out.  My girlfriend asked what flavor was the Kowloon vanilla? She answered "vanilla bean" with a smug tone.  With a name like Kowloon vanilla it requires a bit more explanation.  Why is it called Kowloon? And why isn't it just called vanilla.  

I opted to try the strawberry swirl, instead of asking what it was because she'll probably say "strawberry" and that'd be the end of that conversation.  I got my ice cream in a cup and it was barely filled,  I have been to this creamery many times but I have never complained about the amount served. I can probably attribute the diminished amount to the girl being really tired and her skinny arms had no more strength to scoop.

After I I paid she decided to slam my change on the counter like some Chinese dim sum lady in Chinatown. Then She gave a loud sigh and say to her co worker "Uh, I so tired!"  

Fyi if you're a middle aged white man, they're pretty nice to you.
author: Dan L.

description:
Time:
Sunday afternoon.  We parked on the side streets, though there were many cars coming and leaving.  Polly Ann's had people coming in the whole time my friends and I were there, but we were helped very quickly.

Ice cream:
My two companions grabbed eggettes next door while I grabbed ice cream from Polly Ann's.  The eggettes made a good base for the Macapuno (currently near the end of a a coconut phase) and Toasted Almond flavors.  I got them in a waffle bowl.

After we left, of course we had a conversation about ice cream.  Polly Ann's is apparently "Asian" ice cream, which is fluffier, less sweet, and not as dense as "non-Asian" ice cream.  Though there were many flavors to choose from at Polly Ann's and though the flavors I chose were tasty, I would not seek out the ice cream if I were not in the Sunset District.

I saw a man walking out with a sundae - lots of chocolate & caramel syrups and nuts.  I would get that next time.

Service:
Great!  The two employees at the counter were very, very kind.  The employee not helping me was letting a group of 5 sample a few flavors, and the employee helping me even offered some suggestions!

Advice:
If you are in Sunset and in the mood for ice cream, I would suggest grabbing a scoop or two of Polly Ann's and heading to the Moraga Steps to balance out the calorie intake.
author: Samantha C.

description: Stopped here yesterday afternoon with my cousins who highly recommended it. They love this place so much that one of them had a few of her engagement photos taken here! Decided to try the Thai Tea (as that seems like a flavor most ice cream shops can't get right) and it was delicious! The flavor was not too sweet, and pretty close to what real Thai Tea tastes like. Not to mention the consistency was nice and creamy. Also, love the decor and quirkiness of the shop. Will definitely be coming back to try more flavors! :)
author: Megan C.

description:
Fun environment, and very welcome, super open space for one to ponder the permutations available in stuffing the pie hole with creamy concoctions.... 

My Mom and split a triple: black sesame, lychee, and durian.... the "asian" side-o-da-board.... and the fresh zip! and great reflection of the real flavors of such delicacies shone WAAAY through... 

think the topic of convo in the car the way back was half stolen by a deep, detailed analysis of the flavors, which really sang. Loved it... nice new recent find after a day of exploring Grand View Park and inner/outer Susnet the 'pied' way!

PS Spotted red bean, mango, strawberry, coconut flavors to go in tub containers... but none of the ones that we had chosen...awwww.
author: Jana C.

description:
I'm a cheap gambler. 

That might sound like a contradiction, but it's actually a nice benefit. I love the adrenaline of the game and the "high" from winning but when I'm down on my luck, I know when to throw in the towel.

It's evidently due to my Gambling Code of Conduct: 
- Always know how much $$ you hold. 
- Stay away from cheap frills and scams. 
- Intentionally play it dumb, for the upper hand.
- Attempt to get your money back, reasonably.
- Never get drawn in for the full cost, if you can get it for cheaper.
It's what makes me A-S-I-A-N.

My girlfriend and I stumbled in to Polly Ann's on one of those rare sunny SF days. We originally planned to stop by Eggettes next door but I was low on cash, and they don't accept card. (Boo!) With $3 burning a hole in my pocket, we opted for ice cream instead. 

48 homemade flavors, from chocolate to taro to pistachios and even soft served. But what caught my eye was their Wheel of Creamy Fortunes (that's what I called it), with multiply FREE markers on the wheel. (I love FREEE!)

Simple rules - 
Spin the wheel, and whatever it lands on, is what you must get. 
Yup, I was feeling lucky.

*SPIN*
..
..
.. 
Skippy Peanut Butter Oreo.

Oh, not bad. Not FREE, but not bad (my gambling spirit being spiteful). I love peanut butter! The ice cream was very creamy with that distinct taste of Skippy's, which didn't overwhelm the ice cream itself, BUT it was $2.95 per single scoop (minimum) which was about the size of a baby's fist. Damn, that just doesn't fly with my CoC.
author: Albert L.

description:
Eek.  I wasn't expecting this place to be an Asian inspired Ice Cream place.
I think this ice cream was far too Asian for me, and that just didn't work for me.

It is oddly located.  Pretty "out there" for being in San Francisco.  Not really much around, so it doesn't make for a convenient dessert place for me.

There is a huge list of flavors, but none of them particularly stood out to me, and they aren't on display like nearly every other ice cream shop in existence, so you can't use that to help decide.  The ones I tried were pretty boring and straight forward, but at least it had a good consistency to the ice cream.

The one great aspect of Polly Ann for me was the spin wheel.  Since there are so many uninteresting flavors, it was very difficult to decide, so the spin wheel solved that problem for me.  In addition, there was a chance for free ice cream.

Pricing is reasonable, and they have a check-in offer for a free scoop.

The ice cream was no where close to a match for Bi-Rite or Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous.   Furthermore, for the Asian flavors, I think Mitchell's does a far better job.
author: Jason S.

description: Favorite ice cream place in the Outer Sunset. It has a rich history as well! The Green Tea ice cream is unique compared to other green tea ice creams I've had before. It is distinct and you can tell its homemade. Service is great. They work hard there, so make sure you tip! They deserve it!
author: Gabby D.

description: This place is so cute and dog friendly! Lots of ice cream flavors to choose from, I would definitely come back here!!
author: Lauren K.

description: Straight up the best ice cream you can get, have been coming here ever since I was kid! Super creamy and delicious! They know how to make ice cream and it's definitely a go-to spot whenever you're in the mood for ice cream. Have tons of flavors to choose from, literally, they have so many that you even have the option to spin the wheel in the center of the board to decide a flavor for you! Always get the Thai Tea ice cream here since it's the only place I know that serves it and if you can't decide or simply are feeling a bit risky, spin the wheel!
author: William E.

description:
It has been years since my last visit to Polly Ann but it was as good as I remembered it. My relatives use to by 3-4 tubs for dessert after family dinners. We would all get together at my grandparents house and enjoy some good o'l Polly Anne ice cream. Our usual flavors were mango, green tea and lychee. I always had problems picking just one flavor so I'd ask for half a scoop of each flavor. 

Flash forward 20+ years later, mango, green tea and lychee are still my Polly Ann favorites. During my last visit I tried the black sesame which was delish but I had to stick to one of my usuals. My mom and I both had a single scoop of the Lychee ice cream. It was so refreshing and I love how it had little bits of Lychee in it. I have yet to find a mango, green tea, lychee ice cream that tastes as good as theirs.
author: Serena K.

description: delicious ice cream.  friendly service.  will let you try a sample.  superb green tea ice cream.
author: K H.

description:
Among the ice cream gems of San Francisco (Smitten, Mitchell's, Bi-Rite, Humphrey Slocombe), I'd say this parlor ranks high in my book of ice cream. They have random flavors and an Asian touch to everything. I like how the have a big wheel in the middle of the main wall for those who can't decide what to get. I had the Green Tea and the Taro flavors. I don't think you can go wrong with that. They have a flavor called Star Wars. How can you even imagine what that would taste like? There were some other random flavors such as E.T. or Bumpy Freeway. What the heck.

I'd come back here for sure--there's too many flavors. Prices are decent and service exists. You might be battling the line or a table with lots of Asian high school people.
author: Marlon T.

description: Diddddd someone say starwars ice cream?? i know it sucks that its so cold in SF but i've missed the ice cream here for sure! Gummy bear favor is a must try
author: Nancy W.

description: They have the most extensive selection of "normal" and odd-ball seasonal ice cream flavors in San Francisco.  I used to go there when they were in the old building.  I though they were closed for good when it was razed but when the new building came up, they were now at the corner!  I look forward to the days following Valentine's and Mother's days so I can get some of that rose ice cream.
author: Herb L.

description: One of the best in the city. It's a 25 minute drive for me but I still make it out there when I get hit with a craving.
author: Zippy L.

description: Server was very friendly as we asked to taste several flavors.  The sesame and strawberry oreo ice creams were delicious, as was their waffle cone.  They have some other interesting flavors I hope to try next time.
author: J C.

description: It is nice to have a good local ice cream place here in Outer Sunset.  The service is always great!  The ice cream itself, most flavors are good, some are just too sweet (peach, durian, lychee) or too perfume-my (eg. the mangosteen).  Overall, it is a good place :)
author: Meiko S.

description: What a cute ice cream place!  We tried a couple of flavors but decided to get the star wars since the boyfriend wasn't feeling the durian.  The people who work here (owners?) were really nice and patient as we were deciding.  The ice cream is pretty good.  It's like good old fashioned ice cream meets interesting flavors.  It's not AMAZING but it's pretty dang decent. I can't believe they have so many different flavors to choose from.  I will have to come back!
author: Irene C.

description:
Free ice cream day today (October 12, 2013) at Polly Ann from 12-5pm because it is their 58th Birthday!!!  The service was great!!! Super friendly and quick. I tried both the Kowloon Vanilla Bean (Vanilla Bean with Condensed Milk) and Angel Mint Pie (Mint, Brownies, and Chocolate Chip). Surprisingly, they were both really good.  However, I must say my favorite flavored ice-cream at Polly Ann is still their green tea.

It was also brilliant to have the Chairman Bao Food Truck sell the Pork Belly steamed buns right outside. If you buy 4 Polly Ann gift-cards for $10, you get a free steamed bun. You can redeem each gift card for a scoop of ice-cream worth about $3 each,  normally. Very good deal. Worth waiting in line for the free scoop too. The total wait starting from the door of Eggettes to Polly Ann only took about 10-15 minutes so the wait was not bad at all.  I recommend coming here next year for the free scope of ice-cream or just getting their green tea ice-cream whenever you get a green tea ice-cream craving.
author: Monica C.

description:
After a big hefty dinner of some excellent pizza, my sister and bro-in-law decided to grab some dessert with the baby.  I suggested some froyo, but after hearing about the wheel of destiny over at Polly Ann's, I had to give it a spin.

I happened to land on bubble gum, a flavor I can't stand.  Fortunately it was flanked by French vanilla and green tea!  Boy was I in for a treat.  Their green tea ice cream tastes just like the stuff from Shimo's, one o my favorite sushi joints ever.  I've been craving this stuff ever since I left for San Diego and was elated to finally taste the dark smokiness of the green tea in this authentic ice cream.  It was a fabulous end to a great evening.

The ice cream at Polly Ann's is excellent but the wheel of destiny really put it over the top for me.  It's one of the coolest gimmicks I've ever seen in an ice cream shop and there's even a ~5% chance of winning a free cone!  I can't wait to come back and spin again, and I've got my fingers crossed for some green tea.  Also, I heard that if you bring your dog, they even hook them up with their own special doggy cone.  How cool is that shht?!  WIN.

Food: 9/10

Service: 10/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 9/10
author: Joe M.

description:
Polly, oh Polly...  How do I love thee?  Let me count the ways...  

Out of 48 choices (some that always stay, others that rotate out) I've tried 8.  My tried and trues are durian, green tea and taro.  Perhaps I'm a creature of habit (or taste buds) but those 3 have served my ice cream cravings well.  In fact, no other green tea ice cream does Polly Ann's any justice, if you prefer strong green tea flavor vs. sugar.  (You green tea ice cream lovers will know what I'm talking about, the whole green tea ice cream debate.)  Same with the taro.  It's not dyed some crazy grape color,  isn't overly sweet, and isn't artificial: you can feel the itty bitty slivers of taro now and then.

Most recently I've ventured out of my comfort zone and have tried the hazelnut, rum raisin, Thai tea, and Jasmine tea.  Jasmine was very fragrant indeed and something I will likely add to my go-to list.

Wanted to try macapuno this last week when I was in, but it was not on the day's line up.  Better luck next time!

There are some better time to go than others, considering AP Giannini Middle School is only a block away.  I am both jealous and relieved at the same time.  Jealous that when in middle school I was in no close proximity to such an awesome ice cream shop...  And relieved because when in middle school I was in no close proximity to such an awesome ice cream shop.  If I was, my school delinquency would have started at a much younger age.
author: N M.

description: I love the jasmine tea flavor! Sounds strange, but has a nice floral flavor to it with tea at the same time! Usually I'm not a huge tea fan, but I keep coming back to this one. You have to try it at least once!
author: Mimi L.

description:
Polly Ann has been around for ages.  I remember coming here and spinning the wheel to take my chances on winning a free cone.  The risk is that you have to buy whatever it lands on if it does not land on "FREE" - whch means you could end up with Durian, or something funky.  All-in-all it's a fun experience to try.

The ice cream here is made fresh, and are fairly popular for the lychee, black sesame, and green tea flavors...  In fact, I might dare say that they could have been one of the original ice cream makers to make these flavors famous in the Bay Area.  I didn't know much of any other spots that served such flavors...  They marketed pretty well, as they can be found at the local 99 Ranch Markets, and other local Asian markets.

I had the black sesame (nice rich flavor), and my daughter had the lychee (she loved it)...  Cool spot to check out if you're in the neighborhood!
author: Lawrence L.

description:
DONT GO AT 3:30! That's when the middle school let's out, and it will be PACKED and loud. 

Spinning the wheel is always fun and different. I'm a fan of the strawberry-mango ice cream. The Star Wars one is okay. It'll probably be really got inside if you go on a sunny day!
author: Jade F.

description:
What attracts me here: I love that it's a great place for dates. there's toyose nearby and if you want to stretch out time with your date, bring them here for dessert! there's a ton of flavors to choose from and a great ice breaker to spin the wheel and see how adventurous your date can be with flavors.

Specialty: An array of ice cream flavors such as taro, coconut, mango, and multiflavor combos such as brownie|white choc|mint. bring home a pint too! 

Cost: single flavor is $2.45 , double flavor small is $2.95 etc

Parking: plenty of neighborhood parking

My purchase: I opted for two small scoops of pumpkin and angel mint pie, which had white choc, mint and brownie. both were delicious!
author: Connie C.

description:
Consistantly good!

Recommend: red bean

I usually buy the ube for making halo-halo. 

Buy the prepackage quarts. They are cheaper.
author: Teresa S.

description: The workers are very nice and I always come here for their ice cream. They have a large selection of flavors and three types of cones. The pricing is reasonable and the place is a decent place for sitting down and talking.
author: Angel N.

description:
GREAT ICE CREAM! and they have such a great selection of flavors.
The Taro icecream is so delicious with real taro chunks in it. The Thai ice tea flavor is to die for~
author: T P.

description: This has to be my new favorite ice cream place in the bay after coming here three times.  They have different flavors compared to Bi-Rite and both are great in their own ways.  My favorites are the honey dew, taro, and the thai ice tea ones - my girlfriend prefers the green tea (very intense flavor) and lychee (has lychee bits).  Polly Anns ice cream is on point and will not disappoint.
author: Christopher C.

description:
Polly Ann's ice cream is kind of a strange concept. They're not exactly gourmet ice cream, yet they have gourmet flavors. I was surprised by how many flavors they have! As soon as I got there I just *had* to try all the interesting flavors...! I tried the taro one (great), green tea (too bitter .. maybe if youre into the actual taste of green tea and not the sweetened version.. I prefer the sweeter one :P), and the star wars. I had no idea what star wars was but it had marshmallows in it and too sweet. I didn't like it at all. They have a few ice cream flavors that are masked by some weird names so you have no idea what their actual flavor is...unless you ask... 

KIND OF OVERWHELMING!!!... I ordered two scoops of taro ice cream cuz to me that one tasted the best.. the others were second and third place by a loooong mile. Got my free scoop by checking in on yelp...! Yay me! So thrifty yeeeh! I saw on the menu while I was eating the taro... jasmine tea flavor?!?!?! What?! How did I miss that the first time?! I told you! The menu is overwhelming..too many flavors..too many things to read! Anyway I tried a sample of that but decided not to get another scoop.. Watching my calorie count if you know what I mean. *wink wink nudge nudge*

Anyway.. I have got to come back to try the jasmine tea flavor.. It was good.. If I had gotten it, I might have bumped this rating to 5 stars. ;)

I'll be back for you jasmine tea flavor!!

PS Ici is still my favorite ice cream parlour. Please do yourself a favor and drive over that dang bridge and try the magic that is ICI!!! In Berkeley... !
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Well, Polly Ann. One thing is clear...so many flavors, so little time. Not my favorite ice cream in the world but the eclectic variety of flavors is undeniable and you'd be silly not to drop in once and at least sample some of their creations. You could always spin their wheel of fortune. When an employee spins it and it lands on free spot, you get an ice cream of your picking gratis but if it lands on a particular flavor, you're stuck with that one or it's neighbors. I'm too much of a wuss to try my hand at it but I've seen people do it every time I've come in. 

Their specialties lie in the realm of Asian flavors like lychee, mango, green tea, taro coconut, thai tea, black sesame, vanilla with condensed milk, jasmine, and even durian, which is a major selling point for me. At the risk of sounding cliche, the green tea is and will always be my favorite. The non-Asian types I've tried are the pistachio, star wars, and the strawberry oreo, all of which would be best described as awesome. In addition to cups and cones, they have sundaes, banana splits, and shakes like any other classic parlor. Somehow, I've lost my childlike tendencies and get one scoop in a cup like a boring mom. 

I'd probably give them four stars but one of the kinds I tried was freezer burned and had some ice chips in it. Hell nawww. I guess not all of the flavors have enough turnover, which is not surprising. I can't imagine there are people making daily trips for rum raisin. 

For all you East Bay people... if you don't want to venture to West Sunset, Ranch 99 in Pacific East Mall carries their products but if you want that dripping cone of Star Wars, you have to make the trip.
author: Ruby G.

description:
It's a pleasure having Polly Ann in the neighborhood. 

Turkish Coffee is my favorite flavor, but Jasmine Tea and the Mint Cookie are also uniquely delicious. The flavor wheel is totally cute and the staff is always friendly. No lines, lots of parking. 

And for some reason.. It's really satisfying that they give out their samples on a popsicle stick!
author: Jasmine M.

description: "Spin me," their wheel calls. And whatever flavor you land on, you must try. Personally, their mango is my favorite, so I don't need their wheel of indecision. Or do I like their green tea? Thai tea? Or maybe their coffee ice cream? Damn, where's that wheel again?
author: Jack R.

description:
FIRST TIMER! (Warning: This is probably one of my most unorganized reviews ever..) 

What do you do when you're feeling a bit sad? You eat ice cream of course!! My reason for being sad was cause my guy chose League of Legends over me.. -sad face- (boys and their toys.. -__-) But it was made up when he treated me out for ice cream, Eggettes (next door), and a ghetto cup noodle dinner! :) 

Who eats ice cream on a rainy night? Apparently quite an amount of people do! When my guy and I stepped in, there were a few couples and families sitting around eating ice cream. The service is good, as we were greeted by the two girls behind the counter immediately when we stepped in. Parking can be a pain since it's street. (There were 2 spots right by the entrance but all the single cars decided to be greedy and take up two spots!).  There are probably about 4-5 tables, so if you plan on eating inside, better snag one while you can! 

What's interesting about this place is, they don't just sell ice cream...but they also sell CANDY! Now I'm not talking about M&M's, Snicker bars, and stuff from Costco...I'm talking about Sour Patch, Nerds Rope (omg, do you ever see these stuff around anymore?), ring pops, etc. Do you remember those old school Kool-Aid bottles with those twisty caps? Omg. They sell those too!! How awesome! I thought they were extinct! It's like I almost relived my childhood all over again.. 

What flavors of ice cream do they serve?? They have a variety of ice cream flavors, some interesting ones too! To name a few, there's Durian, Lychee, Taro, Jasmine, Red Bean, etc. When you look at the wall, you can be quite overwhelmed..I wouldn't blame you though, cause there's over 40 flavors! If you can't decide, just spin the wheel and let it decide for you! (Too bad it was broken when I came.. -sadface-) 

Now back to ordering ice cream! I ordered a mango & strawberry swirl with a scoop of vanilla on the side. I ordered it in a cup and when the girl first set it down on the counter for me while my guy ordered, the first thing I noticed was an eyelash in my mango & strawberry swirl ice cream... Does this mean the people who make the ice cream rub their eyes while making it? Anyways, I'm not the type of person to make a big deal out of things, so I just took it out and moved on with my life. The mango & strawberry swirl wasn't what I expected, maybe because I kinda had high expectations for it..so I wasn't really satisfied. As for the vanilla, you can never go wrong with vanilla! When I mixed in mango & strawberry swirl with vanilla into my mouth, the mango & strawberry swirl sure took away the flavor..I could hardly taste my vanilla! 

Overall, I think I will give this place a second chance some time in the future..only cause my guy says it has some good flavors, haha. Hopefully when I do come back, the wheel will work again! And I pray I won't land on Mango & Strawberry Swirl....

Cool Tip: Check in for a free scoop (of any flavor) for your single or double-scoop ice cream! (This is where my vanilla came from :D)
author: Mandy G.

description:
I never make it out to the sunset, but since it was a hot day and I went to Landsend, I made it a point to go try Polly Ann's.  

Awesome treat.  I got the black sesame ice cream on a waffle cone since I've been craving black sesame for a few months.  It did not disappoint.  I also tried the Taro and Green tea ice cream.  I usually hate all taro products, but this was good!!  I kid you not!!  The green tea was also great... it was more pungent tasting than the normal green tea ice cream you get at the store and other places.  

I will be coming back.  Friendly service also!!
author: Vicky T.

description:
Ice cream!!! They have all the unique and exotic flavors such as: Thai tea, Durian, Black Sesame, Green Tea, Red Bean, etc!

I love love love LOVEE their Black Sesame, Green Tea, and Thai Tea! The flavors are all bold, and tastes like what they're suppose to taste like! Their Black Sesame ice cream is made from actual sesame, unlike other ice cream which uses "powdered sesame" for the flavoring! And their green tea is bitter just like the real thing, and not artificially tasting! 

Also love their quote on the wall: "Harassing employees will definitely result in a smaller portion" lol.

TIP:
- I've been told that Thai Tea goes out really fast! So if they have it, get it!
author: michelle h.

description:
My co-worker gave my team 4 tubs of Polly Ann's as a thank you gift. BEST TASTING GIFT EVER. The texture is so light and fluffy and melts into a rich and cream consistency in your mouth. The taro and lychee are my favorite. My only complaint are the plastic tubs are child proof, they are SO hard to pry open. 

I decided to go o the store this weekend and get more Polly Ann's. I ordered the mint and taro, but was sad to discover the ice cream was not as light and fluffy compared to the ones in the tubs. Don't get me wrong it was still delicious but it just tasted like regular creamy ice cream.
author: Cindy A.

description: I really love the durian ice cream! I'm so excited to hear that they will open in the South Bay (hopefully that isn't a rumour!). They have real chunks inside the ice cream and it's so creamy! I would eat this in cold weather any day!
author: Jenna L.

description:
(See pics)

Review #1028.

Some of the ice cream flavors gear towards Asian dessert, so a higher rating for its uniqueness and proximity to the beach. The red bean and strawberry mango swirl were both great hits especially when you are on your way to the beach. It will be the most enjoyable walk as you want to walk while racing the cold sensation of some amazing silky firm ice cream.

Ah and of course, you can also "Spin the Wheel" if you can't quite decide or want to step out of your typical choices. There are THAT many choices!
author: T L.

description:
Clean and lots of great flavors. Counter people are not major "tasting nazis," we were able to try a few and decide.

WARNING: if you order a "single" the sign says "1-2 flavors." HOWEVER, they will ask if you want "two scoops." If you say 'yes,' (of COURSE I want two scoops/flavors, I just told you that - lost in translation?) it somehow costs an extra dollar, apparently there are two kinds of "singles" but only one is listed on the board. The guy said something about the single on the wall is half of a scoop or something, which I actually would have preferred. Hard to figure out how he expected to get two flavors onto the cone without using two scoops, but will have to remember their crazy code if I return. 

Beyond their off-kilter method of selling product, they make some very good ice cream here. Probably a 4-star place, gotta knock off a star for the confusing pricing.
author: T J.

description: A fun, low-key neighborhood venue in the Sunset district. The servers wore wide smiles with pleasant communication skills.  They offered tasters and shared their personal favorite flavors.  The Black Sesame has the right balance of flavors so as not to be overpowering.  I almost spun the Wheel of Flavors but finally settled on a waffle cup of both Pudding Caramel and Heavy Chocolate that included chocolate, chocolate chips, and chocolate fudge - YUM! 4 starts for flavor quality and the 5th star for unique, fun attributes; Wheel of Flavors, creative ice cream flavor names, interesting variety of sweet snacks, and an interesting way to let guests access their restroom facility, and know when access to the facility is available - or not!
author: Natalie H.

description: Love all the flavors and the atmosphere. Fun time and really good service. Prices are reasonable and parking is easy so overall seems life a great spot to bring the family. I enjoyed the mint and coconut!
author: Sue S.

description:
Good ice cream. Crappy service. I ordered the Kowloon vanilla and they gave me vanilla. My fiance was like is that Kowloon vanilla or vanilla, the girl who served it said vanilla. I then told her I asked for Kowloon vanilla. She said: Are you sure? You ordered vanilla.

Yes I am sure. In fact I said it twice. Ask my fiance, he was next to me and heard it and I was ordering for HIM! 

Even if I did NOT, be good at customer service and give me what I want. Thanks.
author: Jenny W.

description:
OH EM GEE.

I came here because of all the ravings about Durian Ice Cream that I've been hearing!!!! I've never had it, and boy was it GOOD!!!!!!!  The ice cream itself is a lot lighter and fluffier than cold stone's and bi-rite's, and the minute the scoop came out I SMELLED THE STINK.  of course, it was a deliciously good stink.  I got my single scoop of durian ice cream in a waffle cone and enjoyed it for the 10 minutes that it lasted.  I would definitely come again for durian ice cream!!!!! it was such a blast. 

Plus, they have hilarious signs inside their little corner shop.  Cute decor :)
author: Liz W.

description:
I've always wanted to try different ice cream flavors i'd see on tv but never had the chance so I had gotten a suggestion from a friend to try this place. 

Polly Ann's has some traditional flavors and not so traditional. Haven't got the guts to try the durian. :) 

I've never had black sesame ice cream before and it was delightful! Even though it's an ice cream, it had such a nice warmth from the sesame flavor and every time I tried to decipher this new flavor in my brain, it just got washed away with a positive enjoyment of it.

I've also had the lychee. Great! So many new flavors to try out can't wait to try some more out. Very, very good experience.
author: S Y.

description:
This place was a nice and unexpected find in the outer sunset.

I was in the area to try out a new place to get my haircut and I noticed this place as I was driving down Noriega. I made a mental note to check this place out after I got my hair cut and it was definitely the right decision.

This place has SO MANY OPTIONS. How on Earth am I expected to choose without sampling every single one. So I did. kidding. I opted for the Thai tea since it's always something that I enjoy and it was tasty! Nothing too overpowering and not extremely sweet.

Needless to say, I'll be back here to check out more flavors. If anything, an ice cream after each haircut won't hurt. I did notice they had some star wars flavors. Can't pass those up!
author: Karma B.

description:
After a day at the beach on a very hot day, drop by Polly Ann's.  Plenty of flavors to choose from.  They even have durian on top of that.

Yum :)
author: Pam S.

description:
This is a recurring habit of mine, but I still love going to Polly Ann and enjoy doing this:

But not spinning the wheel!

I just want a $5.00 half-pint of fresh hand-scooped Taro Ice Cream!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/2kigSyi7myx0-34YATi-Xw?select=MDh7T0T4B1FK7qNlatqfNA

After 10 minutes and lo & behold:
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/2kigSyi7myx0-34YATi-Xw?select=_ylQQll0aDSjYJlOtoPNQw

Many of the young admirers, mainly Asians, were terrified by what I just done. I'm sure you would too, if you hung out with me!
author: Matt G.

description:
Polly Ann's is one of my favorite ice cream places in the Bay Area. :)

It was relatively easy to find parking at 2pm on a weekday. Polly Ann's wasn't too busy either.. which meant more time for me to try different flavors! They have a wide array of flavors from Banana Rocky Road to Star Wars, you'll definitely find something you'll like.

The employees are friendly, patient, and knowledgeable. I swear, the poor guy probably got "What's in Star Wars?" at least 10 times. I ended up getting Honeydew Melon and Lychee and oh my goodness, it was amazing! Their ice cream is so creamy, rich, and flavorful! 

The decor is fun and laid back. Definitely a place to have some ice cream with friends! Prices are reasonable, too and you get two scoops in the smallest cup. I believe they have popsicles if you're not an ice cream person!

Lovelove this place!
author: Joyce E.

description: Great customer service even though they were closing in 15 min on a Sunday! The boss should be proud of EY and Lauren for their representation of the shop and salesmanship.
author: Tracy A.

description:
The Ice Cream here was not as rich and creamy as I would like but the flavors were delightful. I tried Durian, Sesame, Lychee and American Beauty (Rose), Taro, Green Tea and Jasmine Tea. 

American Beauty was very distinct. Rose flavored ice cream was unlike anything I had tried before. Unfortunately it reminded me too much of my hand soap. I liked the sesame one at first but after a couple more bites it became a bit too overpowering for my taste buds. My favorite of all was Durian but it is definitely not for everyone. For a safer bet I would recommend Lychee or Green Tea. Taro flavor was too artificial. Jasmine Tea was similar to Green Tea but with a more flowery after taste.
author: Mona W.

description: Back in the 70s, they had the absolutely best rum raisin.   Do they still have that?   I would drive all the way from East Bay to get it if they do.
author: Siu C.

description:
One of my favorite local ice cream shops. I love all the choices and the fun SPIN THE ICE CREAM WHEEL.

My all-time favorite is 
* Lychee Flavor (5 of 5)

But I also recommend 
* Melon Flavor (4 of 5)
* Red Bean Ice Cream Sticks (4 of 5)

The ice cream is so light, tasty, and creamy. Yummy. If you haven't tried it and like to try variety flavors such as lychee, melon, coconut, durian, or sesame. This is definitely the place to go visit. And, Eggettes is just around the corner.

Be warned, this place closes early.
Mon-Sun 11 am - 10 pm.
author: Janice T.

description:
You have to love this place for the sheer amount of different flavors they have and the interesting flavor combinations they have created (Ex. Star Wars, which is a mint ice cream with marshmallows).

What keeps this place from being truly top notch however is that it's not really a full bodied ice cream. I think places like Mitchell's or Bi-Rite for example, are just a step above because they a lot creamier and smoother than Polly Ann's.

But don't let that discourage you. I still think Polly Ann's is really good and is probably my go to spot in the neighborhood.
author: Jeffrey J.

description:
We were in the area after having dinner and our friend who lives nearby suggested making a pit stop at Polly Ann's. We were all stuffed, but after trying a few flavors, we all ended up getting something. I like how they make things interesting by allowing you to spin the wheel, for a chance at getting your ice cream for free! The only downfall is that you must get the flavor the wheel lands on, or the two neighboring flavors.

Most of us ended up spinning the wheel but all of their flavors are pretty good. I ended up getting the pistachio almond even though I'm a fan of their coconut ice cream as well. They have unique flavors such as durian and jasmine tea!

Don't forget that if you check in on Yelp, they have an offer for 1 free scoop on top of your singe/double scoop purchase (even though one scoop was more than enough for me haha).
author: Stephanie Y.

description: A lot of flavors. So many flavors.  My friend and I got a junior scoop each and the total came out to $4 something.  Not too shabby especially with all these pricey ice cream shops around in the city.  Anyways, I had a sample of the jasmine tea, taro, thai tea and durian.  From what I tasted, the jasmine tea had a bold flavor but a little too sweet for my liking.  The durian... Let me tell you about the durian ice cream.  They have to put it in the fridge in the BACK.  It is sooooooo strong in flavor and not to mention smell that they have to separate it from everything else.  I was expecting a small hint of durian or something, but no.  It was the real deal.  It smelled like it and tasted like it.  Full on flavor.  Go Polly Ann for getting that much of flavor into it, but no thank you.  I couldn't do it.  In the end I had to flip between the thai tea and the taro.  I opted for taro.  It had a grittier texture because of the taro, but nonetheless I did enjoy it.  I'll be back for you thai tea... I'll be back.
author: Kenitha Y.

description: I love all the flavours this spot has to offer. At this point I've tried so many and I've yet to be disappointed. Hands down though my favourite has to be the black sesame and the red bean ice cream. So delicious, especially when they mix just a tad bit together.
author: Shauna S.

description:
Super yummy icecream. I highly recommend the jasmine tea! It's SOOOO good!!!!!! I often travel half way across the city just for it~ 
Super friendly workers~ I often come in when its 2 guy workers and they never fail to entertain my pickiness & always offer suggestions~ 
Some flavors are eh ( red bean, cherry, lychee ICE CREAM,)

Honestly, try the jasmine tea~~ 
It taste like the milk tea ~ you'll want some boba!
author: D. C.

description:
Omg the toasted almond and the toasted sesame ice creams were amazing. 

Tried the durian fruit and had gasoline burps all evening.
author: Robert P.

description: Probably one of the best ice cream places I'VE been too! I mean the ice cream is not too sweet and just enough flavor. I would probably get addicted to this place since it has soooo many flavors to choose from at a reasonable price. The ONLY reason why I gave this place 3 stars instead of 5 stars is because ONE of the employees, SHE got mad and said that my friends and I didn't tip her even though we only ordered one scoop each. TIP/GRATUITY is optional it shouldn't be something you force your customers to give.
author: Pj A.

description:
Great variety of ice cream, especially with Asian flavors like Thai tea, taro, durian, etc. 

Tried a sample of durian. Too strong for my taste but I can see a durian eater falling in love with it. I ended up ordering the caramel salt in a waffle cone. Good price for the right amount of ice cream.

Flavors are there but in the end, the ice cream is a bit too creamy for my taste.
author: Henry P.

description: Best jasmine tea ice cream ever! I'm a big fan of jasmine tea so once I saw there was an option I had to try a sample and I fell in love! The staff was really helpful and we weren't shy at all asking for samples. I will be back next time I'm in San Fran!
author: Evett L.

description: Always great ice cream. They're open late too. Maybe flavors to chose from as well. Definitely a repeat visit.
author: Red S.

description: I was drawn in because a friend lives nearby, and I couldn't help but be curious. I walked in to almost too many flavors, but I really enjoy the variety. They have funky flavors called Old San Francisco (something with pineapple?) & Star Wars (mint with marshmallows) which are worth a try. But I used the yelp check-in to have my two personal favorites, the chocolate chip and the mint chocolate chip. Definitely worth a stop if you happen to be in the area.
author: Jessica M.

description:
I use to bike to Polly Ann when I was a kid. Now I drive my kid to get ice cream. It's so much cheaper buying a tub of Dreyers ice cream from Safeway, but it's so nice to sample the ice cream flavors! It's just more fun when you get to pick your own flavor and someone scoops it out for you. My favorite flavors - Green Tea, Jasmin Tea, Turkish Coffee, Black Sesame, Taro, Lichee, Oreo Mint and almost everything in the menu. My daughter's favorite flavor - Chocolate. 

Spin the wheel if you can't decide. You might win a free scoop. It happened to us twice! They have durian flavor if you're into that smell.
author: Linda S.

description:
I've had Polly Ann Ice Cream before, but it was always from a tub bought from the grocery store. I was finally able to stop by over the weekend since I wasn't too full from dinner and in the neighborhood (a rare combination for me!). There's a lot of choices and some w/ interesting names like Star Wars (which is mint w/and rainbow marshmallows) or Bumpy Freeway (rocky road). A majority are Asian-inspired flavors like Taro, Durian, Thai Tea, etc. If you're unsure what to order, you can also spin a wheel (which also gives you a chance to win a free scoop!).

Our order
Hazelnut Marble & Black Sesame
Mango & Lychee

I really enjoyed my Hazelnut Marble & Black Sesame. Both very strong flavors and creamy. I tried my friend's Mango & Lychee which were very refreshing and not icy. Highly recommend!
author: Kitty K.

description: Wow who knew it gets hot in San Francisco. Over the weekend it was pretty hot and I was craving ice cream. The place was nice and clean with a line out the door, but it moved pretty fast. So many flavors to choose from as well, so be prepared to be overwhelmed with all the selections. I ordered a marble fudge and hazelnut marble. Both were nice and creamy, I just wished it had a tad bit less sugar (I don't like overly sweet stuff). My sister got vanilla bean and blackberry. I think they gave her regular vanilla because we didn't see a speck of vanilla bean at all. The vanilla was ehhh pretty consistent with all other vanilla. She really liked her blackberry, it tasted just like a blackberry "creamsicle". Check this place out if you're craving good ice cream without the hustle and bustle of bi-rite type of line.
author: Julie C.

description: Pretty inexpensive compared to other ice cream shops in the city. I like how many different flavors there are including a lot of unique asian flavors as well. If you enjoy tea flavored ice cream, you gotta try the jasmine tea. It's so good and refreshing!
author: Julia H.

description:
I heard this place had Durian Ice Cream (yayyy), so I made a pit stop on the way home to SJ. It's located in a residential area, but there's open street parking all around. It's a clean and simple ice cream shop. No thrills and frills. They have a really good variety of flavors and a wall packed with candy and treats (a lot of which reminded me of my childhood). I asked to sample the durian, but they didn't have any for single scoops  =( Oh well, what's not to like about Durian ice cream? so I picked up a whole tub of it anyway. It was around $6. Waited an hour later to enjoy it at home and it was scrumptious! It's not too creamy and the flavor isn't overbearing.

Minus 1 star because the gal who served me was moody and wouldn't even look at me when she was talking to me. Also, the containers that the ice cream comes in is really hard to open! I have to pry it open and it hurts every single time!
author: Lynn V.

description: Good ice cream, free waffle cone with check in is a plus. Got the black sesame and it was very good.
author: Mandy Y.

description:
Best ice cream ever. I have been coming here for the last 15 years. My dad went to the original Polly Ann's, and although the owners, and location changed, the quality has not. 

I am lactose intolerant, yet I still eat here because it is that good. I repeat I poison myself in order to eat Polly Ann's. That should speak wonders to this ice cream.
author: Greg L.

description: Polly Ann's black sesame ice cream is the best! The store has tons of different ice cream flavor and also other snack such as candies and chips. It's a great and family friendly dessert option in the sunset neighborhood.
author: Clare H.

description:
One bonus star because I grew up on this stuff. It's pretty much the go to brand for Chinese flavors for ice cream. I've tried many different brands for green tea ice cream but I always come back to polly ann. The others are great, however most of polly ann's flavors aren't too sweet which fits my taste perfectly. 

The shop is located in a neighborhood, not really what I'm used to, but there's a school nearby so i suppose it makes sense; kids, walking distance etc. It's just a bit strange that you can't actually see the ice cream since the counter isn't those glass freezers. It's not a BIG deal, but.... what if I just want to see what it looks like.. without having to ask for a sample? 

Anyways, used the yelp check in buy one get one scoop for free so pretty worth it. Their stock has been quite limited in ranch 99 these past few months. I'm not sure if it's because ranch 99 isn't ordering from them as often or if it's being grabbed up as soon as it's in the freezers. 

There are a few tables in side (4 if I recall correctly) parking (non street parking) is available right in front. It was pretty empty when I went.
author: Scott K.

description:
My neighborhood ice cream shop! I've been going to Polly Ann's since it was in the original store where Eggettes now sits. They have a great variety of flavors, from Asian flavors to Polly Ann's original ice cream recipes.

I've never had better Green Tea ice cream anywhere else, and their Cookie Caramel - which is one of their originals, is the YUMMIEST. I wish they had this flavor ALL THE TIME, sadly it gets switched out. 

I'll be back for you, Cookie Caramel.
author: Cynthia L.

description:
I was so intent on trying this place that I walked an additional 2 miles after just running 26 miles in the Nike's Women Marathon, since I figured that I usually don't come this far west in SF. I was terribly disoriented by the numerous flavors and eclectic names, such as Star Wars. However, a lot of their names are actually their labels for normal flavors. For example, their version of Rocky Road was dubbed something "highway" instead. There is even a lovely wheel that you may spin for a chance to win free ice cream or else buy whatever flavor the arrow lands on. 

I got a double scoop for $4.75, which isn't too shabby. This is a Asian-owned ice cream shop, so there are a good deal of Asian flavors, such as Durian, Taro, Ube, etc., all of which I heard good things about. I decided on the Macapuno and the Peach Brandy. Both were above average and tasted like the name implied. However, the consistency of the ice cream is not my cup of tea. It definitely had a slow-churned texture that I liked, but it tasted smoother (halfway between a gelato and ice cream) rather than the creamy taste I prefer.
author: Alice L.

description:
Overall: tasty neighborhood ice cream

Pros
- taro
- banana tastes like real banana


Cons
- green tea was a bit too hardcore for me, it's a bit more bitter than what I like 
- mango is ok


Sidenote: 
-Tried going during a weird time hoping it would not be too busy, but it was crazy busy.
author: Michelle D.

description: It is a delightful environment. The store is all white except for the vibrant colors of the 40+ flavors. The flavors are illustrated and simple and enticing. The only downsides are the price and some flavors are the worst I've ever had. Its a gamble, but it's worth it to try.
author: Rosalind S.

description:
There's a giant wheel that they'll spin if you're happy to take whichever flavor comes up (or a couple of options close by) - lots of fun if you're adventurous since it's pretty hard to choose between all the selections otherwise. They entice you with some "Free Ice Cream" spaces on the board too. 

Ice Cream was great - maybe not up to the quality of Bi-Rite or Humphry Slocombe, but well worth trying given the interesting flavors - many of them Asian influenced. Lychee is especially great! The prices totally reasonable for good ice cream too.

Only downside was we spun what looked like "Free" and they called it "on the border" and only gave us half off.
author: Amy D.

description: Great interesting favors and super friendly staff love this place. A good alternate to Mitchell's
author: Dave B.

description:
I haven't been back to Polly Ann's in a while, but I usually frequent the Eggette's next door. The last three times that I've been here, the customer service was impeccable. About two weeks ago, my uncle decided it would be a bright idea to bring all my little cousins and niece here for some ice cream. The man behind the counter was very nice and patient, which was greatly appreciated. Btw, melting ice cream in cones and kids do not mix. We left a messy, melted ice cream trail during the walk back to my house. 

More recently, I went to check if they had a flavor that my cousin asked me about. I'd never heard of it before, but I decided to go ahead and ask anyway. It was a rainy day and we were the only ones inside, so I figured it'd be okay to ask. And, it was! I asked the lady behind the counter if they had banana oreo ice cream. She looked at the menu on the wall, walked to the back, walked back out, looked at me, and finally found it. She told me it was the last three gallon they had. I felt so bad for making her go through the trouble that I bought a junior scoop. Though it's a unique flavor, it wasn't my cup of tea. It's just like cookies and cream with banana extract added. I'll pass. 

The other day my cousin and I went to go pick up two cakes and one of them had durian ice cream. The man behind the counter said, "The durian one is wrapped in the plastic bag...cause you know..," implying that it emits a foul odor. HAHA, I cracked up on the spot. I guess durian is one of those acquired tastes. Anyway, I love Polly Ann's--brings back a lot of good memories :)
author: Audrey T.

description:
Lots of flavors, most of them pretty good. Also have other snacks besides ice cream. 

Popular place for middle schoolers after school, so it can get really crowded. 

Try the green tea!! :)
author: Jenny E.

description: Good selection of ice cream, good size scoops.  Atmosphere is relaxed and the staff is nice.  the location is a plus, near Sunset Blvd.  Sometimes lines are disorganized and we got skipped a couple of times.
author: Sarah T.

description:
Polly Ann's is the original Asian-flavored ice cream shop in the City. There are oodles of flavors, ranging from the familiar to the exotic. 

Aside from the motherland, this is the only place I go to feed my sesame ice cream cravings. In the past, I was lured by other sesame ice cream options from the Chinese and Japanese grocery stores, but I always end up disappointed. Since I learned my lessons, I will never make the mistake of getting black sesame ice cream elsewhere.

At Polly Ann's, the sesame ice cream cannot be compared to anything else. It is made up of real black sesame seeds, sugar, and cream. Each tiny seed is personally roasted and grind in house for that extra flavorful touch. Thus, each lick is slightly smoky and leaves behind grind seeds in between my perfectly straight teeth. Since the sesame ice cream is made of real seeds, I came up with the perfect justification to get this treat - the black sesame seeds will help me grow thicker and more luscious hair, and is just like taking my daily vitamins. 

I dare you not to order this health-beneficial, creamy delight of black sesames!
author: Mabel Y.

description: asian ice cream parlor with popular asian flavors that you cant get at your local baskin robins! I came here cause one of my girl friends wanted to reunite with her childhood memories of polyann ice cream and she was really happy when she got it! I had to minus a star cause gosh, the boys that were working were rude and unfriendly. Theyhad no patience to serve us and it was our first time and since there's so many asian flavors it was hard to pick what flavors we wanted! Boys, stop being mean and learn some patience!!!
author: Cindy C.

description:
Nice little ice cream joint in West Sunset. I just wish there was an easier way to get here if you don't have a car. Lucky we were able to get a ride over to enjoy some of Polly Ann's Ice Cream. 

They have a cool concept of a giant spinning wheel. One of the employees will spin the wheel and you have a chance to win a free scoop of ice cream. If you don't land on one of those free spots, you will be stuck with the choice of the one it lands on and the surrounding spots. I heard previous stories where you did not get a choice. 

I enjoyed a nice scoop of Thai Tea ice cream in a waffle cone. I wish they made their own cones as these were pre made somewhere elsewhere.

If there is a long line, do not get discouraged. The line goes quick as they are veteran ice cream scoopers.
author: Michael C.

description:
This is a Asian ice cream shop. I enjoy their green tea ice cream and sesame ice cream. Their flavors are true to the ingredients. It is not too sweet.

The only thing I am not a fan of are their ice cream cakes. I purchased one for Mother's Day and it did not look very appealing when I picked it up. The taste was not what  we expected it to be.

I would come here for their ice cream but not their ice cream cakes.
author: Irene L.

description:
Polly Ann's has been a favorite of  mine since i discovered their ice bars at various asian markets. first time i came to this shop 

here they offer 48 flavors (2.75 a scoop, 4.75, 2 scoops) choice of plain or sugar cone,                                3.5 stars

menu: hot dogs, soft serve softies, smoothies, ice cream, sundaes...... 

sampling: mango
-fruitty, not too sweet. will try taro, my fav, next.

licks:
-ice cream flavors range from bubble gum to traditional chocolate to asian flavors of macapuno, taro, mango, lychee, etc.
-definite upgrade when i try more flavors.
-only one person on duty so service may be slow.
-ample street parking.
author: Victor G.

description: Wow, lots of great flavors! I picked out a Star Wars themed flavor, and I got a free scoop with a check-in.  It ended up being too much for me (I'm getting old!) but it was delicious.
author: Vira P.

description:
I've been meaning to try Polly Ann Ice Cream for some time now, but just never really got around to it since it's a bit out of the way for me.  During my final exams though, as a much needed break, I finally found the perfect time to visit.

The shop located on the corner of Noriega and 39th, and serves up a variety of flavors.  Some of the standout flavors, in my opinion, were: green tea, red bean, jasmine tea, lychee, and sesame.  The sesame is very interesting and all I have to say is, make sure you try a sample before ordering it for the first time- it's very sesame-y.  

I got a scoop of red bean ice cream and it's a lot bean-ier and heartier than other red bean ice creams I've had before.  I really enjoyed it.

My boyfriend had a scoop of the lychee and it was really delicious as well.  This ice cream was a bit smoother in consistency than my red bean, but both were great.  Their ice creams are all really flavorful and I love the different flavor options.  They still serve up the classic flavors too, if you want something a little more familiar.

The pricing is very fair/average and the service was fine.  They sell plenty of pre-packed tubs of ice cream at a very fair price as well.  I'll probably be back soon.
author: Samantha L.

description:
I had a double scoop ($4.75) last weekend and was delighted to hear that I could have up to 4 flavors! There were so many to choose from and I did not want to be a sample hoard so I limited myself. I had half scoops of: jasmine tea, taro, pistachio almond, and root beer. All 4 flavors were oh-so-yummy.

jasmine tea: wasn't too powerful but still had the tea flavor
taro: nice and not very sweet
pistachio almond: very green in color but super good
root beer: tastes just like the drink
author: Dominic T.

description:
How can I not love Polly Ann?  It's the equivalent of Marianne's in Santa Cruz with the exception that Marianne's doesn't have the magic WHEEL that Polly Ann's has.  Of course, Marianne's has probably the best reputation and business as Polly Ann but both are must stops for any ice cream obsessed person in their respective cities.

I always spin the wheel and usually if I don't get a free ice cream on my spin, I get a flavor that is somewhat appealing to me.  Today, it was vanilla, orange sherbet or pumpkin so I chose pumpkin.  I've gotten two free scoops in my life and there's nothing like letting the ice cream gods dictate your flavor of ice cream when arriving.

Even today on a rainy SF Saturday afternoon, Polly Ann still managed to pull in the business.  And while in line, make sure to notice the catchy and humorous signs posted all over the walls.  

They had been CASH ONLY in the past but I saw decals for Visa or MC on the counter so be prepared to bring the cash just in case.
author: Ben H L.

description:
One Big Damn YUM!   (Awarded when stars just aren't up to the task)

You haven't been here yet?  Well neither had I until recently.  Rich and creamy and super dreamy is how I describe this place both for ice cream taste and appearance.

Just let your palate range far and wide for rewards you never expected.  You'll come back again like I did.
author: Chris R.

description:
HUGE SELECTION OF ICE CREAM. You're bound to find something you like if not many! 
I loooove the rum raisin and the classic mint-chip! Polly Anns is a very familiar brand of ice cream, most Asians would know. The ice cream is great and creamy, never too sweet. 
Some flavors are a hit or miss, but you can sample them before you buy them which is great! Given, there are many better ice cream places, I just love the wheel and the huge selection of ice cream flavors. It's really a fun ice cream place to be and the feel is always welcoming and laid back. The service is great as well. Fun place to bring your kids or your friends and family. The prices are very reasonable as well.
I would definitely recommend trying this place at least once.
author: Veronica L.

description:
