Love the honeydew....banana rocky road... turkish coffee.... mm mm mmm. Great spot in the sunset for a creamy scoop of ice cream. Take a crack at the flavor wheel if you want a shot at a free scoop but if not free...you have to get the flavor it lands on.... the rules of the wheel...

Prices are average. Place is clean and we'll lit. They also have cakes and tubs that they sell. I will continue to go back :)
author: Krystal T.

description: Love the variety of flavors offered here! If you're in the mood for taro, red bean, durian, jasmine, sesame, or lychee ice cream, then this is a place you should try out. My favorite so far is the red bean.  They also have different spins on classic flavor (like strawberry rocky road). Prices are reasonable and service is good.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Used their yelp check-in deal. Buy 1 get 1 scoop free! Ohhh sooo yummy!

I had their black seasame and durian flavor. Portions are great!   Can't wait to try other flavors
author: Diana M.

description: Great, quick service. The servers were patient with me as I tried different flavors. I got the jasmine tea flavor AND IT WAS SO GOOD (different from green tea flavor, which is your more typical/generic green tea flavor). It was fresh and flavorful, but more on the light side so it wasn't overpoweringly sweet or anything like that.
author: Esther C.

description:
Polly Ann is kind of like a bizarre Asian ice-cream staple.

Where else can you find Red bean, Durian, Taro, Black Sesame, Melon, Jasmine, Lychee or Guava flavors all in one place?

Can't decide?  Spin the wheel and let fate decide for you!

Can't go wrong here.  Great flavors and consistent.
author: Anthony L.

description: SO GOOD! i always go for their tea flavored ice creams(jasmine, earl grey, green) being the tea lover that i am. Their green tea and jasmine are my favorite. The taste is like real tea! So light and refreshing, not creamy or milky like other green tea ice creams. Also so affordable and very generous scoops!
author: Kim S.

description:
So many flavors! Durian? Black Sesame? Green Tea? Red Bean? Mint chip? Expresso? 48 flavors in total..... how do I decide?
There was a wheel of joy you can spin... I wanted to landed on "free" so I'd be able to get any flavor for free, but I saw durian on the flavor menu and I couldn't risk getting that.
After standing there staring at the menu for 10 minutes, I decided to go with Green Tea and Jasmine Tea. 
Creamy, sweet, not watery, the flavor wasn't too strong or weak. My taste buds were happy.
author: Janet L.

description: Enjoyed the creativity of different ice cream flavors and let me tell you.. that Taro flavor...
author: Susan K.

description: Their black sesame is the best black sesame ice cream I've ever had.  Smooth and rich. This, and Jasmine Tea are my favorite flavors here.
author: Mimi S.

description: Worst customer service  ,    after spending 10.00 on a ordinary milk shake,  asked for a paper cup so I can share with my wife,  counter girl wanted to charge me 25 cents for a paper cup.  I had a shocking look,  she additional commented.  Well I'm not gonna give to u free.    Gwhiz just a paper cup to a paying customer.
author: Roland C.

description:
Hi Polly! You've been around since I could walk and even though you took some time off for a makeover, I'm glad you came around the corner to share your fifty four flavors of ice cream with me.

I remember those middle school days where we used to share suicides, purple dragons, and blue mules for pocket change, and spinning the wheel to find out that I absolutely LOVE durian ice cream. 

All time favorites: Taro, green tea, jasmine, and spinning the wheel on a cold day, because in all honesty, how do you not enjoy a surprise like that?

Oftentimes the gallon packs of ice cream are rather icy, but I've never had an icy shard in my scoops at the store.

Have a complaint? Go to Helen Waite. 

Gotta love those witty signs.
(And the free doggy cones for our little friends.)
author: Colleen M.

description:
How this place was so close to school and I never went?!  I must say I missed out!

The menu includes many different flavors you don't see anywhere else.  Rum Raisin and Pistachio are some of my family's favorites.  I really like Honeydew and Lychee.  Can't decide?  Spin the wheel!  Hey, you might get it for free.  And you do have three choices when it lands.  

They happily give samples, and they can split your scoop with 2 different flavors.  Prices are good too!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Wheel of fortune.

Pat Sajak would appreciate the wheel mounted on the wall. It's for when you can't decide. There are so many amazing sounding flavors you just might need help.

Or go locally inspired with the Sunset Sundae. Incredible mix of vanilla, fudge, caramel, nuts and Oreo pieces. Get a cone. All together just $2 and change for a junior size.

Walk to the beach. Enjoy some of the best ice cream in the best city in the world. How fortunate we are?
author: Jason B.

description:
I remember reading about this place on yelp and hearing about their durian flavor smelling like gasoline. I couldn't believe, so I checked it out for myself. I'm actually a huge fan of durian, although people were right. The durian flavor ice cream is gross. 
Nevertheless, this place has my all time favorite flavors. 

Green Tea and Red Bean. I use to be a big fan of their taro flavor,  but I got sick of it. 
It's pretty far deep into the Sunset. I don't go here too often, however when I do I make sure to leave with three scoops in my cup!
author: Lisa T.

description:
I've tried the following flavors here: 
Lychee 
Lemon Strawberry 
Coconut
Caramel Cookie Dough

All of which were great! The service is good. Prices are reasonable. Love Polly Ann's Ice Cream! I would definitely recommend this place!
author: Tara V.

description:
Oh so many flavors to choose from. Four C's, Star Wars, banana chocolate chip, jasmine milk tea, yum yum yum.

This place is like Asian baskin robbins, but oh so much better. 

My grandpa loves their durian ice cream and I've been having to resupply him with a box of it every two weeks or so. Dat durian ice cream... so pungent.
author: C. Z.

description:
I went to Polly Ann Ice cream last weekend and it is awesome!

The space itself is cute, and there are countless flavors to choose from. There's even a wheel to help you decide which flavor to get if it comes down to that.

Prices are extremely reasonable too.

I ended up getting a regular sundae, and it was the perfect size. Not too big or too small and completely delicious.
author: Kathleen A.

description: I have had my share of green tea ice cream, and I have to say, Polly Ann has the best green tea ice cream anywhere.  I don't know if it is the extra matcha powder they put in their ice cream...or Chinese crack...but I love the intense flavor.  Too bad it is all the way in the Outer Sunset.  One would think there would be more places centrally located for crack ice cream, I mean green tea ice cream.
author: Ally W.

description:
Your single scoop in a cup is dinky as heck! I can finish that in 3 spoon fulls. 

And stop getting so cheap on your products! Your green tea AND lycee ice cream tastes like tart/chalk whatever you want to call it! It's disgusting!
author: Jess W.

description: This place has lots of candy and snacks and ice cream !  I also always order my ice cream cake here .Some stuff there are likee only 25 cents . Like the sour power is so worth it. And the ice cream is soo good! And they have these really good drinks ! I recommend the Suicide ! Its so good! And costa cola and i Purple dragon is good too. (: they sell chips for 75 cents and they many other food too! Abd right beside it is eggettes. :D my fvorite ice cream is the oreo cookie and jasmine tea. Anywayss tey have lots of varieties of cool food ;D
author: N S.

description:
Polly Ann's is my childhood. I've been coming to this local a few blocks away ice cream shop since I was in pre-school when they were a small, hole in the wall little store. I remember it used to be packed, even if it was freezing outside. The infamous wheel had my little brother eat Durian Ice Cream for the first time! 

I can never go wrong with any flavor at Polly Anns. My personal favorite is the chocolate mango but its rare they have it. The strawberry mango will do instead. I've tried their 'snacks', they're OK for a kid coming by after school. Definitely try any of the flavors here or even give the wheel a spin! 

Glad Polly Ann's will be here to stay!
author: Leah F.

description: Jasmine tea & Black sesame so good.
author: Frederick A.

description: Yummy! I had the jasmine green tea. It was very good. I like how it tasted like the real tea.
author: Michelle S.

description:
I don't come here too often, but when I do, I must say I always have to "spin the wheel". Unlike you're typical ice cream shop, this one has a large numbered wheel where customers can spin to hopefully land on a "Free" spot for ice cream.. Otherwise they must choose from 3-4 numbers from where the wheel spoke lands.   It's definitely for the "risk-taker" as you must order from one of the numbers. 

In general,  they have over 40+ flavors and some flavor change seasonally. They have everything from Chocolate to Macapuno to Strawberry Oreo Cookie (that's seasonal). 

I would definitely recommend coming here and trying your luck at the wheel if you're ever in the Sunset!
author: Phillip D.

description: Bummed a little, I wanted to love it but I just didn't.
author: Sarah S.

description:
Can't help but give this place a 5. 

I've been coming here since I could remember. I remember coming here, when it was literally a hole in the wall, where only a couple people could be squished inside and I was too short to see over the counter. I was sad when it was closed but I'm happy it's open once again. Just being here brings always brings back memories of coming here after school every Friday and getting ice cream or fries with friends. 

I like their lychee and red bean but I absolutely love love their taro. Best taro I've ever had. Everytime I come here, I try to get a sample of something I've never tried but I always end up with at least half a scoop of taro.
author: Katie M.

description: One of my favorite childhood ice cream place to go to. They renovated, but still have the delicious green tea ice cream that I will forever love from here. It's much darker and flavorful than any other green tea I've tried. They also have a huge selection of flavors, my runner up would be Taro but some of the other options they offer have interesting names like "Star Wars" which isn't bad at all either. The fun part is getting to spin the wheel when you can't decide, and if you're lucky enough you'll land on the FREE :D Definitely come here if you're in the sunset neighborhood. Also, Eggettes is right next door :)
author: Amanda C.

description:
I'm sorry but I HAVE to give Polly Ann a really bad rating... especially since I was misled by the seemingly awesome 4 star reviews to try out the supposedly heavenly ice cream... -.-

If you are someone who appreciates natural flavors, DON'T TRY Polly Ann!!!!

I tried dark sesame, and at first taste, it was great!!! But just after a few more bites, I tasted NOTHING but CREAM :|

My boyfriend's durian ice-cream.. was disappointing. Strong pungent flavor, but tasted nothing like the real fruit, if you have tried it before, you probably know what I mean.

AND GREEN TEA?! gosh, it taste like cheap candy I get from lousy chinese restaurants.... strong jasmine-like taste, and nothing like the japanese matcha fragrance. 

My boyfriend's sister-in-law had Lychee, and sadly it was so creamy, unlike what fruit flavored ice creams are supposed to be like!!!!

I'm sad to say, none of the recommended flavors taste good at all..... everything had this artificial flavoring aftertaste :(:(:( Go grab yourself a tub from supermarkets and you can do better with that $3+ 

There isn't many seats available so you probably will get take-out. One minor good point was that there's free parking along the street.. and the adorable spin the wheel!
author: Ka L.

description: This is my favorite ice cream place. My favorite flavors are definitely the mango, lychee and honeydew. The ice cream is super delicious and always keeps me coming back. This is one of those places that I would drive hours for, but luckily it's a 3 minute drive from my house.
author: Emily G.

description:
After having a huge bowl of ramen, we went on a search for some dessert.  Having lived in the Sunset for most of my life I decided to give my childhood dessert spot another chance since the remodel.

After tasting a few flavors I settled on a scoop of the pistachio almond in a small cup.  My BF got a scoop of the taro and a scoop of the butterscotch twist.  I didn't do well in choosing my flavor.  I normally don't like little chunks of stuff in my ice cream.  I guess I'm more of a gelato kind of girl?  I've had much better pistachio ice cream before.  The taro flavor was also lacking and the butterscotch twist tasted like vanilla ice cream.  The temperature of their ice cooler must have been off too because there were little chunks of ice in several of our bites.

It's too bad I didn't enjoy my dessert.  Oh well, off the eggettes next door!
author: Rosalind S.

description:
Many flavors are too sweet (certainly ones with syrup).  Guy working there with a baseball hat has the personality of a tree trunk,  with two little kids excited to pick their ice cream and after two tastes (they have 48 flavors) he goes, "only one more taste then that's it, you have to make your decision."  

We were the only folks in line.   I've been coming here since I was a baby, but the new attitude it isn't worth the hassle.
author: Mike P.

description: Good to see this long time business still going strong. The Turkish coffee ice cream is to die for, yes it is that good!
author: Martha M.

description:
I like this place a lot. It's so close to the house, I can walk home with a cone before the first drop of melting goodness flops down on my hand.

I do have one complaint though. How come they never have good old chocolate ice cream in tubs to go? What the hell! I don't eat Durian flavored ice cream. I don't eat Sushi flavored ice cream. 

I wish someone would listen and stock good old fashioned chocolate ice cream in containers.
author: Wayne B.

description:
I LOVE GREEN TEA ICE CREAM!! :D

For me, Lychee did not live up to the hype.
author: Chris C.

description:
Contemporary, traditional and tropical flavors in a family establishment near Ocean beach.

Mind your step when the middle schoolers are out of class trying to buy squeeze-its and hot cheetoes!

Also, spin the wheel of ice cream if you can't make an executive decision or you want to take a chance :)
author: Solitaire M.

description: Dont forget to check the app for a check in discount/coupon. Giving away a free scoop with a purchase of a scoop. Don't miss out.
author: Craig I.

description: I've been going to Polly Ann's since it was a hole in the wall next to a laundromat that was where it is today. The ice cream is great and they have so many amazing flavors. I always spin the wheel as it forces me to try new flavors, I've landed on "Free" quite a few times as well. This is my favorite ice cream place in SF, I highly recommend it.
author: Chris M.

description:
Unpretentious neighborhood ice cream joint with some Asian flavors.

For my time and money, I'd happily go here over Bi-rite with its insane lines and overrated ice cream. I'm a fan of Polly Ann's taro ice cream (with real taro pieces) and jasmine green tea ice cream - think green tea ice cream with a more floral/refreshing taste!
author: Steve L.

description:
Big portion ice cream& lots of variety. I think everyone will find something they will like. Don't forget to ask for samples 
My personal favorites are black sesame, banana Oreo, mango and Thai tea.
author: J W.

description: I made it to the flagship of this sought-after brand which you can find screaming at you from the frozen section of many local Asian markets. Taro, red bean, and black sesame are my faves but after this visit, I was pleasantly surprised to discover that their "non-Asian" flavors are also amazing. Try the hazelnut coffee and peanut butter oreo. Better yet, do what I did and combine those two together in a waffle cone. Heaven in a cone. I love ice cream and I love Polly Ann!
author: Allison M.

description:
Polly Ann's does have great Ice Cream and Ive been coming here since I was a kid so almost 30 years. Only thing is I miss the little hole in the wall spot it use to be I use to love going up on the three steps by the front door to see over the counter as a kid and the mom and pop vibe it had back then. 
O well times change :(

I do still love the JC sundaes......
author: Michael W.

description: Who else has taro, lychee, or durian ice cream?!?! (seriously, who else? if you know msg me). All I gotta say is F* YEAH!!
author: Tri V.

description:
Even though we were all stuffed from dinner & then Eggettes (read my review), we just couldn't resist going into this busy ice cream parlor.

The boyfriend got a scoop of Bubblegum which had really good flavor but not a lot of actual gum pieces.  I got a scoop of Red Bean which was too sweet.  The good thing about it was that it was made with real red beans; but not enough to make it red, just grayish pink.

Op top of our scoops, we also brought home a tub of Mint Chip.  We were really excited to see actually chocolate chips but were disappointed to find that they only existed on the surface.  Also, as we progressed through the tub, we found that there was a really strong milk flavor & not enough mint.

In addition to their ice creams tasting only mediocre, we also discovered one of the store's "cheap tricks."  If you order a cone - like our friend did - the workers don't pack the ice cream in so you're left with an empty tasteless cone.
author: Karen S.

description:
For those SF Indian Summers, come get your ice cream treat here!

FOOD: There are about 48 unique different flavors!  Not just your typical chocolate and vanilla, but infused flavors such as coffee and almond OR flavors you wouldn't think ice cream such as Lychee Ice cream or Jasmine Tea. 

SERVICE: The girl who helped us was pretty nice. She explained the rules of the wheel very well. This wheel is interesting...if you can't decide amongst the flavors, then they choose for you by spinning this wheel! Unfortunately, my friend landed on the flavor with nuts and he's allergic...the girl should have let him re-spun, but instead made him pass it off to a friend. Luckily, I enjoyed this random choice of flavor which was this coffee almond ice cream. 

PRICE: Min on a credit card is $2. The prices are fairly reasonable for an ice cream store especially for the portions they give you.  

OVERALL: I give this place a 5/5! Try it out at least if you're not a cookie cutter type ice cream person.
author: Isabel N.

description:
SPIN THE WHEEL!
Pleeease!

i liek Bumpy Road and Coconut!
But then you can always go get a JC too! 

You to hang here every day when I went to Giannini! 

They have since update the decor and the place is bigger now. But the flavors are still weird and cool!
author: Erika G.

description: Very cute spot. I'd come back more if I lived in the neighborhood. The wheel is great and all their flavors are uniquely named! They also sell candy and snacks.
author: M. R.

description:
Fix the damned Frosty machine. Eight times out of ten I walk in there, the damned thing's broken.

Updated to 5 stars. Looks like they finally fixed the Frosty machine. Yay!
author: Evelyn C.

description:
I am very sad to leave SF because of you Polly-Ann ICE CREAM x(

They have wide variety of flavors and they are crazy good!
Literally the flavors are all crazy,,,like Rose flavor, Jasmine Greentea, Che (three colored bean dessert), Thai Ice tea flavor...etc

If you live in SF and if you have Asian taste-buds, you will LOVE this place.
author: Rio S.

description:
It's a bit out in the middle of nowhere, but that actually works in its benefit sometime. Much less trouble finding parking, and it doesnt get too crowded. Never a long line, usually just 1-2 persons in front of me. 

I was leaning towards a 3.5 stars for the ice cream, but what bumped it up to a 4 and not a 3 star was because of the many many different flavors available - and some of them are fairly unique and interesting. A lot of Asian-esque flavors. The flavors of the ice cream do not lie - they tend to be fairly strong and taste strongly of whatever flavor they are.The texture was good too, but not SUPER amazing. Creamy and fairly smooth. 

They don't have any obnoxious signs about limiting the number of samples to have, which I really like. If you're not a douche, you're not gonna take THAT many samples, but sometimes, you just want more than just two! I'm looking at you, Holy Gelato. And with the sheer number of flavors they have available here, it's nice to try multiple flavors  before settling on one. 

Of the flavors I tried, I really liked their mango, green tea and jasmine tea. The banana oreo was super good too! I was hesitant about it, but that's what the tasting is for. The two flavors blended really well together actually. 

One more unique cool thing about this place is they have this wheel-of-fortune-esque game where you can spin a wheel. If it lands on the free space, you get a free ice cream! If not, you have the choices of choosing between one of three flavors; whichever flavor the wheel lands on and the ones next to them. I have yet to be gutsy enough to try this - I like the choice of CHOOSING my flavor of ice cream. Because ice cream is serious business, yo.
author: Lena Y.

description:
This place is kind of amusing. If you can't decide what flavor ice cream to get (which wouldn't be surprising because they are a plethora of choices on the menu), you can spin the wheel. It's like a really relaxed version of Russian roulette, on the one side, you have to get the flavor you land on, but on the plus side, if you land on "free" you can get a free ice-cream cone!

Now here's the funny bit, my pointer landed right in the middle of "free" and another flavor. So the server gave me a cone for half-price (although my friends and I would have argued that it was leaning slightly towards the free slot). But then again the store owner can do whatever she wants so...haha

Anyway, anecdote aside, I got the red bean flavor ice-cream, which is something I absolutely love because it's not too sweet but has a really satisfying texture to it. The decor is kinda neat too, there are joke signs everywhere (most of them about ice cream, but some are really amusing to read).
author: Samuel H.

description:
I don't think there is anywhere I wouldn't go for Black Sesame Ice Cream. I knew Polly Ann's had it so I visited on a Saturday night at around 8:30. 

There was only one group in line in front of me but it literally took forever. There was one girl doing everything and one lurking in the back doing god knows what. Whatever happened to "The customer comes first?" I might have made up that saying, but you know what I mean. 

Anyway, I got the Black Sesame Ice Cream and it was perfection. So so so good. Not too sweet and tasted freezer burn free.  

The place itself has two round tables for hanging out but seating is very limited so you may need to take your treat to go. Also, the door was open and it was freezing. I don't really get why they did that. 

Parking was on the street but plentiful.  

Would like to try some of the other ice cream institutions in SF but would definitely come back for the BS fix.
author: Carmen K.

description: Cute little shop. Unfortunately, (maybe fortunately for some) the smell of durian lingered in the air. After perusing the extensive menu for a bit the husband ordered melon and mocha almond fudge. And I hopped on the yelp check in deal and got a free scoop of jasmine tea. The ice cream texture has a nice enough consistency, but it's not as special as the unique flavors they offer like black sesame and lychee. That would be the main reason I'd return. Also, make sure to state what size you want. The single serving should come with an option of 1-2 flavors, which is what we thought we were getting, but the server assumed we wanted the largest size. Whatevs, still saved $ with our free scoop! There are about 4 small tables inside, so not ideal for large groups sit, but the space is big enough that people can stand and hang out for a little bit.
author: Lisa H.

description:
The ice cream made from this place is the same high quality I remember it when I was a young lad.

The variety of exotic flavors are still the same great tasting stuff from then and much more of it. I wish I could say the same for the youngsters who buy stuff from them. But aside from that, the place has ice cream that is out of this world.
author: Jacen W.

description: Who can ever be disappointed after having ice cream?! After a hard day of teaching I came here with my co-teachers and got a scoop to cheer me up. And cheer me up it did, I got the thai tea ice scream in a cone and I have to say that was one of the best ice creams I have ever had besides the notable Mitchell's in the mission. I was pleasantly surprised by the amount of flavors and how affordable it was. It actually I believe was cheaper than Mitchell's but they didn't skimp on the amount. Definitely need to check it out!
author: Desiree C.

description: Matcha green tea ice cream - YUM! and no lines, unlike the crazy, never-ending Bi-Rite lines!
author: Mary J.

description:
I like sesame black ice cream.
I like the wheel you can spin.
And I like the selection.
Service is also good.

However, my party and I pointed out a multitude of inconsistencies in the signs that sit on their walls. Cash only? Yet they accept credit cards? Bathroom doesn't work? But it does? Curious. Needless to say, they did not at all depreciate the quality of their ice cream.

Still, Polly Ann doesn't serve the best out there. I'm talking about Tucker's in Alameda and Double Rainbow in SF. Yum!
author: Sarah W.

description: I've literally been coming here for almost 20 years and almost always order the same thing- green tea ice cream!! They have a lot of unique Asian inspired flavors as well as more traditional ones.
author: Mel M.

description: The ice cream was awesome. They had a ton of flavors and I spent a long time sampling and trying to figure out what I wanted. The man was super nice and patient with me. I ended up getting coconut and salted caramel in a waffle cone. They even gave my puppies a piece of waffle cone with ice cream on it. Super kind and friendly!
author: Megan M.

description:
Oh Polly Ann. One of San Francisco's special places. Yay for homegrown ice cream! I love this place because they actually make pretty unique flavors (there are close to fifty different unique flavors) that you would never see anywhere else. It is somewhat far away from stuff... but trust me... totally worth making the trip there! (Or if you're lazy, they sell their stuff in Asian grocery stores too... just not as extensive selection).

The green tea ice cream has a very strong flavor that I like... same with the coffee too. They have a giant wheel you can spin in the center of the store... if you're lucky, you'll get a free ice cream... whatever you want! The only catch is if you don't land on a free square, you have to take whatever flavor (number) the wheel lands on. On the bright side, if you're terrible at making decisions... the wheel is for you! Someday... maybe someday... I'll try every flavor they have.

Ice cream here is your typical, slightly more expensive like in any other "boutique" ice creamery, but it's definitely worth it. Plus I don't mind supporting my local businesses when they're that freaking good :D The store is super small (basically a counter... maybe a couple chairs and that's it), but it's super fun to read all the random stuff they have posted up on their walls while you get our ice cream. One of my favorites is the "I only eat ice cream on days that end in Y." Look for it by the door.

Side note: Polly Ann gives free ice cream to dogs?! I went there there with my dog once, and they give you this tiny cone with a little bit of ice cream in it for the dog. Even my dog loves Polly Ann. He ate it so quick I was pretty sure he was going to choke (or get a mini doggie brain freeze). My only complaint is that the scoops are inconsistent, for what you get :/ Depends on who's serving you, but some of their guys definitely give you less...
author: Denise C.

description: I've been coming here ever since I was a little girl and it's still good! I often crave ice cream and find myself driving to Polly Ann's. The location is great and there's usually parking nearby. The workers are very nice and patient (especially the tall dude) since I'm always indecisive with what flavor I want. I used to get pralines and cream all the time but I'm starting to like pistachio more now!
author: Cheryl P.

description:
The selection of unique flavors makes Polly Ann's one of my favorite places to get ice-cream in the city. If you're into Asian flavors, the selection here is sure to satisfy. There's so many to choose from! They have all the classics along with flavors such as taro, rose, mango, green tea, jasmine tea, red bean, lychee, and even durian. I'm not brave enough to try durian but their other flavors have never disappointed me. My favorites are the taro, green tea, and jasmine. 

Their scoops are very generous and affordably priced. I like to get mine in a waffle cone. The ice-cream here is deliciously creamy and the flavors taste exactly like their description. If you want some good ice-cream and you don't want to go crazy circling around for parking in the Mission where the -other- ice-creameries are, check out Polly Ann's. There's angled parking on the main street and plentiful street parking on the side streets in the residential area.
author: Nancy C.

description: very nice service. they said not even the locals realize this place is here. it's low key, but relaxed. apparently they specialize in Asian flavors like lychee and jasmine tea; they said the most popular is caramel salt lick and jasmine tea. plenty of parking nearby. there is a boba tea place right around the corner.
author: Jeff K.

description:
No one else has a cool spinning wheel of ice cream death!

One time we spun it and one of the choices was durian and lemon ... ewww! He chose the lemon lol...

Other than that I come here for the Taro and Green tea ice cream because they are bomb! I love this place for the fact they have exotic and untypical flavors with a great fun atmosphere! 

Great for kids!
author: Misty M.

description: Love their ice cream!!! Durian..sesame ....all flavors were delicious !!!
author: Buyi Y.

description: It was just ok. Not blown away whatsoever by the ice cream. Will not return.
author: Amy P.

description:
[M]ona: 3.5 Stars
[W]ayne: 4 Stars
Average: 3.75 Stars

+ Good variety of flavors
+ Try spinning the wheel if you can't decide on a flavor 
+ Serves by the bucket if you want to take some home

- Didn't get my free ice cream after wheel landed on "FREE". 

[W] I like this place because they're an independent local ice creamery. They make a lot of unique flavors such as Durian. You really have to go there and experience it yourself. And of course, spin that wheel if you're undecided. 

The flavors that I always like are any of the coffee flavored ice cream and mint chocolate chip! My GF on the other hand loves all the fruity flavors and the weird ones as well such as DURIAN.

The only bad thing is that they have a 10-15 minimum charge if you want to use a card to pay. I don't know anyone who can really eat that much ice cream by themselves unless you buy their buckets of ice cream.

[M] If the wheel ever lands on "FREE", be sure to remind them. They will "forget" and charge you sometimes. @~@
author: Mona C.

description: Coconut for days. Two scoops or blended as a milk shake, every time I have their ice cream I am brought back to my childhood, eating fresh coconut in Hawaii. The creamy goodness makes me leave with a scoop, and a pint during my weekly or bi-weekly visits. I can't wait to come back again!
author: Andy C.

description: My favorites are Lychee, Rose, Durian, Black Sesame, Red Bean, and Green Tea.  Typical flavors not sold in Safeway, Lucky's, etc   My only complaint about this place is the slow service...Can you imagine a line for ice cream on cold foggy days in the Sunset?  I need you to Scoop faster!  I am double parked with kids in the car!
author: S F.

description:
Is the new bigger, brighter and clean location an improvement?  Not to us.  It lost its charm and the mom and pop feel.  Even the spin wheel is too put together. 

We came here as part of our search for black sesame ice-cream.  They have one but it was probably the worst we have tried. 

We truly miss the old Polly Ann.
author: Gloria H.

description:
Me: Green Tea Ice Cream
BF: Taro Ice Cream 
Together = happy happy

The ice cream is creamy and very flavorful.  It def. beats Dreyers, Baskin Robbins, and Cold Stone.  Not super rich and fresh tasting.  I have yet to try the "wheel" game where it randomly chooses your flavor or gets you a free serving...cause I can't get enough of the green tea...and cause I'm scared T__T... AH!  ANND they have classic snacks and candies on the side that I can't help but stare at...(taffy, chips, corn nuts, chocolates, blow pops, etc...)

I also like how Luckys and other grocery stores in SF (including Kukje supermarket!) sells Polly Ann Ice Cream, too.  :)  

Note to self: Never eat a pint of ice cream on an empty stomach early in the morning...it's the yaksville...
author: Kat C.

description:
Dog friendly - 5 stars!!
Ice cream- 2 stars

My coffee rocky road had freezer burn.  My hubby's ice cream had big chunks of ice. My poodle's cone was perfect.

We come here only so our dog can get a free "doggy cone". They take the end of the broken sugar cones and make a little tiny cone of soft serve ice cream for the pooches. Adorable. 

As another review said - the ice cream you can buy at Safeway is better and usually without the freezer burn. 

Parking is easy.
author: Kim W.

description:
Really great ice cream! Creative flavors! Plus open late!

I literally just bought my husband's birthday cake from Polly Anne's and it was a hit!
author: Kayla H.

description: It's has been years since I've had their ice cream! I got the pistachio almond this time around. It was a junior scoop for $2.40. We also got a tub of mango ice cream which brought our total to $9. Would definitely suggest getting the tubs to get more for your money! As for the ice cream, it was bright green and it had a pistachio flavor but no real pistachios in the actual ice cream.
author: Janice A.

description: Terrible service on wednesdays afternoons. Try Tuesday or saturday nights the emplyees are much more attentive
author: Raffy R.

description: Many flavors!. My daughter got the ube, my wife the cantaloupe.  Both sucked down the ice cream in no time so I think they liked it.  I had a salt lick caramel shake to go.  I didn't get to have it til later and I had to refreeze it but despite all of this, it tasted great when I had it later that night.  We usually go to Mitchell's but i would come back here in the future as well.
author: Scott P.

description: Polly Ann is one of my all time favorite ice cream places in the Bay Area. My uncle used to bring me here as a little girl and back then I just loved the ice cream because.. Well it was ice cream. Duh what little kid wouldn't like it. Since moving from the city, I rarely had the time and it wasn't convenient to travel to the city a lot but when I do I come here because the ice cream is just amazing in all aspects. I think Polly Ann is underrated when compared to other ice cream places in SF but if you're in the area, you need to grab yourself a scoop of Polly Ann ASAP because it is so good and so worth every lick.
author: Tiffany T.

description: Best ice cream I ever tasted ! They have so many flavors it's so hard to choose. I like how they let you spin the wheel for a chance to win free ice cream. My favorite flavor is mint chocolate chip.
author: SF K.

description: Who doesn't love Polly Ann's??  I used to come here weekly when I was a kid.  They still have their infamous wheel, although a little updated now since it is in a newer location as well.  If you are feeling daring, you can spin and have it tell you what flavor to get.  They have unique flavors and "asian" flavors too such as Jasmine Tea (one of my faves), Green Tea, Lychee, Durian, Ube/Taro.  I often find their pre packaged ice creams in asian supermarkets on this side of the bridge as well.  I'm rarely around this neighborhood anymore, but when I am, trust that I have to make a stop here!
author: Kymberli C.

description: Best green tea ice cream!!! Must try!!!!! They finally remodeled the place and it looks more like a cute ice cream shop now. Their prices are average I would say. I like how they have spin the wheel to help u choose what flavor u want to get this time if u can't decide.
author: Carmen Y.

description: Oh this place is good, I remember it in the old location way back. Recently was driving by with my kid and thought you know when daddy used to be young I used to go to this ice cream place and here it is, same ice cream new place. Recommend this place to anyone craving for some sweet ice cream. One negative is that the ice cream counter is very high, only an adult can see all the actual flavors and for the kids it is half the fun to see the actual ice cream being scooped out (not a smart design).
author: El J.

description:
A million flavors, some with crazy names, and all delicious!!

Know before you go, but this is a Chinese joint. We had a laugh when we found out, thinking it'd be some cute handmade Ici/Bi-rite type store.

The high schoolers working here are really accommodating and let me try almost a dozen flavors without complaint or rolling of the eyes.

We did go way out of way to come here, but if you're seriously craving ice cream, this is the place.

Seating is really limited!
author: Hana J.

description:
After dinner on Polk St. I wanted ice cream. Okay, lets be serious, when do I *not* want ice cream?! I perused my bookmarks and Polly Ann came up so we took a mini roadtrip to the other side of the city to check it out. There are 48 flavors, most sounded intriguing but I decided on coffee fluff (coffee ice cream + marshmallows). I wanted more marshmallows!! My driver got banana oreo which was also good and banana-y but that fake banana flavor one finds in yellow laffy taffy. I wouldn't take another roadtrip specifically to go here but if I were in the neighborhood (which I never am) I might try another flavor. 
Vicky L. and I agree on most food related things, but Polly Ann is not one of them!
author: Sara P.

description: I've been coming to this place since I've been a kid, even since before the remodel. I've always been happy coming here, but the ice cream in itself isn't the absolute best. They have the most variety of flavors than any other ice cream parlor I've been to. They aren't afraid to make interesting flavors so I recommend this place if you want a variety. The prices are very reasonable as well. Polly Ann's is a great place to get casual ice cream on a whim, but if you're looking for better quality ice cream, I would go somewhere else like Mitchell's or Bi-Rite.
author: Melissa L.

description:
The texture of this ice cream is what I imagine the clouds in heaven tastes like: so smooth it's unreal.

I first stumbled upon Polly Ann by ordering it at an Asian grocery store in the Richmond. It was coconut flavor and it was perfect! Smooth with a hint of coconut flavor. The best ice cream I've ever had.

This time I decided to jog to to actual store. They have a TON of flavors that the Asian groceries did not. They'll even pack a large amount (1.5qt, 2+qt). At an even lesser cost they have a fridge filled with pre-packed ice cream. The fridge doesn't contain all of the flavors, but I was able to get a 1.5qt container of thai tea for $5. The thai tea flavored ice cream was surprisingly lacking flavor, almost flavorless. This won't stop me from eating it.

Another gripe is that it's not natural. It contains corn syrup, calcium sulfate, polysorbate 80, and food coloring. I'm not sure if the one sold at the store is made fresh.

Even though it's not natural, I still love the texture and the taste of the coconut flavor. Until I find a natural alternative, this will be my shop to try all of those wicked flavors.
author: Rahil P.

description: You can't go wrong here. Ice cream is Delish people are nice and it's pretty clean!  Parents and kids love this place!
author: Joanna P.

description: Gotta love the neighborhood ice cream parlor that's been around forever! I can always count on Polly Ann's for an ice cream fix. I love that they have the various random asian ice cream flavors as well. Service is always great.
author: Linda N.

description:
I can remember coming here as a wee youngun to the old location where there was a teeny narrow step by the door that I would climb so I could see the ice cream being scooped!! Oh, the memories!

Ok, done with the reminiscing. Their ice cream and ice cream flavors are the stuff of legend (durian anyone?). They're pretty cool about sampling and explaining flavors and if you need help deciding, the giant wheel can help! My favorites have changed over the years, but with such a great selection, you can take everyone here and they will leave happy campers. 
I am the "ice cream kind of girl" but Polly Ann's is really where I was first introduced to unique flavors!!  Nom nom nom. 


One note though: I had the most amazing English toffee ice cream about 3 years ago and only ordered one scoop which the bf, who said he "only wanted a bite," promptly gobbled up. Haven't seen it in store since. Has anyone one else had this ice cream/ seen it in stores since?! I'm desperate!
author: Rayna L.

description:
I went here awhile back when my bf took me here.  He told me that this was his childhood place to get ice cream & said I must try it.  Deelish!  The only con to this place is that it doesn't help my indecisiveness with picking a flavor.  Can't wait to return this summer.

I think it's safe to say that the pineapple ice cream is even better than the pineapple gelato that I liked so much at the buffet at the Wynn.  'Nuff said!
author: Cat C.

description: What can I say about this wonderful place? I love that they have a colorful wheel of selections and cool names to their ice creams. The staff is friendly and you can always try samples. I usually get their jasmine green tea! They also sell snacks inside, and there's chairs to sit down inside if you choose to eat in. Sometimes there is a long line, and sometimes there's no one at all. It all depends. It's pretty random. But I have noticed on a weekend it's def busy.
author: Jade D.

description:
LOVE all the selections - you can always come here to try a new flavor!
We've only tried: coffee, mango, black sesame, pistachio, durian, red bean, green tea. 
DO NOT get the pistachio - it tasted kind of funny. 
Of course all those flavors come with a price - a pretty pricey one! 
CONs - there are very limited seats.
author: MissJ J.

description:
Durian?!  Why, oh, why?!

Of the 500 or so flavors that Polly Ann offers, my wife had to choose one that tops the list of all things stinky.  Being the simple man that I am, I went with vanilla naturally.

From the exotic (durian, zucchini, rose) to the mundane (vanilla, strawberry, chocolate), the wholesome ice creams at this tidy mom-and-pop establishment are rich, creamy, and just plain tasty.

Feeling overwhelmed by the profusion of flavors?  Spin the carnival wheel, and let lady fortune decide.  Who knows?  You just might get a freebie.

Oh, by the way, every dog gets a free doggy cone.  Kudos to Polly Ann for obliging man's best friend!
author: Subrosa I.

description:
FUCKING. AWESOME. ICE CREAM.

'Nuff Said
author: Cody A.

description: First timer tonight and the red bean ice cream was exceptional. Unique flavor and so tasty!
author: Jenny W.

description: Never been, but friendly staff and great ice cream!
author: Kevin S.

description: This place is awesome. I prefer it over Bi-Rite, but maybe because I used to live right down the street. If you are ever in the area, it's worth it. Very creamy and rich taste to all flavors.
author: Kimberly A.

description:
Doggy Cones really make this place great.
Flavor wheel too.
Great selection of exotic flavors ex-durian

Only downside, it is a bit more expensive than other ice cream places.
author: Chelsey G.

description:
The flavors here are so abundant it is always so hard to choose what flavor I want!

If you have as much trouble as I do, you can spin the big wheel. There are even spaces on there for a free scoop of ice cream! Also don't be afraid to spin the wheel because they will usually let you pick from the ice cream flavor you landed on and the ones on either side of it too.

Some of the prepackaged ice cream that I love the most are mango and green tea. Normal flavors but mightily scrump-diddily-umptuous.

If it is cold outside, like on a typical San Francisco day, you can still enjoy your freezing treat inside the store, reading all the funny quotes and articles on the wall.
author: Wilson T.

description: Strawberry and oreo-why didn't I think of that flavor before!!! Clean place, but the snacks on the left side of the store is random. The pistachio almond and the strawberry oreo are the only flavors I've tried thus far, and I was definitely pleased. Can't wait to go back to try the other flavors.
author: Justina L.

description:
Apparently they have the best green tea ice cream, but did I order it?  Of course not.  I wanted to do something different.  I ordered the taro and jasmine tea.  The jasmine tea was good but you really have to concentrate to convince yourself you're eating taro, as it was mostly sweet with some taro bits.  I guess I'd have to try their green tea to be absolutely fair, but if I want tea and taro flavored ice cream again, I'd hit up Bombay Ice Cream and Mitchell's, respectively.  The flavor wheel is creative though, I'll give them that.

My friend who always gets green tea from here ordered the lemon cheesecake this time.  She said she couldn't taste the cheesecake, and the lemon "tasted like the goo in lemon pies."  Sounds like she's going to stick with green tea.
author: Jenn C.

description:
I like the wheel because I cant decide on flavors. I got a free scoop before and that was my first time spinning, although it did not help me on deciding what flavor i wanted. It was some yummy free ice cream.

Green tea, strawberry cheesecake, mint ice cream with oreo, etc. Just try samples till you like one. 
Their cone is not good. I wanted sugar cone but they didnt have any and i didnt want to pay extra for waffle. The one i was stuck with tasted like plastic. 

i like the signs on the walls.
author: Erica L.

description: Quick service and I loved spinning the wheel! Never would have tried Choco Berry otherwise. Awesome!
author: Alex M.

description:
Go here when you are in the Outer Sunset and in need of some frozen dessert!  The seven days out of the year it is actually HOT in this neighborhood, it is absolute heaven to stop by here, and then walk to Ocean Beach as you race against gravity and the Sun to make sure the asphalt, or the San Franciscan ants, get NONE of the hard-earned ice cream sitting precariously atop your sugar cone.  

My personal go-to's are green tea, oreo mint, strawberry cheesecake and taro.  On my recent visit here, it has been discovered that the strawberry buttermilk flavor and tequila Mexican hot chocolate are very delicious and very true to their names.  And they don't card!
author: Jaclyn L.

description:
We checked out the lady's old hood this past Sunday (hot, hot, hot!) and she took me to her favorite spot - Polly Ann's. I'd been there before with another Sunset local but it was at the end of a long night. One thing I remember was this Anglo dude ordering durian ice cream! DURIAN! Uggh...I'd rather lick my own dirty feet after a 10-mile hike before trying that stuff.

Anyway, all the flavors I tried are great - especially the rum-raisin that the lady had. I wasn't particularly overwhelmed but it was still good. You've got to give it to these local mom & pop joints though!
author: Art O.

description: The best ice cream in San Francisco!  You can chose from many traditional flavors, but you can always order something new and exciting for your palate.  Just don't visit the place between 3:30-4:30 because all the kids from AP GIannini hang out over there!
author: Ingrid B.

description: If you like the lighter ice cream with an Asian touch, then this is it. Most of the flavors are normal, but they have the few that are more special like Durian or red bean, etc. They have that fun spinning wheel. I give it a spin a couple of times. Being a person that's not afraid of the Durian smell, it wasn't so frightening. But if you are afraid of that, then don't do it. Parking isn't all that bad around there. On a nicer day in Sunset, you should definitely take a walk there.
author: Julie V.

description: This place always has a customer in line.  Well, thats how it seems.  The ice cream is good.  And they also give away free ice cream.  But you have to bring your best friend with you.  And your best friend has to qualify.  My best friend always gets a free cone.  Enough said!
author: Miguel C.

description: Been coming here since I was in middle school! I am glad they're still open because I can just go down the block and get some good ice cream. The wheel helps me decide when I'm indecisive!
author: Teresa C.

description:
Green Tea Ice Cream tasted like Honey Dew Ice cream. I should of inquired but didn't -- I still need my "fix".

$2.40 for a junior cone.
author: Jboogie L.

description:
3 1/2?  It wasn't the best ice cream I've ever had, but it's also not the worse either.  It was definitely tasty and smooth.  I ordered the dutch chocolate and i felt like it could have been a tad sweeter, but maybe I should have ordered the heavy chocolate?  I'm not sure...it was just a little off for me.  The boyfriend seemed to enjoy his cherry vanilla (which I got a taste and it was pretty good).

It's one of those places that I wouldn't be opposed to going but I would seek it out either.
author: Quynh-An P.

description:
I've been a loyal, scratch that -- my sisters and mother are super loyal patrons of Polly Anns Ice cream for over 20 years. We have grown with the parlor ever since it was a small "hallway"  in the wall. 
What's good here? I'll give you the inside scoop.

Can't decide!? Let the wheel decide your fate! It's fun and a great feeling of excitement !!

Pretty much everything is good! There's a reason they have been operating for so long!!! Restaurants serve their ice creams!!!

Tip#1 Green Tea ice cream. It's delicious whether it's a sunny warm day or a freezing thunderstorm outside. 

Tip#2 Soft serve. It's inexpensive and is a great substitute for ice cream. Word on the street, milk used in soft serve isn't that fresh and hence the yummy yogurt flavor. Since then, I've always spring the extra dollar for ice cream.



Tip#3 Suicide soda- a special mixture of different sodas to create a very unique and refreshing beverage. Polly Ann special
author: Sue T.

description:
Couldn't decide if I wanted to give this place 3 or 4 stars, but decided to go with 4, just on the premise of their flavor selection. The ice cream is decent, but there isn't a whole lot that's special about it.

Previously being into the shop, a co-worker bought pints, which I got to try. The ice cream texture was so fluffy and I immediately fell in love. However, at the ice cream shop itself, this is not the case.

Also, beware of spinning the wheel, unless you go into it with an open mind. They have some really interesting flavors to say the least..
author: Derrick W.

description:
There are soooo many flavors to choose from! Good thing they have a wheel for the indecisive. I decided to spin it because YOLO. The rules are you have to buy the flavor that you land on, or the flavors surrounding it. Got the mango and it was pretty good. Not life changing or anything, but still pretty darn good. 

Little shop in the residential area of sf. I like! 
3.5/5
author: Mindy C.

description:
I'm an ice cream lover, i loooove ice cream like no other LOL. My friend went to Eggettes and i've never been to Polly Ann's and heard good things about it so i decided to go in! I had noo idea what to get and saw the wheel. I love trying new flavors so mind as welll, so i spun it! Rules are whichever number you land on, you get the choice of either that number and the two next to it. Also if you land on free, your ice cream is free :D 

It had the Bumpy Freeway (Rocky Road), Rainbow sorbet and root beer for my choices. I don't like sorbets very much and i'm not a big chocolate fan, so i settled with root beer! sounded interesting :D It was alright, definitely tasted like root beer for sure! like a root beer float all in one ice cream LOL. 

The service was alright, the wheel was fun! ice cream was pretty decent, but i like my ice cream cold and hard haha for personal preference. it seemed like a soft serve and i didn't really like that.. but definitely will come back for other flavors ^__^ not bad for a first impression!
author: Bernice F.

description: Took the kids and really enjoyed the ice cream, plus there is a yelp coupon there now.
author: Rudy H.

description: The peanut butter oreo is amazing.  Over a week later and I'm still thinking about it.  I mean, seriously ridiculous.  I loved the black sesame ice cream, too, and it's not all that easy to find really tasty black sesame ice cream, as you no doubt already know if you are a fan of it.
author: Maisie G.

description:
On the hunt for taro ice cream. Taro is not ube! This was a harder task than expected. 

Luckily, Polly Ann supplies it regularly! The small tubs were on sale too. Didn't go for the wheel spin... I don't like to be surprised with food choices. 

I liked the flavor but it was a bit sweet and a bit too soft. Delise does a similar version (when ube isn't in season). I didn't really like Mitchell's ube ice cream (no taro...I'll take what I get). Bombay didn't have it when I went. The surprising winner is Double Rainbow at Chinatown's Sweetheart Cafe, which serves up taro pretty regularly.
author: Erika C.

description:
If you have a craving for creamy, fluffy, and deliciously tasting ice cream, go to Polly Ann's. 

They have a wide variety of flavors, my favorite being Taro, Jasmine Tea, and Coconut. If you can't decide, spin the wheel of flavors! The shop is small and cute, but not many nice places to sit and enjoy the ice cream. I look forward to trying all the flavors on the menu, there are so many! Definitely a great place to satisfy an ice cream craving.
author: Megan K.

description:
I am a fan of their vanilla-chocolate swirl soft-serve ice cream and their lychee ice cream! I also adore the taro, green tea, and mango flavors. As you can tell, I prefer the simple flavors. For the more adventurous, try the jasmine green tea flavor. It is kind of quirky but the tea flavor is prominent. Other notable flavors are durian (haven't tried this yet), black sesame, and thai tea.

This ice cream joint will please all palates. You might even find yourself buying a tub of ice cream to-go!
author: Annie S.

description:
Polly Ann has a lot of flavors, like 50?, I forget, but if you can't choose for yourself they have a giant wheel they can spin which will determine which flavor you get! (You have to get what you land on!) Plus there's a possibility the wheel lands on FREE ice cream. 

Some of the cool flavors I remember: Star Wars, Old San Francisco, Banana, butterscotch twist, watermelon, coconut, oreo cookie etc...I went classic with Chocolate Chip in a waffle cone. 

Definitely coming back to try more flavors.
author: Arnold N.

description:
Not as good as Mitchell's...but good enough for me 

You won't find the long lines here like Mitchell's unless if it's after school 

Located in the Sunset District, just a few blocks from the sea 

Memories of days gone by, but this place is still just as cool 

Lots and lots of special flavors...and you gotta try the Green Tea 

Mix and match them all you want; Man, I'm starting to drool 

Sugar n Spice n everything nice is the feeling you get here, see 

But don't you take my word for it for I am just a fool
author: John G.

description:
Plenty of flavors
Overwhelming if it's your first time
Lychee, honeydew, jasmine tea, green tea, sesame
Liked the black sesame the most
Yay! I finally made up my mind...

And got a small scoop of SESAME ($2.75)
Not super WOWed by this place
Nowhere near anything... =\

I wasn't impressed with the texture and the tastes of the ice creams that I had tried. It was quite pricey too for such a small scoop. o.O They give you such a tiny sample you can barely taste the flavor. I actually didn't like the taste of the lychee, green tea or jasmine tea. :P blehhh. But the sesame was pretty accurate.

I don't think I'd go out of my way to come here again... definitely not another 40 min bus ride. =\ But to Bi-Rite, definitely any day!!!!

Bring a jacket or sweater... they're by the ocean... it's FREEZING!

Go green take: 71 Muni (about 40 mins ride from downtown SF) and stop at 38th & Noriega.
author: CeCe C.

description:
Used to live on 44th near Polly Ann's Ice Cream on Noriega.  Noriega is a strangely fascinating street.  I often visited the Korean market a few doors down from Polly Ann's to get sushi handrolls and seaweed salad.  

Polly Ann's truck was always parked near where I lived on 44th Ave, so it always felt quite cozy to imagine that the owners were sharing the same neighborhood.  

My favorite over the long run was the purple taro ice cream.  They had a good business selling the green tea ice cream to many restaurants around the city.  I recall that they had one freezer dedicated exclusively to durian ice cream.  The smell is so potent and penetrating that it will probably "enhance" the flavor of any other ice cream that is stored with it. 

I've since given up ice cream as my digestive system is not strong enough to endure cold dairy products.  But the sweet memory of the establishment is still with me.  I love family businesses, and Polly Ann is really a great traditional establishment ... an only in San Francisco sort of place.  

So 5 stars and right up there with the Golden Gate Bridge as something whose mere existence has a positive effect on me.
author: Em S.

description:
One of my favorite ice cream parlors! There's over 30 flavors to choose from. My favorites are Old SF, Bumpy Road, & Pineapple Coconut. But when I'm indecisive, I spin the wheel! 

There's always parking in front or on the side. Plus, there's no long line like Mitchell's (Sorry...I just hate long lines.) 

Btw...they sell to-go ice cream tubs and ice cream cakes!
author: Diane C.

description: Can you go to Mitchell's instead? :/ Sorry Polly Ann!
author: Krystle I.

description: The ice cream picker wheel thingy is fixed and the fun has resumed! thankfully, i've never ended up on the durian ice cream... no offense intended for those lovers of durian out there - i'm just not a fan. but, according to our mint enthusiast friend (michelle), if you are a fan if mint flavors, this is the place to go... so many different mint options. even the star wars ice cream seems to have mint in it. just a great place to go for some ice cream, even on a cold san francisco summer night.
author: Abe L.

description: Craving their Jasmine Tea Ice Cream so drove all the way to sunset to get my scoop of delicious goodness!  While I was waiting for my Jasmine Tea and Red Bean to be scooped I found out I get a free scoop for checking in!  The guy helping me was nice enough to put my free scoop of Black Walnut in a cup. Thank you!!!!!! My bf enjoyed his free scoop since he usually can't find his favorite black walnut ice cream in a lot of ice cream parlors.  5/5 for excellent service.  5/5 for great tasting hard to find flavors!!!!
author: Betty L.

description:
Been coming here back when they were at their old location; old location being in the middle of Noriega instead of at the corner. 

Their old location made it seem more like a family ice cream shop, unlike now. The place seems franchised out and just hired some people to work there.
author: M C.

description:
I've been coming here as a little girl when their store was tiny with the huge counter in the front. My brother and I would always jump up and down to see over the counter. They remodeled a few years ago and the place is much larger now. 

They've kept the cute names like "bumpy freeway" for rocky road and the blue Star Wars ice cream. The classic wheel is still there where patrons take a whirl for a free cone. Beware though! You have to choose the flavor you land on or the flavors directly next to it.

They serve ice cream cakes and now they even have a bathroom inside! The packaged ice cream is the best in my opinion and there's a discount on Tuesdays. I think the packaged ice cream is a dollar off. 

Try to avoid coming here around 3-5pm on weekday afternoons. It's full of middle schoolers from AP Giannini so the line is sooooo long. 

Enjoy a cone on a foggy night while reading the cute signs around the store! This is a must try!
author: Vikki K.

description: Ice cream was good. Customer service was great. I'd go back if I was in the neighborhood and since Than Long is round the corner I'm sure I will be.
author: Don A.

description:
I'm excited just writing this review.  I wasn't sure what to expect when a friend mentioned we should go for dessert, but I had heard good things from other people and decided to make the drive into the city to get ice cream.

It sorta seemed in the middle of nowhere, pretty residential area..small little corner shop..but OMG the ice cream was indescribable.... well thats not true, it was DELICIOUS!  Just thinking about it makes me want MORE MORE MORE!!

I tried a few flavors, the jasmine green was interesting.. mm captured the flavor perfectly which I love... but I ended up going for the lychee and pumpkin..random mix, yes.  They give you a sizable portion per scoop...big round scoops of ice cream.  I think it runs about $5 for two scoops on a waffle cone... it may have been the first time in my life where I didn't finish my ice cream.... sad.  

The wheel that they have on the wall also looks fun.  May want to try next time....
author: Melody T.

description:
Mm really good asian flavors. I like to eat their banana and mint chip. The wheel is cool too, but I don't wanna risk any odd flavors. 

Nice and cute place to enjoy ice cream.
author: Jasmine W.

description:
Do you hate making decisions? 
On some level I think we all want to, at least sometimes, leave things up to fate, or at least other people. I personally really don't like making decisions which is why I love heading to Polly Ann, ironic huh? 

With all the ice cream choices available at run-of-the-mill ice cream shops sometimes there is just too many choices and we end up going with our 'favorite' and rarely stepping out of that establish comfort zone.  The main reason for this, I believe, is that deciding which other ice cream to try is just too stressful, there are way too many options! 

Well Polly-Ann takes all the stress away when you spin *drum roll* "The Wheel of Ice Cream". All the flavors are really yummy, it does depend on what you like, but they have some really interesting flavors that the *drum roll* "The Wheel of Ice Cream" gives you the courage to try out. 

Be Spontaneous! Spin the wheel when you go, maybe you'll get lucky and win a free ice cream.
author: Anna B.

description: Delectable ice cream, Russian Roulette style? Yes please and thank you.
author: Clarissa S.

description:
They have a TON of flavors, I don't even know how many. About 40? I might be way off.
I got a scoop of the green tea and the honey dew melon on a cone. My friend got green tea and lychee on a waffle cone, I think.
This place is cash only.
It was about $10 for the two of us, which is pretty damn expensive for ice cream. But I would go again just because it's so good.
author: Lori C.

description:
How does Eggettes expect to make any money if they're going to close down for two weeks during the holidays?? Oh well, more business for Polly Ann's. I actually have not been here since they moved to their new location because I've always opted to get Eggettes instead. I used to always get sesame, coconut, or lychee as ice cream flavors as a kid from this place. I chose to forgo the wheel (1 in 12 chance of getting a free ice cream by the way, which isn't too bad!) and play it safe and got mango. I also tried strawberry, which was also good. The ice cream is soft and is almost like gelato (maybe that's only the fruit flavors?) Next time, I'll be more cavalier and try a more exotic ice cream.

By the way, dogs are quite welcome here too. I saw a woman with a dog come in and basically if you order an ice cream, your dog gets one for free. It's a small cone with a bit of ice cream in it for your dog to enjoy. The story goes that the original owner was a dog-lover so every person accompanied by their furry friend got a doggy cone along with their purchase.
author: Bailey Z.

description:
This ice cream parlor is a bit of a let down compared to the rest in the city - Birite, Humphry Slocombe, Mitchells, Mr. & Mrs. Misc, Three Twins, etc...

It was super hot and stuffy! Not a good warm for an ice cream shop. The bathroom wasn't pleasant either. And they don't use biodegradable cups and spoons, which is so common everywhere nowadays. Prices are cheap, but the flavor was a miss. I had the green tea. Didn't taste like green tea. Didn't look like green tea. Should have tried it first. I thought the consistency was a bit watery and melty. Won't be back.
author: Cindy T.

description: I've been going to Polly Ann's since I was small. I remember going there as a kid and stand on the little so called steps by the door to see. Love the soft serve ice creams, cookies n cream, mint chip and so much more. It was a place to go after school and along the way on walks with my parents. When they had close for remodeling it was so hard not going and having that special treat. Now with the remodeled place and so called new location (a little down from where it was) it's still my go to place.
author: Melanie T.

description:
Overwhelmed by all the choices and still having a bit of a gambling streak in me (I'm blaming Vegas), I decided to spin Polly Ann's famous (or infamous) wheel of ice cream flavors and let fate decide what I should try.

Fate deemed I should have the espresso.

Initially, I was digging the taste of coffee but towards the end, the flavor was lost and all I had left was a sweet, creamy, yet non-descript ice cream flavor on top of my sugar cone.

Will I be back for more?

Yeah.
One more chance for this legendary local spot.
author: Dan B.

description:
I've been coming here since i was a kid. They really upgraded and made the store bigger from what I remember in the 90s.  The ice cream here are concocted from asian flavors (taro, ginger, green tea, etc). With so many flavors to choose from, you can spin their WHEEL and let it decide for you. You have 4 chances to land on free ice cream of any flavor. 

Recently, I tried the JASMINE TEA ice cream.  It was like no ice cream that i've ever tried! Tasted kind of like Jasmine Milk tea ice cream. Love it!

Some other noteable treats from my childhood: Purple dragon soda, Chocolate frosty, taro ice cream.
author: Jennifer C.

description: I have been coming here since I was little and it always has nice and fast service. Also like many others have mentioned I love that they have a wheel to spin and choose for you when you can't decide. I have actually landed on free twice which was nice and just choose green tea because that is my favorite flavor, but its always to try new things.
author: Lawrence Y.

description:
Forget Baskin Robbins and their 21 flavors. They have a BAZILLION AND ONE flavors here. Forreal.

Spin the wheel and you might get a free ice cream. Or be stuck with American beauty and Durrrrrian. BLECHHH. 

Theres still two sad-looking, hard-as-rocks, tubs of Polly Anns in my freezer from last year. And that's saying a lot since I'm an ice cream killa. Their flavors taste good at first bite, then leave you with an unpleasant aftertaste of artificiality that coats your mouth, kind of like Housewives of Beverly Hills.

Polly Ann's is my last resort ice cream. I'd hit up Mickey D's for their ice cream cone first.
author: Angela W.

description:
Stepping into Polly Ann's I instantly feel this down home feeling.  Open area, stools by the window, cute posters and signs on the walls.. Oh, and did I mention the Wheel o' Flavors?!  So if you're feeling indecisive / brave, you can let fate decide your ice cream flavor by spinning the wheel.  Be warned - you *have* to get the flavor that the wheel lands on.  The question you should ask yourself is, "Do I feel lucky?" 

There are some good combinations (coffee & oreo bits), a lot of fruity choices (mango, macapuno [baby coconut]), and creative names ("Bumpy Freeway" is rocky road, "O.P.P." is orange, peach, and pineapple).  You can also turn almost any flavor into a shake!  Mango shake, anyone?  All around we liked our choices, gobbling it all up in mere minutes.  The staff is friendly and the place was clean. 

Not as innovative as Bi-Rite or as creamy as Mitchell's, but still some good eats.  Will definitely come back to try some more!  And, maybe spin that wheel...
author: Shereen R.

description: Delicious! I can't help but get the taro ice cream every time because it's light and sweet. Fast, friendly service, and they accept card which is nice.
author: Madhu K.

description:
Holy cow!  Two hundred forty six other reviews of an ice cream parlor?!   What more needs to be said about this place?  I'll just add some random notes about this ol' stomping ground of mine when I lived in the city...

I estimated I burned about 150 calories running at a brisk pace from my old house in the outer Sunset to the beach and back (roughly a little over a mile).  Then, I promptly added those calories back after stopping by this place to get a scoop of some good homemade ice cream.  If I felt like two scoops, then I'd run that extra mile along the beach.

I recall they gave free ice cream to dogs if you bring them in.  Cute thought but bad idea.  Just what you want, a dog with the runs afterward.  I remember many of the female dog owners that would come in here were really cute.  Not that this was why I came here.  (There were other good-looking women that would come here too...minus the dog.)  

Speaking of the runs, this place is good for the lactose intolerant and very Asian friendly (yes, often they go hand-in-hand), with flavors like durian, taro, ube, lychee and logan.  My personal favorite was mango, although I still preferred the sorbet at Double Rainbow a little more.  

A large variety of flavors you won't find anywhere else.  Group friendly, kid friendly and animals too.  And don't forget the cute girls that come here.
author: Andrew K.

description: Continues to put out delicious ice cream.  Black sesame is still my favorite.  The staff is usually courteous and efficient.
author: Debbie T.

description:
Great place to visit if you have access to a car and you are craving uniquely-flavored ice cream (though Polly Ann has your regular favorites, too!).  The service is great (we had MANY a sample!) and they have a wheel in the back so if you can't decide what you want, they'll spin the wheel and decide for you!

They have a very impressive assortment of Asian-inspired and other flavors, including lychee and durian (they have to keep this one contained because it's so potent!).  

My only complaint is that the flavors did not seem that natural.  There were strange chunks of something crunchy (I have no idea what!) in my pistachio almond ice cream (it was neither of those 2)...  Oh well, I'd come back!
author: Julie S.

description: been coming here since i was a little girl! My godmother would always get me Polly Ann's when it was at their old location and during my high school days, my daddy would bring me here after school :) i always get some tea flavored ice cream. it's probably the only place that has it because i cant seem to find it anywhere else. love it here. always eat there and buy a tub to eat at home :)
author: Kristina L.

description:
So I finally got the chance to visit the actual store! Polly Ann was quite busy on this cloudy Saturday afternoon, but parking close-by wasn't too hard to find. 

The store was very colorful and had fun stuff like a gum ball machine and a big wheel, which you can spin if you can't decide on a flavor. What happens is that you choose between three flavors--the one it lands on and the ones adjacent to that. There's also a possibility of landing on a Free ice cream slot, which kinda rocks.

I knew what I wanted for once, so I didn't brave the wheel. I've already tried a few of their flavors at grocery stores, so I settled on Jasmine Tea Ice Cream, which sadly, can't be bought at grocery markets. 

Service was friendly, and my ice cream was soooo good. The scoop didn't look too big, but it was actually a very satisfying portion--sort of dense and very full of flavor! Yum!!

I tried my Cone-eating Cutie's Chocolate Ice cream and was unimpressed. My Jasmine Tea was far superior.
author: K W.

description:
A bit out-of-the-way ice-cream parlor (yes, I say parlor!) but they serve pretty good ice-cream. They have an interesting spinning wheel to help you out if you can't decided which flavor to get. Honestly though, I wouldn't spin it because some of the flavors don't sound too appealing. 

This is the only place I know (so far) that serves jasmine tea ice-cream. There was a strong jasmine tea taste upon the first spoonful but after that, the taste was pretty much gone. I was a bit disappointed but would still come back for the jasmine tea ice-cream.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Great neighborhood creamery!

1) Love how they have so many great flavors.
2) Giant wheel to help you choose when you don't know which flavor you want.
3) Love the funny signs all around.
4) Free parking outside.
5) They sell their flavors by the pint so if you ever want Polly Ann's at home = yay!

I always bring my kids here afternoon when SF is nice and warm. :)
author: Jean T.

description:
My boyfriend loves coming here. Whenever we're in the city, we're always going to ice cream places and Polly Ann's is an often location.

The lychee is the best flavor! The green tea is also delicious. I've never spun the flavor wheel, but it looks pretty darn awesome :)
author: Rachel L.

description:
Polly Ann's is a local favorite.  A dark shadow was cast over the outer Sunset area when we heard Polly Ann's was closing down.  And the clouds moved away when we all learned that it was only temporarily closed and a newly remodeled Polly Ann's had opened just a few stores down.  Yay!  

Rain or shine, I've been found wanting some Polly Ann's ice cream.  Sometimes I'll brave the wheel and go for a spin.  With three choices, there's bound to be at least one you can pick.  (Even with some adventurous flavors like Rose or Vegetable, I still would be happier with the likes of Lychee or Ube.)

On a recent visit, I brought my out-of-town guests to Polly Ann's for some Durian ice cream.  I guess you could call it our first meal of the day.  Well, I had a couple bites of it myself and I was burping up Durian all afternoon!  So, watch out for that stuff.  They were in absolute heaven though as they gobbled up this goodness.

Polly Ann's is one of those places that remind me of home.  It's a comforting type of ice cream and atmosphere.  

Sidenote:  Parking is a real bitch here, so if you can, drop someone off and have them get your order.  Otherwise, you'll be circling the block a lot before you find a space.  And it's funny to see that through the years, the young high school crowd and their rice rockets still hang out at Polly Ann's.  Who doesn't love a little ice cream anyway?
author: Teri C.

description:
I think it's awesome that I'm still burping up ice cream goodness a couple hours after eating at this place.

A nice ice cream boutique that you should try if you're in the area. It's homemade ice cream with a variety of flavors. There's about 50 flavors on the menu, but my cousin said that they change on a regular basis. I sampled the Star Wars (peppermint with marshmallow) and thought it was interesting, but I settled on Peach Ameretto (sic) and Rum Raisin.

I thought it was interesting and unique that they serve you the ice cream in a little plastic tub. If you had a cap, you could keep small portions of leftover meals in it  Overall, the texture of the ice cream was light and creamy. Just what you want out of good ice cream. The Peach flavor was pretty subtle but enjoyable, and the Rum Raisin was delicious as always. It's different from Haagen-Dazs... I wouldn't say better or worse really. I think the consensus in our group was that the fruit flavors were all great, so try those if you stop by.

I have no idea when I'll be back in the neighborhood again, but I really can't wait to try their other flavors.
author: Chris V.

description:
I remember coming to Polly Ann's when I was in elementary and what I always remembered was that huge wheel they had in the back! The people who work here are really nice and friendly. =)

I came here with the bf because I was craving red bean ice cream, we brought the pup and got her a doggy cone. Being the big pup she is she ate that thing in 2 licks and 2 bites. I thought it was nice that they have free doggy cones for your furry companion. 

The boyfriend and I grabbed a tub of the red bean ice cream and six cones, which came out to be about $7 all together, not bad at all! I've had other flavors but red bean was always my favorite, the green tea is pretty good as well. YUM! 

I think after work I am going to be coming here to pick up another tub of ice cream! =P
author: Heather C.

description:
Can't choose between the 48 wacky, delicious flavors? Spin the giant roulette wheel and have the choice made for you . . . with a 1 in 12 chance that you'll get a free cone! 

I love the slightly silly attitude here. The flavors can be hard to decipher (e.g., "Bumpy Highway" = Rocky Road, "4 CCCC" = Cherry, Chocolate, Coffee, and Champagne). But just ask one of the cute kids staffing the place and they will be happy to help you. 

Leave a big tip! These kids have to go to college, you know.
author: Mandy H.

description: It's a good ice cream place, maybe a level or two below Mitchells.
