But definitely not in the same category as Bi-Rite or Humphry Slocombe when it comes to originality and creativity of flavors. But I can see why some people choose to stay loyal to this place. Classic, creamy and flavorful ice cream, located in the the middle of Outer Sunset, next to homes and schools- it's a neighborhood ice cream parlor every city would want! Spin The Wheel is pretty fun for the indecisive folks like myself, but be scared of that Durian! =)
author: S Y.

description:
I NEVER WROTE A REVIEW FOR POLLY ANNS?! 

favorite flavors of all time: JASMINE TEA and TARO!

they have unique flavors here, but out of all of them, jasmine is my favorite and this is like the only place that carrys it. RARELY do they NOT have people waiting to order or not have a line. 

def a place to take my dog, they give free soft serve yogurt doggy cones!
author: Kenny L.

description:
There are tons of flavors. Even naturally weaker flavors like lychee really stand out. If you can't decide, you can spin the giant wheel. They sell their ice cream in tubs in supermarkets too. Their tubs aren't that cheap, but their cones are.

Since it's close to the beach, it's a great way to compliment the day.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Absolutely the BEST green tea ice cream you can get. They sell it by pints, quarts and gallons if you want the ice cream togo. The staff here is nice and so helpful. They happily treat every customer. The place is great. It's huge and roomie, so you can sit and enjoy your ice cream. There are cute little signs every that make you giggle every time you read them. Newspaper articles line their walls which great reviews. 

Their menu is huge. Their flavors range from regular American to Asian originals. I would stay clear from the American ice cream here and stick to the Green Tea and Duran flavors. There are many to choose from. I tried the Green Tea of course. There is  unique taste to it. You can definitely taste the green tea in the ice cream. The sweetness is just the right amount. None of the fake stuff here. 

I also tired black sesame ice cream, well i was forced to. in my opinion I hate black sesame ice cream, but from what I hear, Polly Ann's is the best place to go for it. They also have sundaes, and frosties if those of you don't like ice cream.

One scoop is around $2.50, which us decent priced for the goodness you get. I recommend this place to everyone craving some Asian fusion ice cream. Most definitely.
author: Katie C.

description:
It's so hot today so I visited the famous Polly Ann to get their ice cream then take them to the ocean beach (which is just blocks away).
     Back to the Polly Ann, there were no any decorations or fancy service. Most of the time they might not smile at you. Yet they are pretty fast and very helpful. 
       Not all of them ( ice cream ) are good but once it's good, it 's really really good. For me, I love their Green tea ice cream.
author: Dom G.

description:
So many flavors, soooo hard to choose!! iIt all makes me so happy! :)

Such an adorable store, but i am always too chicken to spin the wheel. they have really cute flavors, such as a mint ice cream with marshmallows.
author: Stella C.

description:
Okay, Polly Ann is now a solid 2-star ice cream place for me.

Weeks ago, I had their pumpkin ice cream... liked it well enough. The service was quite awesome, too. So I mentally bumped Polly Ann up to 3-star status. 

Fast-forward to this week, hubby surprised me with a pumpkin ice cream CAKE. That... was not so good. For whatever reason, the pumpkin ice cream lost its luster in cake form. The vanilla cake itself was quite gross. 

Back down to 2 stars...
author: Wing Y.

description:
Polly Ann. The often-elusive brand in Asian supermarket freezers. It's always a "Eureka!" moment when I happen to find a single tub of green tea ice cream buried under inferior flavors. So I have to say I was excited to see this dedicated shop on the corner of Noriega and 39th. In the sea of flavors, I stuck with the tried-and-true, and ordered a scoop of green tea. Though after the first taste I wasn't instantly taken back to my childhood memory of sitting at the kitchen counter devouring 3 scoops of Dreyer's, there was a sense of satisfaction, at least for the moment. The green tea intensity was a bit much. It was like munching on icy tea leaves after a while. I was also overwhelmed (in a good way I guess) by the locals sitting in the shop, specifically the seniors sitting peacefully and staring off into space with cones in hand, scarfing them down on that lazy Sunday. Yep, they looked like regulars.  

+ Sea of flavors
+ True local favorite
-  Flavors can be a bit realistic (not in a good ice cream way)
-  Pricing is a bit steep (3 scoops costs close to a tub at the supermarket)
author: Michael Paul C.

description:
Have you ever seen so many flavors in one place? I get antsy just thinking about it.

It's close enough to SFSU I contemplate sneaking away for sweet treat between classes, though it's not something I would necessarily travel across town to get when many small markets carry half gallon tubs of Polly Ann all around the city.

It was lacking something though, something I can't quite pin point. Delicious, nonetheless.
author: Chelsea P.

description:
Polly Ann is one of my favorite ice cream shops!  They've moved since my middle school days to a larger shop.  A larger shop + a nicer wheel = apparently not a good thing, according to other reviews. /facepalm

When you walk in, you see a big wheel and about 40 ice cream flavors on the wall.  Also, signs with witty sayings.  "Our credit manager is Helen Wait.  If you need credit, go to Helen Wait".  Yeah, didn't get that one until I was in high school.  Anyways, when I go to Polly Ann with friends, I usually end up being the only one spinning the wheel.  Why?  Because I live life on the edge.  I've gotten at least 3-4 free ice creams from the wheel, and I've never received anything gross.  

The workers are usually nice, and the ice cream is good.  It's not cheap, but it's tasty!  

Oh, and they have a batman flavor.  It's amazing, so if you see it on rotation, get it! :D
author: Wayland L.

description:
I am not going to explain how the wheel works since a lot of people have written about it below me. However, I will say that the workers there are pretty friendly and chatted with us about random things like what "the suicide" is (basically all the fountain drinks mixed in one) and just the nature of their business.

I had lychee ice cream and its basically comes as promised. Tasty and decent size portion. They have some funky names like the Star Wars and so forth, so you may ask a lot of questions before deciding what you want.

They had some funny decorations with funny sayings. I really wanted to tear some down for my friend who loves ice cream, but alas, that would make them mad. Anyways, parking wasn't too bad on a Sunday night so I would recommend it. It's a bit of a drive from North Bay but hey, you can end up at San Tung after this (see my other post).

Anyways, I recommend the place based on the novelty, ice cream flavors and just good customer service. Enjoy!
author: Frederick C.

description:
I have been going to Polly Ann for years.  I always went to the old location before they moved.  

A great place to take kids for ice cream.  Awesome ice cream and cool local Sunset vibe.  It's also fun for adults because they can enjoy the ice cream also.  My Polly Ann favorite has always been the bubble gum ice cream.  =)

Forget Baskin Robbins.  I'll take Polly Ann any day.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
Came here after dinner one night because my friend really likes this place. Thought I would give it a try.

As soon as I walked in, I noticed two things. The big wheel and the 48 flavors lining the wall. The big wheel is to help you decide which of the 48 flavors to get. The walls are also peppered with some silly phrases and saying.

I decided to get the red bean ice cream on a sugar cone. My initial lick was interesting. I expected a more red bean soup kind of taste, forgetting I was eating ice cream! So I was in for a little surprised because the ice cream here is creamy and sweet. I loved the chunks of red bean though. I thoroughly enjoyed the creaminess, although the sugar levels were a bit high.

There's a sign that the bathroom doesn't work. But while I was in there, I totally saw the guy who works there go in there! I'm assuming he used the bathroom..
author: Viola L.

description:
***** 5 Stars *****
Their ice cream are totally make my day!!!!
I bought a box of durian flavor ice cream and got a red bean ice cream cone!
It tastes super good! Even though today is hella cold-.-
Everyone must try if you live in San Francisco
I think their ice cream is much better than another brands from walgreens!
And they have a lot of flavors!!
I love this place!
author: Kassidi L.

description: love the plentiful flavors. my favorite is the caramel salt lick (something like that!). the staff are friendly.
author: Helen J.

description:
love polly ann's! it's been a childhood favorite for me, and has witnessed my transition through favorite flavor to flavor. most of the times i blame polly ann for making me so disloyal to a single flavor. actually, i blame the flavor wheel (see below)! it also doesn't help that all the flavors are SO good!

the large flavor wheel behind the counter is ingenious, and always a hit with the crowd! you spin the wheel, which has numbers all around it, and a few red tags indicating a free ice cream with the flavor of your choice! each number corresponds to a certain flavor. you have a choice of either the number you land on or the two adjacent numbers to the left and right. i've been spinning the wheel for years, and i can attest that it's worth the gamble. you're bound to be content with at least one of the three choices you can choose. and for a chance at free ice cream, i highly encourage it! definitely makes the ice cream acquisition that much more sweet. i can attest for the reliability of the wheel, because i recently landed on free. and let me say, that ice cream tasted of sweet, sweet victory.

every time i'm here, i have to get a tub of the lychee ice cream. it's so creamy, with little bits of lychee in it. other favorites are the cookies and cream, green tea, there are also many other unique flavors, such as durian, rum raisin, and english toffee.

cash and credit is accepted here, and parking is very easy!
author: Caitlin C.

description:
I have been going to Polly Ann's since I was a kid.  They have so many unusual flavors to choose from.  It's fun to see what new flavors they can conjure up.  They even give out free doggy cones!

The shop is pretty small, with only a few seats but the ice cream is so good you wouldn't spend much time sitting down anyway.
author: Rosie M.

description:
Polly Ann was not anything that extraordinary. There are a lot of ice cream places in this world that can beat Polly Ann's even in terms of its "special" flavors.

I paid a good deal for ice cream and can't say I am exactly willing to do it again. The Sundae was boring, the packaged ice cream tasted like Magnolia's, and the line was out the door.

Made the special trip out and really would never again.
author: Winè C.

description:
Good ole classic San Francisco ice cream joint, and located in my hood! There really isn't anything to dislike about this place. They carry classic flavors as well as Asian fruit flavors (lychee, durian, etc). They even have their own concoctions such as the one called "Star Wars," which I can't remember what combination of flavors it consisted of. 

I've never spun the giant wheel, nor have I been in the presence of someone who has, so I can't say whether or not that brings any excitement to my Polly Ann visits. I pick what flavor I'm going to have depending on my mood. I've had mango, pistachio, and green tea. When I'm feeling in that classic mood, I go for strawberry.

I haven't been disappointed yet.

Oh, did I mention they have a ton of candy for sale too?
author: Lani S.

description: Decent prices but the reason I live going here is their variety of flavors!!! They have your basic flavors but they also have their own creations! The only way to find out your favorite flavor is to go in and try them!! Tonight I tried their root beer and I really liked it. It was very creamy and had great flavor!
author: Sayuri I.

description: many flavor to pick from. friendly service. price is very reasonable.  get the waffle bowl it's very crunchy.  I had the the pistachio+ almond/honey dew/Turkish coffee.  I will definitely go again very soon.
author: Rina C.

description:
Me: "And I'll take a small frostie swirl to go with the small sesame waffle cone"

PollyAnn: "Would you like a doggie cone for him?"

Me: "You have Doggie cones? Yeah sure, why not!"

PollyAnn: "Here you are sir"

Him: "slurp, slurp, slurp" (see pic)

Free doggie cones. 5 Stars. 'nuff said.
author: Peter T.

description:
Ice cream: 4/5
service: 4/5, the older lady cashiers are very nice and patient with people who can't decide what to get. Their english isn't that great though. 

I've been here a handful of times over many years. Being a long time resident of san francisco, you surely would have heard of Polly Ann ice cream. It is more or less in a small business area in the middle of a residential area. Street parking is plentiful. The ice cream shop is fairly small and there are several tables. I don't think they can seat more than 25 in the whole place.  What sets this place apart is the dozens of unique flavors they have. Other than that, I felt the flavor and texture of the ice cream itself can sometimes be lacking. Sometimes the ice cream is not smooth and has small ice chunks in them, other times it is perfect. I don't come here too often because the price is a bit high for what you get, just under $3.50 for two small scoops. When ever I come here it is more to have a taste of the new unique flavors they have in rotation. Also, this tends to be a popular hang out place for middle school and high school kids, with a smattering of families. I don't like being here when there are hordes of teens milling around.
author: Cecile S.

description:
Peach Amaretto could be the next party in your mouth!  

I'm biased though.  I grew up down the street so my family has been coming here for over 20 years.  

Seriously though, peach amaretto...that's the latest flavor I tried and I was really surprised.  DO IT...DO IT NOW!!!  Mmm.
author: Meesh K.

description:
Jasmine tea ice cream! People like green tea but I think the Jasmine has a lighter, cleaner flavor. You can buy many of the flavors to take home too. They have all the Asian flavors you can think of.

Funny signs on the wall and elsewhere!

My wife ordered the Durian ice cream. The person goes in the back. I think to myself, hmm, that was a smelly truck that just passed by! But it turns out it was the ice cream. When the person comes back out to the front with ice cream, the stench of natural gas/sewer leak hits us. I notice that after serving it, the person starts immediately washing off the scoop with large amounts of water. We start eating the ice cream, but I can't concentrate on my own due to this durian smell next to me. Then we turn around and realize that everyone in the whole shop is gone!

I make us go outside and finish the ice cream. Good thing it's windy here in this part of SF!
author: Ryan C.

description:
Oh Polly Ann's...how you bring back memories of my youth from years and years ago!

I remember making the journey out here just to partake in your dairy goodness (thank god for lactose tolerance!) and debating on whether to press my luck on that giant wheel of yours.  I remember those feelings of internal turmoil, weighing the joys of getting what I want versus the potential thrill of victory for not getting a whack flavor on that giant wheel of flavors of yours.  Even now I still will tempt fate, just to push my luck.  So far I haven't gotten burned with a bad flavor yet, but until I do...spin that wheel!
author: Mike L.

description:
Replace Vanna White and cash prize with Asian momma and ice cream and you have Polly Ann. 

Got the taro but heard that the green tea is THE item to get here. I would stick to Asian flavors. If you get the durian, I'm not sitting next to you. 

Not at the level of Bi Rite, Ice, or Humphry Slocombe though :-/
author: Kenny L.

description:
Don't waste your time... unless you like artificially flavored sugar frozen cream!!

My family and I came here based on all the good reviews but were very very disappointed with what we got. Unlike Marco Polo ice cream where you can taste the real fruit, the lychee ice cream and durian ice cream we got at Polly Ann tasted so 'fake'. The ice cream tasted like they were made with lots of sugar with artificial flavor and coloring. 

I have read lots of review and company literature about how the ice cream is made from natural ingredients. I don't even think it's possible to get ice cream tasting like the way they did if REAL natural ingredients were used.
author: Serena L.

description:
Polly Ann Ice Cream is a Yelp client -- and their manager Eric very kindly just sent over a large box of ice cream and popsicles for our staff.  I'm currently eating a mug of delicious Chocolate and Peanut Butter ice cream while the guys next to me rave about the pineapple popsicles.  I haven't been to the shop yet myself, but am eager to get there now.

Thanks Eric and thanks Polly Ann.
author: Geoff D.

description: Althought not a lot of people like durian, I have to say for those who like the flavor, they do have the best durian ice cream. Green tea and sesame tastes great also. I would like to try E.T. Next time!
author: Catherine L.

description:
I use to go here all the time as a child and have fond memories of going to Polly Anne's with my brother and father. I am 26 now and recently went back to visit a great establishment and get a cone. The store was empty and my girlfriend and I were deciding on what flavor we wanted. 

We asked to try a couple different flavors and when we requested only our SECOND flavor, the lady behind the counter (I'm assuming the owner, she was older and chinese) made a remark to us along the lines of "This is your last taste OK!" as if we juvenile delinquents who only came in to try free samples!

I'm sorry but this is a society based on consumers and if you are going to try and restrict a patron of your store from deciding out what product of yours he would like to purchase, then you have quite an askew view of how to run a business.

With that being said, my girlfriend and I were quite offended that she has snapped at us like this and promptly informed her she had just lost two customers and that we would be taking our business elsewhere. It's unfortunate and sad to say, but my childhood memories of this place will just have to stay memories from here on out. A lot has changed about this place.

I mean how ELSE am I supposed to know what "Star Wars" ice cream tastes like? Well, now I'm figuring it's something similar to C3PO's dick.
author: Aaron V.

description:
I recommend you avoid Polly Ann Ice Cream at all cost and I will explain why.

First and foremost the ice cream is expensive and the taste does not justify the price in my opinion.  Perhaps my palate is not as refined as yours but what I tried was not anything better than what I could purchase at the supermarket.  To their credit they definitely have more variety than a supermarket but what's the point when the taste is average at best.

Now, the main reason I will never go to Polly Ann Ice Cream is because of their rude service.  My girlfriend asked to have their wheel spun because she couldn't decide on what flavor to select.  Their response was something like "you have to buy what the wheel lands on" and then they spun the wheel.  WAIT A SECOND - what did they mean we have to buy what the wheel lands on?  Is someone going to strip me of my money?  I don't think so.  If the wheel lands on something I don't want to purchase you better believe I am not going to buy it.  If this business (using the term as loose as possible) wants to do things that way then have a price for spinning the wheel and have customers pay before the wheel is spun...  

Then...my friend tried to pay with her credit card and mysteriously the credit card wouldn't work in their store.  Mind you this is the same credit card that worked earlier that day and later that day.  Again - in a rude manner we were informed the credit card wasn't working and we needed to pay in cash.

If you want to spend far more than you should on ice cream, then at least go somewhere else.  That is my recommendation.
author: Bánh B.

description:
New thing to try...

Old San Francisco.
What is it? Pineapple ice cream with toasted almonds.  Sweetly pineapple ice cream with almonds.  *droool* o_O,,,,

They have other new stuff too...go try it...NOW!!!!

Er not sure...but I was able to use my credit card for my purchase tonight. :-D (Minimum $5.00)
author: Fannie S.

description:
we LOVE this place... 

so when it came time to think about where to have my 50th birthday party well... Polly Ann's was an inspired choice.  the folks on staff were so nice and so friendly  (and were able to chat about my favorite team, the WARRIORS).   they let my husband and kids come in to decorate and they made special arrangements for us to take over the place for a few hours so that our friends and family members could come by.  Great ice cream, great fun... really a fantastic way to launch into the second half of life!
author: Keeva L.

description:
We were craving a root beer float when we thought of Polly Ann.  

However, upon arrival, we noticed that ordering a large soda with one scoop of ice cream was cheaper than ordering the small float/shake they had listed.  

After informing the server of this, she became very impatient and pretended like she did not understand.  Then she said that we could order the items separately, and that she would not simply make the combination of the soda and scoop of ice cream at the lower price.  So we did just that, ordering separate cups of soda and scoops of ice cream.  

When we had combined the ice cream and root beer to make our own float, we realized that it was not very good at all, and that we could have made the same float at McDonald's or ordered the same float at In N' Out for less money.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Before there was Bi-Rite and Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream (both delish!), there was Polly Ann.  

Where else could you go to get your Bumpy Freeway (rocky road) and standard Vanilla along with Red Bean, Mango, Lychee, and Green Tea?  By far the best treat in the Outer Sunset.

Try a new flavor.  Hell, they'll even give a little scoop to your dog!  But if you're feeling indecisive, spin the wheel and try something awesome!

Classics:  Cherry Vanilla, Lychee, Mango
Feeling adventurous and have no sense of smell:  Durian
author: Christine K.

description:
I think Polly Ann has the best ice cream in SF. Its location is a bit out of the way, but it is an easy stop if you are at Ocean Beach, the Zoo or Golden Gate park. They have 50 flavors and are happy to let you taste several to make up your mind. Their staff is great, friendly and patient. There is one tall Asian girl in particular that is always helpful and friendly.
I will make sure to recommend Polly Ann to my friends
author: Greg P.

description:
Possibly my favorite spot for ice cream, and I don't have easy access to it. :(

Spinning the wheel is absolutely perfect for my indecisiveness, and desire to sample everything under the sun. 

Any excuse to try something new. "Hey, the wheel told me to."

However, after tasting Polly Ann's banana oreo...oh man...

It haunts me. I'll just have to adjust and order banana/cookies&cream, and then let the wheel make all my other decisions for me. Ahh...lack of responsibility.

If only they'd open a location closer to an interstate...
author: Emmanuel H.

description:
I grew up on Polly Ann's ice cream.  I remember my grandfather used to take us here before we hit up the playground when we were youngins.   Loved it then and love it now.  Of course, now they've remodeled the place and it looks different but the ice cream is still as delicious as always!  

If you don't know which ice cream flavor you want, SPIN the WHEEL and let it make the decision for you.  You can either pick the flavor you land on, or the two right next to it.  And if you land on a free one, well you get a free scoop of ice cream.  Beats driving all the way to LA to play wheel of fortune.  

Polly Ann's holds a special place in my heart  because it holds many wonderful childhood memories!
author: Christine P.

description: My favorite ice cream flavors are vanilla, chocolate, strawberry and coffee.  So I admit that I have boring tastes when it come to ice cream.  That being said.......Polly Ann's vanilla is substandard, but their other more adventurist flavors are great.  Go to Mitchell's, Joe's or the other "foodie" ice cream places for better classic flavors.  However, other than Marco Polo on Taraval , the Sunset is void of ice cream parlors; so it's not a bad choice if you live nearby.
author: Edmond S.

description:
A big part of my childhood.  Went there the afternoon and was happy to see they still have the wheel and a drink called the Suicide, just like the olden days.  Sadly, was totally craving a frosty cone, but was told that the machine was out of order so I guess I'll have to go back again soon.

I could be wrong, but back in the day, wasn't it Polly Ann's instead of Polly Ann?  Regardless, I'm glad that despite the changes a few years ago, it is still around to bring joy to plenty of children, both young and old.

Long live Polly Ann's Ice Cream!
author: Roy N.

description:
They have a whole bunch of different flavored ice creams. I love the teas. I think there's green tea and jasmine tea and other ones, but I'm not really sure.

I do remember that I liked watermelon...not a tea; but it's ok.

I'm scared to spin the wheel!!
author: Erica A.

description: Who doesn't love ice cream? Polly Anns is definitely a go to spot if your in the sunset. They have a great variety of flavors and awesome staff who are super patient with their customers as they choose their flavors!
author: Kristy V.

description:
I love their lychee, taro, durian and green tea...etc... ice creams either in a tub or waffle cone. =) I just can't get enough ice creams. Gotta have them ALL. Yummers...try their ice cream cakes too. If you come here and can't figure out What flavor to eat...simply tell them to spin the wheel.

Downfall is waffle is NOT freshly made and scoops are literally 1 scoop, its not like cold stone how they bundle approx. 2 scoops and say its 1=(
author: Julie B C.

description:
Great ice cream shop. Not only does it sell ice cream only but it sells snacks at a price that you can't compete with. $0.75-$1.00 for a bag of chips is a great price especially when almost all the chips are only $0.75. The idea with spinning the wheel of fortune is original. You don't see to many ice cream shops with those do you? Also, the idea with making your own fountain drinks are great. At $1.75 for the largest size which is probably like almost as big as the largest size soda in a movie. The flavors in the fountain drinks are original. I recommend getting a suicide or a purple dragon drink.

    They have plenty of choices in ice cream flavors which takes up almost the whole entire wall which is great. The Popsicle four for $2.00 have better flavors like Thai tea. The ice cream cakes are delicious. The ice cream cakes are even better. Very sweet and tasty and lots of different kinds you can choose from. The soft serve ice cream is also good to ranging from $1.25 for a cup or $1.50 for a cone. OK price.

    If your in the sunset district, you should stop here and grab some ice cream or some drinks or snacks. Just about 4 or 5 people behind the counter but still able to serve.
author: Reginald W.

description: This place is quite good for the ice cream selection they have!! ^^  I do like their sesame ice cream (I think this was it LOL) that I ordered last time I was here and I do remember their prices were quite reasonable for where they're located.  ^^ Cute store and nice location near my old flat! ^^
author: John H.

description:
lots of parking.

i haven't been here in a while.  they are at a new location.  just down from where they used to be...on the corner now.  much larger space...and it looks cleaner and more spacious.

i came here because i was reminded by these almost popsicle like treat.  they sell it at this market in daly city.  its 2.18 a box there.

I called polly ann's and they sell it for 1.99 a box.  contains 4 bars inside.

They have LOTS of flavors and i LOVE them ALL!

They have lychee, blueberry, macapuno(coconut), green tea, thai tea, mango, honeydew melon, red bean, and EVEN Durian(this great tasting but SMELLY tropicl fruit)

i suggest you give this a try.  if you want something like a popsicle and don't want ice cream...this is a great thing thats different than a cone.
author: Bing D.

description: Such interesting flavors!
author: Colleen B.

description:
5 stars because of the creativeness this place has (the unique flavor names, the big wheel (makes decisions so much easier when I can't figure out what I want), the crazy sayings on the walls, and the crazy variety of ice cream and desert treats.

There's always something new when I go.

I can't say anything bad or good about the desert picks, it's really what ever your taste buds love :) and you can't go wrong with that!
author: Quinallison D.

description:
I think I finally figured it out. The whole secret to life. In each place I have come across in my travels, there has always been one location where an ice cream man set up shop and either through sheer nostalgic reasons or perhaps they're a little like Willy Wonka and try really strange flavors, they all seem to forever be known as "the place" to go for ice cream. 

This is the location for S.F. to get your ice cream fix. Mainly due to the off the beaten track flavors that you'll possibly imagine they have. Stuff from Rose ice cream to my favorite.. Durian. 

Yes, I said it. Durian ice cream. The one food that some pansy on the travel channel will not eat, they make into a really tasty ice cream. So you can skip the middle man of having to smell this foul smelling fruit while cutting it up and just consume it whole. 

This stuff typically smells like a dead body does after a couple of days of marinating in the sun, if you catch my drift. But when you taste it.. Oh man, it's some really good stuff. Sort of taste like avocado with a better kick to it. 

This place was the first place I ever had black sesame ice cream and I've seen it pop up here and there from time to time and I have to say, it's always been a nice treat to see and enjoy. 

Speaking of which, I did see Avocado on the menu once here. I can imagine that it's really good. Having tried some of the other flavors, they may not all be for everyone, but the folks here are really good about giving you samples, so by all means take advantage of that before you go for a cup of whatever you're getting. 

Now the service of this place is pretty top notch. And while it is Cash only, I don't think that should be a deterrent. I think I have hated when people have harped on the fact that it's cash only, but I don't know why people don't carry more cash on them. Come on folks.. stop living off a piece of plastic.
author: Javier J.

description:
I don't go out for ice cream very often.  Not anymore anyway.  I've come here for Soft Serve.  I like when they have two flavors swirled together - vanilla on one side and chocolate on the other.  This past weekend I ordered the Mango Strawberry Swirl in a plain cone.  It was mango ice cream with some strawberry chunks in it.  I liked it.  A had the Soft Serve.  He likes Soft Serve.  I like him.  It all works out.

I like that it's a small, local business.  I like the wheel because I'm terrible at making decisions and that's something I'd totally need.  Except, there are some flavors I totally wouldn't want to eat.  Although there is some leeway.  You're not stuck with the ONE flavor the wheel lands on.  You could choose one on either side of the one flavor also.  Still, the chances are so slim.  What if it lands on a flavor I really don't want?  It's much better if I just make up my mind and pick something I want.

Go to Polly Ann and support a local business while enjoying some ice cream.
author: Kris L.

description: Tons of flavors and you can spin a wheel for a chance to get a free scoop. All the flavors are delish.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Polly Anne Ice Cream has a very special place in my heart.

I used to come here all the time as a kid, when they used to be located up the block in a little shack with no tables inside and you can only fit about 7 people in there. My dad used to bring me here as a *treat* for being good or when he just feels like spoiling his little princess. I loved it every time.

Even though they've moved and the place is bigger and nicer now, they still have the same cool, kid feel with funny posters posted around the walls, lots and LOTS of candy, including jolly ranchers and ring pops (those were my fav :)). They're the only place I know that has a wheel for customers to spin because there are so many flavors to chose from. I love bringing my friends who arent from the city to Polly Anne's. They always have a big smile there because it makes them feel like a kid. And yes - you have to spin the wheel - at least just once! You might get a free cone :) :) ... or a bitter tasting flavor like durian, but don't you worry - you can select the ONE it lands on, or the one to the left of it.
author: Rosie W.

description: litchi? black sesame? durian? and frosties? i'm SOLD. and the line here moves rather swiftly. i'd rather come here then drive all the way out to mitchell's and wait forever!
author: Ann T.

description:
There's so many flavors it was hard to decide.

I decided to get Honey Dew Melon and Pomegranate.

Each one was okay, I definitely would have picked something else. I'll be back sometime to try out the other flavors. Maybe I should have just spun the wheel.
author: Chris T.

description:
Grew up with this place. 
I taught at a local day camp a few blocks from this place and we would take the kids to go get a scoop! YUM! 
Doggie cones are cute.
Come here to sample unusual flavors and if you can't decide, spin the wheel!
author: Angela D.

description:
I love Polly Ann's! The have tons of different flavors, even a wheel to spin if you can't decide!
I love the honeydew and jasmine tea flavors! MMM good.!
PS. Bring your dog and get a free doggy cone, my boyfriends dog was devouring it and he was obviously enjoying his ice cream just as much as we were.
author: Tiff C.

description: Not your average ice-cream joint. Ube, Green Tea, Taro and other Asian flavors. I like trying new things so I am happy to trade in the typical rocky road for pistachio.
author: Jessica M.

description:
Been a fan for years growing up in SF.  I remember when they were a hole in the wall down the block.

My fave ice cream shop cuz they have Asian flavors...lychee, green tea, and jasmine tea are my faves. I do also enjoy Irish coffee, marvelous mint, peach brandy...

My bro loves the honey dew flavor.

I don't like spinning the wheel cuz I'm way too picky to settle for what the wheel wants me to eat.  Sometimes if I go with a bunch of people, someone in my party will spin the wheel and try the luck of winning a free cone.

They have +40 flavors on the board...I feel like but usually have 30ish permanent flavors and rotate 15 pitch hitters.
author: Melissa F.

description: Good ice cream. They have some interesting ass names for their flavors, too. I'm pretty sure there was a Star Wars themed one for all you nerds out there. You know who you are.
author: Don F.

description:
I like the ice cream, but I'm not as happy about the cost.  

The best thing about them is the unique flavors.  In particular, they make a flavor that is my mom's favorite which is incredibly tough to find.  The worst thing is that they seem to have a very difficult time keeping that particular flavor in stock.  Four out of five times I inquire, they are out and the reason they give is its popularity.  

Suggestion: keep the popular flavors in stock!
author: Tom H.

description:
"Wheel of Morality, turn, turn, turn. Tell us the lesson that we should learn." -Yakko (+points if you get this reference)

Except its the Wheel of Ice Cream! Yay! I had no idea how to even imagine what a lot of the flavors they had on the wall even remotely tasted like. Seriously, what is Star Wars flavor? Lasers? Yoda's bug stew? Tauntaun? So I chose the wheel. In fact, all of us in the group chose the wheel. And all of us almost ALMOST ALMOST ended up with the magic free spot. But so sad, we didn't get it. So sad.

Also they had a trick bathroom. There a prominently displayed sign on it that says its closed, but yet its actually OPEN if you ask them? SURPRISE. I guess its to keep out free bathroom freeloaders from the outside world.

I'm not usually an ice cream guy (seriously, my favorite flavor is cookies and cream), but this place was good enough for me to think it was actually special. I wish I tried their green tea ice cream after reading all the reviews now. Oh well.
author: Andrew M.

description:
YAY!!! I found Pre-packed Polly Anns at Ranch 99 Supermarket in Milpitas.
Me+Durian Ice-Cream=EXCITED.
author: Lynn C.

description:
Take a chance and come spin the wheel!  Let it keep going and pick something for you if you are the indecisive type like me.  You might even get free ice cream!  :D

They have a good selection of ice cream flavors here and the scoops are decent sized.  They even have durian flavored ice cream.  After ordering they disappear to the back and scoop up this pungent treat.  Its either hate it or love it, and I know I definitely love it.  Be brave, give it a try!
author: Jay W.

description: Great selection of ice creams...spin the wheel if you're adventurous...been eating here since 1997...
author: aaron t.

description:
Given I only tried 1 flavor (a junior green tea), I thought it was ok.  Perhaps my expectations were too high or perhaps it wasn't warm enough, but I'd say Polly Ann is an ok ice cream place, but not my favorite.  I would give it another try though.

Note: cash only, parking is free (with a time limit)
author: Denise A.

description: love their honeydew and taro. seriously the best
author: Jennie Y.

description: Dozens of fun flavors and great service too.  Polly Ann is a great place to head after dinner with your kids, or on your own on a walk through the sunset.  It's even worth a trip across town! Unfortunately there are only about 3 tables so don't count on sitting down.  Once you get past that flaw - you can't top a place with such a huge ice cream menu!
author: K C.

description:
Ice cream is ice cream right?  Wrong!  There is delicious ice cream and there is average ice cream.  Baskin Robbins would be considered average.  Polly Ann Ice Cream is amazing!  We ordered the Taro, Durian, Mango and a mint with brownies in vanilla ice cream.  All Amazing!  The taro was my favorite because it actually tasted like creamy taro.  I have not tried the Durian because it is too strong for my liking but my boyfriend LOVES it.  

The ice cream is soft and creamy.  We ordered pints of these ice creams and when you put them in the freezer, usually they are like bricks to scoop out a few hours later.  When we went to eat it later that night, it was frozen but still soft to scoop.  It also still tasted great.

The two ladies working behind the counter were very helpful and polite.  I would highly recommend this place for that sweet, cold treat.  Especially if you are looking for different flavors.  The Ice cream tastes like quality and not that store brand that is light and full of air.
author: Maricelle R.

description: Great selection of ice cream. I usually buy a few buckets to eat at home.
author: Neo S.

description:
So I've been here a couple of times, and I've finally decided to write a review. Btw, PollyAnn's is good. I usually die for their Black Sesame, but this last time I decided to go and try their Honeydew Melon. Omg, so good. Tasted just like the drink, which is exactly what I was hoping for.

So besides the deliciousness, and the immense amount of flavors. And the wheel in the middle where you have a chance to win a free flavor (it does happen! I've won before!), the only thing that confuses me is their sizing. It seems like their Junior and Single scoop might be the same size, but one cheaper than the other. Then again, maybe the thing that separates them is the cone.

But overall, PollyAnn's is yum yum. But it's not much of a long hangout place due to limited seating. If you wanna sit and hang, maybe head to Eggettes (which I learned is just next door!)
author: Jessica H.

description:
This isolated little shop is well worth a trek out to the outer Sunset. About 4 blocks away from the N, and 6 blocks away from the L, your most likely route on public transport would be the 71, which should drop you off right on Noriega, minimizing your walk requirement. 

The best things about Polly Ann:

-variety! From taro and ube to French vanilla and Star Wars, this place has about 50 flavors available to satisfy any craving. Want a milkshake? They do that too -- even malted. They even make their own fountain sodas.

-funny signs! According to one sign, their credit manager is named Helen Waite. Want some ice cream on credit? Go to Helen Waite!

-fun! Can't decide on a flavor? Spin the wheel and it'll choose for you.

I love me sum taro and macapuno ice cream from Polly Ann.
author: Nicholas F.

description: Too bad they are a little remote coz their ice creams are great. Thai Ice Tea flavor was our fav but the flavors we sampled (like 8 types) were all delicious. And very friendly service too.
author: Paiyu G.

description:
I'm not a big fan of ice cream, but when I am brought to the ice cream shop,. I go for the weirdest flavors.  

I was crushed when they didn't have enough for a scoop of DURIAN and  insisted that I just buy a tub.  A TUB? no one that I hang out with, would even go near a Durian or even go near me after I eat it. 

I ended up settling for honey dew. which was light and refreshing.  Since I am not a big fan of ice cream,. I only ate half and gave the rest to my friend who loves eating my germs! 

If you can't decide on which ice cream to order, you can spin the wheel.  If you are lucky, you may score yourself a free ice cream.  Love the gimmick, has a restroom and everything looks and smells clean. 

I will be back for the scoop of DURIAN!
author: Chanel L.

description:
One of the best ice cream places in the city.
Favorites:
-lychee
-mango
-taro

They used to sell the fake candy cigarettes. I'm not sure if they still do.
author: Matthew T.

description:
Too much betting makes me feel like a part time gambler.

I made a bet with bf earlier last week on who would get voted off American Idol. After watching the bottom 3, I chose...the blond girl with short hair...Alexis. I won this bet. Winner gets to choose Eggettes or Polly Ann's, i chose Polly Ann's. 

What do I always get? Pineapple ice cream, because it reminds me of the Dole Plantation's pineapple ice cream in Hawaii. This time, it didn't taste as good as i remembered. It tasted like the container and sort of icy, not as creamy. The only upside I could see were the bits of pineapple in my ice cream. Another usual of mine is honey dew, which is artificially flavored good.

Next time, I'll remember not to get pineapple...or maybe it'll be as good as the last time I got it.

APG kids hang out here & at Eggettes after school. I wouldn't want to be stuck here right when the last bell rings. Yeah...I went to APG, but I didn't come here after school...I guess I wasn't cool enough.
author: Kylie L.

description: I used to come here after school all the time and get the frostys. I dropped by today and there were no frostys. I got a scoop of durian and a scoop of lychee instead. The girl went to the back to get the durian. I instantly smelled a gas leak and was thinking oh shit, what did i get myself into. The durian smell was so strong and the color of the ice cream was neon yellow. I'm not a fan of polly ann's durian and would not recommend. Lychee, on the other hand, was not bad. I've had better but lychee was 10x better than durian. $3/scoop is pretty pricey to me. I do like their signs on the wall. I would not expect that of a ice cream store. Oh, and the big wheel is pretty cool.
author: Vivian L.

description:
AS GOOD AS IT GET! Is the perfect phrase for Polly Ann Ice Cream.  I love love LOVE the flavors that they have.  My favs are Jasmine Tea, Green Tea, Star Wars, Bumpy Freeway, Taro. heck I love them all.
And if you can't decide, you can always spin the wheel and the number you land on and the ones next to that number are the choices you get. And if you land on the RED TAG marked FREE. That means your out of luck on what flavor you want because it is FREE!!! yes FREE! i have never landed on free, but my friend has landed on it twice, but I never need the wheel to help me decided because I always know what I want.
Ever since I came here, I have been a fan and I always want to go there late at night to get my ice cream and my eggettes next door. yumm.!
author: Fanny C.

description:
Awesome ice cream.  This place is right by my house.  Be sure to stop here on your way to or from the beach.  It's easy to miss, but hard to forget.  They are also very affordable!

They have sooo many flavors, I haven't even come close to trying them all.

Spin the wheel, that's definitely the best way to choose which flavor to get.  And if you do, you might get your ice cream for free!
author: Jackson W.

description: Unique, asian themed flavors, BEST green tea ice cream in the world, gimmicky yet entertaining wheel game- what more could you want?
author: Stephie M.

description:
The biggest selection of ice cream in San Francisco! They were giving away free ice cream on Mother's Day. Gotta love that!

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description: What a little gem on Noriega!  Super friendly and nice staff and 48 interesting flavors.  I looooooved the strawberry rocky road!
author: William L.

description: Great ice cream shop! They have so many flavours! And their scoops are huge! Every time I go I get something different so I don't have a favourite flavour yet. Strawberry cheesecake is on the top of my list so far. Store is very clean and the service is very pleasant. It does get very busy after the school kids are out since its just a couple blocks away from few different schools.
author: Kasia G.

description:
Their ice cream sure brings out the little girl inside of me. After getting a scoop I felt like I was skipping home. 

Anyway, definitely SPIN THE WHEEL like everyone else says :)
author: Tina T.

description: Their green tea flavor is my favorite! If you're in the area, definitely try to stop by. Sometimes they have specials on yelp, where if you check-in, you'll get a free scoop!
author: Mable J.

description:
BEST. GREEN. TEA. ICE. CREAM. EVER.

I remember my mom would buy the big bucket of green tea ice cream for me and I would eat it all. It is that damn good.
author: Vivian L.

description:
I think my 20-something self would give it 4 stars but now that I'm 30-something and have been around the block a few times, not so much - just 3. 

We had green tea and durian.  Both were good but we also felt like the flavor faded as we ate it. Certainly a new experience; this fading ice cream. Worth a return trip but I wouldn't put it on par with some other excellent ice cream parlors in the city.
author: Shum S.

description:
Still love the variety, and I've softened my stance on the flavors.

I do still find that many of the flavors are good on the first few licks - but after that the flavor seems to fade.
author: Greg H.

description:
last year, this rating would have been five stars, no doubt. BUT THEN THEY CHANGED THEIR GREEN TEA RECIPE!!! im not sure what it is they changed but their green tea tastes like banana green tea now. YUCKK!!! WHYY POLLY ANN!!! WHYYYYY!!!! i even came back here twice just to make sure it wasn't a one time fluke. i gave them an extra star because i still like their jasmine ice cream but its nothing compared to their green tea. Well at least it used to be ....

AVOID THEIR DURIAN!! i have been eating durian my entire life and this is the worst attempt at durian ice cream i have ever tried. im not sure how you can make durian taste artificial but this place did it. 

again, im probably just super disappointed that their green tea isnt the same. they probably deserve more than two stars but im just that crushed...
author: Minerva l.

description: GREAT ice cream... Lots of variety... It'd be better to go on weekends otherwise there are lots of middle school kids hanging around the place.
author: Brandon N.

description:
Have no fear and spin the wheel! ALL of the flavors are good and you can't go wrong. Plus the wheel may land on the free spot!

They also have an awesome selection of candies like sour powers and fundips.
author: BYRON D.

description:
I love their green tea ice cream! The consistency is rich and creamy with a strong flavor of green tea that doesn't make it too bitter which is what I like.  When i first came here, I was seriously blown away by how many different flavors they had. 

Then...I saw it. The spinning wheel that everyone has been talking about. The wheel has all their ice cream flavors on it and once you commit to spinning it, you must get the flavor that it lands on or the two flavors next to the one you land on. This is really good if you're adventurous and just really can't decide on what flavor to get. Personally, I can never do this because I don't particularly like every single flavor that they have - I'm not a big risk-taker in that sense. 

I really like all the wacky signs they have posted. They probably don't mean anything...they're probably just a collection of signs that they have collected over the years and decided to put up.
author: Julia K.

description:
The ice cream here is really good, and Polly Ann has an excellent selection of flavors, featuring lychee, durian, jackfruit, green tea, and honeydew. Polly Ann has many flavors, I don't know how many. 30-40? I don't know, but it would take me a long time to work my around to all of them.

The prices are rather expensive for regular ice cream; I'm presuming it's because it's San Francisco and the rare flavors, but who knows why? Despite that, because the ice cream is so good, people always come back.

The service was good, the people behind the counter are super-nice. Be sure to try some new flavors you've never tried and be more adventurous. There were some annoying people with us in the store who only got the really lame flavors and didn't want to try any of the more exotic ice cream flavors that are really unique to Polly Ann. 

The ice cream was really good -- the texture of the ice cream (different from gelato, which is much thicker and denser) is very light and airy. The ice cream was not too sweet but very packed with flavor. The lychee ice cream even had pieces of lychee in it; it was so delicious. 

Generally, I prefer gelato over ice cream, but this is excellent ice cream. You can also buy ice cream in (half-gallon or pint or something? not sure on the size of the little tub of ice cream) a to-go container to take home, which is nice. When you have people over and just put out ice cream, they might not be so impressed, but they will be when you take out some crazy delicious honeydew melon or lychee ice cream. Yum!
 
One criticism: I had the lychee ice cream in my freezer for a while, and a few weeks later, the ice cream separated and tasted terrible. We had to throw it out, it was completely inedible. I'm not sure if that was because we left the ice cream out too long one day or if that's just how old ice cream gets? Just make sure to eat the ice cream quickly after you buy it to be safe. 

We're coming back, though, and we're still buying the ice cream to go but eating it a lot more quickly this time. Sooooooooo good.
author: Anh D.

description:
I liked it but I didn't LOVE it.

The green tea was definitely different. The ice cream itself wasn't very creamy, which I liked. It was most whipped and airy. The flavor wasn't as strong and sweet either.

I actually enjoyed the jasmine green tea ice cream more than the original green tea. More tea flavor I guess.

It's a great little place, but I'm not CRAZY about it.
author: Lynn C.

description:
Polly Ann you used to have such great green tea ice cream, creamy but a tad bitter, like a green tea latte. 

Now your green tea is sweet and artificial, like a so-so green tea cookie :(
author: Mia G.

description:
The ice cream here is ok.... I don't really recommend coming here for flavors that other places offers too, like green tea, coffee, mint chocolate chip... its good but it isn't anything special. 

You should come here if you are interested in new and different flavors that other places do not offer. Like my sister's favorite, gummy bear flavor.

The service here is ok... but i the girls that are serving here looks moody and pissed off a lot of the time. And there was a time when my lil sis ordered gummy bear flavor, and it turned out to be a similar flavor ice cream(same color) but there were no gummy bears. It was too late to go back because we were already driving... so she was very disappointed...

I give them three stars since I've went there a lot when I was a kid, and LOVED it back then... guess i grew out of it.
author: Alicia W.

description: the dude behind the counter was rude as hell. we wanted to try out a few flavors but told us it was enough after trying three with small servings, that wouldn't even get an ant full. anyway after sneezed onto the sugar cones behind the counter. dont order and cones, you might catch a sickness then all of a sudden turn out like him. gave it a 3-star rating since i got the original green tea. i miss the old location where it was much more of a friendlier staff.
author: Christian A.

description:
I have been coming here for over 18 years and I think I have finally decided I will not return for more ice cream. I miss this place when it was a hole in the wall and they were actually generous with their mix-ins. I keep coming back, hoping that maybe the ice cream I had was just a bad batch, but NO! They have been really, really stingy on the mix-ins. 

A few weeks ago my friends and I went to get some ice cream, and all three of us left the place wanting to cry. I ordered mint chocolate chip...but all I got was mint ice cream. My friend ordered rocky road, and all she got was vanilla ice cream. My other friend ordered kooky dough boy...but there was no cookie dough. You can't call ice cream "Kooky Dough Boy" if there is no cookie dough in it!! 

I came back a few days later...and I got the same experience. I came back a week after that...and still no difference. *tear*tear*tear*

I will not lie though, their green tea ice cream is one of the best green tea ice creams I have ever tasted in my life....but I don't think I will continue to buy my ice cream here until they start putting in more chocolate chips in my mint chocolate chip and more cookie dough in my kooky dough boy ice cream. 

Until that day happens...I will be going to Mitchells.
author: C L.

description:
Friendly ice cream shop located in sunset, there are a wide variety of flavors to choose from and you can always have some fun by spinning the wheel and you have to get whatever flavor it lands on or the ones next to it, the only  benefit from this wheel is if you can't decide what flavor to get, and the fact you have a chance of winning free ice cream.

The space is pretty small probably fitting at most 8-9 people inside.  And it is pretty hard to find nearby parking most of the time since it is only street parking.

The ice cream is pretty good quality at par with other higher end quality ice cream specialty stores but for cheaper.   Their asian flavored ice creams are their specialty with green tea, red bean, honeydew, lychee, black sesame, durian etc.

Definitely stop by here when you want some ice cream and try the classic favorites or you can take a chance and spin the wheel for some fun!
author: Adriel H.

description:
I came to this place because of the Japanese restaurant Fujiyama-Ya.  They use to serve the green tea ice cream from Polly Ann as their dessert.  This place is small, clean and is cute.  I like that you can spin the wheel if you cannot make up your mind and some of their messages on the wall are pretty funny. 

It is a place worth trying.  My suggestion is to try a sample before you make your final choice.  The flavors are different compared to other ice cream shops.
author: Rosie D.

description: first of all if you are a picky eater like me, dont spin the wheel. you have to get what it lands on.  i love how this place has so many different flavors of ice cream. and my fav. is the jasmine tea and the durian. i also like their sesame flavor ice cream. i usually get the durian flavor ice cream here. i bought my caucasian friend here once, and at first she said she smelled a gas leak only to realize it was my ice cream.  i made her try it, and at first she hesistated but she finally gave in and like the sweet taste but she might have a heard time getting over the smell if she were to order it.  you can order a whole pint to go, but it's kind of expensive if you do so. there's plenty of parking outside and it's right next to eggettes. i just wish there were more places to ice in this place. i also which that the supermarkets had more of their flavors.
author: Belinda C.

description:
Back in the day before I was tall enough to reach the flavor wheel, I thought I was the luckiest girl in the world cause my dad would treat my friends and I to Polly Ann's ice cream all the time after church.  Jump 15 years and I still think I have the best dad is the world.

My favorite flavor has always been black sesame.  Outside of the Asian desert realm, sesame ice cream is a hard find, but Polly Ann's always has it.  Green tea and mango also hits the spot.

if you're adventurous, try the wheel of flavor!  it's all fun and games until someone lands on a flavor like rum raisin. yuck!
author: Maggie L.

description: So many flavors to choose from! Can't decide? Just spin the wheel, you could even win a free scoop! =)
author: David D.

description:
I've been coming since the 80's.  The place has moved to the corner since than.  I love the different variety of ice creams they serve.  Very unique and not your everyday flavors like chocolate, vanilla and strawberry.  

My favorites are Sesame, Coconut, Mango and Green Tea.  Just to name a few. 

When you come here and you can't decide you can spin a wheel to help to you decide.  Stop by and give it try.
author: Rose F.

description: This is a great neighborhood ice cream shop, located about 5 minutes from Ocean Beach. There are a ton of flavors to choose from. My favorites are Turkish coffee, sesame, coconut and jasmine tea. Contrary to what other reviews may suggest, they do have more traditional ice cream flavors as well: rocky road, cookie dough, banana-chocolate, etc. I would definitely recommend stopping here if you're in the area and have a sweet tooth.
author: Gloria B.

description: Love the variety of flavors! I also spin the wheel when I don't know what to hv for the day
author: Michelle K.

description: It was good and very clean nothing crazy amazing but I do love ice cream and it did the deed. I had the star wars and mint  which was yummy as well.  It was really crowded when I went
author: Tawnee V.

description:
Marco Polo is A-OK! They ice cream can't compete with like Fenton's or Marianne's, but they probably have twice as many flavors! Including asian flavors like taro, green tea, sesame, etc. 

I find their ice cream good tasting, just not great, but I do come here occasionally due to their candy selection of sour belts, and cheap ice cream on Tuesday ( I think ). I usually buy by the pint and share with family. 

I recommend their coconut, sesame, and taro flavors!
author: Austin N.

description: I love the Jasmine Tea flavor! The wheel is super fun - you get 3 choices from each spin OR a free ice cream cone. Gives you the same odds as drawing a certain number out of a deck of cards (4 out of 52). The servers were very gracious in letting us try all of their flavors. If you want to try some unique flavors with awesome names, go to Polly Ann's!
author: Jessica L.

description: Love their Taro Ice Cream!  I could probably eat a whole tub of it in 20 minutes if my stomach can hold it, but I shouldn't .
author: Lauren C.

description: Love Polly Ann! so many delicious flavors and very friendly staff. Reasonable pricing for ice cream. You can always go for a spin of the wheel if you are feeling crazy :)
author: Nicole S.

description: I love the ice cream here! They have plenty of flavors and the ice cream is smooth and delicious.  They also sell their ice cream if you want to bring it home.  Their check in offer is also great!  I can't wait to come back and try their other flavors.  I had the strawberry and lychee ice cream. The ice cream here tastes true to their names.  The lady here was attentive and sweet.  The parking outside is not meter so you can stay longer!
author: Jennie W.

description:
I have been coming here since I moved to SF. This is an amazing local place where you can win a free scoops of homemade ice cream (if you're willing to spin the wheel and take your chances). The ice cream is all homemade, and comes in soooooo many amazing flavors, which rotate in and out all the time. 

I've never spun the wheel because I'm a coward, and I wouldn't want to risk missing out on their Gummy Bear (with gummy bears folded in) and Pineapple Sherbet (which has real chunks of fresh pineapple). 

I had never had a single bad experience there, until tonight. Maybe I'm crazy, but didn't this place used to be open until 10:30? Anyways, we rolled in the door at 9:55p, and there was another group of people there. They helped us, but as my friends were trying flavors and making their choices, the other employee started closing up around us. 

I'm not talking about just wiping down surfaces and putting up chairs. They were turning off the lights in the shop as my friends were ordering their scoops. I was sitting on a chair, waiting for my girlfriends, and the guy just stood over me until I got up so he could flip my chair up. 

The woman at the counter was also extremely curt. This was my friends' first time here, and they were trying to enjoy the experience and pick a flavor they would actually want to eat! They only asked for 3 samples total, which is not a lot. I've seen other people ask for way more when there was a huge line out the door, and they were never treated so rudely. 

It could not have been more obvious that they wanted us to leave. If they really didn't want to serve us, they could have told us they were closing. We would have understood. Don't treat the people who are giving you business like garbage you need to take out. It made me want to stop coming here, which really broke my heart. Until today, they would've had 5 stars, but they'll need to do a lot more to win back my love.
author: Rachel A.

description: This place is great!  They give out dog ice cream cones!!
author: Lisa M.

description:
My cousin brought me here after a wonderful dinner, and even though I was rather full from that meal and don't really have a sweet tooth, I had NO trouble whatsoever finding room for some very tasty ice cream.

I had a dark sesame ice cream that left me smiling for quite some time.

The folk were very, very friendly, too.
author: BL W.

description: Spin the wheel! If you don't want to risk landing on a flavor that you won't like... then get Pistachio Almond.
author: Jenn C.

description: I've never been brave enough to spin the wheel in case i end up with a large scoop of durian ice cream to enjoy.  The best flavors are coconut and green tea!
author: Samantha L.

description:
Come on down and spin the WHEEL-OF-ICE CREAM!

If you don't know what you want you can leave the decision to the hands of fate and spin the wheel. You might even end up with a free scoop. I didn't know what I wanted but I was too scared to leave it up to chance. I sampled exotic flavor after exotic flavor, some of which included sesame, blackberry cheese, peaches and strawberry, cherry vanilla, and root beer, but nothing tickeled my fancy. 

Two flavors get brownie points just for their names:
-American Beauty (rose flavored ice cream with rose petals, Mena Suvari fans please put your tongues back into your mouths)
-Wedding Bells (Strawberry with champagne)

I ended up getting green tea after sampling it from my friend's cup. I know. Nothing different and new but it wasn't too sweet and it was cool on the taste buds. Besides, we had just eaten Japanese food. 

The staff at Polly Ann is relaxed and patient. They will let you sample every possible flavor without showing any sign of annoyance. It's difficult to get stressed when there are corny signs adorning the shop from head to toe. One read, "I eat ice cream only on days that end in a y." Let the truth be told.
author: Rachel A.

description:
Another fav. place of mine. When I was at AP I use to go there all the time, they have the best flavors around. All types of traditional and non-traditional ice creams, plus doggy cones for the pups.

I will be picking up some yummy creams this weekend for a shower and I have no doubt it will be a hit!
author: Bella B.

description:
Spin the wheel if you can't make up your mind! You might even land a free scoop of ice cream on the house!

Anyhow, I tried the lychee ice cream and it really tasted like lychee. Didn't think it was bland at all and it was soft served. There were ALOT of flavors to choose from. The most interesting one may be Durian but it's not on the spin wheel. The waffle cone is about 50 cents extra but it seemed worthy...
author: Ced C.

description: I went there recently, was disappointed in the scoop size and the counter mentioned 5.50 for two ice cream cones and I gave $6.  We waited for our change and the person went to the back to go so something else!!  It was quite rude not to give change back as we waited and other employee was chatting with friends.  Never go back.
author: Brad L.

description: Polly Ann's has great customer service, a wide variety of amazing tasting ice cream, and it's even cooler that my parents came here when they were my age!! The wheel was a little too risky for me, but my sister went for it and won a free scoop of Caramel Ice Cream :) I got a double scoop of Kooky Dough Boy (Cookie Dough) and Honeydew, which both tasted great. The Cookie Dough was chewy and scrumptious while the Honeydew was sweet and unique, definitely an acquired taste, though. The employees were kind, helpful, and patient (very important for an indecisive girl looking at a menu of 46 amazing flavors). The shop isn't in its original spot in the middle of the block, but now at the end.
author: Jillian O.

description:
Not just the best Ice Cream in the Sunset, but possibly in the Bay. I have been coming here since i was knee high to a grasshopper.

I remember heading to the beach, spending the day yelling at the waves, collecting sandollars and climbing up the sand dunes then ending the day with a stop at polly ann's. My favorite as a child was bubble gum. I dont recall getting anything else!

I have gone back only 2xs in the 15 yrs since I have moved out of the City, just recently for my birthday.

This place brings back so many memories! I didnt spin the wheel cos some of these flavors scare me! lol but I used to as a kid! This time, I got the Green Tea and Baileys Irish Cream! it was soooooo good! I finished mines before he finished his! 

Polly Ann Ice Cream will forever be a lifetime favorite!
author: Jasara B.

description: I made a huge mistake going here because now no other ice cream place can compare. I love that they have a million flavors and an easy way to pick, the wheel. I wish I had spun the wheel but instead I went ahead and picked my own ice cream. It was amazing nonetheless which only makes me want to go back more and spin it. I can't wait for summer!!!
author: Andrew M.

description:
spinning the wheel is super fun, except for the fact that my bf should have gotten his free ice cream because it landed there, but whatever. 

I've tried the green tea one now, it's pretty decent. The root beer is good since it tastes like a root beer float. We've also gotten some other flavors and they've all been pretty good. 

ice cream is really my weakness on some days...
author: Nina Y.

description:
Great little ice cream parlor in sunset. They have about 40 flavors and you can spin the wheel the try to get a free scoop. If you don't land on free, you get to pick from the 3-4 other flavors, and chances are you will like at least one of them, so I pretty much always spin the wheel. Their ice cream is really creamy and the flavors are like BAM IN YO FACE. It's like two scoops for the price of one in terms of flavor. I love their coffee flavors and black sesame. They also have some exotic flavors like durian, jasmine tea, and taro! Don't be fooled by the line; it never takes that long. 

Also, you gotta get the waffle cone! It is so delicious and crunchy!
author: Joyce Man H.

description:
I've always seen Polly Ann ice cream at the asian markets or even at crepe places, but I've never been to the actual ice cream shop until yesterday.  They have a HUGE variety of ice cream, ranging from your asian flavors: lychee, taro, mango, young coconut, and some others; to your typical american flavors with less typical american names: rocky road (named something else), strawberry, pralines and cream, etc; then to your interesting combination ice creams (but not as interesting as Humphrey Slocombe, but better tasting for sure): strawberry oreo, some banana flavor, honey dew, gummi bear, just to name a few.

We decided to get the strawberry oreo and honey dew in a waffle cone (50cents extra).  The honey dew flavor reminds me of the honey dew boba...which means it's DELICIOUS!!  It wasn't too sweet--had the right amount of honey dew in it.  It definitely satisfied my boba craving. haha  The strawberry oreo was also very delicious... think cookies and cream but with strawberry!  The strawberry had good flavor and creaminess to it.  In fact, both of them did.  

Only thing I didn't like about Polly Ann's was the service... I only tried 3 flavors, and the server was already getting annoyed.  What the heck!  She actually asked to serve someone else because I took longer than 30 seconds to decide what I wanted after my 3 samples.  LAME. She didn't even offer to spin the wheel. UGH  -__-

Well, whatever... I like the Honey Dew and strawberry oreo enough to come back regardless of the service.  Oh, and they are also open late! So, there was plenty of parking at 8:30-9pm.
author: Diane L.

description: This place is like heaven and somewhere where I wanna work. Great customer service and great ice cream and very affordable. Workers are really nice and approachable and always smiling.
author: Robin C.

description:
I've been going here ever since they moved to the corner ( WORK IT POLLY ANN!) 
Hands down my favorite and not want to try anything else, TARO AND GREEN TEA!! :) 

Price is definitely cheap compared to Bi-Rite and Humphreys!
author: Lianne D.

description: This is my best friends favorite ice cream spot! I've now been there twice. I like Polly Ann's ice cream. I think the wheel is a really cool idea though I have never been brave enough to spin (one day!) I got the bumpy freeway (otherwise known as rocky road.) Although it is not one of my favorite ice cream places in SF I would for sure go back and recommend it to friends in the area.
author: Natalie G.

description:
I love coming here after school its a very cheerful place and the people working there are so friendly there, it's very cheap and my favorite ice cream there is cookies 'n cream :) I'm serious it's super cheap! I like how it's layed out, one small counter where you can buy candy and another counter where you can buy anything. They also give you testers if you want to try out the ice cream before buying it. 
          They sell candy, ice cream, kimchi, popcorn, hot dogs, chips, and soda. There is this soda they make that's called "suicide", a mix of many sodas. They have this freezer thing next to the small counter were you can buy a bucket of ice cream. If you do buy a bucket of ice cream to share with friends remember to ask for spoons!
author: Mellany Q.

description:
My first visit to Polly Ann resulted in 2 Fails, and 1 Win.

Chickened out from spinning the Flavor Wheel (and lost chance to win free ice cream) = FAIL

Chickened out from ordering the most unique flavor on the menu, Durian = FAIL

Ordered the Jasmine Green Tea = WIN

Polly Ann's offers an impressive menu of flavors, from the basic (chocolate chip) to the kid-pleaser (Gummy Bear) to the unusual (Durian!), so they have something to please every age and palate.  

The Jasmine Green tea was excellent both in texture and taste.

I will be back, and next time you can bet it will be a WIN-WIN situation.
author: Liz S.

description:
OH POLLY ANNS, POLLY ANNS. you make it so difficult because you were so mighty delicious back then when everything was so creamy and tasted like what the label said. The mango and all the other fruit/tea ice cream, I USED to get. Well, today my boyfriend brought me a tub of green tea which is NORMALLY my favorite BESIDES UBE. But the tub was lacking in green tea. It was all milky, like vanilla ice cream mixed with matcha powder to create a light tasting green tea ice cream and greenish vanilla ice cream. I took in a spoon because well, it is my fave! OH HELL NO. I almost had him take it back because of the lack of green tea! Green tea ice cream should have a flavorful and intense and eat spoonful should be like green tea heaven. I guess, I had better thats why I felt like polly ann's was lacking in flavor. Sorry guys a tub is now 6.75 and you'll need that extra .25 cent for the meter. So make it 7 bucks for a tub. I remembered when it was 6 without meter!
* they do have that wheel for you to spin and another things, but still. Kills me to say I have had better green tea ice cream.
author: Carolyn Y.

description:
3.5 stars.  This place has an amazing list of flavors, everything from Asian flavors like jasmine tea, lychee, and black sesame to things like American Beauty (rose flavor) and Turkish coffee.  I liked that the people working there were really friendly and let us sample as many flavors as we wanted without getting impatient.  I tried the black sesame (very rich and dense), lychee (had a realistic flavor and real pieces of fruit in it), and jasmine tea (tasted kind of like eating the ice cream version of jasmine boba milk tea).  They were all pretty good.

You can buy tubs of their ice cream from a freezer in the store.  I also learned that they sell the boxed popsicles that you can buy at stores like Ranch 99.  I actually really like their popsicles, especially taro, grean bean, and lychee.
author: Cassie H.

description:
I grew up on Polly Anns ice cream!

Guess what flavors..... taro, jackfruit and durian. YEP, durian.. 
tho i dont care for the real fruits, except jackfruit, oh boy, id eat some durian.
author: Cali L.

description:
Quality of Food 4
Ambience 3.5
Price 3.5
Service 4
--------------------------------------- 
Average 3.75

I go there a few times a month during the summer.
author: Mary W.

description:
Great flavors, but damn that wheel of misfortune.

I always love going to ice cream places that have a cornucopia of flavors especially when I can try some store made, tasty-treat-bombness, fresh ice cream (seems like an oxymoron, don't it?) . I hate paying 3 bucks for a scoop of something that tastes like Dreyer's from the store...

BUT I'm awful at decisions AND I have a slightly competitive[::cough::understatement of the century::cough::] /gambler nature about me, and cannot resist that damn wheel.

HERE'S THE LOWDOWN:
- spin the wheel**
   - if you land on a free: you get a free scoop of anything
   - if you land on a flavor: you HAVE TO BUY that flavor or
   one of the flavors on either side of that tile
**no redos!

...I have never gotten free. I think there are weights behind the wheel making it virtually impossible to win because I feel that the wheel always lands on the polar opposite side of a free...That or there's like a 5% chance of actually getting it anyway since there's so many damn flavors.

Nonetheless, this is still a win/win for me because it usually lands on a flavor that I might not have picked (thus making a decision for me...saving me the effort) and I get to try one of the many awesome flavors at Polly Ann. Yum Yum.

-1 star for promoting children [and me] to gamble by teasing them with hopes of free ice cream...and never letting them [me] win
author: Samantha R.

description:
guar gum, mono and diglycerides, calcium sulfate, polysorbate 80, cellulose gum, carrageenan, food coloring.

Stuff tastes ok.. but might as well get Safeway brand. It's ok if a place sells you ice cream with some corn syrup or maybe a single stabilizer but this is a factory food ingredient list.
author: Bob R.

description:
If there's one thing I miss about where I used to live in the Sunset, it was my proximity to Polly Ann. This was often my after-dinner go-to for something sweet. 

The flavor options here are epic. My favorite is the 4 C ice cream, which is a taste combination of chocolate, coffee, cherry, and champagne -- amazing!!
author: Kathleen S.

description:
Was here yesterday and i cant believe i havent reviewed it yet.  Ive been coming to Polly Ann's since i was a little girl.  Its an SF classic.  Some of the best ice cream you'll find in the city.  Whether you like soft serve, odd mix of flavors or asian flavors (like red bean, mmm), you wont be disappointed.  And for gods sake, spin the wheel at least once!  The wheel is legendary.  

Im an ice cream addict, i know the good spots, my tongue doesnt lie, and Polly Ann's is at the top of my list along with one other place.  F*ck Snapple, THIS is the best stuff on earth.
author: Juv C.

description:
My neighborhood ice cream shop. Best ice cream in the sunset. Rivals Marco Polo. A great place to cool down on a rare hot day in SF. Lots of variety. I like the spinning wheel, sometimes I get a free scoop, sometimes I don't. Their little sayings on the wall are very cute. 

I hope you don't get caught in btwn kids from APG.
author: Winnie L.

description: Came here with my dad after a crushing loss @ AT&T park. Sure brings back memories. The best thing is the wheel of death isn't the wheel of death anymore!
