Updating with a coupon my sister and I found online. 20% off all ice cream purchases!

http://www.pollyann.com/coupon.asp

Good ice cream AND at discounted prices too! Wooohooo!!!
author: Teresa Y.

description: Great variety of ice cream. But horrible and crappy service. Especially when one of the workers just puts one little scoop of ice cream in a cone and doesn't even bother to know the price of the ice cream.
author: Rob E.

description:
Durian ice cream?  I think Polly Ann's just found the way to my heart.  

A great selection of flavors that appeal to an asian palate (Jasmine Tea, Green Tea, Red Bean, Lychee) as well as the standard favorites.  
If you have trouble deciding, you can play the ice cream equivalent of the 'Big Spin'.

The Durian ice cream was so awesome, it inspired me to write a haiku:

Durian ice cream
Don't listen to what they say
I think you smell great
author: Tan H.

description:
i wanted to spin the wheel, but that'll have to wait for another day. i wonder if the wheel lights up when you spin it? signs point to no, but man that'd be awesome!

there's lot of ice cream, and even some fun quotes on the wall.
author: Ameer N.

description:
I never know what I want, but I never want what the wheel lands on either, but I appreciate the thought.
Dude the milkshakes are tasty-town. The fact that they offer DURIAN ice cream both disgusts and intrigues me..
author: Serene L.

description:
This place has the best 'Asian' flavored Ice Cream in San Francisco!  

Some of my favorites are: Green Tea, Jasmine Tea, Mango, Honey Dew, Taro, and.... there are more just that I cant think of it off the top of my head right now....

But Green Tea flavor is my all time favorite! After tasting the Green Tea from Polly Ann's... all the other green tea flavor from other brands doesnt taste right anymore.  Polly Ann probably have some type of secret forumla for it to taste just like how green tea should taste! The only time Ive ever tasted Green Tea flavored Ice Cream better than Polly Ann's, is when I went to some high class market in Napa, CA, which cost me a little over $5 for a single small scoop.

They also have this wheel of fortune like thing, where you can spin to get a chance to win a free ice cream, or spin to help you decide which flavor to choose.

Their products are also sold in many Asian supermarkets.
author: Jannifer H.

description:
Polly Ann is Mitchell's sister-in-law! =P

It's sort of like a neighborhood corner store but it isn't because a lot of outsiders (meaning people from diff neighborhoods) come here! Of course, one of those peoples is me!

I remember coming here and getting myself a green tea ice cream cone. It was goooood!!

And another time I came here I was with my cousin and sister and bf. It was around 3pm so there were a lot of middle schoolers (from AP Giannini??). It took us about 10 minutes to get to the counter and get what we wanted. That's the only thing I hated about going there. I wish we came earlier so we didn't have to get in line with the annoying middle schoolers. I was so annoyed I got a popsicle instead. =[

Screw the middle schoolers who forced me to give Polly Ann's three stars!
author: Michelle B.

description:
I came here as a kid to try the Suicide Drink. I barfed after and never came back here until this recent summer. Mitchell's ran out of my flavor, so I'm going to get a cheaper alternative. On hot summer days in the Sunset (rare), ice cream is bliss. The ice cream isn't super expensive. The store and bathrooms are also clean.

I tried the Sesame ice cream. It was great. Spinning the wheel is recommended. It felt pretty cool, plus I'm indecisive. You have a chance for a free scoop. If you aren't craving a specific flavor, spin it!
author: Glen H.

description: I love this place.  Love love.  Love.  They have so many flavors of ice cream and it's so cheap!  You can come here any time of the day and since I live so close I love randomly meeting up friends at Polly Anns even at 10 at night.  What I don't like about it though is that around 3 o'clock on weekdays all the teeny bopper middle schoolers and even high schoolers crowd the place.  I love how the exotic flavored popsicles are only $2 a box.  Nothing can get better than this.  This place definitely improved my quality of life.  Mmm.
author: Vivian H.

description: I love Polly Ann's to go tubs, but going to Polly Anns to just get a scoop of ice cream totally does NOT hit the spot. I usually go to supermarkets to buy the big tubs of green tea ice cream or their mango one & I'm especially picky about my green tea ice creams (as I mentioned in my other ice cream reviews) & I love how they tasted in the tubs, they're not too sweet & not too bitter. When I came to Polly Ann's, I was expecting their green tea to taste the same, but I was SO wrong because their green tea has too much of a tea flavor in it which makes it taste bitter. I also tried their other flavors, but they weren't really appealing to me. If I ever come to get ice cream again, I think I'll probably just go to the freezer & buy the tubs instead of getting the scoops.
author: Lisa T.

description: I can't get enough of Polly Ann's Ice Cream. Once of San Francisco's landmark. Must visit
author: Tin L.

description:
oh the memories, .. my first memory of polly ann ice cream wasn't actually going here as a kid with my mum and pops, it was actually when i was 17 looking for job. and polly ann was there for me. ;] thanks. 

i really liked working here, great people, servers and customers. and because i've worked here previously .. i really know the ins and outs of the place. 

first of all, the many many flavors of ice cream.. is really astounding, but they are really holding back on you guys. i've been through the flavor label box, and what you see in approximately over a year's time, how long i've worked there, is only about like 25% of all the flavors they have possible, some stuff are just too different, it would only appeal to a small group of customers, which is unfortunate. they should really make use of all the flavors. i generally enjoy every flavor i've gotten here so far.

TOP  8 Regular Flavors (the ones you usually see everytime you go) :
1. Taro
2. Green Tea
3. Irish Coffee
4. Red Bean
5. Seasame
6. Double Chocolate
7. Lychee
8. Coconut/ Coconut Pineapple


TOP 5 Uncommon Flavors (stuff you see once every two months or so):
1. Pumpkin, usually seen around the fall 
2. Rose
3. Banana Oreo, sort of common
4. Pistachio 
5. Mint Oreo, sort of common, too. 


i just really like oreo's in my ice cream =].. the infamous durian ice cream is always available to try, but i suggest it after you get your ice cream so it wont leave a taste in your mouth. ask for a doggy cone if you have your dog with you, the servers don't mind, sometimes they can't see over the tall counter. try to avoid afterschool times, cause it gets really busy from the middle school down the street. 

there are other food offered here, too. but those are really just filler snacks for the kids that come around. 

sorry for such a long review, i have so much more to say, but i would just be boring everyone.

go get some ice cream, be adventurous and try a new flavor.
author: Michael L.

description:
I've been on an ice cream kick lately -- check that, I'm always on an ice cream kick, as well as a baked goods kick, a confection kick, and pretty much anything else that involves sugar and fat kick.  But in contemplating ice cream, I've been taking serious stock about one of my regular haunts, Polly Ann.

There's really nothing terribly outstanding about Polly Ann.  The ice cream is good, but not exceptional.  The flavors can be eclectic, which is kind of cool, and the coffee cheese is pretty good (and where else are you going to be able to get Durian on a waffle cone)?  The place is always clean, with friendly staff, and it can get pretty busy some nights, although not by Mitchell's standards.

What makes Polly Ann a winner is the sillier than silly flavor wheel on the wall.  It's irresistible, and whether you choose to take your chances or not, you'll surely contemplate it.  That's built-in fun, and what is going out for ice cream if not fun?
author: Hugh B.

description:
I give Polly Ann's a 4.5 stars.
Love this place and I love the ice cream. I use to come here back in the day after school and get the frosty..... I have since graduated and am now getting flavored ice cream.  I usually get the lychee and mango on a sugar cone. I have now gotten smarter and am now buying the take home ice cream- much cheaper and a better deal. I know.... sometimes you need a fix right then and there.  
Polly Ann's offers so many unique flavors and it really is hard to decide on a flavor. There is a wheel that you can spin. If you can not decide, it will decide for you and you can even win a free cone. I have personally never tried spinning the wheel, I'm too picky with my ice cream. 
I would definitely recommend coming here for some great ice cream.
author: carebear l.

description:
We live right down the street from this ice cream shop so yes... we're about five months away from obesity.  But this place is that good.  When people think about SF ice cream parlors, they usually think of this place and Mitchell's, with the latter usually receiving more praise.  Well, PA's is not that far off.  Here's why:

1) Their selection of flavors is very diverse.  You can get flavor that's normally eaten by humans.  There are as many, if not more, flavors than Mitchell's.

2) It's in the Sunset.  That equates to minimal wait and residential parking.  We all know how painful it is to wait 15 mins for a freakin' ice cream cone.  After all, ice cream is a dessert, and desserts, by their very nature, are made for instant gratification.  You get that here.  

3) The wheel.  There's a wheel behind the counter where you can potential win free ice cream.  You have to buy whatever flavor it lands on, but then again, you could be getting it for free as well.  We've never tried this, but that's because we're not risk-takers.

It's open until 10 p.m., so if you're ever stuck in Sunset after the bonfire, come by.  It's great homemade ice cream without all the hype.
author: Kel S.

description:
I came here last weekend after not having been since high school, which was a long time ago. I do remember Polly Ann's as being the place where there was a large amount of security patrolling the unit at night. 
Oh wait... those were the Fobs. Yup, they're still there to this day.

Polly Ann, you're the man.
author: Jen Y.

description: I use to take my brother here often, he enjoys it but i thought it was okay, strange flavors to fatten up the kids i suppose, okay for a cheap date.
author: Tiff W.

description: Cute little ice-cream shop on the corner. What makes this place so unique is the wheel they have in the background. I believe if you spin it, whatever it lands on is what you get. The classic ice-cream that everybody needs and desires. Highly Recommended =D.
author: Jeffy Y.

description:
This is probalby the only ICE CREAM Parlor I would hit.  Never give my money to Baskin Robbins or the flakey people that are Ben and Jerry.

What you get here is about 350+ possible ice cream flavors in the store... yes 350!! 

When you get in, you'll see this huge wheel with #s and those numbers corespond to the flavors along the way. If you want even more flavors, ask the people their and they'll give you a huge list of what they have in the back ;) 

For $2.25, you get yourself a huge portion of a single scoop of ice cream and your choice of sugar or plain cones. For 50 cents more, upgrade to a waffle cone.

Spinning the wheel yields you a 1 out of 36 chance of getting a free ice cream cone. Otherwise, you will have your choice of ice cream flavors number that you land on, and the numbers next to it.  It's fun, and definately inviting.

I love Mitchells too, but this place feels more homey and down to earth.
author: Wilson L.

description: The only reason I come here is for the non-fat yogurt for my dog which is free with purchase. I don't crave for their ice cream; they're too artificial for me. They have Durian ice cream, and there's no real durian in it.
author: Lovetoeat A.

description: Great ice cream. My favorite flavors are cherry vanilla, mintie oreo cookie and thai tea.
author: Amy C.

description:
This has been the spot for ice cream as long as I can remember, or atleast as long as I was old enough to climb up on the counter. Where else can you have so many choices of ice cream tht you have to spin a wheel to decide? With flavors like Bumpy Freeway,  Pac Man, Ube & Macapuno, Turkish Coffee, Jack Fruit, and Star Wars! The possibilities have been endless for over 50 years. And who can forget American Beauty, rose flavored ice cream, or the free doggie cones that they used to give out way back when!

http://www.pollyann.com/
author: Jonathan P.

description: There are 2 girls when we got in there, one with a smile on the face and one without. We got the girl with no smile, that's fine, I just want to get an ice cream.  My husband ordered durian and this is what we came here for, the girl told us no more.  So we have to get something else, while we eating our ice cream and chatting, I smelled durian all the sudden and I saw the girl with smile on her face scooping ice cream for a customer.  She said oh this is durian and she even asked me if I want to try it.  I said why the other girl told us no more then the other girl heard it then came out and said it is hard scoping it!!!! Then she walk away. I was like how come the other girl can scoop it for other customer and u can't ? We came all the way from South Bay just for the durian ice cream.  She doesn't feel bad or sorry at all, sounds like is our fault to order durian.  Her attitude is horrible we are really disappointed, I wish I didn't place our orde with her so we can get our durian ice cream, will not return here
author: joyce c.

description:
Two words: Black sesame

If you're a disbeliever, there are a ton of other flavors to try too. Parking can be hard sometimes, and the location is pretty far from the main roads.

Also check your local 99 Ranch, some of them stock buckets of Polly Ann's now.
author: Jerry W.

description:
So my first impression of this place was walking in to see a lady walk out of the bathroom holding up one hand with a plastic glove...
She was cleaning the bathroom... not making Durian ice cream... hahaha... if you have ever smelled durian... you know get this joke...

and if you ever want to make a bet with someone... dare them to eat Durian ice cream... its a taste you will never forget... =D

On another note... This is definitely a neighborhood ice cream parlor with adventurous flavors like lychee, watermelon, cantoloupe, turkish coffee... to name a few... (they supposedly have 400 flavors... thats a lot of freakin' trips to come back and try to sample them all) however they only have 30 or so on hand at a time...
The ice cream itself is good ...3 stars , but I give them the extra star  for the "wheel" for those who cant make up their minds...
you know the ones you just want to kick in the butt when they just stand there going ... uhhhhhh.... whats that? is that ??? or ...???
Just spin... and let God decide... 
enough said...
author: Florio M.

description:
Mmmm...In a pinch, I guess it will do.  I just can't help but think that Polly Ann is the wannabe Asian Mitchell's.  Yup, I said it.  The place is clean, the kids who work there are polite, but it's just not the same. 

But they do get points for creative flavor names; bumpy freeway???..that's golden.
author: Emily X.

description:
I have been coming here since I was a VERY young child. I went to Holy Name school which is on 40th and Lawton and if you were a COOL kid you would go to Polly Ann's after school. Wow did they rob me of all my allowance money! As a kid, I loaded up on your typical sugary substances like ring pops, sugar sticks, corn nuts (omg so good!), and some special things like the Purple Dragon or Suicide... basically a combination of all their sugary drinks combined into one diabetic's nightmare in a cup. 

I love their green tea ice cream the most out of all their other flavors. Other notable flavors include mango and cookies and cream. In fact, all their ice creams are delicious EXCEPT durian. However, I doubt that any place has good durian ice cream. 

I wandered upon durian ice cream one day when my friend pointed over to a girl holding yellow ice cream. She asked the guy what it was and he said durian. She said she wanted to try some. He gave her a hesitant look and asked if she was sure and she said yes. The moment she and I tasted the ice cream our face turned inside out and we vowed never to eat it again.

I have tons of great memories here and am glad that this place continues to be the place for cool kids and still serves all of these things (purple dragons, corn nuts, etc.)
author: Christina B.

description:
I have been coming to Polly Ann's since I was a little kid and the only reason why Polly's is getting 4 stars instead of 5 is because I miss the tiny, cramped space that Polly Ann's was before the remodeling. 

Polly Ann Ice Cream is awesome simply because of the ridicuous array of flavors. This is no Baskin Robbins, take your 31 flavors and beat it! There are a large number of flavors that are more exotic and those are the best flavors. My favorite is the Lychee ice cream, but Green Tea is very popular here. If anything, i would recommend a mixed frostie dipped in chocolate...YEAH BUDDY! Two must-haves if it's on the board are Caramel and American Beauty (NOT together! gross!) American Beauty is a rose flavored ice cream that has actual rose petals in them. OH and of course, you can't forget about the giant wheel o' ice cream, though it doesn't do the clicky sound like it use to, the wheel is REALLY awesome if you can't decide OR if you want to tempt your friends into getting something other than what they normally would. 

Polly Ann's is also dog friendly. They offer a doggie cone, which is just a vanilla frosty, to anyone who brings their dog in.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Lots of cool different flavors of ice cream.

I bought 3 tubs of different flavors - lychee, mango, and green tea. My cousin ate it all in 2 weeks.
author: B L.

description: 5 stars based on tons of childhood memories and the best green tea ice cream I've ever had. Seriously, it's so good that it's life changing. Each time I have green tea ice cream, it's never up to snuff because Polly Ann has set the bar extremely high for me. It's a distinct taste, and the tea really hits your taste buds. I used to come here as a kid during the summers, back when it occupied the space a couple doors down. I'm all grown up now, and that entire block has gotten a major makeover, but I'll always love Polly Ann and their green tea ice cream. :)
author: Olivia V.

description: I like Polly Ann's because it's a mom and pop, Asian ice cream shop with its own unique spin on ice cream!  Random and fresh flavors like taro, green tea, but also has regular flavors like chocolate, vanilla.
author: Dee H.

description:
As a kid I would go in here excited to see what the wheel would come up with. It always seemed to land on some flavor I had no interest in and I never landed a free scoop. You'd think a little boy with such big dreams of winning a free scoop would be disappointed but then i'd get my ice cream and I would be set.

Even through a change of location and a remodel the wheel still exists and the ice cream is as good as ever.
author: Patrick B.

description:
I love this place!!!  I've been there about twice already and I'd like to try all the flavors.. a real unique place to get ice cream considering the names of ice cream are quite tricky to know what's in it.  

Today I got Star Wars flavored ice cream and even after eating the cone, I couldn't figure out what it was.. haha My girl said it tasted like Lucky Charms.. for her, she chose Durian flavor in which I tasted and told her it smelled like ass hahah

My favorite so far has been the Mint Oreo, while my girl loved Red Bean when we got it.  

Other flavors we've tasted include Mango Strawberry Swirl [too sweet for my taste] and Jamoca Fudge Almond [real good for those craving chocolate]

I say go to this place instead of Baskin Robins or Haagan--has decent prices as well.
author: JJ C.

description:
Polly Ann has a lot of flavors, so it's a little overwhelming going there. The ladies who work there are nice enough to let you sample a lot of flavors. I ended up getting the jasmine tea ice cream and the lychee sherbet. The jasmine tea ice cream was dynamite, really jasmine tasting. The lychee serbet on the other hand was a little weird. The ice cream here is really mliky tasting and leaves a milky aftertaste, which I'm not too fond of. It's pretty pricey for ice cream and is cash only.

Between Marco Polo and Bi-Rite, I would say Polly Ann is not as good as both of them. It's a fun store. Stop by if you are in the neighborhood, but don't go out of your way to come here.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Kevin is great! Special flavored ice creams. Feeling lucky? Spin the Ice Cream Wheel of Fortune and you can win a free scoop! Highly recommended!
author: Martin Y.

description:
Loves it!! Yummy ice cream!! And who doesn't like ice cream?! 

Saturday I drove all the way to the city for dim sum... and it was good. 
And I met Bella and Danny H... and they were good. 
And then test fired a cannon... and it was okay.
Then bella brought us all to Polly Ann's... and it was GREAT!

Super nice people, quick and entertaining service and the ice cream is drool-worthy! I had the "bumpy highway" which is really just a really good rocky road. Now I'd drive all the way to the city for Polly Ann's.
author: Alex L.

description:
Been here since I was 3 years old...I will always run in and examine the ice cream and the candy twice over. 

try everything! spin the wheel! read the fun posters!
author: Janelle H.

description:
I'm really disappointed about this place. I love ice cream and you guys totally ruined my experience here. It was a nice sunny late afternoon and my boyfriend and I wanted ice cream. We headed over to Polly Ann. First the drive out there wasn't worth it. Then we wanted two scoops of ice cream on a cone. The people working were saying "2 scoops?" Yes we would like 2 scoops on a cone. One on top of the other. Then the flavors had a weak flavor. Ice cream is suppose to have a sebtle flavor burst to the mouth and there wasn't any. It was more like a vanilla base in the flavors that we order. 

I'm never going back to this place.
author: JACLYN T.

description:
AMAZING,

The best natural fruit flavoredice cream in the city...With every taste, I reminisce about Hong Kong, where I had the best fruit flavored Ice-cream in my life.  From the wide range of Strawberry Mango, to Star Wars (inverse Rocky Road) this place has enough flavors to keep your palates stimulated for weeks.  

I personally love any of their Mango and Green Tea flavors and you can't go wrong with anything that has fruit.

Be adventurous...spin the wheel
author: J Y.

description:
Polly Ann's ice cream is special not because it tastes good but because it makes you feel good.  I know, I know.  You're going to say that all ice cream makes you feel good.  True, but Polly Ann's is the only place that likens a scoop of ice cream to a life lesson.  

From the quirky and witty wall plaques to the cleverly named flavors, everything about this ice cream joint is designed to give you more than a smile while licking your cone.  Chuckle at their funny (if a little corny) jokes, and knod your head at the wisdom conveyed by such signs like "If there's anything a depressed person hates, it's a cheerful person."

When you go to Polly Ann's, take a spin on their ice cream wheel.  The flavor it lands on may not be one of your choosing but try it anyways.  As in life, not everything always goes your way, but look on the bright side...at least you got an ice cream cone out of it.
author: Philip W.

description:
I've been coming here since I was 8. This place has never disappointed me. I like their new location, it's more spacier and less dingy than their old location. Parking has been a piece of cake every time I've been here.

You can find the Green Tea, Mango, Taro, Lychee and Coconut flavors at Safeway, Ranch 99 and other grocery chains. And if you're indecisive like me, you can take a chance with the giant wheel. Tons of various flavors to choose from, which is what makes them unique. My favorite now is the Black Knight, Champagne Strawberry and Jasmine. Yeah, everything I order has to have some alcohol in it (or at least just make me think it actually contains alky, I don't care really). It's what keeps me sane and from attending those AA meetings.....
author: Serena W.

description:
One of my favorite ice creams (along with Mitchell's)!  My favorites flavors are mango, lychee, and green tea.  You can ask for a sample if you don't know what flavor to get.

We prefer to buy a half-gallon tub to enjoy at home.  The only problem I have is my husband eats all the ice cream before I get any!  What a hog!

On their website they have a coupon (under ice cream) to print out for a 20% discount off all ice cream items.
author: Stacey L.

description:
I spun the wheel!  Twice!  Bumpy Freeway and Mango together in a single.  Not bad at all.

Oh no.  The story does not end there.  Yours truly decides the best course of action is to then willingly order a licorice/durian combo scoop.

24 hours, a minor head wound. and a passing hangover later: the sulfuric aftertaste still comes up with every breath.  I cannot begin to apologize to my kind drinking partners for putting up with what I can only imagine was the smell of death emanating from me all night long.

Bonus note: trying to "fix" the situation with shots of Jager and girly drinks is like covering up your smoker's breath with onions and garlic.

Four stars for the flavors that sane people eat, though!
author: K M.

description: I stopped by Polly Ann's craving their ice cream. At First I only wanted a scoop of lychee flavored but somehow I ended up leaving with one scoop of lychee, another container of it, and a container of Jasmine tea. Is it just me or is the ice cream kind of addicting?!
author: Jasmine Z.

description: Great childhood memory here, somehow I always get the Frosty sundae or JC. I love their seasonal Pumkins flavor around halloween!  Plus they hook up the dogs with a doggie cone!
author: DVS A.

description:
fav's:
- mint chocolate chip on a waffle cone with a chocolate dip, yes.. really.
- taro
- cookies and cream
- chocolate and vanilla mixed frostie with sprinkles (J.C. Frostie)
- ice cream cakes
author: Brian C.

description: A little over rated but my woman loves the black sesame milkshake. I'm going to have to ask them to use less milk in my milkshake next time. It's a solid place in the sunset and worth the trip for a date night. The beach is right down the street. And it's in a real quiet part of town so you can actually have conversation with your special someone. And if you can't decide then SPIN TO WIN.
author: Jon H.

description:
Today the Strawberry Oreo ice cream I had was able to bend my warped soul into a childlike stupor. With each lick my soul was reformed into a more enlightened state... then suddenly I hit the bottom of the cone, and exited nirvana as the last waffle cone crumbs left my tounge.

I think next time I'm going to dance with fate and spin the wheel.
author: Snaker Z.

description: Surprisingly, there was a ton of icecream flavors to choose from. This reminded me of a candy shop for some reason. I wasn't sure which to get, so I tried the vanilla/chocolate soft serve on a waffle cone and the taste? rich and yummy goodness. I only visited this place once so far, so I haven't tried their other flavors. The place to go to for ice cream variety and I can't wait to go back.
author: John P.

description: So many choices! At that moment, I had wished the line was longer so I had more time to choose my flavor but it was too late, it was my turn. Spin the wheel? I didn't want to chance getting a flavor I wouldn't like. I went with strawberry mango. DELICIOUS!! I will be back to try other flavors.
author: Laura L.

description:
I've been longing to come here ever since a friend mentioned to me that it was delish.  But as it is quite out of the way most of the time, it has taken me over a year to make my way over here.  And was it worth the detour!!  

I intended to get one of the flavors I saw on the reviews - Sesame, Green Tea, Durian.. but Jasmine Tea caught my eye and with the first sample I fell in love.  Actually, even before it landed on my tastebuds, I sniffed it and was already won over.  Maybe because I grew up drinking a lot of Jasmine Tea, but this was soo perfect.  It tastes just like Jasmine Milk Tea with a very aromatic jasmine flavor!  Mmm.  

I also sampled Pistachio Almond (ugly color) and Sesame (gooood) and Green Tea (creamy but couldn't really taste it after the other samples), and obvs had to get the Jasmine.  Best decision of my life.  

The sesame is a close #2 though. 

I need to come back here ASAP.
author: Lydia W.

description: an Ice cream cone for your doggie?  that was the hook for this Sunset district institution before the current owners took over. Now it's the Asian inspired flavors - taro, durian fruit (stinks, but tastes better than it smells), mango, green tea, macapuno (young coconut) and classics like french vanilla, chocolate and strawberry. It's good stuff! plus if you dare,  spin the wheel for your chance for a free ice cream cone. otherwise it's your paid choice of three different flavors. Polly Ann also sells its ice cream in grocery stores and in local restaurants. Make the trip to the Sunset for this wonderful treat!
author: Jeff W.

description: A+ for creative names.  We got the E.T. flavor that is peanut butter! Wowzers.  The ice cream is so light to taste, it is almost guilt free ice cream, minus the hot fudge...and sprinkles. Next I want to try the Jasmine Tea and Green Tea flavors.
author: Michelle M.

description: I used to come here all the time after church as it was only a block away.  It is probably the most eccentric and wacky ice cream parlor there is in terms of the flavors.  Not only do they have your standard flavors but they also have a vast assortment of colorful flavors to choose from.  Where else can you get Batman ice cream (I do not recommend it by the way)?  It's natural to be indecisive when there are just so many flavors to choose from.  Luckily they have a little wheel of fortune to help you decide if you are having trouble making up your mind or if you are feeling adventurous and are willing to try something totally new and outrageous.
author: Erich D.

description:
They have plenty of flavors at the places, hard to decided which one to have, banana, Choco, vanilla and more more sweet ice cream. I did enjoy the law fat fro yo which was yummie yummie. Polly ann and marco were super Phd in Ice Cream, check out the wheel of fortune spinning round and round. my friend try the green tea which was fub! 
You should do a head and try this place on a summer or even on a cold day when you need some sweet.
author: Jackie K.

description:
Amazing ice cream in so many unique flavors!
Like others, I have fond memories of growing up with Polly Ann's. It used to be a little hole-in-the-wall kind of place and my mom would take me and my brother every Friday after she picked me up from preschool. It even used to have this little step so that short kids could peer over the tall counter.
Polly Ann's has since moved, but the ice cream remains as good as I remember. I always remember to make a trip here whenever I come home from SD for breaks.
My flavor of choice used to be strawberry, but now it's expanded to include taro, jasmine green tea, sesame, and lychee.

Personally, I love Polly Ann's, but it IS creamier than other ice creams. So it is personal preference on this point.

OH and they also have little doggy cones if you stop by with your dog, and the wheel of choices if you're insanely indecisive like me sometimes. (:
author: Jen T.

description:
Come for the entertaining and thought provoking signs...seriously they are a riot.
Great flavors that are ever changing and a nice SF tradition!
author: ERICA E.

description: Polly Ann reminds me of the good days of my childhood when I would spend time at my grandma's house on Moraga St. However, this review is strictly for the green tea and sesame flavors only because those are two of my favorite flavors-especially at Polly Ann. I don't know about some people, but the green tea ice cream here is beyond delicious and I do not know any other ice cream parlor that can make it as good. Other brands make green tea into this powdery-nasty strong flavor and it is totally gross. You don't know green tea ice cream until you've been to Polly Ann! The sesame is really good too and I can never get enough of it! You should buy the take home containers though because it is a good way to help save a few bucks in the long run while getting more ice cream for you to enjoy whenever you want in your own home.
author: Samantha W.

description:
I'd give this place 4.5 stars, but not 5 because its black sesame ice cream is just so-so... But I still love this place. 

Polly Ann's makes some of the best Asian flavor ice creams available in the Bay Area. I've always been in love with their green tea, mango, and taro flavors. Their green tea ice cream is what originally got me hooked, and then I started trying out their other flavors. I really haven't tried any other brand of green tea that can live up to theirs. 

It's also fun to spin the wheel, but I tend to have specific cravings when I come here, so I never actually do it. 

fyi: If you like black sesame ice cream and for whatever reason are in New York City, you must go to Chinatown Ice Cream Factory. They make THE best black sesame ice cream I've ever had.
author: Yvonne W.

description:
Oooh Ice CREAM!!!!

This place is so cute with its bazillion types of ice cream and drinks.  The wheel thing is kind of fun when you're indecisive of what kind to get.  I've only been here several times and always finished my ice cream!  That is a good sign there because if it ain't yummy, I ain't eating =P  

Anyway, earlier I tried the sesame ice cream and it was delicioso!!!

Ooooh, and they have this cool sign that says they trust GOD but for us it's cash only ... something like that .. I thought it was cute =)
author: Chau L.

description: Yummm! This place feels welcoming and clean. I always want to spin the wheel but chicken out. I end up just getting the green tea and mango or jasmine. The staff are always friendly and I dont feel uncomfortable asking for a sample like I do at (some) other ice cream shops. Does get crowded at times, but the line is fairly quick. Longest ive waited was around 5-10 minutes, so that is nothing compared to bi-rite.
author: Lucy T.

description:
This is a really solid ice cream place.  On the SF scale of ice cream, Polly Ann's is better than Bi-Rite but not as good as Mitchell's.

Polly Ann's has some really delicious flavors and tons of options.  Even better, I've never had to wait in a long line to get ice cream like I've had to at some of the other ice cream shops.  Their cookies and cream is pretty delicious (which is always the first thing you should test at any ice cream shop) and I like the way the inside is decorated.  I wish I had the balls to spin the wheel of ice cream, but I usually wuss out and get something I know I'll like.

Only complaint is that it's in the Sunset, which is a little bit far for me.  On the plus side, though, I can usually find parking.

Recommended.
author: Chad H.

description: When Ted and Polly owned the place it was good. Now you go and it's lots of Asian flavored ice cream done bad. If Ted had done durian there would be lines out the door to get a cup of stinky ice cream.
author: Eric K.

description:
Love this place!!  I buy their ice cream at the supermarkets though since I don't live in Sunset :[

4 stars because it's getting a bit expensive and the ice cream cartons are getting smaller LOL *sigh* :[
author: ABC Z.

description:
Something about eating ice cream on a rainy day helps me think twice before going postal at work and kicking everyone in the groin. 

Polly Ann has really good home made ice cream.  I usually get the mango or the green tea ice cream.  They also have pretty good hot dogs.  Not Costo-good, but at least better than 7-eleven.  Try spinning the "wheel of indecision" to see if you can get free ice cream.
author: Sang K.

description:
Good ice cream.

I like the sesame seed, taro, and soft serve. 

I always get it on a sugar cone.
author: Joseph F.

description:
What would be better than having Ice cream on a hot sunday afternoon.  Ok i'm pretty sure you can think of a few things better but work with me here!! 

Polly ann's has a huge variety of flavors.  If you can't decide, they got a big wheel like wheel of fortune to decide for you.  Some flavors are pretty interesting like durian... for those out there in yelpland that doesn't know what durian is.. uhh yeah.. it's that spikey asian fruit that smells REALLY REALLY bad.  Well they have it in ice cream form and it's actually tasty if you can hold your breath.  

Overall this is a place to visit for ice cream.
author: Allan T.

description:
Watching my dear friends' reactions as they try the Durian Ice cream -- my treat so they'll feel obligated to finish... PRICELESS!  I especially like hyping it up like it's the best thing eVer! Hah!
Catch me enjoying my traditional Rocky Road.
author: Michael B.

description:
This was the place to go after my soccer games as a child. I love going by there even though it's moved a few spaces down from it's original spot because it brings back memories from my childhood.

I would walk my dog to Polly Ann's and he would get an ice cream just like mine.

 I think it's good that this place is still around because of what it means to the area. I would put this place in the same category as Doggie Diner as places that help create childhood memories. So much has changed in the Sunset but, some places like Polly Ann's age gracefully and become a place you would want to bring your child after their soccer game and experience the same things you did as a child.

If you go and feel adventurous spin the wheel. If you want a safe choice go with Mango, Chocolate Chip, or Mocha Chip.
author: Mario O.

description:
Favorite ice cream shop to stop at before going to the beach. I usually spin the wheel cuz I am fond of most of their flavors (maybe except licorice). My favorite is Turkish coffee.

They have a sign that says $10 min purchase with debit/credit card, but only once have they ever put that rule on me. All other times they seem to let it slide.
author: Lily Z.

description:
Wheel 

of

 icecream!!!!

( screaming in the crowds )


spin spin spin if you don't know what to order, but then you might end up getting something you might not enjoy.,

I've tried this place numerous times, and still wtf? it's just ice cream, nothing special, and nothing worth the price ...... cool to go with children but not worth going towards the sunset to get it
author: Nina M.

description: Mixed frosty. Spin the wheel. Sour belts, snacks, suicide drinks. DAMN I still remember all these from my days at AP Giannini back from 1997-2000. 10 years later, still loving it.
author: Calvin D.

description:
Two-and-a-half

I was just so disappointed! I had heard such wonderful things. "Could it really be better than Real Ice Cream and Marco Polo?"

It's not.

They have a good amount of flavors, but it doesn't exactly blow my mind. And any enjoyment I could have extracted from the Wheel of Dairyfortune was marred by the frightful surliness of the girl spinning it. I suppose I, too, would tire of spinning that damn thing. I would have nightmares about flaming wheels of ridiculous flavors, and cutesy teenage girls lisping, "I just don't know! What should I choose, ohmiGAAAAAWD!"

Anyway...I got the taro. It was okay. It wasn't as creamy or as sweet as my two pillars of ice cream glory. Too bad.

On to Maggie Mudd, as my Lame Bay Area Ice Cream Tour continues!
author: Center J.

description:
Polly Anns still gives free dog cones but a new statewide heathcode means you and your dog have to sit or stand outside... Grrr!!!!! and sometimes Brrr!!! (we are talking Ice cream in the avenues afterall).

Yes every Asian, British, and American flavour you can think of plus a few you have probably never seen before.
author: Valerie F.

description:
I'm not a big ice cream fan but I am a fan for Polly Ann, just for the fact that it has Ube ice cream. I remember visiting the Philippines and having this super crazy purple ice cream with bits of ub (purple - duh - yam) in it. Seriously weird to Westerners, seriously yummy!

The never seen to have the weird flavors that I've seen on their website though. I wonder if it's just marketing or if they really have a zucchini flavor!
author: joann p.

description: All kids love this place. The roulette wheel seals the deal. Some very odd tastes here have made this a family favorite over several generations. Staff is unfailingly patient and good to kids and dogs.
author: Fred  D.

description: This is a great neighborhood ice cream parlor.  There are over 40 flavors and more than half are uniquely flavorful.  My go-to flavors are Turkish Coffee, Honey Dew, Pistachio, and Green Tea.  The best part about this place is that you always have a chance to get free scoop by spinning the wheel of ice cream destiny.
author: Chris A.

description: I love going to Polly Ann's whenever I travel into the city since the ice cream is delish, the lines are quick, and the flavors are plentiful!  I love getting their red bean ice cream and I can say that their jasmine green tea is also such an awesome flavor!  another nice thing is the ability to find parking close by as well.
author: Anna V.

description: I've heard about Polly Ann's since I was in middle school, but I've never been until now.  So far, I've tried all the old school ice cream parlors in the city, Mitchell's, Joe's, and Swenson's.   The one flavor I measure all establishments by is chocolate.  I wasn't particularly blown away by the the chocolate ice cream here.  I'd have to say it tasted better than Swenson's, but unfortunately, the batch I had was icy.  I would say that Mitchell's is by far the best in the city and a close second is Joe's.  Polly Ann is fine if you happen to be in the area.
author: Naomi N.

description: A friend took me here, and I'm not so sure why he was so excited about this place.  I had the green tea ice cream.  I had tried the banana, coconut and pistachio ice creams too before I settled on a flavor, but all tasted kind of artificial, and didn't seem to reflect the natural flavors as much.
author: Nadiyah S.

description: A sunset district institution! So many flavors to choose from- love the lychee, green tea, and mango. Just go in and spin the wheel. Life is short- live a little! :)
author: Cynthia J.

description:
Their signs are funny, but they should have had someone who actually spoke great English write em up.  

Shorter lines than Mitchell's, also closer to my house.  

EZ parking.  Great green tea + mango ice cream.
author: Dong T.

description: So disappointed when I went here. Not even a classic style ice cream, not creamy more icey, old flavor. My chocolate mint chip had only a few chips in it. I actually threw it away it was not worth the calories. Instead went and bought ice cream at the grocery store atleast I knew what I was buying. Looks cute inside, felt fresh in the interior design, not super friendly... oh well.
author: amy g.

description:
all I can say is I love ice cream that tastes like flowers.
Best flavors I've had here are

JASMINE TEA,  and
ROSE 

can you say YUMM! ?  

And I highly recommend the 4 packs of ice cream bars.  Any flavor.
author: Michelle L.

description: My kids like bubblegum ice cream so came here and got them some. They each had a scoop and there was only one bubblegum in each! They were totally disappointed.
author: Grace T.

description: Green tea ice cream! Hubby intro me to this place. I was surprised to see that they had durian ice cream. No thanks =) Best green tea ice cream I've eaten! So glad that they sell this at Ranch 99 now! Woohoo! Parking isn't too bad here. No where to sit so you're standing around eating your ice cream. A lot of flavors to choose from!
author: Jenny P.

description: I've been coming here since high school, before they moved and rennovated. 18 years!!  It's definitely better than Baskin Robbins.  My favorite flavors are the Turkish Coffee and Green Tea.  The milkshakes are hit or miss.  It's usually either too think or too watery.  It's never consistent.  If you can't decide on a flavor then have them just spin the wheel.  You get a choice of three flavors, so you're not stuck with just the number that you land on.  You can choose between the two flavors on either side of the one that you actually land on.  I've hit free a few times.  One time we hit the jackpot and got two free cones back to back.  Needless to say I went out and bought a lotto ticket that day.   Parking is pretty easy in the area & staff are always helpful.
author: Stacey L.

description:
This review is for the ice cream they sell at Asian grocery stores, as I have never been to this location. Hands down the best green tea ice cream in the world! Way stronger Macha taste than any actual cup of green tea you're likely to find anywhere in San Francisco. If you took Dreyer's Green Tea ice cream (which really isn't that bad) and reduced it to a 10:1 concentration, then maybe it would be as strong as Polly Ann's.
Lychee is tasty too, almost whipped in consistency though, whereas the green tea is very dense.
author: Johnny O.

description:
Me:  I'd like a scoop of durian, please?
Guy Behind the Counter:  Uh, are you sure?  Maybe you should try a sample first.
M:  Ok.

So I tried a little spoon of that creamy, pungent goodness.  It wasn't that bad, and I was feeling adventurous that day, so I went ahead and ordered it.  A little girl was watching me eat my cone, pointed at it, and declared to her mom that that's the flavor she wants.  I advised her that she should try it first.  Durian isn't for the faint-hearted.

Creative flavors with whimsical names attached to them--this place serves up great ice cream.  If you're undecided, spin the wheel and let it choose a flavor for you.
author: Rhoda A.

description:
Janice says:  What fun, but what a headache!  I know i'm in for a treat whenever I come here because obviously I'm going to have some ice cream flavors that aren't in the normal ice cream shop or store.  But then when I go in I just can't decide.  There's too many choices!!!  

Oh I JUST realized why there's a huge wheel on the wall.  It's for people like me who can't decide.  : P  Why didn't my bf tell me earlier?!

Derek says: One of the hidden gems of San Francisco.  The first time i had it was when i was determined to find seasame flavored ice cream  because i was able to try it in Hong Kong but wasnt able to find it here until pollyanns.  It was a small ice cream shop but has been remodelled to a pretty nice place.  They have a large variety of different ice creams like rose ice cream.  Good place for ice cream in the sunset
author: Janice's A.

description:
Spin Spin Spin
That's only if you are indecisive
I think you have to spin after you've tasted 10 flavors
Well, that is what they told me
LOL

It's fun to watch your friends and random people try Durian ice cream.  Will their face wrinkle up or will it turn to a smile?  Be patient while the people in front of you try the flavors.  Sometimes it can take a while.

Cool spot, interesting signs on the wall, and the ice cream is good.
author: Po L.

description:
This is your place to get durian icecream! Oooh yummy stinky goodness! Of course it can't compare to the real thing, but stinkin' close enough! ;)

Free doggy cones!

Love their frosties :) Prices sure gone up since middle school ....
author: Allyson L.

description: I've been eating grocery store bought Polly Ann's ice cream since I was a kid.  Last week, my sister and I walked from 7th Ave to 43rd to get to Polly Ann.  We realized we were a little lost when we didn't see Polly Ann anywhere!  Thanks to our trusty phones, we were able to look up the correct address.  We backtracked to 38th Ave.  The long walk was worth it!  I tried the Almond and the Durian.  The Almond was especially delicious!  I will definitely walk another 10 miles to get more Polly Ann ice cream!  (The employees were really nice too!)
author: J T.

description: This is a San Francisco MUST! I remember stopping here on the walk home from middle school, and the ice cream is as good today as it was way back then. If you like Green Tea ice cream, they have the best! I hear the rose is also fantastic and that Bumpy Road should not be missed.
author: Larina M.

description:
Here is a write up about the history of Polly Ann Ice Cream from a local historian. See web link:

http://www.outsidelands.org/polly_ann_ice_cream.php
author: Jonathan F.

description:
I live in the Sunset and I've never set foot in this ice cream shop until recently. Shame on me! 

What happened to the website? It listed all 500 ice cream flavors and even had a discount coupon!

I bought a tub of black sesame ice cream. OMG! To die for! The other flavors that come in a tub is green tea and also mango.

The employees and owner were very friendly.

I'll stop in on the next hot day in SF.

There are only two reasons to live at the end of the earth (okay, at least the western part of San Francisco): 1. The end of the earth. 2. Polly Ann's.

Neighborhood ice cream shops simply do not get any better than this. I've walked through rain, I've walked through high winds, I've run 9 blocks from where I live just to get to Polly Ann's before closing time.

And every single time I decide to try a new flavor and ask for a little teaspoon to taste it? I get a whole cone anyway because they're all good. (Haven't braved a whole scoop of durian yet though.) And every single time I collapse there and slowly nurse my ice cream cone in mute wonder of the glory of Polly Ann's ice cream.

If one of the apartments above Polly Ann's suddenly becomes available for rent I swear I'm moving in a heartbeat.
author: Sunny V.

description:
I LOVE YOU POLLY ANN.

Your ice cream is so creamy and flavorful, oh how I wish you were closer to me instead of being a 30-40 minute drive...

My favorite is their green tea ice cream. It's rich in flavor, creamy, and just had me craving for more! Usually I won't be able to come here for months so I would always buy 2-3 tubs of different flavors. (Green tea is always a must!) Their ice cream is so yum, even in the winter I'll eat a couple scoops. Nothing can stop me from taking even ONE bite of their ice cream.

I like how they have this giant wheel of flavors behind them in case you can't choose. It makes things interesting as well as allowing you the chance to try something new without having you think of saying yes or no for more than 10 minutes! :) 

Their service is quick and their workers are pretty nice. No one ever gave me "the look" before or something like that. Sure they didn't really smile at me, but hey- check out was smooth and quick!
author: Jessica T.

description:
The remodeling is such a blessing. It was one thing when I was kid and I could squeeze in there and stand on the great little step ladder thing they had on the door, it became not so much fun when I got to tall for that ladder and had to squeeze in with the masses.

I have always loved, loved, and loved all the great signs they have to entertain you while you wait. Plus four stars alone for the doggy cone concept.

You know a guy is really trying to impress you, when he takes you here, spins the wheel, gets durian, and eats it anyway...
author: Dixon T.

description:
Dear Polly Ann:

I hate you. 

Your abundance of flavors, your delightful cheekiness, your take-out line, your sassy wall sayings, your free yummies for dogs... your good hours on weekends... for years, I was able to keep you at a distance because I lived 45 minutes away, but now that I live THREE BLOCKS away, your influence is oppressive. I've lived here for ten days and you've already inflicted nine scoops' worth of yourself on me in total. 

Make no mistake, no matter what the rest of me thinks, I have seen the enemy, and it is you.

Yes, I know that I've just moved here, and that you've been here for 50 years. Sure, go ahead, blame the victim.  

This is war.

Sincerely,

Mig's Waistline
author: Em-eye-gee P.

description:
It's been a long time since I last reviewed an eatery on Yelp. How long? Going on 8 months. That's enough time for several people to go through several relationships. I don't have the math handy, but that's a lot of new significant other time.

So what could bring me out of retirement? 

Obviously, it's Polly Ann Ice Cream. I wasn't really retired, in reality, the time was spent attempting to come up with a clever way to tie the neat ice cream selector wheel to that part of Mad Max: Beyond Thunderdome where everyone chants "Bust a deal, face the wheel" 
In lieu of wit, I'll just say that the wheel is cool. (Mission: Failed)

Here's a list to better describe this place!

 - Hundreds of ice cream flavors

 - The only place I've ever seen with 'suicides' listed on the soda menu

 - There's a kid there that always wears a Tool shirt

 - If you read the plaques on the wall, do so as a grandma. You'll enjoy                 them more.
author: Zack F.

description:
I think the ice cream here rocks. The Green Tea is awesome. I haven't spun the wheel yet. 

I am torn to say it's better than Mitchell's... but it's WAYYY better than marble slab or cold stone creamery
author: j d.

description:
Pretty good ice cream! I love the selection of flavors. The wheel is a good idea but I haven't spun it yet because I am afraid.


I LOVE ICE CREAM!
author: Chatree T.

description:
one mix vanilla frosty pleaseee!!

brings back good memories.

but the prices are never the same :P
author: Carol Y.

description:
I was impressed. I thought it was just an ice cream shop and then I saw it ... the wheel . This was the greatest idea ever. It reminded me of the animaniacs wheel of morality but this was aimed at choosing the ice cream. I ended up with lemon strawberry cheesecake which was awesome. 1 scoop and I was done. Apparently it's made by hand which explains why it is so heavy. Good deal though. There was durian on menu too. However it was not available on the wheel. I am guessing it is not ordered too much or they had some probs. all in all though I will return :) 



Note: Credit accepted over 5 bucks :) It doesn't sound like a lot, but it is when the ice cream is that filling.
author: Greg G.

description:
My brother brought home a quart of pistachio ice cream from Polly Ann's.  "Ooh yeah", I said to myself.  As a fan of the flavor I looked forward to this frozen treat.

Opening the top of the lid omitted a green glow as if a lump of kryptonite were being exposed.  My smile gradually shifted to one of confusion once I realized that the ice cream was littered with tiny green dots.  It was as if this frozen treat had contracted green chicken pox.

After reminding myself that I love pistachio ice cream it was easy to forego this aberration.  Tasting the ice cream was similar to my first sight of the dessert: pleasantness that slowly turns into confusion.

The ice cream is creamy and satisfying until those dots come into play.  These green freckled fiends have the texture of shaved coconut with the lingering flavor of floral and plastic components.  It's not the most unpleasant of flavors, yet I would opt to not have these dots.

I couldn't figure out just what these dots were made of even after reading the ingredients.  Even though I was confused by this "food rash", I still finished my bowl.

___

I wouldn't purchase Polly Ann's pistachio again, but based on the quality of the ice cream I am very interested to see what other flavors they have to offer.
author: Michael H.

description: Mmmmmm I love me some Polly Ann's Ice Cream. Taro and Cookies and Cream are my favorite flavors.
author: Jessie E.

description:
I have been coming here since I was in high school (long time ago)...
They have all the odd flavor ice cream with the Asian flair before it was "in"...my favorite is  the rose peddle flavor...Truely a San Francisco institution.
author: Peter W.

description: Yay, I'm a fan but I still love Mitchell better. One of these day, I will compare the ice cream side by side. I love rum raisin ice cream. I tried Rum Raise, Lychee, the 4CCCC, the Peach Brandy. Mitchell has a more stronger kick to it. Very similar. Mitchael has more topping and the staff made a big different. Friendly.
author: Lily T.

description:
Get this...over 500 flavors!  500!  And guess what?  If they don't have it, they'll CREATE it for you if you just tell them your crazy idea.  How can't you but LOVE this place?  Check it out:  http://www.pollyann.com/default.asp

Of course they rotate the flavors so not all 500 are available at once.  I love the black sesame, taro, red bean, green tea, lychee, mango -- who'm I kidding -- I love them all.
author: Jeannie C.

description:
I've lived three blocks away from Polly Ann's for the last 9 years and it's still one of my favorite places to go. I also went to A.P Giannini Middle School, which is one block away. This is a great place for kids to go after school just to hang out with their friends or pick up a snack on the way home like I use to do. 

A few years ago, Polly Ann's moved from their small hole in the wall in the middle of the block to a spacious spot  on the corner. Everything about it is so much better! The only problem is the dramatic increase in price after the move (minus one star).

If you can't decide on a flavor, spin the wheel! It's probably the most exciting experience aside from a Warriors game. Once the wheel stops on a number, you can choose that flavor or the two adjacent ones. Chances are, you'll end up getting at least one flavor that will taste pretty good...just in case you don't like Durian ice cream. 

And if you're thirsty and you're having a really bad day...don't commit suicide! Order a suicide soda! It looks gross but...it's not! You can order a purple dragon too! I don't know what's in that one either...but try it for fun!
author: Allan M.

description: What I liked most about this place is the variety of ice cream flavors and desserts on their menu.  However, I still prefer Ben & Jerry's, even though there is definitely a price differenece between the two.  We had the "Kooky Doughboy" ice cream at Polly Ann's but Ben & Jerry's Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough beat it with its creaminess, sweetness, chunks, and fresh taste (usually).  I would still go back to Polly Ann's and spend $2.75 for a scoop but only if I was in the area.  I would not journey to the Sunset just for it.  Now Eggettes, on the other hand, is right next door and I would venture to the Sunset for their eggettes!
author: Mary Ann M.

description:
I remember when this place was a hole in the wall and I would stand on a step stool just to see over the counter and point to the flavor that I want or check this spin the "wheel" if i couldn't decide on what I wanted. Whatever flavor it landed on, thats what I got. 

Now, its a really popular place on the corner which caters to like everyone. You can even find this ice cream at Andronico's or Bell Foods in Marin County. I grew up with Polly Ann ice cream and I can never get enough of Lychee, Green Tea, Mango and Passion Fruit! Durian ice cream is another interesting flavor. Try it if you don't know what it is. ^.~
author: Jason C. J.

description:
Their Lychee ice cream is yummy but it is impossible to resist the element of suprise by spinning the wheel. I think the marker has to be straight down and in between the 2 pegs in order to win. I've witnessed a couple encounters where the spin didn't have quite enough momentum to "click" into the free zone and it was stuck on the peg.  Both instances ruled in Polly Ann's favor, even though it looked more than 51% on the free side.

Some advice: if you want a refund, go to Helen Wait
author: Arnold L.

description:
I LOVE icso creeem. ^_^

i mean who doesnt??

I used to come here just to spin the wheel, AND I ALWAYS GET A FREE SCOOP!!!!!! 

that was until one day one of the employees, not the elderly woman, or the old man, but some young punkass skank that said my FREE SCOOP was not on the arrow, WHICH IT REALLY WAS!! that broke my winning streak, bitch.  Even her co-worker whispered to her that it was on the free scoop mark, whatever.  UGHHHHHHH i was so angry that i shouldve just walked outta there. fck her. i hope she smells like durian ice cream for life.  even though that is one of my favorite flavors.  Others do not like the smell of it.

other than that I used to come here for the cool O.g. candies, cigarette gum, pop rocks, squeeze it drinks. and the Suicide soda, (a mixture of ALL sodas). makes you feel like a kid again when you get on a sugar high.
author: kim w.

description:
Homemade macerated fruit* + Polly Ann's Mango Ice Cream =
new favorite, easy dessert

*sugar, brandy, mint leaves, lemon zest, peaches, nectarines, pluots, plums, hulled strawberries, blueberries.  marinade at room temp for 2h.  chill.  serve.  enjoy.  run out for another tub.
author: K W.

description: wow... the last time i was out here was 2-3 years ago when i used to have my acura integra with the police siren which the owner call up on me, haha. there was so many flavor so i dunno what i want, they said you want me to sign the wheel so i did, got this banana nut ice cream which not bad at all... oh yeah, on them nice days when its hot... very long lines :P
author: JessePanda C.

description: Great ice-cream and selection of flavors, but where're the service smiles? And customers shouldn't be the ones saying "thanks".
author: Jayce T.

description:
I used to come to Polly Ann when I was in high school, when it was this little shabby hole in the wall that got super crowded. There was only a narrow space in front of the counter, and stuff tacked all over the wood paneled wall behind you. I remember the wheel having some heft.

I was so stoked when I eventually moved to a house around the corner from Polly Ann...only to find it closed and the building set to be demolished! A year or so went by, and then it reopened! And the place was laid out better, is probably cleaner, but for some reason lacks character. The wheel looks like it's made out of pressboard. 

Still, the same hand-painted flavor signs, and the same funky flavors. I think the ice cream is good. I've spun the wheel a couple of times and I tried Strawberry Rocky Road one time, which was actually very tasty. I wish they had it more often. If I get ice cream, I get it here. I hate to confess it, though - on the off chance I get to go out to Mitchell's, I find the flavors there more varied and tempting.

It's still a hit with the kids after school, though, and maybe time will "season" the place so it regains some warmth. They need some wood panelling or something.
author: Karen H.

description: I was SUPER excited when I walked into Poly Ann's for the first time. I LOVED it! They have this awesome wheel that you can spin if you can't decide what flavors to get. I love this place! My inner child comes out when I come here. :))))
author: Tanya S.

description:
Love this place for alot of reasons but mainly because it brings back great memories. i.e  when i was younger when i went to summer school @ A.P (which was 2 blocks away) i spent most of my everyday after school at polly anns, even if it has to be by myself.

Back in the days this place use to be really small, not excatly at the corner that they are located at now, but as i remember it was pretty much crowded most of the time mainly w/ kids and neighborhood folks. 

the Polly Ann now is well improved and updated. It's more spacer now and has stools for sitting. Area of the store are kept really clean. The greatest thing is that they kept their tradition of making diverse flavors of ice cream flavors. Not some other places would have, even if they tried it of course would not taste the same.

It's also fun to try the wheel when you can't make up your mind. I've always had great times and memorable moments whenever I go to polly anns.

It's always a fun time when there is ice cream. 
But WARNING ***** exceptions to the lactose intolerant !!!! STAY AWAY
author: Ellen K.

description:
You know an ice cream shop is good if its getting at least 4-5 stars in the coldest, foggiest city in California.

Polly Ann's was a hole in the wall way back when... And then they renovated. Now it's a welcoming door to yumland. They have so much flavors, half of them unique flavors that one has to try to know if it's going to be good or not. Their serving is very generous and their prices are very reasonable. It's always a pleasant stop at Polly Ann's and an experience every time.
author: Gabe R.

description: This place is okay but not worth the trip again.  I would rather go to Swenson's than come here again.  For a single scoop, you get a pretty small scoop that's around $2.75  Yes they do have a lot of different flavors but half of them you need to ask what they are. There isn't a sign that explains what unique flavor consists of.  The ice-cream was okay but not worth the ~$5+ for 2 small single scoops.
author: Michelle A.

description: Yummy in my tummy! Love the ice cream but the prices, not so much. Call me cheap but I'd rather pay a few more bucks for the whole gallon of ice cream than just a tiny scoop. The wheel of flavors is cool if you can't decide.
author: Jenny T.

description: Not sure why this place got such high reviews. The icecream is not cheap and not special in any way
author: E T.

description:
all the original and weird combination flavors you want! it's always hard to decide what you want. and if you really can't decide, let the wheel determine your flavor! 

try the mango raspberry swirl, it's tropically refreshing.
author: Charmaine L.

description: I love their remodeled ice cream store, 20 years ago this place was so tiny.  You can't go wrong with any of their flavors, just ask for a sample if you're not sure.  Their smallest cone is free for the kiddies which is such a great thing.  I love their blueberry, macapuno and mango ice cream.  Yesterday I tried their champagne sherbet - slightly pink in color, refreshing and so yummy.  Couldn't also resist getting a couple of pints of orange sherbet to go.
author: Emy B.

description: I've been having this ice cream as a kid. I must admit I haven't gone in a while, but it was always very good and creamy. I still am not sure if I like this or Mitchells better. Guess I'll have to try both again and update ya later.
author: Petra S.

description: I've been coming here for YEARS! I always make an effort to stop by after eating in the city! This place is soooooo yummy! It's got all kinds of flavors more than your usual baskin robins or Ben & Jerry's! They have exotic flavors and your standard flavors if your not daring...Totally worth a stop if your visiting the city!
author: Lynda S.

description:
I think it's 4.5 for me. It has a special place for me since my mom used to take me and my childhood friends when we were young. 

Green tea ice cream is the only thing I ate here for the longest time. It was so special and exciting for me to eat as a kid and I still love it. 

But now I like having black sesame, taro, red bean, turkish coffee, jasmine tea as well. 

The texture of the ice cream is really great and creamy. I think it's 4.25 dollars for two scoops which isn't too bad because the scoops are big. 

Only bad thing is it's out in the middle of nowhere. But you can go to Toyose for dinner then get Poly-ann for dessert! They are just a few blocks from each other.
author: Mastiff B.

description: Came here on a rare sunny/warm day. This place offers unique "Asian" flavors such as jasmine tea, Thai tea and lychee. We ordered durian, green tea and mint Oreo cookie. The ice cream was very creamy and strong in flavor. It was so good we bought a quart to bring home.
author: Angie L.

description: Their ice cream's pretty legit. The fact that they have a STAR WARS flavor made my life complete.
author: CHRISTIAN P.

description:
They have a ton of flavours here, ranging from pretty obscure (licorice) to very Asian (durian) to very American (Rocky Road).  If you're feeling indecisive, you can leave your ice cream choice to destiny by spinning the numbered wheel.

I tried a few flavours (including the licorice) before deciding on the jasmine tea.  I like things that taste like flowers, ok?  It was creamy and refreshing at the same time.  My friends tried the nutty coconut & black sesame and they both proclaimed them very good.

If you've ever been to or heard about the Chinatown Ice Cream Factory in NYC, this is basically San Francisco's version.  It's better too (more flavours, less expensive).
author: Sonia C.

description: I come here once in a while for some Asian flavored ice cream. I love the black sesame and taro flavors. If you want to get your moneys worth, you can buy the prepacked pints in the freezer, but its limited to certain flavors. This isn't the place to go to if you want to sit down for dessert. There are to bar areas with little stools for maybe about 5 people each. Prices are decent and parking is easy to find. if you want to sit down you can buy your ice-cream and walk down to eggettes and order some egg puffs to eat with your ice-cream.
author: David N.

description: Strawberry Cheesecake ice cream FTW.
author: Kimberly B.

description:
Literally, I had been meaning to go to Polly Ann's for about 4 years now, and yet we never seemed to make the trip to the ice cream place with the wheel. Until Labor Day weekend.

The wheel is totally fun. If you tell them you are allergic to all three options the wheel lands on, they will let you out of the seemingly binding contract you enter into before the spin. There are lots of signs with funny sayings, and the staff are nice and don't mind explaining all the odd names of flavors. Here are a few I asked about:

Star Wars: Mint with marshmallow, popular with the kids
Gummi bear: tutti fruity flavor ice cream
Bumpy road: Rocky road
Strawberry rocky road: strawberry with marshmallow and walnut, no chocolate

The downside was that I think Ben & Jerry's has spoiled me. I was expecting a bit more from a small ice cream shop, a bit more of a homemade taste. There are no chunks of things in the ice cream. My butterscotch swirl had no visible butterscotch. Most of the flavorings are chemical. The black raspberry tasted cold, and that was about it. No fruit at all in that or the strawberry rocky road.

I like supporting local businesses, the creative flavors, the nice people, and the wheel spin. I just wish the ice cream was a bit better, but like pizza, even bad ice cream is still pretty good.
author: Alissa S.

description: Ice cream is probably my favorite food in the world. And yes, it is a food haha. Screw Baskin Robbins, Polly Ann has 50 flavors! The flavors alternate throughout the weeks, but many staple flavors are always available. My favorite is the Caramel Cookie Dough. I am obsessed! But they have only had this flavor twice in the 7 months that I have known this place. The staff is friendly and helpful. If you're feeling adventurous, you can spin the wheel but you have to choose between the three flavors that it lands on. If you're lucky, you can land on a FREE spot! I always get two scoops on a waffle cone, so yummy :]
author: Khanh C.

description: Been eating ice-cream here (and buying their products at Asian markets) ever since I was in middle school back in 1991!  Love their durian, lychee, green tea (the best!!!), and taro ice-cream flavors!  The only reason I docked them for a star is that their ice-cream is sooooo creamy that after eating and you soak the bowl/spoon, all these yucky oil floats up.  That's when you're amazed at what you just put inside of you.  However, I understand this is the reason why their quality is SO good and consistent.  I also have to say their price is a little high and can be lowered a little.  Other than that, yes, I would come again until I am old and will bring my newborn child when he gets older to enjoy ice-cream too!
author: Pao Y.

description: One of my favorite places from childhood.  Still gotta spin the wheel!
author: Isaac Z.

description:
The ice cream would be worth the drive - we cross the city to refill on our lychee ice cream. Get your lychee, green tea, mango, strawberry cheesecake, durian, coconut, sesame, red bean, and much more here.

Fortunately, Asian grocery stores have started to carry their ice cream at what appears to be a quite reasonable markup (1.75L is $6.75 at Polly Ann's HQ, and only $6.99 at Sunset Super about 20 Avenues closer to town). Bombay Ice Creamery also carries a few flavors. You lose out on availability and variety when you buy from the middleman, but if your flavor is in stock, you win!
author: Rob T.

description: we came to pollyann after crab and garlic noodles.  i had the black sesame and it was good.  there was a slight aftertaste.  not sure what it was ...
author: claudia y.

description:
Really easy and fast way to get a good cone of ice cream.  I've taken a group of over 20 people here and they were all taken care of within about five minutes even with some of them deciding to spin the wheel.  The portions are just enough and the prices aren't bad.    What more can you say about ice cream?

I do wonder how ice cream shops stay open during the winter... some people must really love it all year long.
author: Chris C.

description:
Not bad for handmade ice cream, but I'd have to say Mitchell's and Joe's are way ahead.  All the kooky flavors are fun, and the ice cream roulette wheel is fun, but for some reason the ice cream seems a bit light.  I prefer it more dense and creamy.  Plus, Hershey's chocolate syrup on a sundae is a cop-out, nay an offense to good ice cream.

On the plus side, parking is usually easy, and it's clean and roomy inside since they moved.
author: Ken B.

description:
I don't know if they still have it, but spin the wheel!  This place always reminds me of my first date long long ago....ahh...the memories....like the corner of my mind....

Great Ice Cream!  I like this place better than Marco Polo because of the selection.  The old shop had a ton of personality and it was fun getting free stuff from your friend's who worked there in the past.  Especially on a hot day like today.
author: patrick o.

description:
Hope my review isn't too skewed because this place is a *ahem* sponsor.  Regardless of that fact, this ice cream was the shizzle.  It had a consistency not that far off from gelato.  Flavors abound, themed to neighborhoods,movies, and moods.  The wheel of frozen fortune is a pretty cool gimmick too, though the employees didn't spin with as much enthusiasm as I'd have like to have seen-doesn't the wheel have to go one full rotation to count? 
Decent prices for their sticked ice creams too $2.95 for a six pack of the coffee light is a great deal.
It's just too damn far.
author: Sam N.

description:
If you like your ice cream on the creamy side, this is the place for you.
Had the jasmine tea flavor and it was really good!  It wasn't too sweet, definitely had the jasmine tea flavor, and super creamy!  

Couldn't remember why this name sounded so familiar until after I'd left.  It's the same brand of red bean popsicles that I had for most of my childhood!  

Had I not already had a full meal from Koi Palace and shaved ice from 37 degrees, I would have a larger portion and try the other flavors.  I need to come back when I'm not as full and try spinning the wheel as well!
author: Anna L.

description: The ice cream isn't bad, but the customer service is.  I took my kids into Polly Ann today after dinner and my eight year old had a small scoop on a sugar cone.  Once he started to take a lick outside the store, the scoop fell to the ground.  I immediately brought the cone back minus the scoop and let them know what had happened thinking they would replace the scoop for my sad eight year old.  The worker declined and recited the policy of "it's not our fault once you left the store".  I was upset because I knew other ice cream stores were not like this and vowed not to go there anymore because it sets a principal that demeans the patrons.  I guess they don't value their customers.
author: Sylvester S.

description:
Daph's rating: 3.5 stars
Jan's rating: 4 stars

Jan wanted to take me here since he went here w/his cousins before and thought I'd really like it. Jan's tried their banana oreo before and was hoping that they had it, but unfortunately they didn't when we went so he just got their pistachio almond. This place has a bunch of interesting flavor combinations and change their menu daily. We wanted to taste their American Beauty ice cream cuz it was odd since it had real roses in it. REALLY interesting flavor, but would never get it. I didn't know what I wanted so I just settled on their double chocolate ice cream. They were good, but I didn't think it was all that. I'd still come back and try more flavors though.
author: Jan And Daph S.

description:
I haven't been to this joint in years but they were the only place that I remember that still sold those fake candy cigarettes that I used to love to "smoke" when I was younger.  I'm not sure if they still sell them but I guess it's not good to promote smoking to the kids.

Anyways, they have a ridiculous selection of weird ice cream flavors and had a little spinning wheel that chose your flavor if you couldn't choose.  They also have a selection of different drinks here and there that I enjoyed when I was in high school.

I'm sure AP Giannini kids still come here after school so try not to be there after 3pm when it's consumed with kids.  I wonder if they still have asian kids working here still. Everytime I went, there were always two serving. I haven't been to the new location so this review for the old one.  Same thing anyways....
author: Jason Y.

description:
The best ice cream in San Francisco.

I've been coming here forever. They have the best flavors. Ever since I discovered their Sesame ice cream, I crave this stuff! Love it. Go there and spin the wheel if you're adventurous.
author: vicki c.

description:
I'm not much of an ice cream person... but i am definitely a mango person. 

Mango Ice Cream.... 

makes me do a happy dance.
author: Angelinaaah h.

description:
Who's idea for the wheel of luck??? I swear anything doing with percentages and averages or games of chance is a hex for me. I ended up with the durian flavor ice cream flavor which by the way was my favorite unusual exotic flavors. HOLY CRAP...it's good. I don't care what others say about this stinky fruit...me so likey!
