I would love to try the sesame or if they have it champagne strawberries next time. The price for a jr scoop is $1.95. much cheaper than 31 Baskin Robbins.

I would like to have them give me sorbet options next time...that's my newest kind of iced treats.  

Good service, place has only a couple stools but still a good place for unusual flavors.
author: Pauline L.

description:
Good Ice Cream!! Right next to Eggets.. FREE ICE CREAM SPINNER?!

Ok, so the deal goes, you spin the wheel get whatever flavor you land on.. I get Cookies and Cream. Yum, next person comes spins it, FREE ICE CREAM.. ok he got lucky, then he spins it again and FREE ICE CREAM AGAIN!!! wtf? why'd i just miss out on two free ice cream possibilities boggles my mind.

But I digress. The ice cream is good, the place is clean, and the service is just. Great place to chill out, literally!
author: Eric A.

description: Ice cream was great, cost was outrageous. For a 1/2 cup of ice cream (1scoop)...2.25. I got two, and the total was more than what it costs to go over the bay bridge during rush hours.  I could have bought 1 gallon of  my favorite bryers rocky road for the price of 1 cup here.  I am not normally a gripper but today I am!
author: Heather T.

description:
I've been coming here since I could walk.  Always good.  Though bad ice cream is kind of hard to find.  I love the lychee.  The strawberry mango doesn't really taste like either though.  

The soft-serve can be awesome.  One time it tasted like bacon.  Not sure why.  I still ate it.  And sometimes it's icy and watery.  So be careful.  When they do get it right...it's awesome.
author: Bruce B.

description:
If anything, go just to spin the wheel! 

At Polly Ann's, you get a wall of homemade flavors to try from.  Between the stacks of flavors is a wheel listing all of the flavors and some free spots.  If you don't know what to choose, you can ask someone working to spin the wheel and you can choose from the flavor that it lands on or either one beside it.  But you must choose one of them.  If it lands on a free spot, then you get a scoop of ice cream for free, and you're stuck with choosing your flavor once again.

Old San Francisco and mango are my favorites to date.  Beware the Durian flavor.  Friends don't let friends smell like Durian =)
author: John L.

description:
Have been going here since I was 4 yrs old. 
The most unique Ice Cream store ever. Although it was better BEFORE it was rebuilt, it is still incredible to a great extent. Flavors are still good, just doesn't have the same atmosphere as it used to, but at least it has seats now.
author: Alan L.

description:
Fantastic place for a sweet tooth, or for those who want to indulge for their guilty pleasures. If there was an ice cream store that did not disappoint, this would be it! 

As you first enter into the store, you are met with a giant wheel, alongside it, a plethora of ice cream flavors (48 or 49, just can't get the exact number) on a giant panel.

Onto the taste portion: ABSOLUTELY DIVINE. I've tried quite a few of their numbers (I've actually visited 3 days in a row, each time with a new guest): Rum Raisin, Green Tea, American Beauty, Mango and Strawberry Swirl, Strawberry, all in which are good in their respected rights.

I've found that simply buying a one-scoop ice cream with a waffle cone (an additional 50 cents I believe... but do not be mistaken for a sugar cone) maximizes the portion of your ice cream with your price ($3.25). As you devour your ice cream (and your cone!), there is still ice cream at the bottom of the cone! A rare find nowadays as I trudge through my life.

However, you can continue to bring the happiness home with you as you had experienced right there! Thats right, they sell take home tubs, (24oz I believe) for the price of 4.99. However, they have a Tuesday special where you can also buy 2 for the price of 8$, an amazing deal already!

Please make note that be weary after 3:30 pm, that is when the boppers come out from their schools and mob the poor ice cream store!
author: Kevin V.

description: Many, many flavors, including oddballs like dragonfruit. Nice people and a very clean store. The wheel of fortune to select a flavor looks fun, but I've always found flavors I wanted to try, rather than trying my luck. The ice cream is very tasty. If my son were reviewing it, he'd give it 5 stars for sure. But I still judge ice creameries from my memories of Bud's ice cream (particularly the bittersweet chocolate...) in the 70's, so I'm stingy with my 5's. So, my 4 stars are very much a recommendation, if you're anywhere near Sunset and feel a need for a cone, try Polly Ann.
author: Lance L.

description:
i stumbled upon this place for the first time during my teen angst years. i'd have major senioritis (though i was only a sophomore) and i'd cut school to hit up ocean beach with my moleskine and camel wides to write the next alanis-inspired song that will inevitably shoot me straight to stardom and past the whole college roadblock.

unfortunately, i am not alanis. hell, not even a jewel or a shirley manson.

but PAIC was one of the rare things that made me happy during that sad, confusing time in my life. PAIC helped me through bouts of depression, various identity crises (sexual, specifically), and other assorted 'my-so-called-life'-caliber teen drama.

just an observation, but lotsa hot girls come in here. so if you like eye candy with your ice cream, head over to PAIC!
author: Vanessa D.

description: Polly Ann is one of my all-time-favor Ice-cream places in the city. There are tons of favors that you can choose from. I usually go for the spinning wheel in terms of picking flavor since there are so many of them. I have not yet tried anything that I didn't like, maybe because I am easy. lol It is a must have experience if you are in the city.
author: Lianna D.

description:
Definitely a classic. Has over 40 flavors of ice cream, so it satisfies all your cravings. Feeling indecisive? Spin the wheel and it picks a flavor for you! Their very own Ice Cream is not too sweet but also filled with flavor. The serving size is definitely well worth it too. Come with friends or family or both!

You can sit and eat or walk out and eat, parking isn't difficult to find, and located in a quiet neighborhood. But if you're looking to avoid busy times, avoid anytime between 2:45-3:45 on weekdays, it's literally the center of all middle school and elementary school kids.
author: Serena J.

description:
This place has gotten better over time. Remember when it was just a small shop selling candy and other junk food in addition to ice cream? There use to a dog poster advertising ice cream for dogs. I have fond memories of this place - the store that all the kids went to after school to buy snacks. We were supposed to be in the library studying but we were out buying candy instead. Ah - the memories.

This place has now moved to the corner with a bigger space. The ice cream is phenomenal. The ice cream is packed full of flavor. My favorites: Green Tea, Mango, Sesame, and Lychee. I usually go and pick up the pre-packed ice cream in the freezer off to the side. They offer a wide variety of flavors. If you ant to sit down and enjoy your ice cream cone, there are seats on the side by the window.
author: Candace F.

description:
I just tried Polly Ann over the weekend, and had a banana split with Strawbango and Honey Dew flavored ice cream. It hit the SPOT!  A friend of mine had a more chocolate/mocha flavored ice cream which was also tasty.

Polly Ann definitely has a ton of flavors to try. Next time around, I'm gonna spin that infamous wheel to see what I get.
author: Janet R.

description:
FIrst off.. let me say I'm not a big fan of ice cream.  I eat it every now and then.. but I don't crave for it like most people.  

I've tried many flavors at Polly Ann and was not disappointed.  Heck... I even took to spinning the big wheel a few times.  A lot of the asain flavors (lychee, sesame, mango and even durain) are pretty good.  Taste is not a problem.

Prices are par with other shops.   

The thing that makes this place special is it's position in the area.  Polly Ann has been a staple in the outter sunset as long as I can remember.  Memories of coming there after school and meeting my friends there for candy brings happiness to my old heart.  If anything, I would compare Polly Ann to a 1950's candy shop in which it would be a gathering place for all the neighbourhood kids, a great social environment!
author: eric l.

description:
Reasons to LOVE it:
1) SOOOOOOOOOO many flavors & SOOOOOOOOOO different from ur plain 'ol Vanilla ice cream!
2) It's CLEAN
3) I love the random quotes around the place, I think it's funny.
4) It's FUN with it's wheel to help out those indecisive people.
5) It has those ice cream cones for DOGS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  =D
6) I believe they still have those specials on pints if you go on a certain day, though I forget which day it is.
7) Lots of parking... in SF... that's a PLUS!

Reasons not to like it:
1) The workers NEVER seem happy!  Most of the time, rude.  =\

Good outweighs the bad.  So, this is a good place for you if you want some ice cream!
author: Michelle Y.

description: Polly Ann's ice cream is pretty good - it's all hand made. The only draw back is that  it's EXPENSIVE - a golf ball sized scoop was $3.20! Next time I'll make the extra trip to Mitchells where you at least get a decent sized scoop
author: Bumble B.

description: Wide range of ice creams, although alas they did not have a carmel one when I was there.  The three flavors I tried were all very delicious and they give pretty large scoops.  If it wasn't so far from where I lived, I would go here again.
author: Alured P.

description: Great selection of unique flavors with Asian twist, like red bean and lychee (which can also be purchased in 5 gallon containers at Ranch 99). Too bad it seems they didn't have watermelon anymore, my prior favorite which was available before the store remodeled.
author: H K.

description: I've been going to Polly Ann's since I was in elementary school. In those many decades of being open, their ice cream has remained my favorite 'mom and pop' shop in the city. I've been getting their amazing turkish coffee since I was 8 years old. Never lets me down!
author: Sara A.

description: They have lots and lots of flavors but I'm not a fan of the texture of their ice cream.  Not creamy and smooth enough for me.  I also don't like any of their chocolate flavors--not enough chocolate in them IMO.  My favorite flavor is Old SF.  It's creamy pineapple with almonds very original.
author: Kandi K.

description:
Oh the Sunset District. You claim to be apart of the city, but it takes me longer to get from anywhere in the sunset to Down Town San Francisco, than it does from my house in Daly City. The only reason I visit is because I have friends and family living in your endless rows of city suburbia. 

When I agree to hang out with my cousin we usually do three things. Play rock band until his wife is tired of us singing to songs we think we know, but we don't. Go down to Golden Buddha so we can get horrible service, but filling food (I had the gourmet "chicken" and rice last night, quite tasty). Cut through the park and get some P.A.I.C. 

Polly Ann Ice Cream has more ice cream that you can shake a stick at,(... but why would you shake a stick at anything in large amounts?.. I don't get that... and I still don't get the phrases "peach keen" "the bees knees" "same difference"... ok I get "same difference," but I just don't like the sound of it... ) From classic flavors like Rocky Road, to not so classic flavors as 5 korean characters that I can only guess translates to "ginger," or "death to round eye."

By now you must know that Polly Ann has a giant wheel of destiny, that turn turn turns, and it will give you an ice cream flavor you may or may not ever again yearn. The first and last time I spun the magic wheel I got the fun flavor of "4 c's," which turned out to be c1 = chocolate, c2= coffee, c3= cherry, and c4= champagne. I like all the things separately. I like some of them in pairs, but all four, It ended up tasting like MEAT ice cream. I did eat it though, and I ended up liking it, but I don't think I could willingly order it.

I guess what P.A's is a little famously kind of known for is their durian ice cream. It is a tropical asian fruit that smells and tastes like gasoline... or like when you are trying to light your gas stove... it taste how that gas smells. I've tasted it... and yeah it wasn't great. My cousins friend actually ordered it once, and threw up, silly white guy, but I have been told that it is a very popular flavor, and I believe them. 

It gets three stars because you are no bi-rite creamery, but you should really get 3-1/2 because you have weird drinks with names like "green monster" and you also have fro-yo and candy. 

Good job, high five!
author: danny e.

description:
I've been coming to Polly Ann's since day care, and still love this place. They have a great selection of ice cream. My favorite part, of course, is spinning the wheel and having the Ice Cream Gods decide what flavor of ice cream I will eat. My only gripe was that one time I spun the wheel and landed on "Free". Woo-hoo! Free ice cream. What flavor should I get? Well, let's spin again! "Free" again! "No, sorry. Only one free," said the bald man behind the counter. I thought I was entitled to two free ice cream cones. What do you think?!

I came for a frosty a few nights ago, a nostalgic throwback to my childhood. Unfortunately, they ran out for the evening. No frosty and no doggie cone for my dog. So I spun the wheel of flavor and landed on Lychee. Not bad. Let's see what I get next time.
author: R H.

description:
I absolutely love Polly Ann Ice Cream. 

It's easy to find coupons online on their website. And they have a wheel where you can spin and gamble on different flavors. they also have free slots on the wheel. If you land on free, you get free ice cream. it's wonderful. creative and classic flavors.
author: Josephine N.

description:
Polly Ann is a truly unique ice cream parlor in that they have an eclectic mix of flavors, which include such standard fare as mint chip and chocolate chip cookie dough as well as more exotic Asian varieties such as red bean paste and lychee. Moreover, the place is unique as a result of its having a wheel of fortune style spinny wheel with all of their flavors on it (with the exception of the infamous durian) that you can have the person behind the counter spin if you are either feeling adventurous or simply can't decide what to get. 

However, despite the ice cream being very good and the service very kind, my friends and I have developed a rite of passage which involves trying the aforementioned durian flavor. Now what is the big deal about durian you may ask. Well, in the words of Anthony Bourdain, the famous chef and traveler extraordinaire, durian's flavor can be characterized thusly: "Its taste can only be described as...indescribable, something you will either love or despise. ...Your breath will smell as if you'd been French-kissing your dead grandmother." In my personal experience, however, at least in terms of the durian ice cream at Polly Ann, it tastes more like gasoline than anything else. Furthermore, it seems to make you burp afterward, which means that no matter what you eat to cover up the taste (my friend ate so many Altoids that he literally teared up) you are constantly in danger of being reminded of the unholy thing you just ate should you decide to burp. 

Thus, if you are looking for great ice cream in a cool off-beat sort of place then Polly Ann is right for you. However, if you're looking for a place to trick a friend (or enemy for that matter) into eating one of the most repugnant things imaginable then Polly Ann is even more right for you.
author: Nick C.

description: Holy moly!  I have been going to Polly Ann's since I could walk, and every bite has always been delicious.  Last night, however, my friend ordered the Jasmine Tea ice cream and I tried it for the first time, and I almost threw the cone I ordered on the floor.  Polly Ann's you are the ruler of my heart.
author: Terika T.

description: I love love love polly anns. They have awesome flavors to choose from. I wish the small came in two scoops though. In order for me to have several flavors (because there are sooo mannnyyy toooo tryyyy arghhh) I had to order a large and that was too much sugar for me. The sesame, honeydew melon, oreo, lychee, and green tea were all yummmyy. I wanted to try to spin the wheel but not really for fear that it might land on Durian. Ickk. I miss polly ann's
author: Geraldine T.

description: OMG! I've only been here once on a trip to San Francisco, but it was unforgettable! Taro and Red Bean ice cream was great! And the service is really good too. I'm really indecisive and used about 10 popsicle sticks for samples, and the lady was still really nice. You have to try it!
author: Emily M.

description: Wishy washy flavor....Did not want to finish a cone and that's unusual.
author: Bleep S.

description:
When I first moved to San Francisco someone told about Polly Ann, the wheel and the 400 flavors and everything...I was drooling, ready to run there at that very moment because I love ice cream soooo much...then they told me it was currently closed.  And I was really sad.  I moped around for about a year, whining "when is it going to reopen?" (it actually may have been open the whole time, I never actually tried to find out anything about it, I was too distraught).  Then I pretty much forgot about it.  Two years later, I was there.  
I always spin the wheel.  I stand and look at all the flavors and tell Steve which ones I would be sad to get.  Unfortunately, so far the most exciting thing I've gotten is bubble gum.  Luckily have never gotten strawberry banana.
author: melissa r.

description: One of my top ice cream places, but not my favorite! I tried the black sesame, jasmine tea and lychee. My cousin and I trekked out here to try the black sesame ice cream hoping it would be as delicious as the one in (Chinatown Ice Cream Factory) NY.. It was not.. but a nice try. I'd come back but beware its cash only.
author: Alison L.

description: I absolutely love all the variety of flavors there are! However, I hate going during the school time because it's loaded with kids. I'm not saying I don't like kids, but I don't like the ones that are bratty and annoying. Anyways, I love taking my baby cousins here for ice cream!
author: Sandy T.

description: Im going to make this simple, any place that has unusual flavors of ice cream and is open late gets five stars.  The people working behind the counter gave generous samples and were really cool about it.  There isnt really anywhere to sit in there, maybe just a couple seats, but man, with all the flavors, who cares.  I want to get this straight, its an ice cream shop, not an ice cream parlor, where you sit in booths and can order sundays and things like that, here you get either a cup or cone and your eating.  So, for a ice cream shop, five stars.  Hell yeah.
author: Jeff O.

description: Ahhh, this place brings back the fondest childhood memories. Taro. Mmmm. That is all :)
author: C L.

description:
apparently they like to yell at their customers, esp. the Asian lady that can not speak English. she accused me of marking three stamps on the buy 10 get 1 free ice cream card if i could of marked all 10. if they cannot afford to give the freebie, then they should of never offered the card to customers. 

+1 star = convenience 
+1 star = honey dew ice cream
-1 star = service
this place is just alright when there are better places to go to in town.
author: Jaine L.

description: some awesome ice cream here. green tea milkshakes were always a fave comin here. and they have a wheel to spin to try for a free cone..but beware flavors that you may not enjoy. i've been a fan for a long time, and its still a hit in sf.
author: Jason W.

description:
another store that's out in the avenues.. so i barely come out here, but when i do.. *purr* the store itself is very clean, with seating [6 stools or so] on the side.. the walls are decked out with funny signs.. You can also bring the joy home by purchasing pints and tubs of ice cream.. 

im always tempted to spin the flavor wheel, but i am just not spontaneous nor adventurous enough.. my usual is the green tea! it's probably the BEST green tea ice cream i've ever had.. creamy perfection.. better than mitchell's imo.. --- musters out a british accent "please sir, may i have some more?" i've had some green tea elsewhere that tastes like the smell of grass.. *does that make sense? anywhoo.. blech!  

next time i'll try their durian flavor.. because i actually like durian.. no really..

stick to polly ann's and you'll be grateful..
author: Donna H.

description: Nice hang out for the kids afterschool, I'm sure the owners love the business but not all of the hyped up kids. My son seems to like the selection and the Hurricanes?
author: mary f.

description:
An aside...

"Free Mini Ice Cream for Kids under 2 Years with their Parents" -- Polly Ann Ice Cream Business Card

Does anyone else find this amusing? I'm trying to imagine a toddler under 2 years old wandering in unaccompanied.... I wonder if this happened and they had to make a disclaimer.
-Toddler: "Me wants ice keem"
-Employee: "Where's your Mommy or Daddy?"
-Tot: "ME WANTS ICE KEEEEEM!!!" ::Grows more impatient:: 
-Employee: "Sorry, but you'll have to pay since you're not with an adult... read the sign!"
-Tot: "I can't weeeed. Wahhhhhhh!" ::beats fists on floor::
*****
Finding Polly Ann's is almost as tricky as finding a needle in a haystack, but perhaps more rewarding, and definitely more delicious.. I honestly wonder how people came across it in the first place. This is why I love Yelp, though... Otherwise I never would have known the goodness that is Polly Ann's. If you're an ice cream maven such as myself, no good ice cream shop is too inconvenient or out of the way. If anything, it heightens the excitement and anticipation. It's like meeting a forbidden lover for a clandestine rendezvous. Wait what was I talking about? Oh yes, ice cream. Chocolate Peanut Butter. Good. Chocolately. Peanut buttery. Smooth. Creamy. Satisfying. Perfect balance of flavor and richness.

The sheer number of flavors is almost mind-numbing. Thank goodness they have the wheel of ice cream for those indecisive types. Patient staff encourages tastings and explain flavors (i.e. "Bumpy Freeway" = "Rocky Road").

Yum.
author: Jill M.

description: I normally buy their ice cream at the asian supermakets on clement and i didn't even realize that they have a shop in the sunset. my all time favorite flavor is their green tea ice cream. it's creamy, smooth, no strong tea taste and the best part it's GREEN! They give you a big scoop of ice cream with every order. if you get overwhelm with the variety of flavors they offer and dont' know what to get, spin the giant wheel of flavor they have behind the counter. it's definitely up there on my list of ice cream parlors but still can't beat my Swensen's.
author: Lynn P.

description: Polly Ann is legendary. I spun the wheel the first time I came here and it landed on red bean. I was thinking, "Oh, crap, I got stuck with one of the weird Asian flavors" ... except it was awesome. My perfect day starts and ends with red bean ice cream from Polly Ann.
author: Jane P.

description: a gem in sunset! my girlfriend and i discovered polly ann this past summer and have been hooked ever since. the staff is quiet and friendly. they have a wheel of fortune type thing and if you dare to take a spin to choose your flavor, you could also win a free ice cream! i am a chocolate lover so i recommend dutch chocolate and irish coffee on a waffle cone. damn, i think i am gonna go right now!
author: Daniel C.

description: Some of the best ice cream I have ever had!!! I love the taro and the red bean.  Nice people and great flavors. Try spinning the wheel, you have a chance to get a free ice cream! You can also buy containers of they're ice cream to bring home.10/10
author: The L.

description: Now how can you say "no" to ice cream.  This place has the most creative ice creams.  They have traditional flavored ice creams, but they also have some funky flavors that you can't get any where else.  If you can't decide, you can always spin the wheel.  I always feel like a little kid whenever I go to this place.
author: hello k.

description: A staple of the Outer Sunset. There are hardly any lines, save for after school time when the five closest schools unleash their rugrats here. The new place is spacious but I miss walking in to a cozy space and nudging my way to the counter to spin the wheel. The wheel is at the new place too so all you indecisive folks can leave it up to the gods as to what flavor you'll get. They're all good. And those signs: bet my dad wishes he would have gotten his hands on those to hang up all over our house when I was little. Not like it would have made a difference. I still spoil my dinner by eating dessert first. Like Polly Ann's: a very good way to spoil your appetite.
author: Kari M.

description: I love the spinning wheel if you're undecided on what to get! I chose the Strawberry + Mango flavor = Strawbango! Such a cute name. My cousin had the Turkish Coffee and my sister went with a boring flavor...mint chocolate chip. Overall it was so good even on a cold day. Will come back to try the other flavors like jasmine green tea :)
author: Karina C.

description: I love spinning the wheel! Enough said. Kidding. Best flavors catering an Asian American niche; green tea, mango, and even durian!
author: Jonathan C.

description: Definitely some unique flavors and quality ice cream. Anyone ever try the "Disco"...do they even have it still?
author: Scott M.

description:
wish more of the unique flavors were available.
still like ube (taro) better at Mitchell's.
durian is a challenging acquired taste.
i think eggettes and polly ann could join forces -- add some filling to those hollow eggettes...
author: Rob C.

description:
i really like it here, i wish i had a car so i can come here every other day.
they have so many flavors to choose from. i had the sesame which was really good, nice nutty flavor, so yummy. they many exotic flavors to choose from such as taro, lychee, durian, coconut + pineapple, pistachio almond...

one scoop = $2.75 (small scoop)
author: Diana T.

description:
Ah, I may have to start a new list . . . favorite S.F. ice cream parlors.  Although Polly Ann may not have the best ice cream in the city (that honor would have to go to Mitchell's), it is my favorite ice cream parlor.  Why?  Not only are the staff friendly and the prices right, but they have the "Wheel O' Ice Cream," which most reviewers have mentioned.

That reminds me of a brief story.  In the Spring of 2003, my friend Brent and I were on a quest to find licorice-flavored ice cream (yes, black licorice-flavored ice cream).  Our quest brought us to Polly Ann.  Unfortunately, Polly Ann did not have the aforementioned licorice-flavored ice cream.  But they had the spinning wheel.  I convinced Brent to spin it and told her I'd do the same.  She spun first, and of course, landed on some strange ice cream flavor (I don't remember which, but it ended up tasting pretty good).  I tried to order without spinning the wheel, but she caught me.  Oops!  So I spun the wheel . . . and landed on free ice cream!  Yum!  Anyway, long story short, my first trip here I tried the green tea ice cream and was sold.

In sum, Polly Ann has a huge variety of flavors, good prices, and, most importantly, the chance to win free ice cream!
author: Andrew D.

description: i've been going to polly ann's since i was little and it's tradition to get green tea. a lot of places have gross powdery green tea, but not polly ann's! jasmine tea is also to die for.
author: Bianca W.

description:
i remember going to Polly Ann as a kid. i brought my puppy and they had free little cones for dogs! i always thought that was awesome.  cute picture, huh? a little girl hanging out on the street with her dog, both licking their ice cream. 


except i was a chubster. not so cute. but my dog was!

always good ice cream!
author: Regina C.

description:
The best place for ice cream and other dairy-based desserts! All thanks to the selection of both classic and exotic flavors like durian, honey dew, Turkish coffee and star wars (it's a name for one of the flavors). There's literally a wall dedicated to all the ice cream flavors, but half of that wall is occupied by a wheel. This is one of the best parts of this Polly Ann, which is often fun and helpful. If you can't decide on what to get, spin the wheel and let it choose for you. Don't worry if the flavor that the wheel chose for you is unappealing because that flavor's neighbors are part of your options too. That's the helpful aspect of the wheel and the fun part is the uncertainty of what flavor you'll end up with! If you want more than just ice cream, there are malts, milkshakes, sundaes, soft serve and banana splits. Want to take some home? There's plenty of tubs for you to choose from! 

The service at Polly Ann's is always casual and friendly with a professional attitude. A cool tidbit about the store is the many quotes and signs that are amusing to read. The only drawback: too few seats available for indoor dining. Regardless, this is the place for ice cream whether you are adventurous or conservative with your choices.
author: Jeremy L.

description: NO way is this place better than Mitchell's. We did a taste test....Polly Anns comes up short. Mitchell's rules.
author: Sherie R.

description: It's alright...I'd rather have Marco Polo.  It's fun for the kids I guess if they fancy having the scoopers spin the wheel to decide a flavor for you.  I like the gummy bears ice cream flavor.  The flavors seem to be more kid/cavity friendly here.
author: Mel S.

description: I LOVE POLLY ANN!! I never heard of this place until I moved to SF about a year ago.  They have so many different flavors, and if you spin the wheel it decides what flavor you should try.  Although they have a lot of flavors, my favorite ones remain the original green tea and mango.  I find the ones on the cones taste a little different, but still good.  The half gallon that you get from the store or other Asian grocery stores have a creamier taste and softer texture.
author: May C.

description: Even though I live a mere hop, skip, and a jump away from Mitchell's, I still manage to get to Polly Ann's once in a while. I prefer their roasted almond over Mitchell's version and they have a Jasmine flavor that just can't be found anywhere else. Hint: make a Jasmine tea float with the ice cream, Jasmine tea, and some ice.
author: Holly T.

description: It seems the recipes have changed... I think the quality of the ice cream is slowly but surely going down hill. It's a shame really because we used to walk over on Saturday nights. Now, we just go to Safeway and pick up some Bryers.
author: Julie M.

description:
delicious and unique flavors.  convenient location and easy parking.  fast and excellent service.  

another great feature is their wheel for the indecisive which randomly selects a flavor for you.
author: Andy L.

description: the wheel gimmick makes this place a SF landmark.  Nuff said.
author: joseph k.

description:
i'm not gonna say i'm an ice cream connoisseur. but.. well. let's be honest. i am. (kidding.. sort of.) 

the ice cream itself at pollyann's is pretty.. standard. there isn't anything BAD about it though. easy parking, good service, affordable, ice cream is good. the redeeming quality is the sheer number of flavors they offer. hence the 4 stars. that and that goshdarned wheel that i never win on!
author: Mel L.

description:
I remember coming to this place when I was 12-13 yo,  The original owners were Ted and Ann, they lived across the street and their garage was basically used to stock all of their flavors, so if Ted ever needed to stock up, all he had to do was go across the street and pick another flavor.  They were the nicest couple..   at times I did not have enough to cover the cost for a frosty, but they did not care..  Well..  getting to the latest and greatest  location of PollyAnn's
     I was really excited that the new owner's finally opened the new location at the corner.  Initially, I felt that all of the old charm, from the original store was lost, but I really think that the new store kept most of it's charm.  The choice of flavors are incredible!  They have so many to choose from that it is not possible for them to offer all of them at once, so they rotate the flavors and as aa ice cream lover, you can go there often to try out new flavors as they are offered.
     I definately reccomend this place if you are an ice cream lover..  endless flavors..  yummy!
author: Lester S.

description: My parents go here from time to time...with my dog. Yes, they do offer little cones with some vanilla ice cream for your little furry friend. I thought that was awesome. They even have that "Wheel of Fortune" thing going on if you can't decide which flavor to order. I've never done that. Maybe next time I go I'll try spinng the wheel.
author: Jillian J.

description:
Had this yesterday and I can't believe how plain the ice creams tasted!  I will not include my husband's opinion since the nostalgic aspect of it is clouding his judgment.

I didn't like it.  I ordered the taro and it just tasted like frozen cream.  There was no flavor what so ever.  I tried my husband's ice cream too.  He had the lemon thing and the watermelon.  I thought both tasted SUPER fake.  Like it was made from some goofy powder mix.

I will not go out of my way for Polly Ann's again.
author: Angie C.

description: Eh...Polly Ann is definitely not one of my favorite places. Sure, they have tons of flavors and spinning the wheel is fun, but their ice cream tastes so artificial! I bought canteloupe once, and all you could taste was sugar, sugar, sugar. Their ice cream tastes no better than Dreyer's or even a Safeway brand.
author: Cee J.

description: A mission in terms of getting there. But the wide variety of flavors makes up for it. I spun the wheel and unfortunately got pistachio so the guy said I could have the flavor next to it, Strawbango. I'm not a fan of dairy based fruit flavors but the alternative was worse. I'll probably choose one of the many other ice cream parlors that have sprouted up before I head out to Polly Anns again.
author: Elizabeth D.

description: Amazing, long-time SF Ice Cream store. I grew up on 43rd and Moraga and Polly Ann was a frequent destination, especially given its proximity to AP Giannini Jr High and West Sunset. Ice cream was $.15, a frosty was $.10 and they sponsored our Cub Scout softball team... ok nostalgia off. New owners, new locale, same great ice cream, even more new flavors. Check the 1960 signs giving advice to kids.
author: jim b.

description:
i miss the old store...

but the ice cream is still awesome. sometimes they have my fave - mint cookie. 

i usually get the vanilla frosty. brings me back to the giannini days.
author: julia t.

description: Polly Ann has the bestest asian icecream such as green tea, red bean, sesame, and taro icecream.  So good!  My favorite is green tea icecream.  It tastes the most authentic... unlike the ones served at sushi restaurants.  I am always tempted to bring home a tub of this ice cream after eating a cone.
author: Jessica N.

description: Good ice cream(flavored) but u can not compare it to the mother of all ice creams...Marco Polo on 1447 Taraval St for real 100%fruit ice cream.
author: Tony A.

description: This is one of my favorite ice cream shops! So many different flavors. My favorite is green tea. They also have a wheel for customers to spin. And if you're lucky, it just might land on FREE. There are also seats for you to sit, which is nice. And other than ice cream, they also serve food, like hot dogs, and cup ramen, and other snackable foods.
author: Amy X.

description: I used to come here all the time as a teenager. Later on I stopped coming because they closed this place for over a year and to be honest I haven't returned since they reopened. Yes, they have a lot of interesting flavors but the ice cream really isn't all that. I think the texture/flavor of baskin robins, cold stone and even Ben & Jerry's is much better hence the reason I haven't bothered coming back. I think it's a cute place, well at least it was since I haven't been back since they remodeled it, for kids and teenagers but for an adult it just doesn't cut it.
author: Diane M.

description: They sure do have a lot of flavors here.  Can't decide?  Spin the wheel...an excellent touch.  Seriously, Mitchell's gets all the hype but Polly Ann and Marco Polo show that the west side can represent ice cream-wise.  Not to be missed by ice cream fans.
author: Wes M.

description: This is the 3rd best ice cream place i have been too in SF.  #1 is Bi-Rite and #2 is Bombay.  Good job.  Too bad you are located out in nowhere.
author: Fatty A.

description: Um, the toasted almond ice cream is to die for.
author: Denise B.

description: I'm not going bring up nostalgia because thats not very useful, but this place makes my mouth salivate unintentionally. Its not just an unheard of, cheap, ice cream parlor, it's Sunset District tradition. Patient employees, (now since the location move) spacious, clean restrooms, and open 'til 10. IF you live around here, it doesnt make sense to go anywhere else. Batman flavor is good, but for normal days i perfer plain banana. mmm
author: Maurice T.

description:
i was devastated the day we came across from town to find it closed indefinitely.............happy they have re-opened...........larger with a clean modern feel, but agree with previous review -- definitely missed its old neighborhood charm........

lots of interesting flavors, along with asian flavors....................my favorite is getting:
 
1 half gallon of green tea (the best green tea -- has a nice strong green tea taste unlike others i've tried which are too creamy)
                                          AND
1 half gallon of black sesame (great texture -- has somewhat of a seedy feel)

if you're into asian flavors, this is definitely an awesome combo...............love taking it home & storing in the freezer as i'm all the way across town.
author: Cindi N.

description: I love this place. They have a million flavors! My favorite is the Strawberry Oreo. And if they don't have that, Strawberry Brownie. I also like Mango, and Lemon was pretty tasty. I don't remember what else I have tried. They don't always have the flavor you want, so it's good to have backup flavors. They just have too many flavors to serve in one day. I don't see that as a bad thing. Yummy. Endless possibilities.
author: Lola S.

description:
i used to go to polly ann's all the time when i was younger. 
we finally found this heavenly ice cream place again recently. and i was not disappointed.

back then, i always rotated between three flavors: green tea, mango and lychee. 
naturally, this last time i went, i got a lychee. PLUS a tub of green tea and a tub of mango to go. hellllll yeeeeah!

although i haven't tried any other flavors, this place gets five frickin' stars just 'cause of those three ice cream flavors, ESPECIALLY the green tea. BEST green tea ice cream EVER. not like the wannabe ones elsewhere that taste like seaweed. 

and once you have the best green tea ice cream on the planet, well, you just topped the charts.
author: Veggie J.

description: Does expresso go with red bean?  I like jasmine ice cream but I'm going back to try black sesame and coconut.  I usually like to go to SF during the off season, but for this I'll suffer through the other tourists in the Summer.  This brand can also be found at Cafe Mum's in Japantown.  Why get strawberry or vanilla if they sell durian, lychee, and taro?
author: Ai M.

description: This might be one of the few places i would travel to to get ice cream because its cheap and taste great! easy to find parking, good service, and a great place to get ice cream...although sunset's weather isn't particularly good, but its worth it!
author: Q W.

description: This is my little ice cream shop near me. I like it. I use to go to the other one 20 feet away from this location when I was a kid.
author: Michael M.

description: if you love green tea ice cream and similar asian flavors, you will love love love this place. their green tea ice cream is exceptionally smooth and very authentic tasting. it even has the slight bitter aftertaste of drinking green tea. the sesame flavor is a winner as well. the only reason i'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is because their durian ice cream is a bit below par. they've made it overly sweet, causing it to taste generic. other than that i have no complaints. also love the fact that i'm supporting a local mom and pop shop that's literally 20 steps from my bf's house =)
author: Melissa Y.

description: This is the best green tea ice cream in the City.  Double Rainbow has a really good one too but it's harder to find as they're closing their parlors (you can get hand-packed pints at Toy Boat).  Mitchell's green tea is a little too chewy for lack of a better word.  I like how parking is easy and they have a wide variety of flavors.  It's a nice large space with seating so you can enjoy your ice cream there.  I've spun the wheel and gotten a free ice cream and they even have tiny ice cream cones for your dog (although they're not allowed inside).  You can also find select flavors (including green tea)at local markets like Tower Market near Twin Peaks if you're far away from the Sunset.
author: kiwi l.

description: Polly Ann's will always have a special place in my heart! My elementary school was close by and my mom used to take me there all the time after school! It went from being an almost hole in the wall to something much bigger! I haven't tried all their flavors yet but I do love Star Wars and Turkish coffee. Does anyone know what is in the Star Wars flavor?! Polly Ann's is a refreshing change from ice cream chain stores like Cold Stone's and Baskin Robbins. Some people complained about Polly Ann's prices but don't forget when you go to Baskin Robbins or Haagen Daz you're getting generic flavors!
author: selina n.

description: They offer the most diverse selection of ice cream flavors in SF!  And holy craaaaaap is their green tea ice cream good.  My parents used to buy it for me when I was a kid, and upon rediscovering Polly Ann's, I've realized my affinity has only grown.
author: Sid D.

description: Ice cream galore in the Outer Sunset! They have a constantly rotating selection of flavors. In case you can't choose, they have their famous wheel that you can spin and let it choose for you. (Beware, they have durian ice cream.)
author: Richie K.

description: The ice cream here is pretty good, and they have very creative flavors. Though this place doesn't even come close to how good the ice cream is at HOLY Gelato on 9th and irving. It is a nice place though.
author: Nikita K.

description:
It's ice cream heaven! I was so sad when I thought they closed up shop a while back but wondered why they still sold their 1 pint and 1 gallon ice creams at stores. I figured they couldn't sell since they're always full at the grocery stores, but they were still churning out ice cream throughout the remodeling period. I still prefer this to Mitchell's Ice Cream or Marco Polo because there are simply more exotic, eccentric, and tasty flavors! Though the ube and coconut ice cream at Mitchell's is one of my favorites! But the lines @ Mitchell's are always so long and parking is so hard to find, even at 11pm, whereas there's plenty of parking at Noriega.

If you have no idea what you want to order, just spin the wheel or ask for a buncha samples. I usually ask for samples already knowing what I want to order so I can cheat my count of # of ice cream flavors tasted. My favorites here are:

Seasame, green tea, pink champagne, lavender, lychee. I haven't tried their drink selection here since they're known for their ice cream!
author: May S.

description: 5.35 for 2 scoops , their ice cream isn't that good. much better alternatives out there, although the strawberry oreo is tha bomb
author: Wei W.

description: I have a the gallon size of Lychee flavor in my house and its wonderful.  My favorites are the mango, lychee, jasmine tea, green tea.  I haven't tried the Durian yet but ..... the ice cream is very flavorful and these types of ice creams are hard to find hellovajob on thier part to find a market.
author: Stevezee C.

description:
I use to go here every friday after I played football with my friends on the field nearby. I always left my fate up to the ginormous wheel of flavors. It's funny you come in thinking you don't know what to get, but when the wheel lands on something you don't want, you decide what you want anyways. haha. There are is a buttload of flavors. Say goodbye to 31 and say hello to like 60. Delicious. My favorite ice cream flavor is chocolate or chocolate chip cookie dough. And those two flavors are perfectly sweet. Awesomely good. If you're feeling dangerous, try one of their "weird" flavors or combo it up. 

The prices are kinda cheap I think. The employees are very helpful and nice. They have a smile and are patient, since they understand they have a lot of flavors. 

Bangarang. Good stuff. Just go if you want cheap, melt-in-your-mouth ice cream.
author: Philbert K.

description:
In Short -- Delicious. Ridiculous + Creative Variety. Reasonably Priced. 
A sunset staple.
author: Jackie C.

description: I grew up eating Polly Anne Ice Cream. I have been a sunsetter since I was born. I have to say I've been dissapointed since they reopened, they cut the menu down by alot! for one thing, and I think their freezer is not working too well. Is it just me or haven't anyone else noticed their icecream is not set. It used to be harder and creamier. Now it's a bit runny. The flavors are still good, and I will not deny icecream but I wish they would fix their freezer.
author: Karen T.

description: This is the best Ice cream joint in the city hands down Biaaaaaaches, for real! Broooo, the best one to get of course has got to be the Durian ice cream in a huge waffle cone and dip it in Chocolate so you won't offend other people with the smell.  Nah, I'm kidding, the best is the sesame Ice cream for all you vegetarians and especially lacto vegetarians who eat a lot of soy for protein and need that extra amino acid Methionine that's missing in soy beans.  Cover that up in Chocolate on a huge waffle cone and you know it's wholesome goodness and good for you too.  Out here in Asia/Taiwan they've been big on using Dairy to help keep people slim.
author: TJ P.

description:
I'm a creature of habit when it comes to ice cream. I generally stick to with the tea flavors, but I'm never too disappointed with any of the random flavors I get with the wheel. 

The ice cream itself isn't the best quality, but you just can't beat Polly Ann's variety. 

Some of my favorites are jasmine tea and peach ginger. Yum.

Big ups for the cheesy plaques plastering the walls. I love reading corny jokes while enjoying a cone.
author: Marianne C.

description: Sooo, when I've been going here since I was younger. Whenever I manage to go, I think of all these old memories I made growing up in the Sunset. Pistachio ice cream is great. I like the little green strings in it. But I haven't been there in awhile so I'm unsure if that flavor is still there.. but if it is, try it!
author: Krissel A.

description: I'm sorry, I just really do not love this place. I love it's ambience and 'spin the wheel' gig and the funny candies but the ice cream itself is MEH at best. Just a weird, odd aftertaste. I finally gave up and just started getting the occasional soft-serve there, but then the soft-serve machine broke and I haven't been back. Wah.
author: Cake M.

description: We stopped in here after shopping nearby, and I was impressed by the quality of the ice cream (smooth, rich, and creamy) and the assortment of flavors.  Definitely a "hidden treasure" in San Francisco.  Close enough to the beach that you can walk over.
author: Asteridae A.

description: Came here with my parents and sister and the place was empty since it's Easter, which was great for us since we got to take our time to sample the flavors and decide what to get.  I tried the Honey Dew Melon and Jasmine Tea and thought both of them were tasty.  I especially loved the Jasmine Tea one.  I think I like it even more than green tea ice cream, which is shocking because I LOVE green tea everything.  The jasmine tea one was really floral and fragrant...delish!
author: Katelynn L.

description: I love this place. I always have to spin the wheel though to see what I would get. The first time I went here almost 15 years ago, I spun the wheel and guess what I got? Vanilla. But it was a good vanilla, gosh darn it! Other times, I got pretty off the wall flavors and they were all really good. They do have the best green tea and red bean ice cream i have to say (better than mitchell's...shhhh, pretend i didn't say that)
author: Pippi L.

description: In my opinion I thought the ice cream had a grainy texture. I've been their twice and was unsatisfied both times.
author: Vespa Fox C.

description: Tuesdays are their discounted nights..there may also be a 20 percent off coupon on their website that can be used any day.  GREENTEA is to die for!!
author: Lise T.

description: I really love their Chocolate Banana flavor. Their service is always pleasant, attentive and efficient. They give great suggestions based on what flavors you prefer. I live on this side of the city and am perfectly fine with Polly Ann's for my ice cream fixes. Plus, there's LOTS of street parking.
author: Lotte D.

description:
Great ice cream.  Lots of novel flavors.  In the avenues where it is getting hard to find niche family run ice cream shops.  Spin the wheel to expand your pallette.

They could use more seating.  But they have plenty of space to stand while you lick your cone (more ice cream for the same size in a cone over a cup btw).
author: Brad R.

description:
Meh. I used to live around the corner from this place and me + jack would walk over for a cone, mostly out of convenience.  I don't ever recall being blown away like I am with Cold Stone's cake batter.  We find ourselves in the City last weekend, Ocean Beach of all places, so we bring the kids for a cone.  It's been a while - wow - new building? so they've spruced up the joint... (now please clean it, it was trashed when we were there... the little counters where you sit were filthy, the trash cans overflowing...)   And no napkins!  I couldn't find a napkin to save my life (or clean Reno's face!!) 
I chose mango - which is huge for me,  I usually never stray from my top 3 fav flavors no matter where I am.  Mango disappointed, it didn't taste like mango.  At all.  It tasted like creamy nothing.  Reno had black raspberry, which was pretty good.  Cinzia had rainbow sherbet - the most flavorful of what we had.  I don't remember what Jack had, but I do remember him trying to swap me for my mango (nien! - so I kept my bad mango over whatever he had.)
Lots of weird flavors to pick from so you're bound to find something you like.
author: Meg W.

description: Unique flavors, but why do some of their ice creams have a flowery taste to them? I can't figure out which flower...sweet pea, honeysuckle? It is really strange. I wouldn't make a special trip to catch their ice cream, but heard about this place and went out to check it out and it seems as if now it is run by some Taiwanese family.  Not high fat cream used. Probably just 2% fat milk, because it tastes more like Ice Milk.
author: miriam b.

description: I love their chance wheel! I got free ice cream twice! I've been going here since I was 12 and the service is still great and everything is still so cheap!
author: Amy C.

description: Polly Ann Ice Cream really has a lot of different and unusual ice cream flavors...and they taste great.  I like their green tea (my favorite), lychee, coconut, red bean, and chocolate mint flavored ice creams.  Their service can be a little slow though on a semi-sunny or warm day (since SF sunset is cold).
author: Tom S.

description: So anyways I started feening for some ice cream so I decided to go on yelp and check out the icecream spots around the hood I always passed Polly Ann's but never tried it so one day I decided to try it out. Walked it Saw that they had many weird flavors. The asians dudes were nice on the other hand the asian chick looked kinda upset but hey we all have bad days. So anyways I tried the Honey Dew ice cream woww I was pretty shocked after that first lick  it was so good so good that I came back 2 days later to get the same thing lol
author: jeremy d.

description: They have the best Honey Dew and Lychee flavored ice creams around. Sometimes it can be a long wait to get the ice cream, but well worth it.
author: Marty M.

description: OH, I Love your green tea ice cream :))))))) It makes me happy. But it makes me feel sinful.. But I will work out more so I can always have your green tea ice creammm yummmmm :d
author: Marlis T.

description:
Where...do I even...start...
There are no words, really.
It's simply the best.
Creamy, creative, and affordable ice cream in the heart of the most residential neighborhood you'll find in San Francisco.  In my book (and this IS my book) it kicks Mitchells' ass, no contest.
I love everything about it -- the neighborhood (the Sunset gets a lot of -- surprise surprise -- sun, and it always feels like the right day to take a stroll with your cone and your man candy), the giant roulette wheel (more on that in a second), the ever-changing cast of flavors, and the fact that they stock SQUEEZ-ITS in the cold case.
SQUEEZ-ITS!
I have a great idea for a promotional t-shirt for them; a picture of the wheel front and center,  surrounded by text that says, "I'm a gambler at...POLLY ANN ICE CREAM", followed by the appropriate contact info and whathaveyou.
I am steadfastly awaiting the return of their all-time best flavor, lemon cheesecake...until we meet again...
Man, I use a lot of parentheses.
edit: sweet jesus!  The owners of Polly Ann have seen this review, and they are offering me a free tub of Lemon Cheesecake on the house.  Six stars.  SIX STARS!  Let this be the first establishment to ever garner a six-star review on Yelp.  Rock on, Polly Ann.  Rock.  On.
author: Jody A.

description: FLAVOR WHEEL!!!  I don't care how "outer" this place is...it's outer-this world...ehem.
author: Maxwell M.

description: I have had ice cream at Mitchell's on San Jose Avenue, and when it used to be called Garrett's, also at Joe's Ice Cream on Geary and a few more.  And the only ice cream I will buy at supermarkets is Breyer's which uses no corn syrup and other "preservative" ingredients and whipped air.  Did Polly Ann's Ice Cream parlor on Noriega change owners and I did not notice?  I bought one of their packed ice creams just a couple of nights ago and assumed it was still homemade with wholesome ingredients.  After I got home which is way across town, I read the ingredients.  For the price, I am better off buying similar ice cream with all the corn syrup and other "cheap" preservative and flavor and color additives at any grocery store.  Too bad Breyer's is the only brand in major supermarkets which still maintains integrity of basic real pure ice cream ingredients and less than Polly Ann's.  Why pay more for "additives and preservatives"?  I think just as fast food services are forced to post ingredients etc., ice cream parlors should disclose  when ingredients go beyond cream, sugar, natural fruit, vegetable or spice flavors.
author: Lizabeth G.

description: The ice cream is between average to good.  Its serviceable when I want to have ice cream but doesn't wow me.  The location is good and it isn't difficult to find parking.  The staff is not that friendly as there are no smiles or thank you's to customers.
author: Jim T.

description: Good and unique ice-cream parlor. Plenty of flavors to choose from and service is good. Their ice-cream is not filling, but satisfying. We had Coffee Brownie (but hoped for more brownie chunks) and Sweet Coconut (tasted too much like Strawberry, not enough coconut). Overall, prices are decent, but wouldn't hurry back for a second trip.
author: Lisa C.

description: The ice cream variety is AWESOME- there is something for everyone.  I have not seem this one for a while...but over the summer, they had something like a Rocky Road, only made with coffee instead of chocolate...YUMMM!  They have some interesting flavors that I have not been brave enough to try yet- such as Rose.  I like how they have preserved some of the old time charm from the original store.  Why spend over 5 bucks for ice cream at such places as ColdStone?!?
author: Judy K.

description:
Is it strange that in all my reviews my first five-star is for an ice cream parlor?  Yes it is.

But you gotta hand it to the place.  Nice small ice cream shop not too far from the beach.  A visit to this place was really a nice way to cap off a fun weekday afternoon, and the end of the heat wave, at the beach.  All of their joke signs are actually quite amusing and they have an interesting variety of flavors.  On a warmer than usual day, a visit to this shop is very relaxing and refreshing.

Mmm mango-strawberry ice cream...
author: Joel J.

description: A local favorite.  I've been visiting this ice cream hot spot since 6th grade...so that makes it...umm...hmmm...how many years?  Let's just say I've eaten at this place my whole life time and more.  I began with tasting their interestingly named drinks like Purple Dragon and Green River and ordering their JC sundae every once in a blue moon.  As years passed, I moved to their lychee and sesame ice cream.  Polly Ann's homemade ice cream tastes natural and delicious.  They also have some interesting ice cream flavors you will not find anywhere.  Oh yeah, and if you visit during the afternoon, you'll see a cascade of middle school children lining up for ice cream!  Take it from an ice cream fanatic...if you love Mitchell's, you'll definitely love Polly Ann's!
author: Angie K.

description: My Parents have been taking me here ever since i was a little girl.  The Green Tea is my absolute favorite but if you cant decide, they have a big wheel you can spin and try ur luck with a new flavor.  They place is clean, bright, and it makes me feel like a little girl again =)
author: Tiffany J.

description:
so many flavors
oh crap, it is my turn
the pressure is on *sweating bullets*
I'll spin the wheel and take my chances with the ice cream god
author: Katie K.

description: Oh, I love Polly Ann's. I love anything taro or red bean flavored, and think it is amazing that polly ann's makes those two flavors of ice cream! The ice cream is creamy, not too sweet, and completely true to the true flavor of taro and red bean! Too bad we don't get enough sunny ice creamdays in sf!
author: Carmen L.

description:
i'm a girl of few words... so let me just say these four:

STAR. WARS. ICE. CREAM.
author: C J.

description: The ice cream is awesome and they have many exotic flavors. The staff is nice and they even have a wheel that you can spin. x3
author: Katherine C.

description: In 2004, I attending the King's Bday in Bangkok and tried a piece of durian at the festivities.  I learned after a week in bed that I was allergic to durian despite that I thought it tasted pretty good.   So when I saw there was durian ice cream here I was bummed I couldn't eat it. But that doesn't mean others should'nt try it.  They are in Sunset and it can be a long ride ,but what the hell..
author: Susan K.

description: A classic place to get some ice-cream treats. I've started going here  in 6th grade and now revisit it in my 30s. The same good old frosties, unique sodas, and good ice-cream are still there.  The spin wheel is still there, too. The tradition keeps going on which is great!
author: Leon C.

description: A dreamland for ice-cream. There are SO many flavours to choose from! It's good too! I would definitely recommend it. It's a bit pricy, so it's quiet a treat when you get some ice cream from this place.
author: Jay Z.

description:
There are 48 flavors to choose from (and I have yet to try them all), but the ones that I've tried have been fantastic! They have the best green tea ice cream ever. And they even have one called American Beauty, which is rose flavored! I couldn't get over how amazing the taste was. It was definitely a unique flavor, but you must try it at least once. The decor in the shop is cute and humorous as well as the creative names for the ice cream flavors. I like how you can also buy a tub of their ice cream or boxes of ice cream bars. The service is sweet and the prices keep your wallet happy. Go treat yourself.

Note: DO NOT go around 3:30PM on weekdays, because the place will be swamped with kids who just got out of school. Not to mention, there are insanely rude ones who use profanity and extremely negative connotations like there's no tomorrow. Ugh, just don't go around that time. I'm warning you.
author: Katie N.

description: I absolutely love Polly Ann's ice cream. They have a wide variety of flavors (from typical flavors to exotic flavors). I think it's cute how they play on the names of the ice cream flavors. I also love that their flavors are intense and have a lot of flavor. Anytime I'm in the area I come by, each time I try a different flavor.
author: Anne Y.

description: I love ice cream...like a lot. and i must say, Polly Ann's is one of my favorites! the green tea is my favorite, next to coffee and chocolate.
author: Suzan L.

description: This place has all sorts of ice cream ! whatever you can think of.  and from what i've heard They make these ice cream. they don't buy them. And if you can't choose they even have a wheel that can help you decide on what to get for ice cream. Cookies and cream is my favorite. They sell a lot of sweet stuff in there. If you are looking for something with Sugar. This is the place .
author: Andrew H.

description: Their ice cream epitomizes what a perfect cone of ice cream should taste like.  There are so many unique flavors to choose from, but my favorites are taro and honeydew.  They even give out free mini-sized doggy cones if you bring your dog.  What a nice treat!
author: beatrice m.

description: Pretty expensive for hand packed ice cream. But other than that the mint chocolate chip is my favorite! =]
author: Paula G.

description:
Everytime we are in the neighborhood or going to the beach Polly Ann is the ice cream shop to hit up, they have more flavors of ice cream than you can even imagine. If your stuck and can't figure out what to get, they have a huge wheel that you can spin to decide for you.

Great easy location with parking and the staff is super friendly!
author: muhdee h.

description: If you think Mitchells is the best in SF....try this place!
author: Rick H.

description: jasmine tea is my favorite. go on tuesday and you get $1-2 off the prepacked ice cream and bars.
author: Jen C.

description:
ice cream = 2.5/3.0 - very good but not better than bi-rite or mitchells

location/vibe = cold/foggy but parking is ok = 0.5

service = 1 - good, awarding extra half point for ice cream wheel
author: Ben P.

description:
ick.  i just bought Polly Ann popsicles from Walgreen.  i don't know anything about Polly Ann, but i was sold on the fact that it's a local company (the box says that the manufacturing plant is in SF 94122 - same as the shop being reviewed here - i don't know maybe that's a coincidence?)  and that the ingredients are all natural.
the package doesn't actually SAY that the ingredients are "all natural" but i read the ingredients list and they were:  Filtered Water, Coconut Milk, Sugar Coconut, Non Fat Milk, Fresh Cream, Guar Gum.  so far, so good. 
then i took a bite.  yikes!  that tasted just like hawaiian tropics tanning oil from my childhood.  i (so regrettably) finished the popsicle.  what was i thinking?  now my mouth tastes like i downed a whole bottle of tanning oil.  that's not natural.  or subtle.
there is no mention of added flavor or flavoring of any kind in the ingredients list.  it's impossible to achieve this level of ick using just plain coconut.  i prefer honesty in my food labeling.
to be fair i tried to reach Polly Ann via their website but it seems to be "for sale."
author: passion f.

description: I was heartbroken when I heard that Polly Ann's closed down.  What?  You mean they  just moved right down the street?  Awesome!  So it's missing some of the charm and vintage appeal of the old shop, but so what, this has got to be one of the most unique neighborhood ice cream shops in the world.  So many flavors to choose from (what the heck do they put in Bumpy Freeway or Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles?), a new storefront, a view of down Noriega Street to the sun slipping into the Pacific Ocean--ingredients to the perfect afternoon.
author: Tony L.

description: This was the place to go back in middle school! But then they moved over to the corner and I've probably only been there once since. I used to love the strawberry cheesecake flavor. And I believe I even went for the spin the wheel before too (for indecisive days/people). They had free doggie cones too =P I'll come here again and re-rate.
author: Elaine H.

description: Polly Ann's pretty dope. Crazy and numerous ice cream flavors (48 at any given time, according to "The Wheel") without the insane crowds that can gather at Mitchell's.  I only give it four stars though, cuz some of those crazy flavors are best left un-tasted.  The more pedestrian flavors and Asian favorites are wonderful, though.
author: CINDY K.

description: This long time ice cream and goodies spot is in a new spot- bigger and brighter. They have a wide assortment of "unique" flavors depending on the season. Don't know what to get? Spin the wheel and let it decide for you... hahahaha
author: Leroid D.

description:
so why does the sign say they have over 400 flavors, when the board only advertises 48 flavors?

the "spin the board" is seems fun, but who really spins it? 

we had two scoops of star wars and honeydew melon. star wars is vanilla ice cream colored baby blue with marshmallows.
author: Katy D.

description:
i was introduced to this place unexpectedly one cold evening in san fran and i was so happy that i was brought there! i love love love their green tea!   

they are so generous and willing to give me all the samples i want.. everything taste FRESH and geez.. i want some right now.. i live in orange county and it sucks.. i am willing to move to sf because of this place.

i'll be back SOON!
author: Lourdes N.

description: Too many flavors. Made my indecision really shine. I had the mint-chip. It was kind of gummy; I was kinda disappointed. But I will be back to try more flavors because it's a cute little community ice cream place and the wheel of fortune ice cream spinning thing is a cute idea. Clean, with friendly service. The end.
author: Jasmine O.

description: Spin the wheel, you may get a freebie. The ice cream is good. The green tea is a must. The relocation brand spanking new space is almost too new. I do miss the charm of the old location. DON'T GET THE SPUMONI - it was such a horrific experiment that I threw it out the window.
author: Judy L.

description: Gotta love the neighborhood ice cream shops. especially this one. the first thing you'd notice when you walk in would be the wheel. can't decide on what you want among the 30-40 flavors? take a spin and make sure you don't land on Durian. hehe..j/k. you'd also notice all the clever little signs lining the walls. something to do while they're slathering on their luscious ice cream on either a cup or a waffle cone for ya. the green tea ice cream is exceptional.
author: Chris C.

description: Rose Petal Ice Cream. Pray that you don't land on that when you opt for the wheel.  Everything else is yum.
author: Alia D.

description: This is the only ice cream shop that I have found so far with so many odd flavors.  And oddly, they don't taste as weird as you'd think.  Beware of the durian ice cream!  It's very potent!  I love the little smart alec signs around the shop, too.
author: Hoa Q.

description: I love coming to Polly Ann's whenever I make a trip to SF. They have tons of flavors and they let you try as much as you want before deciding. If you really can't decide then spin the Wheel!!! If you are lucky, you may land on a free cone!. My favorites are: Pistachio Almond, Lychee, Mango and Green tea.
author: Anna H.

description: Nice, average ice cream.  Not to good, not to bad. Good selection of flavors, but nothing earth shattering here.  If you need a fix and are in the area then go.
author: p w.

description: How cool is the roulette wheel? my friend got the free ice cream =P lucky her.. hmm i'm not a big fan of their ice cream because i haven't had the chance to try all of them =P
author: Connie M.

description: Never knew about this place so I decided to check it out today before school. Tons of loud middle or high schoolers in here, unfortunately something that almost turned me away. They left shortly after I arrived though which was good. Anyways I was blown away by how many flavors this place had. I had a 20% off coupon from their website so I decided to indulge myself with a pint. I got chocolate chip, Oreo, M and Ms, and Strawberry Mango....all these were delicious! The woman said getting all these in one pint would be messy....but I didnt care, not when it comes to ice cream! Friendly service, good prices, and great menu. Will definitely return in the future but maybe before school gets out. Plenty of residential parking and limited meters available.
author: Miss H K.

description: Parking f'in sucks but the icecream is worth the trouble. If you are brave, spin the wheel and see what you get! One time they had  banana chocolate and it was the best icecream I ever had...but they haven't had it since. Oh well...all their other flavors are great too! So many to choose from, there will be something for everyone.
author: Becca R.

description:
i remember coming here when it was a little hole in the wall. seriously, their mango ice cream rocks my socks. but i always come in and pick up a root beer ice cream, single scoop, regular cone. myyyyy favorite! 

too bad some of the employees aren't as enthusiastic about their jobs as they should be! last time i came here, they looked like they were enjoying their conversations between each other much, they scowled when a big group of people came into the store.
author: Christine L.

description: Favorite thing to do with the kids on a hot summer night.  We wheel them down the block to Polly Ann's and get a scoop of yummy flavored ice cream.  The kids LOVE it. The best flavor so far is the coffee cheesecake.
author: Rio K.

description: It's easier to find parking here than at Swensen's. Their quality is just as good but with a wider selection of interesting flavors like Jasmine tea. They used to have American Beauty, which is rose-flavored ice cream. I miss that. The servers here are much nicer too.
author: Faye S.

description:
it was better when it was a hole in the wall..almost made me forgot that they're ice cream is really airy.  ice cream should be rich and thick so that you'll break a plastic spoon if you was trying to scoop some.  

4 stars... but -1 for the remodel.  not all news things are betta.
author: Doug ..

description: such a cute place! It has this huge wheel behind the counter that randomizes your ice cream order. I can highly recommend the mocha flavor. Alas, this place is rather far out there. Still, if you're in the neighborhood and not frozen to the core due to the fog, check it out!
author: Jan Michael K.

description: A neighborhood landmark, been coming here since high school days.  The first time was for "rose" ice cream.  I could've sworn I was nibbling on a real rose - tasted like it.  Nowadays, I prefer their coconut (no one makes it as good as theirs) and green tea, which is served at a lot of local restaurants.  During the hot Indian summer days, the lines become especially long after school hours, flood with kids from AP Giannini and Holy Name School which are just blocks away.  It's so much nicer now that they've remodeled a few years ago.  The old shop was too small and they couldn't put out that many flavors.  I hope they stay in business for a long, long time.
author: Ry T.

description:
it's a three - cause some flavors are original and it's not a franchise... 
we got a free ice-cream when we spun the wheel that was fun!

i would go there if i were down in the ave's because it's unique!

there are better ice-cream places, but i think supporting the local business is a great idea.
author: Jippers C.

description: If you look at my record, you will see that I do not give many 5 star ratings. Polly Ann Ice cream is the exception! I love this place! I used to come here during lunch when I was in high school, but back then they were in a smaller location. NOW, it's gotten bigger and newer, but it's maintained it's original flavors and charm. What I love best about this place is that it is unique! It doesn't try to copy other businesses in hopes that it has gotten the "recipe" for success (I hate seeing so many clones in SF). They have unique flavors like: sesame, green tea, vanilla cherry, and coffee with marshmellows. They actually have 35 flavors that are their own invention, but they also have the classical favorites (chocolate, vanilla, strawberry). I love that there is a wheel you can spin if you can't make up your mind, I've been spinning that wheel since high school! That's what I like about the place, even if you are an adult you get all excited about going, just as if you were a kid again. One more thing, I love that they still have snacks that you can buy. Shit like burritos, nacho chips, and they used to have chicken burgers back in the day! WHo does that shit??? No one! That's why I love this place so much!!!!!! Also, when you guys go, be sure to get your ice cream chocolate dipped, it is so worth it!!!!!
author: Gabriel T.

description: I love Polly Ann's. Despite the fact that I preferred the old location for it's ambiance, I am thrilled they are still going strong. I love their Green Tea Ice Cream. It is hands down the best!!
author: Pez B.

description: I used to always see the Polly Ann's ice cream buckets at the asian markets, I didn't know that there was an actual ice cream shop! I stumbled upon Polly Ann's one day as I was exploring the city with my bf. Most of my food adventures are with him. =) It's located on the corner, and in my opinion a random spot. I have yet to spin the wheel, but maybe next time. I really like the pistachio ice cream, it's my favorite ice cream flavor in general. My boyfriend felt the need to be adventurous and a bit obnoxious so he chose the green tea (not the obnoxious part) and DURIAN!! He only chose it because he knows that I simply cannot stand the smell of the fruit. I hated it when my parents would buy it and leave it in the fridge to stink up the kitchen. BOOO.. I think he actually regretted his choice, as the green tea wasn't bad but I prefer the more sweet green tea flavors. This one is more on the bitter, real green tea taste. And for the durian.. he claims to have liked it, however, it didn't seem like it. He was burping up stinky durian smells all day! Needless to say, he stays away from the durian now.
author: Linda L.

description: Fun place to go to. It has a nastalgic vibe that makes the world seem simple, happy and sweet. When I walk in I imediately feel like a wall of deserts has just smashed into me.
author: Keit K.

description: Cut class at Giannini, go to Polly Ann's. Bubble gum ice cream and suicides! Need more?-go to Helen Wait!
author: Mag N.

description:
best GREEN TEA ICE CREAM ever. it will rock your world. 

best ice cream. 
yes, dare i say, better than mitchell's. 

why? well, you get the same "exotic" flavors that mitchell is praised for making: avocado, mango, lychee, macapuno, jackfruit, etc. BUT, on top of offering ice cream that acknowledges and appeals to the "asian" palate, they do it with panache. 

this is a charming neighborhood joint. sarcastic, humorous signage with smartass statements adorns the walls and conjures up images of a (chinese) semi-badass owner with a heart of gold who just loves making people happy with his ice cream. 

can't decide what you want out of the myriad of flavors (represented by sweetly made, almost childish colorful, creative esigns)? have them spin that giant wheel on the wall. depending on what number it lands on, you may end up with the "ET" (grey-colored vanilla with reese's pieces) or "bumpy freeway," the "lemon chippee," or "chocolate cheese"; you could even get a free scoop. 

the ice cream is dreamy, but you'll also enjoy the personality of this place and its endearingly titled inventive flavors. 
not to get cheesy, but the ambiance is also nice, especially at dusk, when couples, families, and solo artists flock to this joint and all revert to childlike euphoria upon being handed their ice cream.
author: jennifer y.

description: Me and my friend got the Star wars and Choco-berry ice-cream. I guess we must have ordered the 'wrong' thing. My choco-berry ice-cream was so choco that I could hardly tell there was any berry flavor in it. I tried my friend's Star wars one and it didn't remind me the Empire.. anyway I ended up eating the waffle cone and had him finished up the 'blue' ice-cream. Nothing spectacular and I guess I'll just stick with Joe's.
author: Ms Piggy W.

description: Polly Ann's green tea ice cream is my idea of heaven.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
this is another one of my childhood favorites. they gave me a scare a couple years ago when they shut down their original location. i was depressed for awhile until i found out they moved to the corner of the block in a new and bigger store front! and then i was happy again.

i love the wheel, the candy, the green tea and pistachio ice cream. but i do miss the old location that felt like a secret hole in the wall ice cream joint. oh well.
author: Dave N.

description: Always was and still is one of my favorites. I grew up in the Sunset so this place was always on my walk home and obviously got quite a bit of my allowance. Now I am 33 and I still find myself going back there when I am in the neighborhood. This place is like something you might find in the 50s. Def one of my favs!!!
author: Jack H.

description: Good Ice Cream and they probably must be rich by now because there is a school nearby and it gets so crowded when school is out and it is a good place to get ice cream
author: Tyson V.
