description: good variety of asian ice creams. located right next to eggettes, this location is ideal for post dinner hang out time. snacks at eggettes and dessert at polly anns. if you looking for asian ice cream this is one of the better places in the sunset. prices are ok and they also sell tubs for customers to bring home. I recommend the green tea, mango, and taro flavors. parking can be a hassle. Personally, I like gelato better so I would go to marco polo on taraval instead of this place.
author: Robert Y.

description: Greatest ice cream store ever? I used to live right across the street so I got to know all the staff, and they're totally nice Chinese girls. It's got one of the coolest vibes for an ice cream parlor and I love taking friends in there. Now that we have a dog we've started bringing him, and he loves it too. Definitely worth driving out to the Outer Sunset for those who don't typically make the trip.
author: Mark L.

description: Ahhh....this brings back memories. No childhood in the Sunset is complete without a trip to Polly Ann's Ice Cream. There are so many flavors you stand there with your mouth open trying to decide what it is you really want. But what ho? There's the Wheel! Spin that baby 'round and it'll make that difficult decision of what ice cream flavor for you. Be brave.
author: Jackie I.

description: It may not be the Polly Ann's of our parents, but this place is still great.  Tons of fun flavors to choose from.  Try the lemon cheesecake, my sister's favorite.  They also have cheap sundaes, and the staff is friendly.  See you out in the marine layer...
author: Mr. G.

description:
Summertime and ice cream. They just seem to go together. 

Skipped dessert at Pizzeria Delfina the other night and drove out to Polly Ann Ice Cream. This is not your usual ice cream joint. They boast a list of 500 flavors, about 50 of which are available daily. 

Many of them are tropical, such as the avocado, durian, jackfruit, lychee, macapuno, papaya, passion fruit, taro, red bean and ube. There are also the puzzlingly named Bumpy Freeway, Hard Hat and I Yam What I Yam and the questionable Bush's Delight, zucchini and fruitcake. The macapuno was delicious, however --- creamy, with chunks of tender coconut. 

Take your cone outside and lean against the stop sign at 39th and Noriega. You'll get a nice dose of fresh sea air and a great view of the Pacific. 

Two other great things about Polly Ann's: no lines like you will find at Mitchell's, and, for the truly gluttonous, its close proximity to Eggettes. This is another unique and yummy dessert spot, and a Yelp review for another day.
author: Deb K.

description: Their green tea and mango flavors are probably my favorite.  Another spot we used to frequent back in the good old Mercy days.  They recently remodeled but the ice cream is still as good as it was.  I miss the cinnamon toothpicks though.
author: Mabelle A.

description: Promised my six-year old daughter ice cream.  Went to Joe's on Geary but guess what?  It's closed Mondays, even Memorial Day Mondays.  So now my daughter's lower lip is trembling, and I'm not sure an eskimo pie from the 7-11 cooler is going to save me.  So I Yelp, and my Yelp is Answered!  10 minutes later we're at Polly Ann.  Decor is circa 1987 Kentucky Fried Chicken, but the ice cream is good - at least, the chocolate and the espresso are.  You'll have to try the Gummi Bear for yourself, that's nasty.  Coolest feature is the Decision Wheel - they spin, you take what they give you.  And if it lands on "free" then you still have to make a decision, but it don't cost nothin'.  Worth the trip, and your daughter won't cry.  Not too shabby.
author: John H.

description: Delicious whipped and creamy style ice cream, great mix of Asian and western flavors, big servings and low prices, completely non-touristy, truly an SF original. Don't change a thing Polly Ann!
author: Nick C.

description: This place is great, we've been going here for over 20years. I like most of the fruit flavors but sometimes it can taste different because it might not be as sweet as before. Good stuff!!!
author: carlos m.

description: ohhh weeeeee!! spin the wheel is sooooooo cool and so are their ice creams!!
author: Valerie N.

description: Where else can you spin a wheel for a free scoop, get a dish of taro root or jasmine tea ice cream and walk around in the fog??  'Nuff said.
author: Frances S.

description: Yes, I was once a Green tea ice cream virgin, but no more. Now it seems like they serve green tea at half the Japanese restaurants in San Francisco.  Polly Ann's almost broke my heart when they closed a few years ago but then reopened a few doors down on Noriega Street...same Pick A Flavor Wheel...same doggie cones.
author: Eric G.

description: I go for the Bumpy Freeway.  Or there's always American Beauty Rose or even Durian.  Doggie cones, too.  There's something special about eating ice cream on a cold foggy night in the Sunset.
author: Janice P.

description: Cute and fun place with great ice cream!  They even have a clean bathroom that customers could use...
author: Mimay W.

description: The best hidden gem in San Francisco!  I think it beats out Mitchell's by far, especially since you don't have to take a number and wait 30 mins for a scoop.  The base is so smooth and creamy.  And they have a large list of creative flavors that change often.  The junior cone is under $2 and is large enough to satisfy you.  My favorite is the coffee oreo.  YUM!  Dog owners bring your dog and you can get a doggie cone for free.
author: SFFoodie F.

description: I'm a fan of ice cream that's hard and frozen, Polly Ann's ice cream is neither hard nor creamy.  the best word to describe Polly Ann's ice cream is icy.  I do like their creativity with the wheel and flavors but it's not good enough for me to go all the way out there.
author: Brian H.

description: Good ice cream at good prices.  Print out the 20% off coupon on their website www.pollyann.com and head on over.  You won't be disappointed!!
author: Natalie P.

description: This place is great. They have this one flavor called Star Wars. I didn't care what was in it - I had to have it. It turned out to be blue vanilla with marshmallows - it was yummy.
author: James T.

description: Polly Ann has the best ice cream in SF.  I especially love their fruit flavors.  The flavor is blended so nicely with the ice cream - they don't do that sort of added syrupy fruit like other places do.  Great, great stuff.
author: Methanie D.

description: You must try their Green Tea Ice Cream, it's so so so great!!! They are having a new flavors, Jasmine Tea, but I think it's too sweet~~~ Many ppl think Lychee is tasty too~~
author: Jun L.

description: I love ice cream and this place has the best flavors.  I like fancy gourmet ice cream, but for a neighborhood ice cream place (in the Sunset), this place is great.
author: Emma W.

description: Definitely one of the best ice creams around. I wouldn't dare brave the wheel, but if you're not as picky, it could be a lot of fun. My favorites are root beer (which is seasonal) and the coconut. Yum! It's in the outer sunset, but parking is usually pretty easy.
author: chip n. c.

description: how small can their scoops get?? and its freakin expensive. i went to mitchelle's the other day for the first time and it's way cheaper and the scoops are actually worth it.
author: Anita L.

description: Best ice cream parlor in SF. The history of this place goes wayyy back. This was the first place to create new flavors like green tea, lycee and mango. After moving to a new location i think the whole aptmospher just got better. Too bad they took away the Star Wars flavor.
author: Brian Y.

description: This place is awesome!  It would've had 5 stars if they only brought back my favorite... orange sherbert.  I know that this particular flavor is very specific, but there aren't a lot of places which have it, and I used to come here every weekend because they actually had it.  BRING IT BACK! :)
author: B F.

description: Who knew this treasure was hiding all the way out in the outer sunset??? My favorite of the many many unique flavors has to be the jasmine ice cream.  Coconut is pretty fantastic too.
author: Danielle B.

description: Because I like to support local small businesses, I keep giving this place more tries even after routinely buying ice cream that has little flavor and tastes old from staff people who are so rude.  Seriously -- I am baffled by why people still go here.  I'm moving over to the Richmond and supporting Joes.  I'm done here.
author: Sunset M.

description: all day on sunday, cruising around san francisco in my minivan...my cousin and i kept burping up this obnoxious yet familiar and delicious memory...the first thing we ate that morning....DURIAN ice cream.  early that morning,  i was informed by my lovely dining companion about this place that had durian ice cream.  we had to go b/c my cousin and i just love durian.  oh yeah, it was great driving around scenic san francisco while licking up this this pungent ice cream.  after each spoonful melted away in my mouth,  it would hum with this spicy jackfruitlike slash creamy vanilla like flavor through my nostrils.
author: Reggie M.

description:
[extremely overdue, dont ferget to read my next overdue entry]

ice cream/gelato makes me REAL happy... what makes me EVEN MORE HAPPY IS THAT IT'S HOMEMADE!

anyways ... 

FINALLY came to this place few weeks ago because J was raving about HOW GREAT this place was, and honestly, i'm super grateful you DID tell me about this place and im finally glad i did visit... sry J, but i still think marco polo is BYFAR better, even though i have to give polly ann credit for their creativity!

man, i swear, asians REALLY know how to do it... no more 31 baskin robbins ... they have 48 BABY!  and if you're like me being SUPER indecisive and all, have no fear, this place can only serve you justice since polly ann is KNOWN for their wheel... 

what is the wheel you ask?

picture wheel of fortune except they have diff flavors on each one, and they even have a freebie one too... i tried 2 times and i was SO close for a freebie. darn it! does anyone know of anyone who EVEN GOT A FREEBIE? 

their cookie dough was good..:) 

PROLLY THE CHEAPEST ice cream i've found ever yet...

friendly sweet staff...

and on top of that, there was P-A-R-K-I-N-G! WOW!

u SERIOUSLY can't beat their prices!!

small (jr) - $1.95
regular - $2.50
2 scoops (jr)- $3.90
2 scoops (reg) -$4.25
3 scoops - $5.35
author: Jennifer S.

description: Oh boy did we put that guy to work!  I haven't been here in awhile, probably because I'm a little embarrassed.  I came in with a friend, each of sampling pretty much every flavor they had.  I was practically ready to leave because I had so many samples and was about done with ice cream.  I was too chicken to spin the flavor wheel and get something they tasted funky.  Like rose flavor.  Blech.  Personally, roses are pretty and all, and are cool for potpourri, but when it comes to ice cream, I just don't like it.  (That goes for rose flavored macaroons too).   Eventually at Polly Ann's I settled for green tea, which is kind of boring and I could have easily bought at whole tub at Sunset Super.  After all those tastings, I'm still plain and predictable.  But still, the ice cream was so refreshing and I actually went here on a freezing cold day.  I worked it out though by walking home, a bit of a walk from there, but I burned about a tablespoon of my ice cream calories away and kept somewhat warm.  Yum.
author: Stacey C.

description: i freaking love polly ann's! They have a large variety of ice cream, but the best part is spinning the wheel and getting a free. woooo.  asians.
author: Thomas W.

description: decent tasting ice cream. the spinning wheel really makes it fun tho and love the humor on the walls but not so obvious for the peeps working there. the flavors are certainly a mouthful so give them a try at least! and spin that wheel yo!
author: Jim L.

description: I WON A FREE CONE ON THE WHEEL! Yes ladies and gentlemen it's totally possible. Ice cream is good...not as good as mitchells..definitely not in the same league as the specialty shops (ie. birite)...but they have strawberry rocky road (sometimes)...
author: Emily W.

description: too many ice cream places lately.  so what style is this place?  its definitely sweeter than other places.  i had mango + strawberry swirl, it was good.  taro was really good, probably the best taro ive had.  still need to try jasmine tea and coconut.  as you can tell i like the asian flavors.  tried durian just for fun.  because you know, fun is like taking a spoonful of garbage and adding a little cream and sugar!
author: Robert S.

description: When thinking about Polly Ann Ice Cream, I'm reminded of a quote from one of the most important Western philosophers of the past few centuries,  "talk about Enlightenment," gadfly of the mind, Homer Jay Simpson, who astonished us with his utterance: "Donuts. Is there anything they can't do?"  Well, is there anything? Boasting the ability or talent of having created over 500 flavors (though they  only have 30-50 on-site-sheesh!), and having only tasted maybe ten, I don't consider myself an expert on the Polly menu. But I do have my favorites: Coconut, French Vanilla, Coffee Mint and Lychee. Those are considered tame compared to the exotic list of concoctions the Wu's are workin' out in their laboratory of sweetness!!!  Respect!! for remaining loyal to the Sunset hood and to dogs (dunno why, but they provide "doggy cones.")  For those of you expecting or comparing PA to Mitchell's.... take yer butts over to Mitchell's. That's what I do. 4 duckets for Flava!
author: Johnny C.

description: bestest ice cream!  all of their tropical flavors are yummy.  my favorite is green tea, taro...if you can't decide, then spin their wheel.  they have funny names for their ice cream too.  i wish they would open one closer to where i live.  lot's of kids go there especially during the school year cuz it's near an elementary school.  yummy!!!
author: D W.

description: their ice cream are the bEST!! creative names for ice cream.. so many flavors choices...should try their stars wars which is a blue flavored ice cream with tiny marshallow..  and their green tea is off da hoOk.. what are u waiting for go grab an ice  cream....
author: Lily T.

description: this review is mostly for the old location. i remember being a kid and standing on the high step over by the doorway and peering down and looking at all the ice cream and the candies they would have in the back. i loved how small it was and how old school it looked inside. and of course, i loved all the tiles the flavors were on, especially the tile the "batman" flavor was on. the new location is too sterile for my taste and doesn't have the same charm that it used to. but the variety of flavors is still there and it's a part of my childhood. and you can't take that away, so five stars it is!
author: Melanie C.

description: My favorite place to go when I was a kid in the Sunset.  I was glad it didn't close, but reopened in a nearby location.  I was able to take my daughter there to sample the unique ice cream flavors, and experience the funny names and wheel of flavors.  The watermelon is probably my new favorite flavor!
author: C L.

description: wow, they totally remodel this place.  it use to be a hole in the wall back in middle school.  and, i remember some of the classmates that actually work there and the horror stories of cockroaches....  now, its a damn fancy pants place...  the ice cream has always been deeelicious...
author: Peter L.

description: Great Green Tea Icecream.  Definitely best in the neighborhood!
author: E L.

description: six grade, twas a good year.  polly ann was 1 block away from my middle school AP.... but it was a long block cuz i always had to watch my back and look ahead for fobs trying jack my magic cards and lunch money.  if i made that walk it was kimbap next door at the korean market and then a red hot burrito, sugar straws and purple dragon at polly anns.  if had money leftover, i could get a softserve ice cream.  damn, i was a fat boy!
author: brandon w.

description: What happened to all those weird signs out front, like the poem about getting knocked up by your boyfriend? What happened to my childhood?
author: Erica T.

description: Yeah, these guys are good, and convenient on the way back from Stow Lake to the Great Highway (back home to Pacifica). I even met a woman with a frozen yogurt place on Crespi in Pacifica who was carrying their flavors (a friend of the owners) but I think she sold and left her place recently. I give Polly Ann high marks for their variety, quality, and imagination. There's what...? nearly 100 flavors? They change all the time. I've had really excellent flavors that included a chiffonade of rose petals and freshly grated lime zest. Yawww! Find that in your Haagen Daz or Ben and Jerry's! Not every flavor is amazing but there are some stunners. Frozen Bananas too; makes me nostalgic for Balboa and Santa Monica pier. 4 thumbs up!
author: Ben P.

description: polly ann's is cool a lot of different flavors to choose from, but  i wouldnt drive all the way over there for ice cream there are defintly better places.
author: stacy l.

description: Lots of fun flavors. Lychee, Red Bean, and Irish Coffee (green? yes) are highly recommended.  But Butterscotch Twist seems to be missing some butterscotch. Note that Durian is NOT on the spinning wheel. If you taste it, you'll understand why -- just like the fresh fruit, it has a stinky onion smell, sweet flavor, and an onion finish -- definitely an acquired taste!
author: See B.

description: the sunset district's old timey homemade ice cream shop. there's so many different flavors that they have a wheel up to spin and help you choose one. and there's always like a gazillion kids here. s says "it's like willy wonka!"
author: Tin-Tin E.

description: I've always been a fan of Polly Ann ice cream, though i always get it from Ranch 99. When i heard about an actual place right here in the bay area, i piddled my pants. Just a little. Anyways, i went with the fam and some of us got adventurous. My sister and I ordered the jasmine tea ice cream, since we always buy the green tea version at the store. my dad got the red bean, mommy got the durian (blechy yuckerella), my aunt got the taro, and my bf got the honey dew melon. All in all, the flavors were very true to its real life counterpart. The flavors still had its usual creamy goodness, and the prices were reasonable--we paid $18 for all of these yummy treats. The workers were very patient, especially when we all couldn't decide what to get! I saw the wheel in action, but I don't think I'll ever need it. Very cool place, would love to come here again!
author: Florence W.

description: Choose the right flavor or you're going to regret it! They have like five hundred flavors, most of them are good. They have a wheel you can spin if you really can't choose. Their ice cream is like homemade. They usually have a crowd of children from nearby schools lining up. Most of the workers are nice, seem a little bit impatient at times. Definitely recommend.
author: M M.

description: For those who can't make the trek to the other side of the City to get some Mitchell's, this is a serviceable alternative. The staff's good attitude and the charming setting conspire to make this place an establishment genuinely unique to its neighborhood. Gotta love that ice cream wheel. I like how the staff giggles at me and my friend when we take forever to choose a flavor but still refuse to spin the wheel.
author: Joseph R.

description: Okay guys, they don't exactly have the best ice cream. -_________- Is it just me or it's always packed with scrawny middle school kids acting as if they were on top of the world. So annoying...
author: amandaaa s.

description: my god, their green tea ice cream is good.  you can find it in lots of grocery stores in the peninsula (hangkook market, for example)
author: Bart D.

description: Tons of choices.  Best tasting green tea ice cream in my opinion.  Their signs plastered all over the store makes me chuckle!
author: deeks ..

description: My friend took me here today, and I had the sesame Ice cream. I have been looking all over San Francisco for this ice cream since the first time I had it. Polly Ann has it, and It is Delicious! the best I have ever had. try it the next time you go!
author: Rhonda Y.

description: Thick, rich ice cream.  Less than enthusiastic staff (but then again, I guess I was waffling).  But then again, he may have been high.
author: Ryan N.

description: This place is great. been going there since college(I'm 33 so do the math):) . the blueberry cheesecake and the Mango flavor are my favorites. got to also try to spin the wheel of flavors. you spin the wheel and what ever flavor it stops on you got to get it. kinda fun especially on a first date with a girl.good ice breaker.
author: mike m.

description: Ive been going to polly annes since I was in grade school up the street at Holy Name. We use to ride our bikes here and indulge in cavity creating calorie bustin ice cream. this place to me is more than a ice cream parlor its a piece of my youth. I love the ice cream there, all the flavors are off the chain. sure mitchells is prolly better but this place is my number 1.  and this place will never EVER get old to me.
author: jonathan s.
